explanation: Sweettongued, they visited with folded hands the best of ascetics Viswamitra who was shining like a flaming fire and addressed him  thus in sweet and generous words:

shloka_text: इमौ स्म मुनिशार्दूल किङ्करौ समुपस्थितौ। आज्ञापय यथेष्टं वै शासनं करवाव किम्।।1.31.4।।
translation: मुनिशार्दूल O Best of ascetics, किङ्करौ two servants, इमौ here we are, समुपस्थितौ स्म in attendance in your presence, यथेष्टम् freely, आज्ञापय command us, किम् what, शासनम् order, करवाव shall we both do.
explanation: "O tiger among ascetics, we  two are at your  service. Command whatever you want and we shall execute" it.

shloka_text: एवमुक्ता स्ततस्ताभ्यां सर्व एव महर्षय:। विश्वामित्रं पुरस्कृत्य रामं वचनमब्रुवन्।।1.31.5।।
translation: ताभ्याम् by both of them, एवम् in this way, उक्ता: having been addressed, महर्षय: maharshis, सर्वे एव all of them, विश्वामित्रम् Viswamitra, पुरस्कृत्य placing in the forefront, रामम् addressing Rama, वचनम् words, अब्रुवन् spoke.
explanation: Addressed, thus by both of them, Viswamitra ahead of all the sages, spoke to Rama.

shloka_text: मैथिलस्य नरश्रेष्ठ जनकस्य भविष्यति। यज्ञ: परमधर्मिष्ठस्तस्य यास्यामहे वयम्।।1.31.6।।
translation: नरश्रेष्ठ O Foremost of men, मैथिलस्य of the king of Mithila, जनकस्य Janaka's, परमधर्मिष्ठ: highly conforming to righteousness, यज्ञ: sacrifice, भविष्यति is going to be performed, वयम् we, तस्य of that sacrifice, यास्यामहे shall go there.
explanation: "O foremost of men, Janaka, king of Mithila, is performing a great religious sacrifice. We shall go there.

shloka_text: त्वं चैव नरशार्दूल सहास्माभिर्गमिष्यसि। अद्भुतं धनुरत्नं च तत्र तद्रष्टुमर्हसि।।1.31.7।।
translation: नरशार्दूल O Best among men, त्वम् च you also, अस्माभि: सह along with us, गमिष्यसि will go, तत्र there, अद्भुतम् wonderful, तत् धनुरत्नं च that  jewel of bow, द्रष्टुम् to see, अर्हसि you are  worthy of seeing.
explanation: O tiger among men, come along with us. You ought to see there the wonderful  jewel of a bow.

shloka_text: तद्धि पूर्वं नरश्रेष्ठ दत्तं सदसि दैवतै:। अप्रमेयबलं घोरं मखे परमभास्वरम्।।1.31.8।।
translation: नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, अप्रमेयबलम् having  immeasurable energy, घोरम् dreadful, परमभास्वरम् highly lustrous, तत् that (bow), पूर्वम् in the ancient days, दैवतै: by devatas, मखे at the sacrifice, सदसि in the sacrificial assembly, दत्तम् was bestowed.
explanation: O best among men, this bow of immeasurable energy. dreadful and highly lustrous was bestowed on king Janaka by devatas in a sacrificial  assembly in the past.

shloka_text: नास्य देवा न गन्धर्वा नासुरा न च राक्षसा:। कर्तुमारोपणं शक्ता न कथञ्चन मानुषा:।।1.31.9।।
translation: अस्य of that, आरोपणम् stringing of bow, कर्तुम् to do, देवा: devas, न शक्ता: are not capable, गन्धर्वा: gandharvas ,न not capable, असुरा: asuras, न not capable, राक्षसा: च rakshasas also, न not capable, मानुषा: men, कथञ्चन in any way, न not capable.
explanation: Neither devas, nor gandharvas, nor asuras nor human, are capable of stringing the bow by any means.

shloka_text: धनुषस्तस्य वीर्यं तु जिज्ञासन्तो महीक्षित:। न शेकुरारोपयितुं राजपुत्रा महाबला:।।1.31.10।।
translation: राजपुत्रा: princes, महाबला: possesing mighty strength, महीक्षित: kings, तस्य धनुष: that bow's, वीर्यम् prowess, जिज्ञासन्त: intent on knowing, आरोपयितुम् attempted to lift or string it, न शेकु: failed.
explanation: Mighty princes and kings have failed to string it, in their attempt to know its strength.

shloka_text: तद्धनुर्नरशार्दूल मैथिलस्य महात्मन:। तत्र द्रक्ष्यसि काकुत्स्थ यज्ञं चाद्भुतदर्शनम्।।1.31.11।।
translation: नरशार्दूल O Best among men, काकुत्स्थ O Descendent of Kakutstha, महात्मन: of the  magnanimous, मैथिलस्य of the king of Mithila, तद्धनु: that bow, अद्भुतदर्शनम् wonderful to look at, यज्ञं च that sacrifice, तत्र there, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.
explanation: O best of men, O descendent of Kakustha, there you will see the bow that belongs to the magnanimous king of Mithila and the wonderful sacrifice at that place.

shloka_text: तद्धि यज्ञफलं तेन मैथिलेनोत्तमं धनु:। याचितं नरशार्दूल सुनाभं सर्वदैवतै:।।1.31.12।।
translation: नरशार्दूल O Best among men, सुनाभम् with strong centre, तत् that, उत्तमं superior, धनु: bow, तेन मैथिलेन by the king of Mithila, Devarata, सर्वदैवतै: by all devatas, यज्ञफलम् as fruit of the sacrifice, याचितं हि solicited.
explanation: O best among men, that excellent bow strong in the middle was offered by king of Mithila, Devarata as well as by all devatas as fruit of the sacrifice.

shloka_text: आयागभूतं नृपतेस्तस्य वेश्मनि राघव। अर्चितं विविधैर्गन्धैर्धूपैश्चागरुगन्धिभि:।।1.31.13।।
translation: राघव O Rama, तस्य नृपते: that king's, वेश्मनि in the house, आयागभूतम् as principal deity in the festival of bows, विविधै: by various kinds of, गन्धै: sandal wood paste, अगरुगन्धिभि: fragrant Agaru, धूपैश्च with incense, अर्चितम् is worshipped.
explanation: O Rama, that bow is worshipped in the king's palace as principal deity with various kinds of perfumes, sandal paste, incense and fragrant agaru".

shloka_text: एवमुक्त्वा मुनिवर: प्रस्थानमकरोत्तदा। सर्षिसङ्घ स्सकाकुत्स्थ: आमन्त्र्य वनदेवता:।।1.31.14।।
translation: मुनिवर: the best of ascetics, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having spoken, सर्षिसङ्घ: in the company of rishis, सकाकुत्स्थ: along with Kakutstha, वनदेवता: sylvian deities, आमन्त्र्य taking leave of, तदा then, प्रस्थानम् journey, अकरोत् performed.
explanation: Having spoken thus, Viswamitra,  the best of ascetics commenced the onward journey along with the Kakutshas and rishis, taking leave of the deities of the forest.

shloka_text: स्वस्ति वोऽस्तु गमिष्यामि सिद्वस्सिद्धाश्रमादहम्। उत्तरे जाह्नवीतीरे हिमवन्तं शिलोच्चयम्।।1.31.15।।
translation: (O Deities of the forest) व: स्वस्ति may safety be yours, सिद्ध: my purpose has been achieved, अहम् I, सिद्धाश्रमात् from Siddha ashrama, उत्तरे जाह्नवीतीरे on northern side of river Jahnavi, हिमवन्तम् named Himavanta, शिलोच्चयम् mountain, गमिष्यामि I shall go.
explanation: "(O ascetics of the forest) May you be safe. My purpose has been achieved in this Siddhaashrama. From here I shall go to the Himavanta mountain situated on the northern bank of  Jahnavi" (said Viswamitra).

shloka_text: प्रदक्षिणं तत: कृत्वा सिद्धाश्रममनुत्तमम्। उत्तरां दिशमुद्दिश्य प्रस्थातुमुपचक्रमे।।1.31.16।।
translation: तत: thereafter, अनुत्तमम् the supreme, सिद्धाश्रमम् Siddha asrama, प्रदक्षिणम्     circumambulation, कृत्वा having made, उत्तरां दिशमुद्दिश्य towards northern direction, प्रस्थातुम् to perform journey, उपचक्रमे commenced.
explanation: Thereafter, circumambulating the supreme Siddhasrama with reverence, they (Viswamitra and the princes) commenced their journey in the northern direction.

shloka_text: तं प्रयान्तं मुनिवरमन्वयादनुसारिणम्। शकटीशतमात्रं तु प्रायेण ब्रह्मवादिनाम्।।1.31.17।।
translation: प्रयान्तम् as he set out for his onward journey, तं मुनिवरम् the best of ascetics, अनुसारिणाम् who was following, ब्रह्मवादिनाम् of the expounders of vedas, प्रायेण nearly, शकटीशतमात्रम् one hundred carriages alone, अन्वयात् followed.
explanation: As Viswamitra, the best of ascetics set out on his journey, expounders of the Vedas followed him, nearly in one hundred carriages.

shloka_text: मृगपक्षिगणाश्चैव सिद्धाश्रमनिवासिन:। अनुजग्मुर्महात्मानं विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम्।।1.31.18।। निवर्तयामास तत: पक्षिसङ्घान् मृगानपि।
translation: सिद्धाश्रमनिवासिन: living in Siddha asrama, मृगपक्षिगणाश्चैव hosts of birds and beasts, महात्मानम् the illustrious, विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम् maharshi Visvamitra, अनुजग्मु: followed, पक्षिसङ्गान् host of birds, मृगानपि beasts, (ततः) निवर्तयामास sent them back.
explanation: Birds and beasts living in Siddhaashrama also followed the illustrious maharshi Viswamitra over a long distance until he sent them back.

shloka_text: ते गत्वा दूरमध्वानं लम्बमाने दिवाकरे। वासं चक्रुर्मुनिगणाः शोणाकूले समाहिता:।।1.31.19।।
translation: ते मुनिगणा: those groups of sages, दूरम् अध्वानम् a long way, गत्वा having gone, दिवाकरे when the Sun, लम्बमाने was hanging down, समाहिता: assembled, शोणाकूले on the bank of river Sona, वासम् halt, चक्रु: made.
explanation: The sages travelled a long distance and halted on the bank of  Sona at sunset.

shloka_text: तेऽस्तं गते दिनकरे स्नात्वा हुतहुताशना:। विश्वामित्रं पुरस्कृत्य निषेदुरमितौजस:।।1.31.20।।
translation: अमितौजस: men possessing great splendour, ते those sages, दिनकरे when the Sun, अस्तंगते was set, स्नात्वा having bathed, हुतहुताशना: having kindled fire, विश्वामित्रम् Viswamitra, पुरस्कृत्य having honoured him, निषेदु: sat down.
explanation: The sages who possessed great splendour bathed and offered oblations to fire at sunset and sat in front of  Viswamitra.

shloka_text: रामोऽपि सहसौमित्रिर्मुनीं स्तानभिपूज्य च। अग्रतो निषसादाथ विश्वामित्रस्य धीमत:।।1.31.21।।
translation: सहसौमित्रि: together with Lakshmana, राम: अपि Rama also, तान् मुनीन् those sages, अभिपूज्य offering respectful salutations, अथ thereafter, धीमत: of the sagacious, विश्वामित्रस्य Viswamitra, अग्रत: in front of, निषसाद sat down.
explanation: Rama together with Lakshmana having offered respectful salutations to the sages, sat in front of the sagacious Viswamitra.

shloka_text: अथ रामो महातेजाः विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम्। पप्रच्छ नरशार्दूल: कौतूहलसमन्वित:।।1.31.22।।
translation: अथ thereafter, महातेजा: highly lustrous, नरशार्दूल: best among men, राम: Rama, कौतूहलसमन्वित: filled with curiosity, महामुनिम् great sage, विश्वामित्रम् Viswamitra, पप्रच्छ enquired.
explanation: Thereafter highly lustrous Rama, the best among men, filled with curiosity enquired of the great sage Viswamitra:

shloka_text: भगवन् कोऽन्वयं देशस्समृद्धवनशोभित:। श्रोतुमिच्छामि भद्रं ते वक्तुमर्हसि तत्त्वत:।।1.31.23।।
translation: भगवन् O Worshipful one, समृद्धवनशोभित: shining with affluent groves, अयम् देश: this region, क: नु what could be?, श्रोतुम् to listen, इच्छामि I am desirous, ते भद्रम् may safety be to you, तत्त्वत: truly, वक्तुम् अर्हसि you are fit to tell me.
explanation: "O worshipful one, what could be the reason for this region shining with luxuriant groves?  I wish to hear from you. You can tell me all about this (region). May it be safe for you"

shloka_text: चोदितो रामवाक्येन कथयामास सुव्रत:। तस्य देशस्य निखिलमृषिमध्ये महातपा:।।1.31.24।।
translation: सुव्रत: O Man of excellent vows, महातपा: a sage who performed rigid austerities, रामवाक्येन by the words of Rama, चोदित: urged by, ऋषिमध्ये in the midst of rishis, तस्य  देशस्य that region's, निखिलम् entire story, कथयामास described.
explanation: A sage of  excellent vows and rigid austerities, Viswamitra, urged by the words of Rama, described  in the midst of rishis the entire story relating to that region. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे एकत्रिंशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the thirtyfirst sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: [Description of the four sons of Brahma and the dynasty of Kusanabha-- enraged Windgod turns the daughters of Kusanabha into humpedback ones. ब्रह्मयोनिर्महानासीत्कुशो नाम महातपा:। अक्लिष्टव्रतधर्मज्ञः सज्जनप्रतिपूजक:।।1.32.1।।
translation: ब्रह्मयोनि: originated from Brahma, महातपा: great ascetic, अक्लिष्टव्रतधर्मज्ञ: indefatigable vows and conversant with righteousness, सज्जनप्रतिपूजक: one who worships pious  men, महान् great, कुशो नाम आसीत् there was one named Kusa.
explanation: There was a great ascetic named Kusa, born to Brahma, as ascetic indefatigable in vows, knowldegeable in dharma and a respector of the virtuous.

shloka_text: स महात्मा कुलीनायां युक्तायां सुगुणोल्बणान्। वैदर्भ्यां जनयामास चतुरस्सदृशान् सुतान्।।1.32.2।। कुशाम्बं कुशनाभं च अधूर्तरजसं वसुम्।
translation: स: महात्मा that eminent one, कुलीनायाम् in lady of noble descent, युक्तायाम् suitable to him, वैदर्भ्याम् in the princess of Vidarbha, कुशाम्बम् Kusamba, कुशनाभं च Kusanabha also, अधूर्तरजसम् Adhurta Rajasa, वसुम् Vasu, सुगुणोल्बणान् manifesting virtues, सदृशान् suitable ones, चतुर: four, सुतान् sons, जनयामास begot.
explanation: That great soul, Kusa, married the princess of Vidarbha  born in a noble family and a match for him. He begot four virtuous sons who resembled him. They were Kusamba, Kusanabha, Adhurtarajas and Vasu.

shloka_text: दीप्तियुक्तान् महोत्साहान् क्षत्रधर्मचिकीर्षया।।1.32.3।। तानुवाच कुश: पुत्रान् धर्मिष्ठान् सत्यवादिन:।
translation: कुश: Kusa, दीप्तियुक्तान् lustrous, महोत्साहान् men of great perseverance, धर्मिष्ठान् eager to observe righteousness, सत्यवादिन: men who always speak truth, तान् पुत्रान् those sons, क्षत्रधर्मचिकीर्षया with a desire to carry out duties of warrior race, उवाच spoke.
explanation: Kusa addressed his four brilliant sons who were highly enthusiastic, pious, truthful and were wedded to duties of the warrior race:

shloka_text: क्रियतां पालनं पुत्रा: धर्मं प्राप्स्यथ पुष्कलम्।।1.32.4।। ऋषेस्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा चत्वारो लोकसम्मता:। निवेशं चक्रिरे सर्वे पुराणां नृवरास्तदा।।1.32.5।।
translation: पुत्रा: O My sons, पालनम् governance, क्रियताम् may be done, पुष्कलम् immense, धर्मं merit, प्राप्स्यथ you acquire, तदा then, ऋषे: that rishi's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, लोकसम्मता: men revered in the world, चत्वार: four, नृवरा: best among men, सर्वे all of them, पुराणाम् of the cities, निवेशम् abodes, चक्रिरे constructed.
explanation: "O my sons, govern with righteousness so that you will acquire immense merit'. Hearing the words of the rishi, the four sons who were the best among men and revered in the world constructed four cities as their abodes.

shloka_text: क्रियतां पालनं पुत्रा: धर्मं प्राप्स्यथ पुष्कलम्।।1.32.4।। ऋषेस्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा चत्वारो लोकसम्मता:। निवेशं चक्रिरे सर्वे पुराणां नृवरास्तदा।।1.32.5।।
translation: पुत्रा: O My sons, पालनम् governance, क्रियताम् may be done, पुष्कलम् immense, धर्मं merit, प्राप्स्यथ you acquire, तदा then, ऋषे: that rishi's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, लोकसम्मता: men revered in the world, चत्वार: four, नृवरा: best among men, सर्वे all of them, पुराणाम् of the cities, निवेशम् abodes, चक्रिरे constructed.
explanation: "O my sons, govern with righteousness so that you will acquire immense merit'. Hearing the words of the rishi, the four sons who were the best among men and revered in the world constructed four cities as their abodes.

shloka_text: कुशाम्बस्तु महातेजा: कौशाम्बीमकरोत्पुरीम् । कुशनाभस्तु धर्मात्मा पुरं चक्रे महोदयम्।।1.32.6।।
translation: महातेजाः man possessing heroic lustre, कुशाम्बस्तु Kushamba on his part, कौशाम्बीम् Kaushambi, पुरीम् city, अकरोत् constructed, धर्मात्मा righteous, कुशनाभस्तु Kushanabha on his part, महोदयम् Mahodaya, पुरम् city, चक्रे constructed.
explanation: The brilliant Kushamba and the righteous Kushanabha constructed the cities of Kaushanbi and Mahodaya (as their capital) respectively.

shloka_text: अधूर्तरजसो राम धर्मारण्यं महीपति:। चक्रे पुरवरं राजा वसुश्चक्रे गिरिव्रजम्।।1.32.7।।
translation: राम O Rama, अधूर्तरजस: Adhurtarajasa, महीपति: king, धर्मारण्यम् Dharmaranya, पुरवरम् best of cities, चक्रे constructed, राजा king, वसु: Vasu, गिरिव्रजम् city of Girivraja, चक्रे constructed.
explanation: O Rama king Adhurtarajasa constructed Dharmaranya, the best of cities and king Vasu, the city of Girivrajam.

shloka_text: एषा वसुमती राम वसोस्तस्य महात्मन:। एते शैलवरा: पञ्च प्रकाशन्ते समन्तत:।।1.32.8।
translation: राम O Rama, एषा this,  महात्मन: of the magnanimous, तस्य वसो: that Vasu's, वसुमती land, समन्तत: surrounded by, पञ्च five, शैलवरा: excellent mountains, प्रकाशन्ते shining.
explanation: O Rama this place where we are (called Vasumati) belongs to the magnanimous king Vasu. This is  surrounded by five great shining mountains.

shloka_text: सुमागधी नदी रम्या मगधान् विश्रुताययौ। पञ्चानां शैलमुख्यानां मध्ये मालेव शोभते।।1.32.9।।
translation: रम्या delightful, विश्रुता renowned, सुमागधी नदी river Sumagadhi, मगधान् in Magadha, आययौ is flowing, पञ्चानाम् of the five, शैलमुख्यानाम् best of mountains, मध्ये amidst, माला इव like a  garland, शोभते is shining.
explanation: The delightful and renowned river Sumagadhi (known as Sona), flowing in the country of Magadha, looks beautiful like a garland amidst five great mountains.

shloka_text: सैषा हि मागधी राम वसोस्तस्य महात्मन:। पूर्वाभिचरिता राम सुक्षेत्रा सस्यमालिनी।।1.32.10।।
translation: राम Rama, सा एषा मागधी the same Magadhi river, महात्मन: of the magnanimous, तस्य वसो: pertains to Vasu, पूर्वाभिचरिता flowing from east, सुक्षेत्रा with fertile fields, सस्यमालिनी surrounded by crops as a garland.
explanation: Rama, this Magadhi river, of great Vasu flows from the east surrounded by fertile crops fields like a garland.

shloka_text: कुशनाभस्तु राजर्षि: कन्याशतमनुत्तमम्। जनयामास धर्मात्मा घृताच्यां रघुनन्दन।।1.32.11।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Prince Raghu, धर्मात्मा the virtuous one, राजर्षि: rajarshi (a kshtriya who governs kingdom in saintly detached way), कुशनाभ: तु Kusanabha, घृताच्याम् in a nymph named Ghritachi, अनुत्तमम् extremely beautiful, कन्याशतम् one hundred daughters, जनयामास begot.
explanation: O scion of the Raghu family, the virtuous rajarshi Kusanabha begot one hundred beautiful daughters through a nymph named Ghritachi.

shloka_text: तास्तु यौवनशालिन्यो रूपवत्य स्स्वलङ्कृता:। उद्यानभूमिमागम्य प्रावृषीव शतह्रदा:।।1.32.12।। गायन्त्यो नृत्यमानाश्च वादयन्त्यश्च सर्वश:। आमोदं परमं जग्मुर्वराभरणभूषिता:।।1.32.13।।
translation: यौवनशालिन्य: resplendent with youth, रूपवत्य: beautiful, ता: they, स्वलङ्कृता: well adorned, उद्यानभूमिम् pleasuregarden, आगम्य having reached, प्रावृषि in the rainy season, शतह्रदा: इव like lightenings, गायन्त्य: singing, नृत्यमानाश्च dancing, वादयन्त्य: playing on instruments, वराभरणभूषिता: decked with all ornaments, सर्वश: moving in all directions, परमम् great, आमोदम् delight, जग्मु: obtained.
explanation: Those welladorned, beautiful, young maidens in the pleasuregarden looked like lightnings in the rainy season. Bedecked with fine ornaments they were singing, dancing, playing on instruments and moving in all directions in great delight.

shloka_text: तास्तु यौवनशालिन्यो रूपवत्य स्स्वलङ्कृता:। उद्यानभूमिमागम्य प्रावृषीव शतह्रदा:।।1.32.12।। गायन्त्यो नृत्यमानाश्च वादयन्त्यश्च सर्वश:। आमोदं परमं जग्मुर्वराभरणभूषिता:।।1.32.13।।
translation: यौवनशालिन्य: resplendent with youth, रूपवत्य: beautiful, ता: they, स्वलङ्कृता: well adorned, उद्यानभूमिम् pleasuregarden, आगम्य having reached, प्रावृषि in the rainy season, शतह्रदा: इव like lightenings, गायन्त्य: singing, नृत्यमानाश्च dancing, वादयन्त्य: playing on instruments, वराभरणभूषिता: decked with all ornaments, सर्वश: moving in all directions, परमम् great, आमोदम् delight, जग्मु: obtained.
explanation: Those welladorned, beautiful, young maidens in the pleasuregarden looked like lightnings in the rainy season. Bedecked with fine ornaments they were singing, dancing, playing on instruments and moving in all directions in great delight.

shloka_text: अथ ताश्चारुसर्वाङ्ग्यो रूपेणाप्रतिमा भुवि। उद्यानभूमिमागम्य तारा इव घनान्तरे।।1.32.14।।
translation: अथ there after, चारुसर्वाङ्ग्य: having all beautiful limbs, रूपेण in beauty, भुवि on earth, अप्रतिमा: unparalleled, ता: those maidens, उद्यानभूमिम् pleasuregarden, आगम्य having reached, घनान्तरे in the midst of clouds, तारा: इव like stars (appeared).
explanation: With beautiful limbs of unparalleled beauty on earth, they shone in the pleasuregarden like stars in the midst of clouds.

shloka_text: तास्सर्वगुणसम्पन्ना रूपयौवनसंयुता:। दृष्ट्वा सर्वात्मको वायुरिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।।1.32.15।।
translation: सर्वात्मक: the all pervading one, वायु: windgod, सर्वगुणसम्पन्ना: those women endowed with all virtues, रूपयौवनसंयुता: blessed with youth and beauty, ता: them, दृष्ट्वा having seen, इदम् these, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: At the sight of the maidens embellished with all virtues and youth and beauty, the allpervading Windgod addressed them these words:

shloka_text: अहं व: कामये सर्वा भार्या मम भविष्यथ। मानुषस्त्यज्यतां भावः दीर्घमायुरवाप्स्यथ।।1.32.16।।
translation: अहम् I, व: सर्वा: all of you, कामये I am loving, मम my, भार्या: wives, भविष्यथ you may agree to become, मानुष: mortal, भाव: feeling, त्यज्यताम् may be abandoned, दीर्घम् long duration, आयु: of life, अवाप्स्यथ you may attain.
explanation: I request you all to be my wives. You will leave this feeling of mortality and attain a long life.

shloka_text: चलं हि यौवनं नित्यं मानुषेषु विशेषत:। अक्षय्यं यौवनं प्राप्ताः अमर्यश्च भविष्यथ।।1.32.17।।
translation: नित्यम् always, यौवनम् youth, चलं हि is unstable, मानुषेषु in human beings, विशेषत: especially, अक्षय्यम् permanent (not liable to deterioration), यौवनम् youth, प्राप्ता: you attain, अमर्य: च immortal women, भविष्यथ will become.
explanation: Youth is always unstable, especially in human beings. If you marry me, you will be ever youthful like devatas.

shloka_text: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा वायोरक्लिष्टकर्मण:। अपहास्य ततो वाक्यं कन्याशतमथाब्रवीत् ।।1.32.18।।
translation: तत: thereafter, अक्लिष्टकर्मण: of him who accompanies pious and wise acts, तस्य वायो: that windgod's, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, अपहास्य ridiculing him, कन्याशतम् hundred maidens, अथ thereafter, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: At the works of the untiringly blowing Windgod the lunged maidens laughed and said:

shloka_text: अन्तश्चरसि भूतानां सर्वेषां त्वं सुरोत्तम । प्रभावज्ञा: स्म ते सर्वा: किमस्मानवमन्यसे।।1.32.19।।
translation: सुरोत्तम O Best among devatas, त्वम् you, सर्वेषाम् of everyone, भूतानाम् living beings, अन्त: within, चरसि you move, सर्वा: all of us, ते your, प्रभावज्ञा: स्म knowers of your valour, अस्मान् us, किम् अवमन्यसे why are you insulting.
explanation: "O best among devatas you move within all living beings, we feel your impact. Why do you insult us?

shloka_text: कुशनाभसुतास्सर्वा: समर्थास्त्वां सुरोत्तम। स्थानाच्च्यावयितुं देवं रक्षामस्तु तपो वयम्।।1.32.20।।
translation: सुरोत्तम O Best among devatas, सर्वा: वयं all of us, कुशनाभसुता: daughters of Kusanabha, देवम् the divine one, त्वाम् you, स्थानात् from your authority, च्यावयितुम् to pull down, समर्था: तु are capable, but, तप: ascetic merit of a virgin, रक्षाम: we are protecting.
explanation: "O best among devatas we are daughters of Kusanabha, We are capable of pulling you down from your position. We are safeguarding our ascetic merit as virgins (we could curse you to save our ascetic merit)" of Kusnabha.

shloka_text: माभूत्स कालो दुर्मेध: पितरं सत्यवादिनम्। नावमन्यस्व धर्मेण स्वयं वरमुपास्महे।।1.32.21।।
translation: दुर्मेध: O Foolish one, सत्यवादिनम् always speaking truth, पितरम् our sire, न अवमन्यस्व you may not dishonour, धर्मेण by ones own duty, स्वयम् personally, वरम् bridegroom, उपास्महे will serve, स: that, काल: time, माभूत् let not come.
explanation: O wicked one, do not dishonour our father who always speaks the truth. He will choose the bridegrooms righteously. Do not invite death (father may be the cause of your death).

shloka_text: पिता हि प्रभुरस्माकं दैवतं परमं हि न:। यस्य नो दास्यति पिता स नो भर्ता भविष्यति।।1.32.22।।
translation: अस्माकम् for us, पिता our father, प्रभु: हि is lord indeed, स: he, परमम् great, दैवतम् god, पिता father, न: for us, यस्य to whom so ever, दास्यति gives, स: he, न: for us, भर्ता husband, भविष्यति will become.
explanation: Our father is our lord. Our father is god to us. Whomsoever our father offers us shall become our husband".

shloka_text: तासां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा वायु: परमकोपन:। प्रविश्य सर्वगात्राणि बभञ्ज भगवान् प्रभु:।।1.32.23।।
translation: तासाम् those maidens', तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, प्रभु: lord, the powerful one, भगवान् the venerable one, वायु: windgod, परमकोपन: exceedingly enraged, सर्वगात्राणि all the limbs of their body, प्रविश्य having entered, बभञ्ज twisted.
explanation: Having heard the words of those maidens, the most powerful and venerable Windgod became furious. He entered all the limbs of their bodies, twisted and distorted them.

shloka_text: ता: कन्या वायुना भग्ना विविशुर्नृपतेर्गृहम्। प्रापतन् भुवि सम्भ्रान्तास्सलज्जा स्सास्रलोचना:।।1.32.24।।
translation: वायुना by windgod, भग्ना: shattered, ता: कन्या: those maidens, नृपते: king's, गृहम् residence, विविशु: entered, संभ्रान्ता: agitated, सलज्जा: overtaken by shame, सास्रलोचना: with tears filling their eyes, भुवि on the ground, प्रापतन् fell down.
explanation: Their bodies disfigured and shattered by the Windgod, the maidens with tears flowing from their eyes entered the palace and fell down on the ground, agitated and overtaken by shame.

shloka_text: स च ता दयिता दीना: कन्या: परमशोभना:। दृष्ट्वा भग्नास्तदा राजा सम्भ्रान्त इदमब्रवीत्।।1.32.25।।
translation: स: राजा the king, तदा then, दयिता: beloved, दीना: distressed, परमशोभना: extremely beautiful, कन्या: daughters, भग्ना: shattered, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सम्भ्रान्त: agitated, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: The king saw his extremely beautiful beloved daughters distressed and shattered and spoke these words with bewilderment.

shloka_text: किमिदं कथ्यतां पुत्र्य: को धर्ममवमन्यते। कुब्जा: केन कृता: सर्वा वेष्टन्त्यो नाभिभाषथ। एवं राजा विनिश्श्वस्य समाधिं सन्दधे तत:।।1.32.26।।
translation: पुत्र्य: O Daughters, इदम् this, किम् what?, क: who?, धर्मम् virtue, अवमन्यते is disregarding, कथ्यताम् let it be told, सर्वा: all of you, कुब्जा: hump backed ones, केन कृता: by whom are you disfigured, वेष्टन्त्यः encircling, नाभिभाषथ you are not speaking, राजा king, एवम् in this way, विनिश्वस्य heaved a sigh, तत: then, समाधिम् concentration of mind, सन्दधे attained.
explanation: "O daughters What has happened? Who has dishonoured virtue? Say it at once. Who has made you hunchbacked? Standing roud me, why are you dumb?" The king heaved a sigh and entered into a state of samadhi. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे द्वात्रिंशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the thirtysecond sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा कुशनाभस्य धीमत:। शिरोभिश्चरणौ स्पृष्ट्वा कन्याशतमभाषत।।1.33.1।।
translation: धीमत: of sagacious, तस्य कुशनाभस्य of that Kusanabha's, तद्वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, कन्याशतम् the hundred maidens, शिरोभि: with their heads, चरणौ his feet, स्पृष्ट्वा having touched, अभाषत said.
explanation: On hearing the words of sagacious Kusanabha, his hundred daughters touched his feet  with their heads and  said:
comments: Kusanabha praises his daughters for the courage and tolerance shown towards the Windgod the birth of Brahmadatta and his marriage with the daughters of Kusanabha.

shloka_text: वायुस्सर्वात्मको राजन् प्रधर्षयितुमिच्छति। अशुभं मार्गमास्थाय न धर्मं प्रत्यवेक्षते।।1.33.2।।
translation: राजन् O King, सर्वात्मक: all pervading, वायु: windgod, अशुभम् foul, मार्गम् way, आस्थाय having taken recourse, प्रधर्षयितुम् to outrage, इच्छति is desiring, धर्मम् the law of morality, न प्रत्यवेक्षते does not consider.
explanation: "O king, the  allpervading Windgod, having taken recourse to foul means intended to outrage our modesty without and moral compunction.

shloka_text: पितृमत्यस्स्म भद्रं ते स्वच्छन्दे न वयं स्थिता:। पितरं नो वृणीष्व त्वं यदि नो दास्यते तव।।1.33.3।।
translation: वयम् we, पितृमत्य: स्म: have our father, ते भद्रम् may prosperity be to you, स्वच्छन्दे freely, न स्थिता: (we are) not situated, न: us, तव to you, दास्यते यदि whether he gives, त्वम् you, न: our, पितरम् father, वृणीष्व request.
explanation: We have our father who is dear to us. Hence we do not have freedom to choose. You may ask our father if he is willing to give us (in marriage).

shloka_text: तेन पापानुबन्धेन वचनं न प्रतीच्छता। एवं ब्रुवन्त्यस्सर्वास्स्म वायुना निहता भृशम्।।1.33.4।।
translation: एवम् in this way, ब्रुवन्त्य: while we were speaking, सर्वा: all of us, पापानुबन्धेन by the sinful one, वचनम् our words, न प्रतीच्छता without accepting, तेन वायुना by that windgod, भृशम् greatly, निहता: we are smitten.
explanation: As all of us were speaking thus, the sinful Windgod, disregarding our words repeatedly assaulted us.

shloka_text: तासां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राजा परमधार्मिक:। प्रत्युवाच महातेजा: कन्याशतमनुत्तमम्।।1.33.5।।
translation: परमधार्मिक: the highly virtuous one, महातेजा: highly powerful, राजा the king, तासाम् theirs, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, अनुत्तमम् excellent, कन्याशतम् hundred daughters, प्रत्युवाच replied.
explanation: The deeply religious and highly powerful king, having heard those words of his one hundred exceptional daughters, replied:

shloka_text: क्षान्तं क्षमावतां पुत्र्य: कर्तव्यं सुमहत्कृतम्। ऐकमत्यमुपागम्य कुलं चावेक्षितं मम।।1.33.6।।
translation: पुत्र्य: you, Daughters, क्षमावताम् of those having forberance, कर्तव्यम् fit to be done, क्षान्तम् forbearance, कृतम् has been done, सुमहत् great, ऐकमत्यम् unanimity, उपागम्य taking recourse to, मम my, कुलं च dynasty, अवेक्षितम् is taken into consideration.
explanation: "O daughters you have done a great act of forgiveness of which only the tolerant are capable. By taking a united stand, you have protected the honour of my dynasty.

shloka_text: अलङ्कारो हि नारीणां क्षमा तु पुरुषस्य वा। दुष्करं तच्च यत् क्षान्तं त्रिदशेषु विशेषत:।।1.33.7।। यादृशी व: क्षमा पुत्र्यस्सर्वासामविशेषत:।
translation: नारीणाम् for women, पुरुषस्य वा or for men, क्षमा forbearance, अलङ्कारो हि is an ornament, क्षान्तम् इति यत् which act of  forgiving, तत् दुष्करम् that one is difficult, त्रिदशेषु even for gods, विशेषत: especially difficult, पुत्र्य: Daughters, व: all of you, सर्वासाम् for the rest, अविशेषत: without difference, यादृशी similar to that.
explanation: Whether for women or men forgiveness is an ornament. It is difficult even for gods. For you, daughters, to show it without any difference of opinion is especially hard.

shloka_text: क्षमा दानं क्षमा यज्ञः क्षमा सत्यं हि पुत्रिका:।।1.33.8।। क्षमा यश: क्षमा धर्म: क्षमया निष्ठितं जगत्।
translation: क्षमा forbearance, दानम् charity, क्षमा forbearance, यज्ञः sacrifice, पुत्रिका: Daughters, क्षमा forbearance, सत्यं हि is truth indeed, क्षमा forberance, यश: glory, क्षमा forbearance, धर्म: virtue, जगत् the universe, क्षमया by forbearance, निष्ठितम् is supported.
explanation: "Forbearance is charity, forbearance is sacrifice, forbearance is truth, forbearance is glory and forbearance is virtue. O daughters, the universe is supported by forbearance".

shloka_text: विसृज्य कन्या: काकुत्स्थ राजा त्रिदशविक्रम:।।1.33.9।। मन्त्रज्ञो मन्त्रयामास प्रदानं सह मन्त्रिभि:। देशकालौ प्रदानस्य सदृशे प्रतिपादनम्।।1.33.10।।
translation: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, त्रिदशविक्रम: a man endowed with the prowess of celestials, मन्त्रज्ञ: one who is wellversed in counselling, राजा the king, कन्या: daughters, विसृज्य leaving, मन्त्रिभि: सह along with ministers, प्रदानम् bestowing of maidens, मन्त्रयामास consulted, प्रदानस्य for bestowing, देशकालौ proper time and place, सदृशे for a suitable person, प्रतिपादनम् about giving in marriage (consulted).
explanation: "O Rama after sending away his daughters, the king endowed with the power of the celestials and wellversed in the art of counselling, consulted his ministers about a suitable person for marriage of his daughters at proper time and place.

shloka_text: विसृज्य कन्या: काकुत्स्थ राजा त्रिदशविक्रम:।।1.33.9।। मन्त्रज्ञो मन्त्रयामास प्रदानं सह मन्त्रिभि:। देशकालौ प्रदानस्य सदृशे प्रतिपादनम्।।1.33.10।।
translation: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, त्रिदशविक्रम: a man endowed with the prowess of celestials, मन्त्रज्ञ: one who is wellversed in counselling, राजा the king, कन्या: daughters, विसृज्य leaving, मन्त्रिभि: सह along with ministers, प्रदानम् bestowing of maidens, मन्त्रयामास consulted, प्रदानस्य for bestowing, देशकालौ proper time and place, सदृशे for a suitable person, प्रतिपादनम् about giving in marriage (consulted).
explanation: "O Rama after sending away his daughters, the king endowed with the power of the celestials and wellversed in the art of counselling, consulted his ministers about a suitable person for marriage of his daughters at proper time and place.

shloka_text: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु चूली नाम महातपा:। ऊर्ध्वरेताश्शुभाचारो ब्राह्मं तप उपागमत्।।1.33.11।।
translation: एतस्मिन् काले एव during the same time, महातपा: a great ascetic, ऊर्ध्वरेता: living in celebacy, शुभाचार: having clean and auspicious behaviour, चूली नाम named Chuli, ब्राह्मम् in pursuit of knowledge of Brahman, तप: austerities, उपागमत् obtained.
explanation: At that time a great and virtuous ascetic named Chuli living in celebacy was performing austerities in pursuit of the knowledge of Brahman.

shloka_text: तप्यन्तं तमृषिं तत्र गन्धर्वी पर्युपासते। सोमदा नाम भद्रं ते ऊर्मिला तनया तदा।।1.33.12।।
translation: तदा then, तत्र there, तप्यन्तम् him who was performing austerities, तम् ऋषिम् that Rishi, ऊर्मिला तनया daughter of Urmila, सोमदा नाम nymph named Somada, गन्धर्वी Gandharva maiden, पर्युपासते doing service, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you.
explanation: When he was performing austerities, a nymph named Somada, daughter of Urmila, used to serve him. Prosperity to you

shloka_text: सा च तं प्रणता भूत्वा शुश्रूषणपरायणा। उवास काले धर्मिष्ठा तस्यास्तुष्टोऽभवद्गुरु:।।1.33.13।।
translation: सा च she, तम् that Chuli, प्रणता भूत्वा bowing down, शुश्रूषणपरायणा devoted to his service, धर्मिष्ठा adhering to virtue, उवास lived, काले in a proper time, गुरु: the spiritual guide, तस्या: in her, तुष्ट: अभवत् was gratified.
explanation: Somada rendered her services with devotion and humility. There she lived a religious life. In the might time her spiritual guide was satisfied with her services.

shloka_text: स च तां कालयोगेन प्रोवाच रघुनन्दन। परितुष्टोऽस्मि भद्रं ते किं करोमि तव प्रियम्।।1.33.14।।
translation: स: च that maharshi Chuli, कालयोगेन when her services have come to fruition with the passage of time, ताम् addressing her, प्रोवाच said, परितुष्ट: अस्मि I am pleased, ते भद्रम् posperity to you, तव to you, किम् what, प्रियम् favour, करोमि shall I do?
explanation: When her services came to a fruition with the passage of time, maharshi Chuli, spoke to her: 'I am pleased with you. What favour shall I do for you? May you be prosperous'

shloka_text: परितुष्टं मुनिं ज्ञात्वा गन्धर्वी मधुरस्वरा। उवाच परमप्रीता वाक्यज्ञा वाक्यकोविदम्।।1.33.15।।
translation: मुनिम् sage, परितुष्टम् gratified, ज्ञात्वा having known, मधुरस्वरा in sweet tone, वाक्यज्ञा knower of words, गन्धर्वी gandharvi, परमप्रीता who was exceedingly delighted, वाक्यकोविदम् proficient speech, उवाच said.
explanation: Having perceived that the sage was satisfied, the gandharva who was skilled in speech said exceedingly delighted to the sage in a sweet voice.

shloka_text: लक्ष्म्या समुदितो ब्राह्म्या ब्रह्मभूतो महातपा:। ब्राह्मेण तपसा युक्तं पुत्रमिच्छामि धार्मिक।।1.33.16।।
translation: महातपा: possessing great ascetism, ब्राह्म्या relating to Brahmana, लक्ष्म्या lustre, समुदित: endowed with, ब्रह्मभूत: like Brahma, धार्मिक O Righteous one, ब्राह्मेण relating to Brahma, तपसा युक्तम् endowed with ascestic virtues, पुत्रम् son, इच्छामि I am desiring.
explanation: Bestowed with the great asceticism and brilliance of a brahmin, you look like Brahma. O righteous one, I desire a son endowed with the ascetic virtues of a brahmin.

shloka_text: अपतिश्चास्मि भद्रं ते भार्या चास्मि न कस्यचित्। ब्राह्मेणोपगतायाश्च दातुमर्हसि मे सुतम्।।1.33.17।।
translation: अपति: च अस्मि I am without husband, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, कस्य चित् to any one,  भार्या wife, नास्मि I am not, उपगताया: having taken refuge in you, मे to me, ब्राह्मेण with the power of penance, सुतम् son, दातुम् अर्हसि it behoves of you to bestow.
explanation: I am without a husband, my sire. I am not a wife to any one. Since I have taken refuge in you, you are competent to bestow on me a son with the power of your penance".

shloka_text: तस्या: प्रसन्नो ब्रह्मर्षिर्ददौ पुत्रमनुत्तमम्। ब्रह्मदत्त इति ख्यातं मानसं चूलिनस्सुतम्।।1.33.18।।
translation: तस्या: to her, प्रसन्न: pleased, ब्रह्मर्षि: Brahmarshi, चूलिन: of Chuli, मानसम् born through the will of his mind, सुतम् son, ब्रह्मदत्त इति Brahmadatta, ख्यातम् wellknown, अनुत्तमम् excellent, पुत्रम् son, ददौ gave.
explanation: Pleased with her, brahmarshi Chuli gave her an excellent son to be wellknown as Brahmadatta born through the will of his mind.

shloka_text: स राजा सौमदेयस्तु पुरीमध्यवसत्तदा। कांपिल्यां परया लक्ष्म्या देवराजो यथा दिवम्।।1.33.19।।
translation: सौमदेय: the son of Somada, स: राजा that king Brahmadatta, तदा then, देवराज: Devendra, दिवं यथा like heaven, कांपिल्याम् Kampilya, पुरीम् city, परया with great, लक्ष्म्या prosperity, अध्यवसत् lived.
explanation: Then king Brahmadatta, son of Somada, lived in the city of Kampilya with great prosperity like Indra in heaven.

shloka_text: स बुद्धिं कृतवान् राजा कुशनाभस्सुधार्मिक:। ब्रह्मदत्ताय काकुत्स्थ दातुं कन्याशतं तदा।।1.33.20।।
translation: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, तदा then, सुधार्मिक: highly righteous, राजा king, स: कुशनाभ: Kusanabha, कन्याशतम् hundred daughters, ब्रह्मदत्ताय to Brahmadatta, दातुम् to give, बुद्धिं thinking, कृतवान् decided.
explanation: O Rama, then the highly righteous king Kusanabha decided to give his hundred daughters to Brahmadatta".

shloka_text: तमाहूय महातेजा ब्रह्मदत्तं महीपति:। ददौ कन्याशतं राजा सुप्रीतेनान्तरात्मना।।1.33.21।।
translation: महातेजा: highly powerful, महीपति: lord of the earth, राजा king, तम् ब्रह्मदत्तम् that Brahmadatta, आहूय having invited, सुप्रीतेन with highly pleased, अन्तरात्मना heart, कन्याशतम् a hundred daughters, ददौ gave.
explanation: The lord of the earth, highly powerful king Kusanabha invited Brahmadatta, and gave his hundred daughters in marriage to him with a heart highly pleased.

shloka_text: यथाक्रमं तत: पाणीन् जग्राह रघुनन्दन। ब्रह्मदत्तो महीपालस्तासां देवपतिर्यथा।।1.33.22।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Rama, देवपतिर्यथा resembling devendra, ब्रह्मदत्त: महीपाल: king Brahmadatta, तत: then, यथाक्रमम् in due order, तासाम् those maidens', पाणीन् hand, जग्राह received.
explanation: O son of Raghu's dynasty that king Brahmadatta resembling Indra received the hands of those maidens' in due order.

shloka_text: स्पृष्टमात्रे तत: पाणौ विकुब्जा विगतज्वरा:। युक्ता: परमया लक्ष्म्या बभु: कन्याशतं तदा।।1.33.23।।ृ32
translation: तत: thereafter, पाणौ hand, स्पृष्टमात्रे with mere touch, तदा then, कन्याशतम् hundred daughters, विकुब्जा: were devoid of hump back, विगतज्वरा: free from anguish, परमया great, लक्ष्म्या splendour, युक्ता: endowed with, बभु: shone.
explanation: Thereafter, with the mere touch of his hand, the hundred daughters were cured of their hump back and freed from anguish. They assumed great beauty.

shloka_text: स दृष्ट्वा वायुना मुक्ता: कुशनाभो महीपति:। बभूव परमप्रीतो हर्षं लेभे पुन:पुन:।।1.33.24।।
translation: महीपति: king, स: कुशनाभ: Kusanabha, वायुना by windgod, मुक्ता: released, दृष्ट्वा having seen, परमप्रीत: immensely pleased, बभूव became, पुन: पुन: again and again, हर्षम् delight, लेभे obtained.
explanation: King Kusanabha, having seen his daughters released from disfigurement caused by  the Windgod was immensely pleased. He experienced waves of delight.

shloka_text: कृतोद्वाहं तु राजानं ब्रह्मदत्तं महीपति:। सदारं प्रेषयामास सोपाध्यायगणं तदा।।1.33.25।।
translation: तदा then, महीपति: king, कृतोद्वाहम् having performed marriage, सदारम् together with his wives, सोपाध्यायगणम् in the assembly of priests, राजानम् king, ब्रह्मदत्तम् Brahmadatta, प्रेषयामास sent him to his kingdom.
explanation: Then the king along with his queens performed the marriage of his daughters in the assembly of priests and sent them with Brahmadatta (to his kingdom).

shloka_text: सोमदाऽपि सुसंहृष्टा पुत्रस्य सदृशीं क्रियाम्। यथान्यायं च गन्धर्वी स्नुषास्ता: प्रत्यनन्दत।।1.33.26।।
translation: गन्धर्वी gandharva woman, सोमदापि Somada also,सुसंहृष्टा well pleased, पुत्रस्य son's, सदृशीम् fit and proper, क्रियाम् acts, ता: स्नुषा: those daughtersinlaw, यथान्यायं properly, प्रत्यनन्दत praised.
explanation: Somada the gandharvi was exeedingly delighted with her daughtersinlaw and praised her son for his right action. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डेण्डे त्रयस्त्रिंशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the thirtythird sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: कृतोद्वाहे गते तस्मिन् ब्रह्मदत्ते च राघव। अपुत्र: पुत्रलाभाय पौत्रीमिष्टिमकल्पयत्।।1.34.1।।
translation: राघव O Rama, तस्मिन् ब्रह्मदत्ते when that Brahmadatta, कृतोद्वाहे got married, गते had gone, अपुत्र: king without sons, पुत्रलाभाय in order to obtain a son, पौत्रीम् इष्टिम् Putreshti, अकल्पयत् performed.
explanation: "O son of Raghu's dynasty (Rama) Brahmadatta got married and left for his kingdom. Now a putreshti was performed by king Kusanabha in order to beget a son.
comments: The birth of Gadhicommendation of Kausikidescription of midnight.

shloka_text: इष्ट्यां तु वर्तमानायां कुशनाभं महीपतिम्। उवाच परमोदार: कुशो ब्रह्मसुतस्तदा।।1.34.2।।
translation: तदा then, इष्ट्याम् when Putreshti, वर्तमानायाम् was being performed, परमोदार: highly generous, ब्रह्मसुत: son of Brahma, कुश: Kusa, कुशनाभमहीपतिम् king Kusanabha, उवाच spoke.
explanation: Then, while putreshti was on Kusa the highly generous son of Brahma, said to king Kusanabha :

shloka_text: पुत्रस्ते सदृश: पुत्र भविष्यति सुधार्मिक:। गाधिं प्राप्स्यसि तेन त्वं कीर्तिं लोके च शाश्वतीम्।।1.34.3।।
translation: पुत्र O My son, ते सदृश: similar to yourself, सुधार्मिक: highly virtuous, पुत्र: son, भविष्यति will be born, गाधिम् named Gadhi, प्राप्स्यसि you will obtain, तेन by him, त्वम् you, शाश्वतीम्  everlasting, लोके in this world, कीर्तिं च fame also (will obtain).
explanation: "O son, a highly virtuous son named Gadhi, similar to you will be born. Because of him you will obtain everlasting fame throughtout this world".

shloka_text: एवमुक्त्वा कुशो राम कुशनाभं महीपतिम्। जगामाकाशमाविश्य ब्रह्मलोकं सनातनाम्।।1.34.4।।
translation: राम O Rama, कुश: Kusa, महीपतिम् king, कुशनाभम् Kusanabha, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having spoken, आकाशम् the sky, आविश्य having entered, सनातनम् eternal, ब्रह्मलोकम् Brahmaloka, जगाम had gone.
explanation: "O Rama so saying to king Kusanabha, Kusa left through space for the eternal   Brahmaloka".

shloka_text: कस्य चित्त्वथ कालस्य कुशनाभस्य धीमत:। जज्ञे परमधर्मिष्ठो गाधिरित्येव नामत:।।1.34.5।।
translation: अथ thereafter, कस्यचित्कालस्य after sometime, धीमत: of the sagacious, कुशनाभस्य Kusanabha's, परमधर्मिष्ठ: supremely righteous one, नामत: by name, गाधि: इत्येव known as Gadhi, जज्ञे was born.
explanation: After some time, a supremely righteous son by name Gadhi was born to the sagacious Kusanabha.

shloka_text: स पिता मम काकुत्स्थ गाधि: परमधार्मिक:। कुशवंशप्रसूतोऽस्मि कौशिको रघुनन्दन ।।1.34.6।।
translation: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, परमधार्मिक: highly virtuous, स: गाधि: Gadhi, मम पिता my father, रघुनन्दन O Rama, कुशवंशप्रसूत: born in the family of Kusa, कौशिक: अस्मि I am known as Kausika.
explanation: O son of Raghu's dynasty the highly virtuous Gadhi is my father. I am known as Kausika being born in the family of Kusa.

shloka_text: पूर्वजा भगिनी चापि मम राघव सुव्रता। नाम्ना सत्यवती नाम ऋचीके प्रतिपादिता।।1.34.7।।
translation: राघव O Rama, सुव्रता adherent of best religious practices, नाम्ना by name, सत्यवती नाम as Satyavati, मम my, पूर्वजा भगिनी elder sister, ऋचीके for Richika, प्रतिपादिता was bestowed.
explanation: O Raghava adherent of best religious practices, is my elder sister well known by name Satyavati. She was bestowed in marriage to Richika.

shloka_text: सशरीरा गता स्वर्गं भर्तारमनुवर्तिनी। कौशिकी परमोदारा प्रवृत्ता च महानदी।।1.34.8।।
translation: भर्तारम् her husband, अनुवर्तिनी following, सशरीरा with human body, स्वर्गम् heaven, गता had gone, परमोदारा highly generous, कौशिकी named Kausiki, महानदी sacred river, प्रवृत्ता च flowed.
explanation: Following her husband my highly generous sister reached heaven with her human body and down assuming the form of a sacred river, flowed Kausiki.

shloka_text: दिव्या पुण्योदका रम्या हिमवन्तमुपाश्रिता। लोकस्य हितकामार्थं प्रवृत्ता भगिनी मम।।1.34.9।।
translation: लोकस्य for the world, हितकामार्थम् for the welfare and pleasure, प्रवृत्ता flowed, दिव्या divine, पुण्योदका sacred waters, रम्या beautiful, मम my, भगिनी sister, हिमवन्तम् Himavat mountain, उपाश्रिता took asylum.
explanation: Conferring the benefit of the other world and worldly pleasures on men my sister  Kausiki who is divine and beautiful having sacred waters took resort in Himavat mountain and started flowing from there.

shloka_text: ततोऽहं हिमवत्पार्श्वे वसामि निरतस्सुखम्। भगिन्यां स्नेहसंयुक्त: कौशिक्यां रघुनन्दन।।1.34.10।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Rama, तत: then onwards, भगिन्याम् in my sister, कौशिक्याम् in Kausiki, स्नेहसंयुक्त: possessed of affection, अहम् I, निरत: enjoying, हिमवत्पार्श्वे on the side of Himavat mountain, सुखम् happily, वसामि I am living.
explanation: O son of the Raghus', from then onwards with affection towards my sister Kausiki, I am  living happily in the vicinity of Himavat mountains.

shloka_text: सा तु सत्यवती पुण्या सत्ये धर्मे प्रतिष्ठिता। पतिव्रता महाभागा कौशिकी सरितां वरा।।1.34.11।।
translation: सा सत्यवती that Satyavati, पुण्या sacred, सत्ये in truth, धर्मे in righteousness, प्रतिष्ठिता established, पतिव्रता chaste, महाभागा holy, सरितां वरा best among rivers, कौशिकी Kausiki.
explanation: Satyavati is sacred, firmly established in truth and righteousness. She is chaste holy and best among rivers. She is known as river Kausiki.

shloka_text: अहं हि नियमाद्राम हित्वा तां समुपागत:। सिद्धाश्रममनुप्राप्य सिद्धोऽस्मि तव तेजसा।।1.34.12।।
translation: राम Rama, अहम् हि I indeed, नियमात् for religious observance, तां हित्वा leaving her, समुपागत: have come, सिद्धाश्रमम् Siddha ashrama, अनुप्राप्य having reached, तव by your, तेजसा valour, सिद्ध: अस्मि I have fulfilled my desire.
explanation: Rama, for the sake of  observance of austerity I have come to Siddhaashrama leaving her behind. Having reached here, I have fulfilled my desire through your valour.

shloka_text: एषा राम ममोत्पत्तिस्स्वस्य वंशस्य कीर्तिता। देशस्य च महाबाहो यन्मां त्वं परिपृच्छसि।।1.34.13।।
translation: महाबाहो O Mighty armed one, राम O Rama, एषा मम this is my, स्वस्य वंशस्य my family's,  देशस्य च of the place also, उत्पत्ति: origin, कीर्तिता narrated, यत् which, त्वम् you, माम् me, परिपृच्छसि are asking for.
explanation: O mightyarmed Rama since you asked me I narrated this, my origin, the history of my family and the history of this place.

shloka_text: गतोऽर्धरात्र: काकुत्स्थ कथा: कथयतो मम। निद्रामभ्येहि भद्रं ते मा भूद्विघ्नोऽध्वनीह न:।।1.34.14।।
translation: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, मम for me, कथा: stories, कथयत: while narrating, अर्धरात्र: midnight, गत: has passed by, निद्राम् sleep, अभ्येहि acquire, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, इह here, न: for us, अध्वनि on the way, विघ्न: obstacles, माभूत् let not take place.
explanation: O son of the Kakusthas while telling my stories, midnight has passed by. Go to sleep now. Prosperity to you. Let there be no obstacles on our way.

shloka_text: निष्पन्दास्तरवस्सर्वे निलीनमृगपक्षिण:। नैशेन तमसा व्याप्ता दिशश्च रघुनन्दन।।1.34.15।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Rama, सर्वे तरव: all trees, निष्पन्दा: are motionless, निलीन मृगपक्षिण: with beasts and birds resting calmed, दिशश्च all directions, नैशेन relating to night, तमसा with the darkness, व्याप्ता: pervaded.
explanation: O son of the Raghus' the trees stand motionless, with the beasts and birds calm, all directions are pervaded with darkness.

shloka_text: शनैर्वियुज्यते सन्ध्या नभो नेत्रैरिवावृतम् । नक्षत्रतारागहनं ज्योतिर्भिरिव भासते।।1.34.16।।
translation: सन्ध्या evening time, शनै: gradually, वियुज्यते is separated, नक्षत्रतारागहनम् filled with stars and planets, नभ: sky, ज्योतिर्भि: इव as if with shining stars, नेत्रै: eyes, आवृतम् इव like covered, भासते is shining.
explanation: Evening has gradually disappeared. The sky is littered with stars and planets gleaming points of light as though they are the eyes of the skies.

shloka_text: उत्तिष्ठति च शीतांशुश्शशी लोकतमोनुद:। ह्लादयन् प्राणिनां लोके मनांसि प्रभया विभो।।1.34.17।।
translation: विभो O Rama, शीतांशु: having cool rays, शशि moon, लोकतमोनुद: dispelling the darkness of world, प्रभया with moon light, लोके in this world, प्राणिनाम् of the living beings, मनांसि minds, ह्लादयन् delighting, उत्तिष्ठति is rising higher and higher.
explanation: O Lord the Moon with his cool rays, dispelling the darkness of the earth and delighting the minds of all living beings in this world, is rising higher and higher.

shloka_text: नैशानि सर्वभूतानि प्रचरन्ति ततस्तत:। यक्षराक्षससङ्घाश्च रौद्राश्च पिशिताशना:।।1.34.18।।
translation: नैशानि nocturnal, सर्वभूतानि all living beings, यक्षराक्षससङ्घाश्च groups of yakshas and rakshasas, रौद्रा: dreadful, पिशिताशनाश्च eaters of human flesh, ततस्तत: here and there, प्रचरन्ति are moving.
explanation: All nocturnal creatures groups of yakshas and rakshasas and dreadful eaters of human flesh are moving here and there".

shloka_text: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजा विरराम महामुनि:। साधु साध्विति तं सर्वे ऋषयो ह्यभ्यपूजयन्।।1.34.19।।
translation: महातेजा: highly lustrous, महामुनि: great ascetic, एवम् उक्त्वा having spoken in this way, विरराम rested, सर्वे मुनय: all sages, साधु साधु इति well said, well said, thus, तम् him, अभ्यपूजयन् praised.
explanation: Having spoken thus the highly lustrous, great ascetic rested. All sages praised him, saying, "wellsaid wellsaid"

shloka_text: कुशिकानामयं वंशो महान् धर्मपरस्सदा। ब्रह्मोपमा महात्मान: कुशवंश्या नरोत्तमा:।।1.34.20।।
translation: कुशिकानाम् of  those belonging to the family  of Kusa, अयम् वंश: this is the dynasty, महान् venerable, सदा always, धर्मपर: devoted to virtue, कुशवंश्या: belonging to Kusa dynasty, नरोत्तमा: foremost of men, महात्मान: highly revered,  ब्रह्मोपमा: similar to god Brahma.
explanation: This is the family of the Kusas, venerable always devoted to dharma, foremost of men, great like Lord Brahma.

shloka_text: विशेषेण भवानेव विश्वामित्रो महायशा:। कौशिकी सरितां श्रेष्ठा कुलोद्योतकरी तव।।1.34.21।।
translation: महायशा: highly illustrious, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, भवानेव you, yourself, विशेषेण especially (you are similar to Brahma), सरिताम् among rivers, श्रेष्ठा the best, कौशिकी Kausiki, तव your, कुलोद्योतकरी brightening the image of your dynasty.
explanation: "Highly illustrious Viswamitra, you  are similar to Brahma. Among the rivers, Kausiki is the best, refurbishing the image of your dynasty".

shloka_text: इति तैर्मुनिशार्दूलै: प्रशस्त: कुशिकात्मज: । निद्रामुपागमच्छ्रीमान् अस्तंगत इवांशुमान्।।1.34.22।।
translation: इति In this way, तै: by them, मुनिशार्दूलै: by the best of ascetics, प्रशस्त: praised, श्रीमान् the auspicious one, कुशिकात्मज: son of Kusika, श्रीमान् the lustrous, अंशुमान् Sun, अस्तगतमिव setting behind Asta mountains, निद्राम् sleep, उपागमत् obtained.
explanation: In this way, adored by the best of ascetics, the auspicious son of Kusika, went to sleep like the lustrous Sun setting.

shloka_text: रामोऽपि सहसौमित्रि: किञ्चिदागतविस्मय:। प्रशस्य मुनिशार्दूलं निद्रां समुपसेवते।।1.34.23।।
translation: सह सौमित्रि: along with Lakshmana, रामोऽपि Rama also, किञ्चित् little, आगतविस्मय: with  surprise, मुनिशार्दूलम् to the best of ascetics, प्रशस्य praising, निद्राम् sleep, समुपसेवते enjoyed.
explanation: Rama as well as Lakshmana, with a sense of wonder went to sleep full of admiration for the great ascetic. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डेण्डे चतुस्त्रिंशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the thirtyfourth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: उपास्य रात्रिशेषं तु शोणाकूले महर्षिभि:। निशायां सुप्रभातायां विश्वामित्रोऽभ्यभाषत।।1.35.1।।
translation: विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, रात्रिशेषम् rest of the night, महर्षिभि: with ascetics, शोणाकूले on the bank of river Sona, उपास्य waiting, निशायाम् in the night, सुप्रभातायाम् at dawn, अभ्यभाषत said.
explanation: Viswamitra lay on the bank of Sona with the ascetics, for the rest of the night. (Getting up) at daybreak he said:
comments: Viswamitra narrates the legend of  sacred  Ganga

shloka_text: सुप्रभाता निशा राम पूर्वा सन्ध्या प्रवर्तते। उत्तिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ भद्रं ते गमनायाभिरोचय ।।1.35.2।।
translation: राम Rama, निशा night, सुप्रभाता has gradually turned into a good dawn, पूर्वा सन्ध्या time for early morning devotions, प्रवर्तते is commencing, उत्तिष्ठ arise, उत्तिष्ठ arise, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, गमनाय for journey, अभिरोचय be inclined.
explanation: "Rama, the night makes way for the dawn. It is time for morning rituals. Arise, arise May the day bring good news Get ready for the onward journey".

shloka_text: तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं तस्य कृत्वा पौर्वाह्णिकीं क्रियाम् । गमनं रोचयामास वाक्यं चेदमुवाच ह।।1.35.3।।
translation: तस्य his, तद्वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, पौर्वाह्णिकीम् relating to forenoon, क्रियाम् oblations, कृत्वा having made, गमनम् to undertake journey, रोचयामास inclined, इदम् this,   वाक्यं च word also, उवाच ह spoke.
explanation: On hearing his words Rama performed morning oblations and getting ready for the onward journey spoke:

shloka_text: अयं शोणश्शुभजलोऽगाध: पुलिनमण्डित:। कतरेण पथा ब्रह्मन् सन्तरिष्यामहे वयम्।।1.35.4।।
translation: ब्रह्मन् O Knower of god, शुभजल: having auspicious waters, पुलिनमण्डित: adorned with sandbanks, अयम् this, शोण: Sona river, अगाध: is deep, वयम् we, कतरेण by which, पथा way, सन्तरिष्यामहे traverse.
explanation: "O knower of Brahman Clean waters of this river are adorned with sandbanks. This Sona is deep. Which way shall we cross this river?

shloka_text: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण विश्वामित्रोऽब्रवीदिदम् । एष पन्था मयोद्दिष्टो येन यान्ति महर्षय:।।1.35.5।।
translation: रामेण By Rama, एवम् thus, उक्त: having been addressed, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke, महर्षय: ascetics, येन by which way, यान्ति are going, एष: this, पन्था: way, मया by me, उद्दिष्ट: determined.
explanation: Having been addressed by Rama thus Viswamitra said, "We shall take the way the ascetics have gone before".

shloka_text: एवमुक्ता महर्षयो विश्वामित्रेण धीमता। पश्यन्तस्ते प्रयाता वै वनानि विविधानि च।।1.35.6।।
translation: धीमता by the wise, विश्वामित्रेण by Visvamitra, एवम् thus, उक्ता: spoken, ते महर्षय: those ascetics, विविधानि various, वनानि woods, पश्यन्त: seeing, प्रयाता: journeyed onwards.
explanation: With these words of the wise Viswamitra the ascetics moved forward surveying various forests.

shloka_text: ते गत्वा दूरमध्वानं गतेऽर्धदिवसे तदा। जाह्नवीं सरितां श्रेष्ठां ददृशुर्मुनिसेविताम्।।1.35.7।।
translation: ते they, दूरम् distant, अध्वानम् way, गत्वा having gone, तदा then, अर्धदिवसे in a halfday, गते having passed, मुनिसेविताम् worshipped by ascetics, सरिताम् among rivers, श्रेष्ठाम् the best, जाह्नवीम् river Jahnavi, ददृशु: saw.
explanation: After travelling a long distance for half a day, they saw Jahnavi, the best among rivers  haunted or worshipped by ascetics.

shloka_text: तां दृष्ट्वा पुण्यसलिलां हंससारससेविताम्। बभूवुर्मुदिता स्सर्वे मुनयस्सह राघवा:।।1.35.8।।
translation: पुण्यसलिलाम् having sacred waters, हंससारससेविताम् attended by swans and cranes, ताम् दृष्ट्वा having seen that (river Ganga), सहराघवा: along with Rama and Lakshmana, सर्वे मुनय: all the sages, मुदिता: बभूवु: were delighted.
explanation: On seeing the river Ganga with swans and cranes floating on the surface of the  sacred waters, all the sages including the sons of the Raghus (Rama and Lakshmana) were delighted.

shloka_text: तस्यास्तीरे ततश्चक्रुस्त आवासपरिग्रहम्। ततस्स्नात्वा यथान्यायं सन्तर्प्य पितृदेवता:।।1.35.9।। हुत्वा चैवाग्निहोत्राणि प्राश्य चामृतवद्धवि: । विविशुर्जाह्नवीतीरे शुचौ मुदितमानसा:।।1.35.10।। विश्वामित्रं महात्मानं परिवार्य समन्तत:।
translation: तत: then, ते they, तस्या: river's, तीरे on the bank, आवासपरिग्रहम् adopting as habitation, चक्रु: made, तत: then, स्नात्वा having bathed, यथान्यायम् as  per tradition, पितृदेवता: the ancestors, सन्तर्प्य having satisfied by offering waters, अग्निहोत्राणि हुत्वा after lighting their sacrificial fires, अमृतवत् like nectar, हवि: having oblations (offerings), प्राश्य partaking, मुदितमानसा: with joyful hearts, महात्मानम् the illustrious, विश्वामित्रम् Viswamitra, समन्तत: on all sides, परिवार्य surrounding, शुचौ in a sacred, जाह्नवीतीरे bank of river Jahnavi, विविशु: entered.
explanation: The birds had made the bank of the river their home. They (Rama and Lakshmana) took a dip and offered traditional oblations to ancestors. Thereafter they lighted the sacrificial fire and made customary offerings to the fire and partook of the nectarlike remains. With cheerful hearts they stood round the illustrious Viswamitra and entered the sacred bank of Jahnavi.

shloka_text: तस्यास्तीरे ततश्चक्रुस्त आवासपरिग्रहम्। ततस्स्नात्वा यथान्यायं सन्तर्प्य पितृदेवता:।।1.35.9।। हुत्वा चैवाग्निहोत्राणि प्राश्य चामृतवद्धवि: । विविशुर्जाह्नवीतीरे शुचौ मुदितमानसा:।।1.35.10।। विश्वामित्रं महात्मानं परिवार्य समन्तत:।
translation: तत: then, ते they, तस्या: river's, तीरे on the bank, आवासपरिग्रहम् adopting as habitation, चक्रु: made, तत: then, स्नात्वा having bathed, यथान्यायम् as  per tradition, पितृदेवता: the ancestors, सन्तर्प्य having satisfied by offering waters, अग्निहोत्राणि हुत्वा after lighting their sacrificial fires, अमृतवत् like nectar, हवि: having oblations (offerings), प्राश्य partaking, मुदितमानसा: with joyful hearts, महात्मानम् the illustrious, विश्वामित्रम् Viswamitra, समन्तत: on all sides, परिवार्य surrounding, शुचौ in a sacred, जाह्नवीतीरे bank of river Jahnavi, विविशु: entered.
explanation: The birds had made the bank of the river their home. They (Rama and Lakshmana) took a dip and offered traditional oblations to ancestors. Thereafter they lighted the sacrificial fire and made customary offerings to the fire and partook of the nectarlike remains. With cheerful hearts they stood round the illustrious Viswamitra and entered the sacred bank of Jahnavi.

shloka_text: अथ तत्र तदा रामो विश्वामित्रमथाब्रवीत्।।1.35.11।। भगवन् श्रोतुमिच्छामि गङ्गां त्रिपथगां नदीम्। त्रैलोक्यं कथमाक्रम्य गता नदनदीपतिम्।।1.35.12।।
translation: अथ then, राम: Rama, तदा then, तत्र there, विश्वामित्रम् addressing Visvamitra, अब्रवीत्  spoke, भगवन् O Venerable one, त्रिपथगाम् flowing in three directions, गङ्गां नदीम् about  river Ganga, श्रोतुम् to listen, इच्छामि I am desirous,त्रैलोक्यम् three worlds, आक्रम्य occupying, नदनदीपतिम् the sea, the lord of all the rivers, कथम् how, गता reached.
explanation: Then Rama said to Viswamitra "O venerable one I wish to know why Ganga flowing in three directions, occupy (purified) the three worlds before entering the sea, the lord of rivers?"

shloka_text: अथ तत्र तदा रामो विश्वामित्रमथाब्रवीत्।।1.35.11।। भगवन् श्रोतुमिच्छामि गङ्गां त्रिपथगां नदीम्। त्रैलोक्यं कथमाक्रम्य गता नदनदीपतिम्।।1.35.12।।
translation: अथ then, राम: Rama, तदा then, तत्र there, विश्वामित्रम् addressing Visvamitra, अब्रवीत्  spoke, भगवन् O Venerable one, त्रिपथगाम् flowing in three directions, गङ्गां नदीम् about  river Ganga, श्रोतुम् to listen, इच्छामि I am desirous,त्रैलोक्यम् three worlds, आक्रम्य occupying, नदनदीपतिम् the sea, the lord of all the rivers, कथम् how, गता reached.
explanation: Then Rama said to Viswamitra "O venerable one I wish to know why Ganga flowing in three directions, occupy (purified) the three worlds before entering the sea, the lord of rivers?"

shloka_text: चोदितो रामवाक्येन विश्वामित्रो महामुनि:। वृद्धिं जन्म च गङ्गाया वक्तुमेवोपचक्रमे।।1.35.13।।
translation: रामवाक्येन by Rama's words, चोदित: prompted, विश्वामित्र: महामुनि: maharshi Visvamitra, गङ्गाया: river Ganga's, जन्म birth, वृद्धिं च progress, वक्तुम् to tell, उपचक्रमे commenced.
explanation: Prompted by Rama's words, maharshi Viswamitra started narrating the account of the birth and progress of river Ganga.

shloka_text: शैलेन्द्रो हिमवान्नाम धातूनामाकरो महान्। तस्य कन्याद्वयं राम रूपेणाप्रतिमं भुवि।।1.35.14।।
translation: राम Rama, धातूनाम् for ores, महान् great, आकर: treasuretrove, हिमवन्नाम named Himavn, शैलेन्द्र: king of mountains, तस्य for him, रूपेण in loveliness, भुवि in this earth, अप्रतिमम् unrivalled, कन्याद्वयम् two daughters.
explanation: "O Rama the great mountain named Himavan is a treasuretrove of ores. He is the king of mountains. He had two daughters, unrivalled in beauty in this world.

shloka_text: या मेरुदुहिता राम तयोर्माता सुमध्यमा। नाम्ना मनोरमा नाम पत्नी हिमवत: प्रिया।।1.35.15।।
translation: राम O Rama, नाम्ना by name, मनोरमा नाम well known as Manorama, या सुमध्यमा she of beautiful waist, मेरुदुहिता daughter of mount Meru, हिमवत: Himavat's, प्रिया beloved, पत्नी wife, तयो: for both them, माता mother.
explanation: O Rama Himavan's beloved of beautiful waist, wellknown by the name of Manorama is the daughter of Mount Meru. She is the mother to both the daughters.

shloka_text: तस्यां गङ्गेयमभवज्ज्येष्ठा हिमवतस्सुता। उमा नाम द्वितीयाभून्नाम्ना तस्यैव राघव।।1.35.16।।
translation: राघव Rama, इयम् गङ्गा this Ganga, हिमवत: Himavat's, ज्येष्ठा eldest, सुता daughter, तस्याम् अभवत् born to her, तस्यैव for him only, नाम्ना by name, उमा नाम wellknown as Uma, द्वितीया अभूत् a second daughter was born.
explanation: O son of the Raghus this Ganga was born to Manorama as Himavan's eldest daughter. A second one  born to him was wellknown by the name of Uma.

shloka_text: अथ ज्येष्ठां सुरास्सर्वे देवतार्थचिकीर्षया। शैलेन्द्रं वरयामासुर्गङ्गां त्रिपथगां नदीम्।।1.35.17।।
translation: अथ thereafter, सर्वे सुरा: all devatas, देवतार्थचिकीर्षया desirous of fulfilling some purpose of  devatas, त्रिपथगाम् flowing in three directions, नदीम् river, ज्येष्ठाम् eldest daughter, गङ्गां Ganga, शैलेन्द्रम् king of mountains, वरयामासु: proposed.
explanation: Thereupon all the devatas desirous of deriving some advantage proposed that the eldest daughter of the king of mountains, Ganga, flowing in three directions be given to them.

shloka_text: ददौ धर्मेण हिमवान् तनयां लोकपावनीम्। स्वच्छन्दपथगां गङ्गां त्रैलोक्यहितकाम्यया।।1.35.18।।
translation: हिमवान् Himavan, धर्मेण having followed his duty, त्रैलोक्यहितकाम्यया intent on doing welfare  for three worlds, लोकपावनीम् sanctifying whole world, स्वच्छन्दपथगाम् flowing at her free will, तनयाम् daughter, गङ्गाम् Ganga, ददौ gave.
explanation: In order to do good to the three worlds Himavan, rooted in dharma gifted his eldest daughter Ganga who sanctifies the whole world by flowing at her free will৷৷

shloka_text: प्रतिगृह्य ततो देवास्त्रिलोकहितकारिण:। गङ्गामादाय तेऽगच्छन् कृतार्थेनान्तरात्मना।।1.35.19।।
translation: तत: then, ते देवा: those devatas, त्रिलोकहितकारिण: doing good for the three worlds, गङ्गाम् Ganga, प्रतिगृह्य having received, आदाय taking her, कृतार्थेन with a sense of fulfillment, अन्तरात्मना with the mind, अगच्छन् had gone.
explanation: The devatas having received Ganga committed to the welfare of the three worlds went back to their abodes with a sense of fulfilment in their mind.

shloka_text: या चान्या शैलदुहिता कन्यासीद्रघुनन्दन। उग्रं सा व्रतमास्थाय तपस्तेपे तपोधना।।1.35.20।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Delight of Raghus, Rama,  अन्या the other, शैलदुहिता daughter of the  mountain (Himavan), या कन्या आसीत् that maiden lived,  सा तपोधना that maiden with asceticism as her wealth, उग्रम् severe, व्रतम् vow, आस्थाय adopting, तप: austerities, तेपे observed.
explanation: O Delight of the Raghus The other daughter of the mountain Himavan was a maiden whose wealth was tapas. She pursued a vow and observed severe austerities.

shloka_text: उग्रेण तपसा युक्तां ददौ शैलवरस्सुताम्। रुद्रायाप्रतिरूपाय उमां लोकनमस्कृताम्।।1.35.21।।
translation: शैलवर: the best of Mountains, (Himavan), उग्रेण with severe, तपसा austerities, युक्ताम्  endowed with, लोकनमस्कृताम् venerated by the whole world, सुताम् daughter, उमाम् Uma, अप्रतिरूपाय unrivalled, रुद्राय for Rudra, ददौ gave.
explanation: Himavan the best of mountains gave his daughter Uma associated with severe austerities and venerated by the whole world in marriage to the unrivalled  Rudra.

shloka_text: एते ते शैलराजस्य सुते लोकनमस्कृते। गङ्गा च सरितां श्रेष्ठा उमादेवी च राघव।।1.35.22।।
translation: राघव O Rama, सरिताम् among rivers, श्रेष्ठा excellent, गङ्गा Ganga, उमादेवी च Uma devi, एते both of them, शैलराजस्य king of Mountains, Himavan's, लोकनमस्कृते worshipped by the world, ते both, सुते daughters.
explanation: O son of the Raghus Ganga, the holiest of rivers and Uma devi  are two daughters of the king of the mountains, (Himavan). They are worshipped by the entire world.

shloka_text: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं यथा त्रिपथगा नदी। खं गता प्रथमं तात गतिं गतिमतां वर ।।1.35.23।।
translation: गतिमताम् among those having marvellous gait, वर best, तात O Child, त्रिपथगा नदी  threeway flowing river, प्रथमम् firstly, यथा as, खम् गता reached the sky, एतत् सर्वम् all this, आख्यातम् is communicated to you.
explanation: O child with a marvellous gait I have related to you about Ganga flowing across the three worlds, Ganga who reached the heaven first and all that.

shloka_text: सैषा सुरनदी रम्या शैलेन्द्रस्य सुता तदा। सुरलोकं समारूढा विपापा जलवाहिनी।।1.35.24।।
translation: रम्या beautiful, विपापा without sins, जलवाहिनी flowing with water, सा एषा the same,  शैलेन्द्रस्य Himavan's, सुता daughter, तदा then, सुरनदी divine river, सुरलोकम् heavens, समारूढा ascended.
explanation: The divine Ganga, daughter of Himavan, beautiful and sinless, carrying a large volume of water ascended the heavens". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे पञ्चत्रिंशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the thirtyfifth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: उक्तवाक्ये मुनौ तस्मिन्नुभौ राघवलक्ष्मणौ। प्रतिनन्द्य कथां वीरावूचतुर्मुनिपुङ्गवम्।।1.36.1।।
translation: तस्मिन् मुनौ when that ascetic, उक्तवाक्ये had spoken the words, वीरौ two heroes, राघवलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, उभौ both, कथाम् story, प्रतिनन्द्य enjoying, मुनिपुङ्गवम् preeminent ascetic, ऊचतु: uttered.
explanation: While Viswamitra preeminent ascetic among the sages was telling the story (of Ganga) to the heroic Rama and Lakshmana, they extolled it and enquired:
comments: The devatas create obstacles to the marital bliss of Maheswara and Parvati--Goddess Parvati curses the devatas and the mother earth.

shloka_text: धर्मयुक्तमिदं ब्रह्मन् कथितं परमं त्वया । दुहितुश्शैलराजस्य ज्येष्ठाया वक्तुमर्हसि।।1.36.2।। विस्तरं विस्तरज्ञोऽसि दिव्यमानुषसम्भवम्।
translation: ब्रह्मन् O Divine sage, धर्मयुक्तम् endowed with righteousness, परमम् supreme, इदम् this story, त्वया by you, कथितम् has been narrated, शैलराजस्य king of mountains Himavan's, ज्येष्ठाया: of the eldest, दुहितु: daughter's, दिव्यमानुषसम्भवम् happened in the celestial and  mortal world, विस्तरम् detailed story, वक्तुम् to tell, अर्हसि it is worthy of you, विस्तरज्ञ: असि  you are conversant with the details.
explanation: "O Brahman sage, this excellent story set in righteousness has been narrated by you. Since you are conversant with the details, you can befittingly tell the story in detail, pertaining to the eldest daughter of king of the mountains and the events that happened in the celestial and mortal worlds

shloka_text: त्रीन् पथो हेतुना केन प्लावयेल्लोकपावनी।।1.36.3।। कथं गङ्गा त्रिपथगा विश्रुता सरिदुत्तमा। त्रिषु लोकेषु धर्मज्ञ कर्मभि: कैस्समन्विता।।1.36.4।।
translation: लोकपावनी purifying the worlds, केन हेतुना for what reason, त्रीन् three, पथ: paths, प्लावयेत् should be overflowing with waters? धर्मज्ञ O Knower of righteousness, त्रिपथगा Tripathaga (threeway flowing), गङ्गा Ganga, कै: by which,  कर्मभि: actions, अन्विता endowed with, त्रिषु लोकेषु in three worlds, सरिदुत्तमा excellent among rivers, विश्रुता well known.
explanation: Why does Ganga, the purifier of the worlds overflow the three paths (worlds)? O knower of dharma what deed made, Tripathaga (flowing in three directions) Ganga wellknown in the three worlds as the best (holiest) of all rivers"?

shloka_text: त्रीन् पथो हेतुना केन प्लावयेल्लोकपावनी।।1.36.3।। कथं गङ्गा त्रिपथगा विश्रुता सरिदुत्तमा। त्रिषु लोकेषु धर्मज्ञ कर्मभि: कैस्समन्विता।।1.36.4।।
translation: लोकपावनी purifying the worlds, केन हेतुना for what reason, त्रीन् three, पथ: paths, प्लावयेत् should be overflowing with waters? धर्मज्ञ O Knower of righteousness, त्रिपथगा Tripathaga (threeway flowing), गङ्गा Ganga, कै: by which,  कर्मभि: actions, अन्विता endowed with, त्रिषु लोकेषु in three worlds, सरिदुत्तमा excellent among rivers, विश्रुता well known.
explanation: Why does Ganga, the purifier of the worlds overflow the three paths (worlds)? O knower of dharma what deed made, Tripathaga (flowing in three directions) Ganga wellknown in the three worlds as the best (holiest) of all rivers"?

shloka_text: तथा ब्रुवति काकुत्स्थे विश्वामित्रस्तपोधन:। निखिलेन कथां सर्वामृषिमध्ये न्यवेदयत्।।1.36.5।।
translation: काकुत्स्थे when Rama, तथा ब्रुवति was thus speaking, तपोधन: sage with asceticism as his wealth, सर्वाम् entire, कथाम् story, निखिलेन completely, ऋषिमध्ये amidst sages, न्यवेदयत् revealed.
explanation: Having heard the words of the son of the Kakusthas, Viswamitra, vested with the wealth of asceticism, revealed the complete story in detail in the presence of the sages.

shloka_text: पुरा राम कृतोद्वाहो नीलकण्ठो महातपा:। दृष्ट्वा च स्पृहया देवीं मैथुनायोपचक्रमे।।1.36.6।।
translation: राम O Rama, पुरा in ancient times, कृतोद्वाह: got married, महातपा: mighty ascetic, नीलकण्ठ: lord Siva, देवीम् goddess, Uma, दृष्ट्वा having seen, स्पृहया with intense desire, मैथुनाय for enjoying marital bliss, उपचक्रमे commenced.
explanation: "O Rama, in ancient times, great ascetic the blueneck Lord Siva got married to goddess Uma charmed with her beauty he indulged in sexual enjoyment with intense passion.

shloka_text: शितिकण्ठस्य देवस्य दिव्यं वर्षशतं गतम्। न चापि तनयो राम तस्यामासीत् परन्तप।।1.36.7।।
translation: परन्तप O Tormentor of enemies, राम O Rama, देवस्य of the lord, शितिकण्ठस्य Siva's, दिव्यम् celestial, वर्षशतम् hundred years, गतम् was over, अपि च even then, तस्याम् in her  (the womb of goddess Parvati), तनय: son, न आसीत् was not born.
explanation: O Rama, tormentor of enemies, while Lord Siva was thus absorbed in sexual enjoyment, a hundred (celestial) years passed but no son was born to them.

shloka_text: ततो देवास्समुद्विग्ना: पितामहपुरोगमा:। यदिहोत्पद्यते भूतं कस्तत्प्रतिसहिष्यते।।1.36.8।।
translation: तत: then, पितामहपुरोगमा: with Brahma in the forefront, देवा: devatas, इह here, now in this goddess, यत् which, भूतम् offspring, उत्पद्यते will be born, तत् that, क: who, प्रतिसहिष्यते will be able to bear, समुद्विग्ना: were exceedingly alarmed.
explanation: "Then the devatas led by Brahma were exceedingly alarmed. 'Who will be able to bear the power of the offspring if it is born here and now', they reflected.

shloka_text: अभिगम्य सुरास्सर्वे प्रणिपत्येदमब्रुवन्। देव देव महादेव लोकस्यास्य हिते रत ।।1.36.9।। सुराणां प्रणिपातेन प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि।
translation: सुरा: devatas, सर्वे all, अभिगम्य approaching Siva, प्रणिपत्य paying obeisance, इदम् these words, अब्रुवन् spoke, देवदेव O God of devatas, अस्य लोकस्य for this world, हिते रत engaged in doing welfare of all, महादेव O Mahadeva, सुराणाम् for celestials, प्रणिपातेन with salutations, प्रसादम् mercy, कर्तुम् अर्हसि capable of doing it.
explanation: All devatas approached Siva and paying their obeisance said, "O God of the gods engaged in the welfare of all O Mahadeva accept our salutations Be king which you can be (if you will)".

shloka_text: न लोका धारयिष्यन्ति तव तेजस्सुरोत्तम ।।1.36.10।। ब्राह्मेण तपसा युक्तो देव्या सह तपश्चर। त्रैलोक्यहितकामार्थं तेजस्तेजसि धारय ।।1.36.11।।
translation: सुरोत्तम O Best among gods, तव your, तेज: energy, लोका: worlds, न धारयिष्यन्ति cannot contain, ब्राह्मेण in conformity vedas, तपसा by yogic penance, युक्त: endowed with, देव्या सह in the company with Parvati, तप: austerities, चर engage yourself,  त्रैलोक्यहितकामार्थम् with the intention of doing welfare for three worlds, तेज: energy, तेजसि in your energy, धारय retain.
explanation: "O best among the gods, the worlds cannot contain your energy (the son born of your energy) You may engage yourself in penance in the company of Uma in conformity with the Vedas. Retain your energy in your body for the  welfare of the three worlds."

shloka_text: न लोका धारयिष्यन्ति तव तेजस्सुरोत्तम ।।1.36.10।। ब्राह्मेण तपसा युक्तो देव्या सह तपश्चर। त्रैलोक्यहितकामार्थं तेजस्तेजसि धारय ।।1.36.11।।
translation: सुरोत्तम O Best among gods, तव your, तेज: energy, लोका: worlds, न धारयिष्यन्ति cannot contain, ब्राह्मेण in conformity vedas, तपसा by yogic penance, युक्त: endowed with, देव्या सह in the company with Parvati, तप: austerities, चर engage yourself,  त्रैलोक्यहितकामार्थम् with the intention of doing welfare for three worlds, तेज: energy, तेजसि in your energy, धारय retain.
explanation: "O best among the gods, the worlds cannot contain your energy (the son born of your energy) You may engage yourself in penance in the company of Uma in conformity with the Vedas. Retain your energy in your body for the  welfare of the three worlds."

shloka_text: देवतानां वचश्श्रुत्वा सर्वलोकमहेश्वर:। बाढमित्यब्रवीत्सर्वान्पुनश्चैवमुवाच ह ।।1.36.12।।
translation: सर्वलोकमहेश्वर: ruler of all the worlds, देवतानाम् devata's, वच: words, श्रुत्वा having heard, बाढम् "Be it so", इति thus, अब्रवीत् said, पुनश्च again, एवम् these words, उवाच ह spoke.
explanation: Mahadeva, ruler of the all the worlds, having heard the words of devatas, said "Be it so" Further:

shloka_text: धारयिष्याम्यहं तेजस्तेजस्येव सहोमया। त्रिदशा: पृथिवी चैव निर्वाणमधिगच्छतु।।1.36.13।।
translation: उमया सह together with Uma, अहम् I, तेज: vital fluid, तेजस्येव in my energy (body), धारयिष्यामि I shall preserve, त्रिदशा: devatas, पृथिवी चैव earth also, निर्वाणम् peace, अधिगच्छतु obtain.
explanation: " "Together with Uma I will preserve the semen in my body thereby the devatas and also the earth will have peace.

shloka_text: यदिदं क्षुभितं स्थानान्मम तेजो ह्यनुत्तमम्। धारयिष्यति कस्तन्मे ब्रुवन्तु सुरसत्तमा:।।1.36.14।।
translation: मम my , अनुत्तमम् excellent, यत् इदम् तेज: if this vital fluid, स्थानात् from its own place, क्षुभितम् is shaken, तत् then, क: who, धारयिष्यति will contain? सुरसत्तमा: best of devatas, मे to me, ब्रुवन्तु tell.
explanation: "Who will contain this exceptional vital fluid of mine if shaken from its own place? O best of devatas tell me".

shloka_text: एवमुक्तास्सुरास्सर्वे प्रत्यूचुर्वृषभध्वजम्। यत्तेज: क्षुभितं ह्येतत्तद्धरा धारयिष्यति।।1.36.15।।
translation: एवम् उक्ता: having been addressed in this way by Iswara, सुरा: सर्वे all devatas, वृषभध्वजम् having flagstaff with bull as his symbol (Iswara), प्रत्यूचु: replied, यत् तेज: that vital fluid, क्षुभितम् disturbed, एतत् thist one, धरा earth, धारयिष्यति will contain.
explanation: Thus questioned, all the devatas replied to the bearer of the flag with bull as its symbol (Siva), saying, "The earth will contain the disturbed vital fluid".

shloka_text: एवमुक्तस्सुरपति: प्रमुमोच महीतले। तेजसा पृथिवी येन व्याप्ता सगिरिकानना।।1.36.16।।
translation: एवम् उक्त: having been spoken in this way by devatas, सुरपति: lord of devatas, येन तेजसा by which vital fluid, सगिरिकानना including mountains, forests, पृथिवी earth, व्याप्ता was pervaded, महीतले on the earth, प्रमुमोच released.
explanation: Thus replied by the devatas, the god of the gods released his vital fluid  on earth. It pervaded the entire earth including mountains and forests.

shloka_text: ततो देवा: पुनरिदमूचुश्चाथ हुताशनम्। प्रविश त्वं महातेजो रौद्रं वायुसमन्वित:।।1.36.17।।
translation: तत: then, अथ thereafter, देवा: devatas, पुन: again, हुताशनम् fire deity, इदम् these words, ऊचु: spoke, त्वम् you, वायुसमन्वित: followed by wind god, रौद्रम् relating to Rudra, महातेज: mighty energy (creative power), प्रविश enter.
explanation: Then, the devatas said to the firegod, "Enter this energy (creative power) related to Rudra followed by the windgod".

shloka_text: तदग्निना पुनर्व्याप्तं सञ्जातश्श्वेतपर्वत:। दिव्यं शरवणं चैव पावकादित्यसन्निभम्।।1.36.18।। यत्र जातो महातेजा: कार्तिकेयोऽग्निसम्भव:।
translation: अग्निना by fire, व्याप्तम् pervaded, तत् that energy, पुन: again, श्वेतपर्वत: celestial white mountain, सञ्जात: became, पावकादित्यसन्निभम् resplendent as fire or Sun, दिव्यम् celestial, शरवणं चैव became forest of reeds, यत्र in which, महातेजा: glorious, अग्निसम्भव: born from fire, कार्तिकेय: son of Krittika, Kartikeya, जात: was born.
explanation: That energy pervaded by fire was transformed into the White Mountain. It turned the forest of reeds (Saravana) (blazing) like the fire or the Sun. From that fire was born the glorious Kartikeya.

shloka_text: अथोमां च शिवं चैव देवास्सर्षिगणास्तदा। पूजयामासुरत्यर्थं सुप्रीतमनसस्तत:।।1.36.19।।
translation: अथ thereafter, सर्षिगणा: with multitude of saints, देवा: devatas, तत: for that event, सुप्रीतमनस: with highly pleased minds, तदा then, उमां च goddess Uma, शिवं चैव Shiva, अत्यर्थम् with great desire, पूजयामासु: worshipped.
explanation: Thereafter highly pleased with the event the devatas along with the saints worshipped Siva and goddess Uma with deep devotion.

shloka_text: अथ शैलसुता राम त्रिदशानिदमब्रवीत्। समन्युरशपत्सर्वान् क्रोधसंरक्तलोचना।।1.36.20।।
translation: राम Rama, अथ thereafter, शैलसुता daughter of mountain Himavan, समन्यु: with anger, त्रिदशान् addressing devatas, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke, क्रोधसंरक्तलोचना with reddened eyes because of anger, सर्वान् all of them, अशपत् cursed.
explanation: "Rama thereafter Uma, daughter of the mountain (Himavan) with her eyes red with anger cursed all of them:

shloka_text: यस्मान्निवारिता चैव सङ्गति: पुत्रकाम्यया। अपत्यं स्वेषु दारेषु तस्मान्नोत्पादयिष्यथ।।1.36.21।।
translation: यस्मात् for the reason, पुत्रकाम्यया with a desire to bear son, सङ्गति: union with Mahadeva, निवारिता is prevented, तस्मात् for that reason, स्वेषु in your, दारेषु wives, अपत्यम् progeny, नोत्पादयिष्यथ you will not produce.

shloka_text: अद्यप्रभृति युष्माकमप्रजास्सन्तु पत्नय:।।1.36.22।। एवमुक्त्वासुरान् सर्वान् शशाप पृथिवीमपि।
translation: अद्यप्रभृति from today onwards, युष्माकम् your, पत्नय: wives, अप्रजा: childless, सन्तु  may become, सर्वान् all, सुरान् devatas, एवम् in this way, उत्त्वा having spoken, पृथिवीमपि Earth also, शशाप cursed.
explanation: "From today onwards your wives will become childless" cursed Uma. The devatas were cursed this Even the  earth:

shloka_text: अवने नैकरूपा त्वं बहुभार्या भविष्यसि।।1.36.23।। न च पुत्रकृतां प्रीतिं मत्क्रोधकलुषीकृता । प्राप्स्यसि त्वं सुदुर्मेधे मम पुत्रमनिच्छती।।1.36.24।।
translation: अवने O Earth, त्वम् you, नैकरूपा do not assume one single form, बहुभार्या as wife of many masters, भविष्यसि you will become, सुदुर्मेधे O evil minded one, मम for me, पुत्रम् son, अनिच्छती is not to your liking, त्वम् you, मत्क्रोधकलुषीकृता fouled as as result of my anger,  पुत्रकृताम् on account of a son, प्रीतिं च pleasure also, न प्राप्स्यसि you will not obtain.
explanation: "O Earth you will assume many forms and become wife of many masters. O evilminded one, you did not want me to bear a son. Having been fouled as a result of my anger, you will not have the pleasure of having  a son, cursed Uma.

shloka_text: अवने नैकरूपा त्वं बहुभार्या भविष्यसि।।1.36.23।। न च पुत्रकृतां प्रीतिं मत्क्रोधकलुषीकृता । प्राप्स्यसि त्वं सुदुर्मेधे मम पुत्रमनिच्छती।।1.36.24।।
translation: अवने O Earth, त्वम् you, नैकरूपा do not assume one single form, बहुभार्या as wife of many masters, भविष्यसि you will become, सुदुर्मेधे O evil minded one, मम for me, पुत्रम् son, अनिच्छती is not to your liking, त्वम् you, मत्क्रोधकलुषीकृता fouled as as result of my anger,  पुत्रकृताम् on account of a son, प्रीतिं च pleasure also, न प्राप्स्यसि you will not obtain.
explanation: "O Earth you will assume many forms and become wife of many masters. O evilminded one, you did not want me to bear a son. Having been fouled as a result of my anger, you will not have the pleasure of having  a son, cursed Uma.

shloka_text: तान् सर्वान् व्रीडितान् दृष्ट्वा सुरान्सुरपतिस्तदा। गमनायोपचक्राम दिशं वरुणपालिताम्।।1.36.25।।
translation: सुरपति: Mahesvara, तदा then, व्रीडितान् filled with humility, तान् सर्वान् all those, सुरान् devatas, दृष्ट्वा having seen, वरुणपालिताम् presided over by Varuna (Western direction), दिशम् direction, गमनाय to depart, उपचक्राम commenced.
explanation: "The god of the gods (Mahesvara), seeing all the devatas humiliated began to depart in the westerly direction presided over by Varuna.

shloka_text: स गत्वा तप आतिष्ठत्पार्श्वे तस्योत्तरे गिरौ। हिमवत्प्रभवे शृङ्गे सह देव्या महेश्वर:।।1.36.26।।
translation: महेश्वर: Mahesvara, गिरौ गत्वा having gone to the (himavat) mountain, तस्य (गिरेः) of that Himavat mountain's, उत्तरे in the  northern, पार्श्वे side, हिमवत्प्रभवे born in the Himavat mountain, शृङ्गे on a peak, देव्या सह along with goddess Uma, तप: yogic practices, अतिष्ठत् performed.
