explanation: "Mahesvara along with goddess Uma, went north of the Himavat mountain and performed penance on a peak.

shloka_text: एष ते विस्तरो राम शैलपुत्र्या निवेदित:। गङ्गाया: प्रभवं चैव शृणु मे सहलक्ष्मण:।।1.36.27।।
translation: राम O Rama, शैलपुत्र्या: relating to the daughter of Himavat mountain, Uma, एष: विस्तर: this extensive story, ते to you, (कथित: has been narrated), गङ्गाया: च relating to Ganga,  प्रभवम् her birth, निवेदित: described, सह लक्ष्मण: together with Lakshmana, श्रुणु listen.
explanation: "O Rama this story of the daughter of the mountain has been narrated to you. Now listen with Lakshmana the tale of the birth of Ganga": इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे षट्त्रिंशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the thirtysixth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: तप्यमाने तपो देवे देवा: सर्षिगणा: पुरा। सेनापतिमभीप्सन्त: पितामहमुपागमन्।।1.37.1।।
translation: पुरा in the olden days, देवे when Iswara, तप: तप्यमाने engaged in austerities, सर्षिगणा: together with ascetics, देवा: devatas, सेनापतिम् army general, अभीप्सन्त: desirous of obtaining, पितामहम् lord Brahma, उपागमन् approached.
explanation: In olden days when Iswara was engaged in austerities, the devatas together with the ascetics, approached Lord Brahma for an army general.
comments: Birth of Karttikeya.

shloka_text: ततोऽब्रुवन् सुरास्सर्वे भगवन्तं पितामहम्। प्रणिपत्य सुरास्सर्वे सेन्द्रास्साग्निपुरोगमा:।।1.37.2।।
translation: तत: then, सेन्द्रा: along with Indra, अग्निपुरोगमा: fire god in their forefront, सुरा: devatas, सर्वे all, भगवन्तम् revered, पितामहम् lord Brahma, प्रणिपत्य saluting with folded hands, अब्रुवन् spoke.
explanation: Then led by Indra and the Firegod all devatas approached Lord Brahma, the grandsire saluted him (with folded hands) and spoke.

shloka_text: यो न स्सेनापतिर्देव दत्तो भगवता पुरा। तप: परममास्थाय तप्यते स्म सहोमया।।1.37.3।।
translation: देव O lord, भगवता by the venerable one (you), पुरा formerly (at the time of creation), न: for us, य: सेनापति: that army general, दत्त: was given, उमया सह with Uma, परमम् great, तप: religious observance, आस्थाय having adopted, तप्यते is practising austerities.
explanation: "O Lord in ancient times your lordship gave us an army general (at the time of creation). He is engrossed in great penance along with Uma .

shloka_text: यदत्रानन्तरं कार्यं लोकानां हितकाम्यया। संविधत्स्व विधानज्ञ त्वं हि न: परमा गति:।।1.37.4।।
translation: विधानज्ञ knower of the law and order, O Grandsire, लोकानाम् for the worlds, हितकाम्यया desiring welfare, अत्र in this matter, अनन्तरम् after this, यत् कार्यम् whichever act, संविधत्स्व you prescribe, त्वम् you, न: for us, परमा supreme, गति: हि verily our refuge.
explanation: "O Knower of law and order O Grandsire verily you are our supreme refuge committed to the welfare of the worlds. Tell us what we should do in this matter (now that we cannot procreate a general on account of Uma's curse)".

shloka_text: देवतानां वचश्श्रुत्वा सर्वलोकपितामह:। सान्त्वयन्मधुरैर्वाक्यैस्त्रिदशानिदमब्रवीत्।।1.37.5।।
translation: सर्वलोकपितामह: grandsire of all the worlds, देवतानाम् devatas, वच: words, श्रुत्वा having heard, मधुरै: with sweet, वाक्यै: words, त्रिदशान् devatas, सान्त्वयन् consoling, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: Hearing the words of the devatas, Brahma, the Grandsire of all the worlds consoled the devatas with sweet words, saying:

shloka_text: शैल पुत्र्या यदुक्तं तन्न प्रजास्यथ पत्निषु । तस्या वचनमक्लिष्टं सत्यमेतन्न संशय:।।1.37.6।।
translation: यत् whatever, शैलपुत्र्या by Uma devi, उक्तम् has been said, तत् that, पत्निषु among your  wives, प्रजास्यथ you will not bear progeny, तस्या: her, वचनम् words, अक्लिष्टम् infalliable, एतत् this one, सत्यम् certain,संशय: न no doubt.

shloka_text: इयमाकाशगा गङ्गा यस्यां पुत्रं हुताशन:। जनयिष्यति देवानां सेनापतिमरिन्दमम्।।1.37.7।।
translation: यस्याम् in this, हुताशन: fire god, अरिन्दमम् destroyer of enemies,, देवानाम् for devatas, सेनापतिम् army general, पुत्रम् son, जनयिष्यति will beget, इयम् such, आकाशगा flowing in the celestial regions, गङ्गा Ganga (exists).
explanation: "Ganga keeps flowing in the celestial regions. Through Ganga the Firegod will beget a son who will be capable of destroying enemies. He will become the army general of the gods".

shloka_text: ज्येष्ठा शैलेन्द्रदुहिता मानयिष्यति तत्सुतम्। उमायास्तद्बहुमतं भविष्यति न संशय:।।1.37.8।।
translation: ज्येष्ठा eldest, शैलेन्द्रदुहिता daughter of king of mountains, तत्सुतम् that son of Agni, मानयिष्यति will accept, तत् that one, उमाया: for Uma devi, बहुमतं भविष्यति will be acceptable, संशय: न no doubt.
explanation: "Ganga, the eldest daughter of the king of the mountains, will tend that son of Agni. This will be totally acceptable to Uma. No doubt".

shloka_text: तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं तस्य कृतार्था रघुनन्दन। प्रणिपत्य सुरास्सर्वे पितामहमपूजयन्।।1.37.9।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Rama, सुरा: सर्वे all devatas, तस्य Brahma's, तत् that, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, कृतार्था: successful in their mission, पितामहम् grandsire, प्रणिपत्य saluting with folded hands, अपूजयन् worshipped.
explanation: "O son of the Raghus having heard Brahma's words all the devatas considered themselves successful in their mission. They saluted him with folded hands and offered their worship.

shloka_text: ते गत्वा पर्वतं राम कैलासं धातुमण्डितम्। अग्निं नियोजयामासु: पुत्रार्थं सर्वदेवता:।।1.37.10।।
translation: ते सर्वदेवता: all those devatas, धातुमण्डितम् adorned with minerals, कैलासं पर्वतम् mount Kailasa, गत्वा having gone, पुत्रार्थम् for begetting a son, अग्निम् firegod, नियोजयामासु: appointed.
explanation: All the devatas, went to mount Kailasa, adorned with minerals, and urged the Firegod for a son.

shloka_text: देवकार्यमिदं देव संविधत्स्व हुताशन। शैलपुत्र्यां महातेजो गङ्गायां तेज उत्सृज।।1.37.11।।
translation: देव O Lustrous, हुतशन O fire deity, इदम् this, देवकार्यम् divine wish, संविधत्स्व accomplish, महातेज: O god of mighty energy, तेज: vital fluid of Ishwara, शैलपुत्र्याम् in that mountain king's daughter, गङ्गायाम् Ganga, उत्सृज release.
explanation: 'O lustrous Firegod, accomplish this divine work. O god, possessed of mighty energy, release the vital fluid of Iswara in Ganga, daughter of the king of mountains.

shloka_text: देवतानां प्रतिज्ञाय गङ्गामभ्येत्य पावक:। गर्भं धारय वै देवि देवतानामिदं प्रियम्।।1.37.12।।
translation: पावक: fire deity, देवतानाम् for devatas, प्रतिज्ञाय promised, गङ्गाम् Ganga, अभ्येत्य having approached, देवि O devi, गर्भम् pregnancy, धारय वै bear, इदम् this, देवतानाम् devatas', प्रियम् desire.
explanation: "The Firegod gave his consent. The devatas approached Ganga and said, 'O goddess bear the energy of Siva (inyour world) since this cause is dear to the gods'.

shloka_text: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा दिव्यं रूपमधारयत्। दृष्ट्वा तन्महिमानं स समन्तादवकीर्यत।।1.37.13।।
translation: तस्य that firegod's, तद्वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, दिव्यम् divine, रूपम् form, अधारयत् assumed, स: that firedeity, तन्महिमानम् her greatness, दृष्ट्वा beholding, समन्तात् on all sides, अवकीर्यत split over.
explanation: "Hearing the words of the Firegod, Ganga assumed a divine form. Beholding her glory, the god of fire pervaded her from all sides.

shloka_text: समन्ततस्तदा देवीमभ्यषिञ्चत पावक:। सर्वस्रोतांसि पूर्णानि गङ्गाया रघुनन्दन।।1.37.14।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Rama, तदा then, पावक: firegod, देवीम् Ganga devi, समन्तत: on all sides, अभ्यषिञ्चत discharged (sprinkled) the vital fluid of Ishwara preserved in his body, गङ्गाया: Ganga's, सर्वस्रोतांसि all her streams, पूर्णानि were filled.
explanation: O Rama then, the Firegod discharged the vital fluid of Iswara, preserved in his body, which pervaded all sides of Ganga and all her streams were filled with (the fluid).

shloka_text: तमुवाच ततो गङ्गा सर्वदेवपुरोहितम्। अशक्ता धारणे देव तव तेज स्समुद्धतम्। दह्यमानाग्निना तेन सम्प्रव्यथितचेतना।।1.37.15।।
translation: तत: then, गङ्गा Ganga, सर्वदेवपुरोहितम् (Fire) who was standing ahead of all devatas, तम् addressing the firedeity, उवाच spoke, देव O God of fire, समुद्धतम् everincreasing, तव your, तेज: splendour, धारणे to hold, अशक्ता incapable, तेन अग्निना by firedeity (by that vital fluid), दह्यमाना being burnt, सम्प्रव्यथितचेतना I have greatly distressed consciousness.
explanation: Ganga addressing the Firegod standing ahead of all the devatas said 'O god of fire, I am incapable of holding your everincreasing splendour. The fiery fluid is burning me. My consciousness is overwhelmed'.

shloka_text: अथाब्रवीदिदं गङ्गां सर्वदेवहुताशन:। इह हैमवती पादे गर्भोऽयं सन्निवेश्यताम्।।1.37.16।।
translation: अथ thereafter, सर्वदेवहुताशन: partaker of oblations offered to all gods, गङ्गाम् Ganga, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke, अयम् this, गर्भ: embryo, इह here, हैमवती mountain Himavat, पादे slopes, सन्निवेश्यताम् may be placed.
explanation: Thereafter the Firegod who is the partaker of oblations offered to all deities said to Ganga 'Place this embryo on this slope of Mountain Himavan'.

shloka_text: श्रुत्वा त्वग्निवचो गङगा तं गर्भमतिभास्वरम्। उत्ससर्ज महातेज स्स्रोतोभ्यो हि तदानघ ।।1.37.17।।
translation: महातेज: O Highly glorious, अनघ O Sinless one, अग्निवच: words of firegod, श्रुत्वा having heard, गङ्गा Ganga, तदा then, अतिभास्वरम् highly resplendent, तम् गर्भम् that embryo, स्रोतोभ्य: towards streams of the river, उत्ससर्ज released.
explanation: "O glorious, sinless one, (Rama) hearing the words of the Firegod, Ganga then expelled that resplendent embryo from her streams.

shloka_text: यदस्या निर्गतं तस्मात्तप्तजाम्बूनदप्रभम् । काञ्चनं धरणीं प्राप्तं हिरण्यममलं शुभम्।।1.37.18।।
translation: अस्या: from this river Ganaga, तप्तजाम्बूनदप्रभम् resembling the lustre of the molten gold, यत् that embryo, निर्गतम् emerging out of her, धरणीम् earth, प्राप्तम् having reached, तस्मात् from it, शुभम् auspicious, काञ्चनम् bright, अमलम् pure, हिरण्यम् gold (was produced).
explanation: The embryo that emerged from Ganga reached the earth. It resembled the lustre of molten gold. It furned into gold auspicious, bright and pure.

shloka_text: ताम्रं कार्ष्णायसं चैव तैक्ष्ण्यादेवाभ्यजायत।।1.37.19।। मलं तस्याभवत्तत्र त्रपु सीसकमेव च। तदेतद्धरणीं प्राप्य नानाधातुरवर्धत।।1.37.20।।
translation: तत्र there, तैक्ष्ण्यात् from  its severity, ताम्रम् copper, कार्ष्णायसम् चैव iron also, अभ्यजायत were produced, तस्य from that embryo, मलम् dirt, त्रपु zinc, सीसकमेव lead, अभवत् born, तत् एतत् that vital fluid, धरणीम् earth, प्राप्य having reached, नानाधातु: various minerals, अवर्धत developed.
explanation: There copper and iron were produced from its acidity, zinc and lead from its residue. Various minerals were formed when that embryo reached the earth.

shloka_text: ताम्रं कार्ष्णायसं चैव तैक्ष्ण्यादेवाभ्यजायत।।1.37.19।। मलं तस्याभवत्तत्र त्रपु सीसकमेव च। तदेतद्धरणीं प्राप्य नानाधातुरवर्धत।।1.37.20।।
translation: तत्र there, तैक्ष्ण्यात् from  its severity, ताम्रम् copper, कार्ष्णायसम् चैव iron also, अभ्यजायत were produced, तस्य from that embryo, मलम् dirt, त्रपु zinc, सीसकमेव lead, अभवत् born, तत् एतत् that vital fluid, धरणीम् earth, प्राप्य having reached, नानाधातु: various minerals, अवर्धत developed.
explanation: There copper and iron were produced from its acidity, zinc and lead from its residue. Various minerals were formed when that embryo reached the earth.

shloka_text: निक्षिप्तमात्रे गर्भे तु तेजोभिरभिरञ्जितम्। सर्वं पर्वतसन्नद्धं सौवर्णमभवद्वनम्।।1.37.21।।
translation: गर्भे when that embryo, निक्षिप्तमात्रे had  been just placed, सर्वम् all, पर्वतसन्नद्धम् sprouted on the mountain, वनम् forest, तेजोभि: with lustre, अभिरञ्जितम् reddened, सौवर्णम् अभवत् rendered golden.
explanation: When the embryo was placed (in Ganga) it spread on all sides of the forest on the mountain. Irradiated with lustre the forest appeared golden.

shloka_text: जातरूपमिति ख्यातं तदा प्रभृति राघव। सुवर्णं पुरुषव्याघ्र हुताशनसमप्रभम्।।1.37.22।। तृणवृक्षलतागुल्मं सर्वं भवति काञ्चनम्।
translation: पुरुषव्याघ्र O Best among men, राघव Rama, तदा प्रभृति then onwards, हुताशनसमप्रभम् effulgent like fire, सुवर्णम् gold, जातरूपम् Jatarupa (born with a form), (इति) ख्यातम् wellknown as, सर्वम् all, तृणवृक्षलतागुल्मम् with grass, shrubs, creepers and trees, काञ्चनं भवति became gold.
explanation: O tiger among men, O scion of the Raghus Then onwards gold which is effulgent like fire, became wellknown as Jatarupa (pure form). The grass, shrubs, creepers and trees of that forest looked golden.

shloka_text: तं कुमारं ततो जातं सेन्द्रास्सह मरुद्गणा:।।1.37.23।। क्षीरसंभावनार्थाय कृत्तिकास्समयोजन्।
translation: तत: thereafter, जातम् born, तं कुमारम् that Kumara, सेन्द्रा: together with Indra, मरुद्गणा: groups of deities, सह together, क्षीरसंभावनार्थाय with a view to suckle him as their own offspring, कृत्तिका: six nymphs (stars) to act as nurses, समयोजन् arranged.
explanation: Thereafter Kumara was born (out of Ganga's womb). The gods together with Indra arranged six nymphs (stars) to act  as nurses to suckle Kumara as their own offspring.

shloka_text: ता: क्षीरं जातमात्रस्य कृत्वा समयमुत्तमम्।।1.37.24।। ददु: पुत्रोऽयमस्माकं सर्वासामिति निश्चिता:।
translation: ता: those Krittikas, निश्चिता: regarded within themselves, अयम् this boy, अस्माकम् सर्वासाम् for all of us, पुत्र: son, उत्तमम् great, समयम् an agreement, कृत्वा having made, जातमात्रस्य just then born boy, क्षीरम् breast milk, ददु: gave.
explanation: Those krittikas, having decided among themselves and having made an agreement with the gods saying 'This boy shall become a son to all of us' fed the newborn with their milk (breast milk).

shloka_text: ततस्तु देवता स्सर्वा: कार्तिकेय इति ब्रुवन्।।1.37.25।। पुत्रस्त्रैलोक्यविख्यातो भविष्यति न संशय:।4
translation: तत: thereafter, सर्वा: all, देवता: devatas, पुत्र: son, कार्तिकेय: इति as Karthikeya, son of Krittikas, त्रैलोक्यविख्यात: renowned in three worlds, भविष्यति shall become, संशय: न no doubt, इति ब्रुवन् thus spoke.
explanation: Thereafter, all the gods said, 'This son shall become renowned in the three worlds as Karttikeya, (son of krittikas). There is no doubt '.

shloka_text: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा स्कन्नं गर्भपरिस्रवे।।1.37.26।। स्नापयन् परया लक्ष्म्या दीप्यमानं यथानलम्।
translation: तेषाम् of those devatas', तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, गर्भपरिस्रवे when the embryo was flowing from womb, स्कन्नम् descended, अनलम् यथा like fire, परया with great, लक्ष्म्या beauty, दीप्यमानम् shining, स्नापयन् bathed.
explanation: Hearing the words of the gods, the krittikas bathed the baby that descended from the womb of Ganga resembling flaming fire and shining with great beauty.

shloka_text: स्कन्द इत्यब्रुवन् देवा: स्कन्नं गर्भपरिस्रवात्।।1.37.27।। कार्तिकेयं महाभागं काकुत्स्थ ज्वलनोपमम्।
translation: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, ज्वलनोपमम् equal to flaming fire, महाभागम् very fortunate, गर्भपरिस्रवात् embryo from womb, स्कन्नम् descended, कार्तिकेयम् Karthikeya, स्कन्द: इति will be known as Skanda, देवा: devatas, अब्रुवन् spoke.
explanation: O scion of the Kakusthas, Karttikeya lustrous like flaming fire, was very fortunate Descended from the womb of the Ganga, he is named Skanda by the gods.

shloka_text: प्रादुर्भूतं तत: क्षीरं कृत्तिकानामनुत्तमम् ।।1.37.28।। षण्णां षडाननो भूत्वा जग्राह स्तनजं पय:।
translation: तत: then, कृत्तिकानाम् of Krittikas, अनुत्तमम् very best, क्षीरम् milk, प्रादुर्भूतम् formed, षण्णाम् of  six of them, स्तनजम् coming from their breasts, पय: milk, षडानन: six faces Skanda, भूत्वा having assumed, जग्राह received.
explanation: Then excellent milk surged in the breasts of krittikas. Assuming six mouths, he sucked the milk.

shloka_text: गृहीत्वा क्षीरमेकाह्ना सुकुमारवपुस्तदा।।1.37.29।। अजयत्स्वेन वीर्येण दैत्यसेनागणान् विभु:।
translation: विभु: the capable boy, एकाह्ना for one day only, क्षीरम् milk, गृहीत्वा having received, तदा then, सुकुमारवपु: with tender body, स्वेन वीर्येण by his inborn prowess, दैत्यसेनागणान् hosts of demons, अजयत् vanquished.
explanation: Drinking milk just for a day and with a body still tender he could vanquish hosts of demons by his inborn prowess so capable be was

shloka_text: सुरसेनागणपतिं ततस्तमतुलद्युतिम्।।1.37.30।। अभ्यषिञ्चन् सुरगणा स्समेत्याग्निपुरोगमा:।
translation: तत: then, अग्निपुरोगमा: with firegod in the forefront, सुरगणा: devatas, समेत्य having  assembled, अतुलद्युतिम् a hero of unsurpassed effulgence, तम् him, सुरसेनागणपतिम् commander of devata forces, अभ्यषिञ्चन् installed.
explanation: With the Firegod in the forefront, all the gods assembled and installed Karttikeya, shining on unsurpassed brilliant, as commander of the gods forces.

shloka_text: एष ते राम गङ्गाया विस्तरोऽभिहितो मया।।1.37.31।। कुमारसम्भवश्चैव धन्य: पुण्यस्तथैव च।
translation: राम O Rama, मया by me, ते to you,गङ्गाया: Ganga's, एष: this story, विस्तर: in detail, तथैव and, धन्य: a fortunate being, पुण्य: auspiciousness, कुमारसम्भवश्चैव birth of Kumara, अभिहित: has been told.
explanation: "O Rama this story of Ganga and that of the  birth of Kumara, who was fortunate and auspicious, has been related to you in detail.

shloka_text: भक्तश्च य: कार्तिकेये काकुत्स्थ भुवि मानवः। आयुष्मान् पुत्रपौत्रैश्च स्कन्दसालोक्यतां व्रजेत्।।1.37.32।।
translation: काकुत्स्थ O Raghava, भुवि on this earth, य: मानवः who so ever, कार्तिकेये in Kartikeya, भक्त: च is a devotee, आयुष्मान् with long life, पुत्रपौत्रै: with sons and grand sons, स्कन्दसालोक्यताम् being in the same world of Skanda, व्रजेत् obtain.
explanation: O son of the Kakusthas whosoever reveres Kartikeya on this earth with devotion and faith, shall have a long life, sons and grandsons and after death will reach the world of Skanda". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डेण्डे सप्तत्रिंशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the thirtyseventh sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: तां कथां कौशिको रामे निवेद्य कुशिकात्मज:। पुनरेवापरं वाक्यं काकुत्स्थ मिदमब्रवीत्।।1.38.1।।
translation: कुशिकात्मज: the offspring of Kausika, कौशिक: Visvamitra, तां कथाम् that story, रामे to Rama, निवेद्य having related, पुनरेव again, इदम् this, (अपरं) वाक्यम् words, काकुत्स्थम् addressing Rama, अब्रवीत् had spoken.
explanation: Viswamitra, an offspring of Kusika having related the story (of Karthikeya) to the son of the Kakusthas (Rama) said again.
comments: Emperor Sagara performs austerities and a sacrifice for progeny.

shloka_text: अयोध्याधिपति श्शूर: पूर्वमासीन्नराधिप:। सगरो नाम धर्मात्मा प्रजाकामस्स चाप्रज:।।1.38.2।।
translation: पूर्वम् in ancient times, अयोध्याधिपति: ruler of Ayodhya, शूर: brave, धर्मात्मा righteous one, सगरो नाम named Sagara, नराधिप: आसीत् was king, स: he, अप्रज: was childless, प्रजाकाम: desiring children,
explanation: "In olden days there lived a brave and righteous king named Sagara who was ruler of Ayodhya. He was childless and desired to have children,

shloka_text: वैदर्भदुहिता राम केशिनी नाम नामत:। ज्येष्ठा सगरपत्नी सा धर्मिष्ठा सत्यवादिनी।।1.38.3।।
translation: राम O Rama, वैदर्भदुहिता daughter of king of Vidarbha, नामत: by name, केशिनी नाम  wellknown as Kesini, ज्येष्ठा eldest, सगरपत्नी wife of Sagara, सा she, धर्मिष्ठा righteous, सत्यवादिनी truthful.
explanation: O Rama the daughter of the king of Vidarbha by name Kesini was Sagara's eldest wife who was righteous and truthful.

shloka_text: अरिष्टनेमेर्दुहिता रूपेणाप्रतिमा भुवि। द्वितीया सगरस्यासीत्पत्नी सुमतिसंज्ञिता ।।1.38.4।।
translation: अरिष्टनेमे: Arishtanemi's, दुहिता daughter, रूपेण in charm, भुवि on this earth, अप्रतिमा unsurpassed, सुमतिसंज्ञिता named Sumati, सगरस्य Sagara's, द्वितीया second, पत्नी आसीत् was his wife.
explanation: The daughter of Arishtanemi named Sumati was the second wife of Sagara and  none surpassed her in charm on earth.

shloka_text: ताभ्यां सह महाराज: पत्नीभ्यां तप्तवांस्तप:। हिमवन्तं समासाद्य भृगुप्रस्रवणे गिरौ।।1.38.5।।
translation: तदा then, महाराजः king Sagara, ताभ्याम् पत्नीभ्याम् with those wives, सह accompanied by, हिमवन्तम् Himavat mountain, समासाद्य having reached, भृगुप्रस्रवणे on a peak called Bhriguprasravana, गिरौ mountain, तप: तप्तवान् engaged in austerities.
explanation: The king (Sagara) accompanied by his wives reached Himavat mountain and engaged  himself in severe austerities on a peak called Bhriguprasravana.

shloka_text: अथ वर्षशते पूर्णे तपसाऽराधितो मुनि:। सगराय वरं प्रादाद्भृगुस्सत्यवतां वर:।।1.38.6।।
translation: अथ then, वर्षशते when hundred years, पूर्णे had completed, तपसा by austerites, आराधित: pleased, सत्यवतां वर: best among truthful persons, भृगु: मुनि: the ascestic Bhrugu, सगराय for Sagara, वरम् boon, प्रादात् granted.
explanation: When Sagara completed a hundred years in austerities, highly pleased by his performance, ascetic Bhrugu, the best among the truthful granted him a boon.

shloka_text: अपत्यलाभस्सुमहान् भविष्यति तवानघ। कीर्तिं चाप्रतिमां लोके प्राप्स्यसे पुरुषर्षभ।।1.38.7।।
translation: अनघ O Blemishless one, तव to you, सुमहान् very great, अपत्यलाभ: gain of progeny, भविष्यति will take place, पुरुषर्षभ O Best among men, लोके in this world, अप्रतिमाम् unparalleled, कीर्तिं च fame, प्राप्स्यसे you will acquire.
explanation: O sinless one, you will get a very great progeny, O best among men you will acquire unparalleled fame in this world.

shloka_text: एका जनयिता तात पुत्रं वंशकरं तव। षष्ठिं पुत्रसहस्राणि अपरा जनयिष्यति।।1.38.8।।
translation: तात O Child, एका one wife, तव your, वंशकरम् perpetuating race, पुत्रम् one son, जनयिता will beget, अपरा the other wife, षष्ठिं sixty, पुत्रसहस्राणि thousands of sons, जनयिष्यति will beget.
explanation: O child, one wife will beget a son who will perpetuate your race and the other, sixty thousand sons, said Bhrugu.

shloka_text: भाषमाणं महात्मानं राजपुत्र्यौ प्रसाद्य तम्। ऊचतु: परमप्रीते कृताञ्जलिपुटे तदा।।1.38.9।।
translation: तदा after that, परमप्रीते exceedingly delighted, राजपुत्र्यौ daughters of kings, कृताञ्जलिपुटे  folding hands in supplication, भाषमाणम् speaking in this way, महात्मानम् magnanimous, प्रसाद्य propitiating, तम् addresseing him, ऊचतु: said.
explanation: Thereafter, both the daughters of the king were exceedingly delighted. Having propitiated  that magnanimous asectic both of them with folded hands in supplication, said:

shloka_text: एक: कस्यास्सुतो ब्रह्मन् का बहून् जनयिष्यति। श्रोतुमिच्छावहे ब्रह्मन् सत्यमस्तु वचस्तव।।1.38.10।।
translation: ब्रह्मन् O Knower of Brahman, कस्या: which of us, एक: one, सुत: son will beget, का who is she, बहून् many sons, जनयिष्यति will beget, ब्रह्मन् O Brahmarshi, श्रोतुम् to listen, इच्छावहे both of us are interested in knowing, तव your, वच: words, सत्यम् अस्तु let this be true.
explanation: O knower of Brahman which of us will beget one, and who many sons? O Brahmarshi we wish to hear. Let your words come true".

shloka_text: तयोस्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा भृगु: परमधार्मिक:। उवाच परमां वाणीं स्वच्छन्दोऽत्र विधीयताम्।।1.38.11।।
translation: परमधार्मिक: highly virtuous, भृगु: Bhrugu, तयो: their, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, परमाम् excellent, वाणीम् statement, उवाच made, अत्र in this matter, स्वच्छन्द: your free will, विधीयताम् be exercised.
explanation: Hearing their words, highly virtuous Bhrugu made an excellent statement saying, 'In this matter, you may exercise your free will'.

shloka_text: एको वंशकरो वाऽस्तु बहवो वा महाबला:। कीर्तिमन्तो महोत्साहा: का वा कं वरमिच्छति।।1.38.12।।
translation: वंशकर: perpetuating the race, एक: one, अस्तु वा shall beget, महाबला: possessed of mighty strength, कीर्तिमन्त: endowed with fame, महोत्साहा: great perseverance, बहवो वा many, का वा who among you, कं वरम् which boon, इच्छति is desiring?
explanation: 'What would you wish? One son who perpetuates the race or many possessed of mighty strength endowed with fame and perseverance?' (asked Bhrugu).

shloka_text: मुनेस्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा केशिनी रघुनन्दन। पुत्रं वंशकरं राम जग्राह नृपसन्निधौ।।1.38.13।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O One causing delight to the descendents of Raghu, राम Rama , मुने: ascetic's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, केशिनी Kesini, वंशकरम् perpetuating the race, पुत्रम् son, नृपसन्निधौ in the presence of king, जग्राह accepted.
explanation: "O Rama, delight of the descendants of Raghus, on hearing the words of the  ascetic in the presence of king Sagara, Kesini chose the boon to have a son who perpetuates the race.

shloka_text: षष्ठिं पुत्रसहस्राणि सुपर्णभगिनी तदा। महोत्साहान् कीर्तिमतो जग्राह सुमति: सुतान्।।1.38.14।।
translation: तदा then, सुपर्णभगिनी sister of (Garuda) Suparna, सुमति: Sumati, महोत्साहान् possessing great perseverance, कीर्तिमत: endowed with fame, षष्ठिम् sixty, पुत्रसहस्राणि thosands of sons, सुतान् as her sons, जग्राह accepted.
explanation: Then, Sumati (the other wife) sister of Suparna (Garuda) obtained the boon of sixty thousand sons endowed with fame and great perseverance.

shloka_text: प्रदक्षिणमृषिं कृत्वा शिरसाऽभिप्रणम्य च। जगाम स्वपुरं राजा सभार्यो रघुनन्दन ।।1.38.15।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Rama, सभार्य: along with wives, राजा king, ऋषिम् saint Bhrigu, प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा having circumambulated, शिरसा bowing down the head, अभिप्रणम्य saluting with folded hands, स्वपुरम् his own capital, जगाम went.
explanation: O son of the Raghus the king along with his wives, having circumambulated saint Bhrugu, bowed his head in reverence, saluted him with folded hands and returned to his capital.

shloka_text: अथ काले गते तस्मिन् ज्येष्ठा पुत्रं व्यजायत। असमञ्ज इति ख्यातं केशिनी सगरात्मजम्।।1.38.16।।
translation: अथ thereafter, तस्मिन् काले गते after lapse of some time, ज्येष्ठा eldest wife, केशिनी Kesini, सगरात्मजम् son of Sagara, असमञ्ज इति by name Asamanjasa, ख्यातम् well known, पुत्रम् son, व्यजायत gave birth.
explanation: After lapse of some time, the eldest wife Kesini gave birth to a son wellknown by name Asamanjasa.

shloka_text: सुमतिस्तु नरव्याघ्र गर्भतुम्बं व्यजायत। षष्ठि: पुत्रसहस्राणि तुम्बभेदाद्विनि:सृता:।।1.38.17।।
translation: नरव्याघ्र O Best among men, सुमतिस्तु Sumati, गर्भतुम्बम् gourd like foetus, व्यजायत gave birth, तुम्बभेदात् when that guard like foetus was burst open, षष्ठि: sixty, पुत्रसहस्राणि thousands of sons, विनिस्सृता: emerged.
explanation: O best among men, Sumati gave birth to a gourdlike foetus and when it burst open, sixty thousand sons emerged.

shloka_text: घृतपूर्णेषु कुम्भेषु धात्र्यस्तान् समवर्धयन्। कालेन महता सर्वे यौवनं प्रतिपेदिरे।।1.38.18।।
translation: धात्र्य: nurses, तान् them, घृतपूर्णेषु filled with clarified butter, कुम्भेषु in pots, समवर्धयन् fostered them, सर्वे all of them, महता कालेन after a long time, यौवनम् state of adolescence, प्रतिपेदिरे attained.
explanation: Nurses placed all of them in pots filled with clarified butter and fostered them. They attained adolescence after a long time.

shloka_text: अथ दीर्घेण कालेन रूपयौवनशालिन:। षष्टि: पुत्रसहस्राणि सगरस्याभवंस्तदा।।1.38.19।।
translation: अथ then, दीर्घेण कालेन after a lapse of long time, सगरस्य Sagara's, षष्ठि: पुत्रसहस्राणि sixty thousand sons, तदा then, रूपयौवनशालिन: अभवन् became resplendent with beauty and manhood.
explanation: Then, after a long time Sagara's sixty thousand sons attained beauty and youth.

shloka_text: स च ज्येष्ठो नरश्रेष्ठ सगरस्यात्मसम्भव:। बालान् गृहीत्वा तु जले सरय्वा रघुनन्दन।।1.38.20।। प्रक्षिप्य प्रहसन्नित्यं मज्जतस्तान् समीक्ष्य वै।
translation: नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men,  रघुनन्दन O Rama, ज्येष्ठ: eldest son,  स: सगरस्य आत्मसम्भव: that Sagara's son Asamanjasa, नित्यम् every day, बालान् children, गृहीत्वा seizing hold of, सरय्वा: river Sarayu's, जले waters, प्रक्षिप्य throwing them, निमज्जत: while they were drowning, तान् them, समीक्ष्य beholding, प्रहसन् while laughing (rejoiced).
explanation: O best among men, delight of the Raghus (in the mean time) sagara's eldest son  Asamanjasa, used to seize hold of children and throw them into the waters of river Sarayu. And while they were drowning, he was laughing.

shloka_text: एवं पापसमाचारस्सज्जनप्रतिबाधक:।।1.38.21।। पौराणामहिते युक्त: पुत्रो निर्वासित: पुरात्।
translation: एवम् In this manner, पापसमाचार: evilinclined, सज्जनप्रतिबाधक: tormenting the good citizens, पौराणाम् for citizens, अहिते inimical acts, युक्तः (रत:) delighted, पुत्र: son, पुरात् from capital, निर्वासित: was banished.
explanation: Thus this son inclined towards evil and formenting the good citizens was banished (of the king) from the capital for his indulgence in malevolent acts.

shloka_text: तस्य पुत्रोंऽशुमान्नाम असमञ्जस्य वीर्यवान्।।1.38.22।। सम्मत स्सर्वलोकस्य सर्वस्यापि प्रियंवद:।
translation: तस्य असमञ्जस्य for that Asamanjasa, पुत्र: son, वीर्यवान् valiant, अंशुमान् नाम named Anshuman, सर्वलोकस्य for the entire world, सम्मत: beloved, सर्वस्यापि for every one also, प्रियंवद: courteous in speech.
explanation: Asamanjasa's son was Anshuman. He was valiant, beloved and courteous to every one in the world.

shloka_text: तत: कालेन महता मतिस्समभिजायत।।1.38.23।। सगरस्य नरश्रेष्ठ यजेयमिति निश्चिता।
translation: नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, तत: afterwards, महता कालेन after a long time, सगरस्य Sagara's, यजेयम् I shall perform sacrifice, इति thus, निश्चिता firm, मति: decision, समभिजायत arose (in him).
explanation: O best among men after a long time, a thought came to the mind of Sagara to definitely perform a sacrifice.

shloka_text: स कृत्वा निश्चयं राम सोपाध्यायगणस्तदा।।1.38.24।। यज्ञकर्मणि वेदज्ञो यष्टुं समुपचक्रमे।
translation: राम O Rama, तदा then, वेदज्ञ: wellversed in vedas, स: he, सोपाध्यायगण: in the company of high priests, यज्ञकर्मणि initiatory rites relating to sacrifice, निश्चयम् determination, कृत्वा having made, यष्टुम् to perform sacrifice, समुपचक्रमे commenced.
explanation: O Rama having determined to perform a sacrifice, he (Sagara) versed in the Vedas, started the initiatory rites for the sacrifice in the company of high priests". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे अष्टात्रिंशस्सर्ग: 2 Thus ends the thirtyeighth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: विश्वामित्रवचश्श्रुत्वा कथाऽन्ते रघुनन्दन:। उवाच परमप्रीतो मुनिं दीप्तमिवानलम्।।1.39.1।।
translation: रघुनन्दन: Rama, विश्वामित्रवच: Visvamitra's words, श्रुत्वा having heard, परमप्रीत: immensely pleased, कथान्ते at the end of the narration of the tale, दीप्तम् flaming, अनलमिव fire like, मुनिम् addressing the ascetic, उवाच spoke.
explanation: Immensely pleased with the words of Viswamitra, to the ascetic flaming bright like fire, Rama spoke towards the end of the narration:
comments: Indra steals the sacrificial horse released by king Sagara Sons of Sagara excavate the earth in search of the horse the gods approach  Brahma.

shloka_text: श्रोतुमिच्छामि भद्रं ते विस्तरेण कथामिमाम्। पूर्वको मे कथं ब्रह्मन् यज्ञं वै समुपाहरत्।।1.39.2।।
translation: ब्रह्मन् O Brahmana, इमां कथाम् this tale, विस्तरेण in detail, श्रोतुम् to listen, इच्छामि I am desirous, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, मे my, पूर्वक: ancestor, यज्ञम् sacrifice, कथम् how, समुपाहरत् arranged.
explanation: "O Brahman I wish to listen in detail as to how my ancestors made preparations for the sacrifice? Prosperity to you".

shloka_text: विश्वामित्रस्तु काकुत्स्थमुवाच प्रहसन्निव। श्रूयतां विस्तरो राम सगरस्य महात्मन:।।1.39.3।।
translation: विश्वामित्रस्तु Visvamitra on his part, प्रहसन्निव (as though) smilingly, काकुत्स्थम् addressing Rama, उवाच spoke, महात्मन: of the magnanimous, सगरस्य Sagara's, विस्तर: in detail, श्रूयताम् may be heard.
explanation: Viswamitra addressing the son of the Kakusthas (Rama) with a smile said, "O Rama hear in detail the story of the magnanimous king Sagara".

shloka_text: शङ्करश्वशुरो नाम हिमवानचलोत्तम:। विंध्यपर्वतमासाद्य निरीक्षेते परस्परम्।।1.39.4।।
translation: शङ्करश्वशुर: Sankara's fatherinlaw, हिमवान्नाम named Himavt, अचलोत्तम: excellent mountain, विन्ध्यपर्वतम् Vindhya mountain, आसाद्य approaching, परस्परम् each other, निरीक्षेते beholding.
explanation: "Sankara's fatherinlaw named Himavan is the greatest mountain. Himavan and Vindhya came close and began looking at one another. (because both are of extreme height and in between them there was no obstruction).

shloka_text: तयोर्मध्ये प्रवृत्तोऽभूद्यज्ञ स्सपुरुषोत्तम। स हि देशो नरव्याघ्र प्रशस्तो यज्ञकर्मणि।।1.39.5।।
translation: पुरुषोत्तम O Best among men, स: यज्ञ: that sacrifice, तयो: मध्ये in the region in between  these two mountains, प्रवृत्त: अभूत् happened, नरव्याघ्र O Tiger among men, स: देश: that country, यज्ञकर्मणि for acts of sacrifices, प्रशस्तो हि is commendable.
explanation: "O best of men, the sacrifice took place in the region in between these two  mountains. O tiger among men the region was appropriate for conducting sacrificial acts.

shloka_text: तस्याश्वचर्यां काकुत्स्थ दृढधन्वा महारथ:। अंशुमानकरोत्तात सगरस्य मते स्थित:।।1.39.6।।
translation: तात O Child, काकुत्स्थ O Kakutstha, दृढधन्वा possessing strong bow, महारथ: great charioteer, अंशुमान् Anshuman,सगरस्य Sagara's, मते on the wish, स्थित: abiding by, तस्य relating to that sacrifice, अश्वचर्याम् following the horse, अकरोत् carried out.
explanation: "O child, O son of the Kakutsthas, the great charioteer Anshuman (who can fight with eleven thousand charioteers), wielding a strong bow  followed the  sacrificial horse (in order to protect it) in compliance with Sagara's wish.

shloka_text: तस्य पर्वणि तं यज्ञं यजमानस्य वासव:। राक्षसीं तनुमास्थाय यज्ञीयाश्वमपाहरत्।।1.39.7।।
translation: वासव: Vasava (Indra), राक्षसीम् pertaining to rakshasa, तनुम् body, आस्थाय assuming, पर्वणि on the concluding day of the fornight (fullnew moon), तं यज्ञं यजमानस्य while the sacrificer  was performing sacrifice, तस्य Sagara's, यज्ञीयाश्वम् horse relating to sacrifice, अपाहरत् had stolen.
explanation: On the concluding day of the fortnight (full moon day) while the sacrifice was being performed, Vasava (Indra) assuming the form of rakshasa, had stolen away Sagara's sacrificial horse.

shloka_text: ह्रियमाणे तु काकुत्स्थ तस्मिन्नश्वे महात्मन:। उपाध्यायगणास्सर्वे यजमानमथाब्रुवन्।।1.39.8।।
translation: काकुत्स्थ O Kakutstha, महात्मन: magnanimous Sagara's, तस्मिन् अश्वे when that horse, ह्रियमाणे was being stolen away, अथ afterwards, सर्वे all, उपाध्यायगणा: the priests, यजमानम् performer of the sacrifice, अब्रुवन् spoke.
explanation: O son of the Kakutsthas, when the magnanimous king Sagara's sacrificial horse was stolen away, all the high priests addressing the performer of the sacrifice said:

shloka_text: अयं पर्वणि वेगेन यज्ञियाश्वोऽपनीयते। हर्तारं जहि काकुत्स्थ हयश्चैवोपनीयताम्।।1.39.9।।
translation: काकुत्स्थ O Kakutstha, king Sagara, पर्वणि on this auspicious Parvan day, अयं यज्ञियाश्व: this sacrificial horse, वेगेन quickly, अपनीयते forcibly is being taken away, हर्तारम् the thief, जहि slay him, हयश्च horse, उपनीयताम्  be brought back.
explanation: 'O Kakutstha on this auspicious (fullmoon) day the sacrificial horse has been stolen away suddenly and forcibly. Slay the thief and bring back the horse'.

shloka_text: यज्ञच्छिद्रं भवत्येतत्सर्वेषामशिवाय न:। तत्तथा क्रियतां राजन् यथाऽच्छिद्र: क्रतुर्भवेत्।।1.39.10।।
translation: एतत् यज्ञच्छिद्रम् this is a flaw (hole) to sacrifice, न: सर्वेषाम् for all of us, अशिवाय भवेत् will be inauspicious, तत् for that reason, राजन् O king, क्रतु: this sacrifice, अच्छिद्र: without flaw (hole for leakage ), यथा in whichever manner, भवेत् be, तथा in that manner, क्रियताम् let it be done.
explanation: 'This flaw in sacrifice will be inauspicious for all of us. Hence O king do everything which will ensure flawlessness to this sacrifice'.

shloka_text: उपाध्यायवच श्श्रुत्वा तस्मिन् सदसि पार्थिव:। षष्टिं पुत्रसहस्राणि वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह।।1.39.11।।
translation: पार्थिव: that king, उपाध्यायवच: words of officiating priests, श्रुत्वा having heard, तस्मिन् सदसि in that sacrificial assembly, षष्टिं sixty, पुत्रसहस्राणि thousand sons, एतत् वाक्यम् these words, उवाच ह spoke.
explanation: Having heard the words of the officiating priests, the king (Sagara) addressed his sixty thousand sons in the sacrificial assembly, saying:

shloka_text: गतिं पुत्रा: न पश्यामि रक्षसां परुषर्षभा:। मन्त्रपूतैर्महाभागैरास्थितो हि महाक्रतु:।।1.39.12।।
translation: परुषर्षभा: O Best among men, पुत्रा: O Sons, रक्षसाम् for rakshsas, गतिम् access, न पश्यामि   हि I do not see indeed, महाक्रतु: this great sacrifice, मन्त्रपूतै: consecrated by mantras, महाभागै: by eminent and pious priests, आस्थित: is presided.
explanation: 'O Best among men, O sons I do not the hand of rakshasas in this as this great sacrifice is consecrated by mantras (to prevent any interruption) and is presided over by eminent priests.

shloka_text: तद्गच्छत विचिन्वध्वं पुत्रका: भद्रमस्तु व:। समुद्रमालिनीं सर्वां पृथिवीमनुगच्छत।।1.39.13।।
translation: पुत्रका: O Sons, तत् for that reason, गच्छत you may go, व: for you, भद्रम् auspiciousness, अस्तु happen, समुद्रमालिनीम् garlanded by oceans, सर्वाम् entire, पृथिवीम् earth, अनुगच्छत search for.
explanation: 'Therefore my sons, go and search this entire earth surrounded by oceans. May you be safe'.

shloka_text: एकैकयोजनं पुत्रा विस्तारमधिगच्छत। यावत्तुरगसन्दर्श: तावत् खनत मेदिनीम्। तं चैव हयहर्तारं मार्गमाणा ममाज्ञया।।1.39.14।।
translation: पुत्रा: O Sons, एकैकयोजनम् yojana by yojana, विस्तारम् length and breadth of earth, अधिगच्छत you may acquire, मम my, आज्ञया by command, तं हयहर्तारम् that thief of horse, मार्गमाणा: while search for, तुरगसन्दर्श: finding the horse, यावत् तावत् till such time, मेदिनीम् earth, खनत excavate.
explanation: 'O sons, acquiring yojana by yojana the length and breadth of the earth, search for the  thief of the horse. Excavate the earth till the time the horse is found. This is my command'.

shloka_text: दीक्षित: पौत्रसहितस्सोपाध्यायगणो ह्यहम्। इह स्थास्यामि भद्रं वो यावत्तुरगदर्शनम्।।1.39.15।।
translation: दीक्षित: having been initiated into the sacrifice, अहम् I, पौत्रसहित: with my grandson, Anshuman, सोपाध्यायगण: together with spiritual preceptors, यावत्तुरगदर्शनम् till such time the horse is found, इह here, स्थास्यामि I will stay here, व: to you, भद्रम् safety be.
explanation: 'Having been initiated into the sacrifice, I, along with my grandson, Anshuman and  other spiritual preceptors will stay here till such time the horse is found. May you be safe'

shloka_text: इत्युक्ता हृष्टमनसो राजपुत्रा महाबला:। जग्मुर्महीतलं राम पितुर्वचनयन्त्रिता:।।1.39.16।।
translation: राम O Rama, इति उक्ता: thus spoken, महाबला: highly powerful, राजपुत्रा: princes, हृष्टमनस: with joyful hearts, पितु: their father's, वचनयन्त्रिता: commanded by the words, महीतलम् about earth, जग्मु: departed.
explanation: "O Rama thus commanded by Sagara, the highly powerful princes with cheeful hearts departed in obedience to their father's command in quest of the horse on earth.

shloka_text: योजनायामविस्तारमेकैको धरणीतलम्। बिभिदु: परुषव्याघ्र वज्रस्पर्शसमैर्नखै:।।1.39.17।।
translation: परुषव्याघ्र O Tiger among men, एकैक: each one of them, योजनायामविस्तारम् one yojana of length and width, धरणीतलम् ground, वज्रस्पर्शसमै: resembling the touch (sharpness) of diamonds, नखै: with their nails, बिभिदु: broke (dug up).
explanation: O Tiger among men each one of them occupying one yojana in length and breadth of ground, dug up the earth with their nails that were sharp as diamonds.

shloka_text: शूलैरशनिकल्पैश्च हलैश्चापि सुदारुणै:। भिद्यमाना वसुमती ननाद रघुनन्दन।।1.39.18।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Rama, अशनिकल्पै: similar to thunderbolt, शूलै: with lances, सुदारुणै: which were dreadful, हलैश्च with plough, भिद्यमाना being broken, वसुमती earth, ननाद emanated sounds.
explanation: O Son of the Raghus (Rama) dreadful sounds emanated while the earth was being broken open by  ploughs and lances similar to thunderbolt.

shloka_text: नागानां मथ्यमानानामसुराणां च राघव । राक्षसानां च दुर्धर्षस्सत्त्वानां निनदोऽभवत्।।1.39.19।।
translation: राघव O Rama, मथ्यमानानाम् being churned, नागानाम् of serpents, असुराणां च of demons, राक्षसानां च of rakshasas, सत्त्वानाम् of all the creatures, दुर्धर्ष: intolerable, निनद: अभवत् sound emerged.
explanation: O descendant of Raghu when the earth was being churned, an irrepressible sound of serpents, demons and rakshasas --of all creatures emerged.

shloka_text: योजनानां सहस्राणि षष्टिं तु रघुनन्दन । बिभिदुर्धरणीं वीरा: रसातलमनुत्तमम्।।1.39.20।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Rama, वीरा: heroes, योजनानाम् of yojanas, षष्टिं सहस्राणि sixty thousand, धरणीम् earth, अनुत्तमम् great, रसातलम् nether world, बिभिदु: excavated.
explanation: O Descendant of the Raghus the heroic sons of Sagara excavated sixty thousand yojanas of earth reaching the nether world (one of the several regions below the earth).

shloka_text: एवं पर्वतसम्बाधं जम्बूद्वीपं नृपात्मजा:। खनन्तो नरशार्दूल सर्वत: परिचक्रमु:।।1.39.21।।
translation: नरशार्दूल O Foremost of men, नृपात्मजा: sons of Sagara, पर्वतसम्बाधम् filled with mountains, जम्बूद्वीपम् Jambudweepa, एवम् in this way, खनन्त: while excavating, सर्वत: everywhere, परिचक्रमु: moved around.
explanation: O Foremost among men (Rama) the princes while thus excavating Jambu dweepa,  in this way filled with mountains, moved around everywhere.

shloka_text: ततो देवास्सगन्धर्वास्सासुरास्सहपन्नगा:। सम्भ्रान्तमनसस्सर्वे पितामहमुपागमन्।।1.39.22।।
translation: तत: afterwards, सगन्धर्वा: together with gandharvas, सासुरा: with asuras, सपन्नगा: with serpents, देवा: gods, सर्वे all, सम्भ्रान्तमनस: with bewildered minds, पितामहम् lord Brahma, उपागमन् approached.
explanation: Then the gods together with the gandharvas, asuras and serpents in bewildered minds approached Lord Brahma.

shloka_text: ते प्रसाद्य महात्मानं विषण्णवदनास्तदा। ऊचु: परमसन्त्रस्ता पितामहमिदं वच:।।1.39.23।।
translation: परमसन्त्रस्ता: highly agitated, विषण्णवदना: with meloncholic faces, ते they, महात्मानम् magnanimous, पितामहम् Brahma, प्रसाद्य having propitiated him, इदं वचः these words, ऊचु: spoke.
explanation: With highly agitated minds and meloncholic faces, all of them approached magnanimous Brahma and having propitiated him said:

shloka_text: भगवन् पृथिवी सर्वा खन्यते सगरात्मजै:। बहवश्च महात्मानो हन्यन्ते तलवासिन:।।1.39.24।।
translation: भगवन् O Venerable one, सर्वा entire, पृथिवी earth, सगरात्मजै: by sons of Sagara, खन्यते is being excavated, तलवासिन: those living in the lower worlds, बहव: many, महात्मान: great  beings, हन्यन्ते are being killed.
explanation: O Venerable one the entire earth is being excavated by the sons of Sagara. Many great beings living in the lower worlds are being killed.

shloka_text: अयं यज्ञहरोऽस्माकमनेनाश्वोऽपनीयते। इति ते सर्वभूतानि निघ्नन्ति सगरात्मजा:।।1.39.25।।
translation: अयम् this one, अस्माकं our, यज्ञहर: destroyer of our sacrifice, अनेन by him, अश्व: horse, अपनीयते is being stolen away, इति saying so, ते सगरात्मजा: those sons of Sagara, सर्वभूतानि all beings, निघ्नन्ति are slaying.
explanation: 'This one  is the destroyer of our sacrifice. He  has stolen away our horse' saying so the sons of Sagara are slaying all living beings". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे एकोनचत्वारिंशस्सर्ग: ।। Thus ends the thirtyninth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: . देवतानां वचश्श्रुत्वा भगवान्वै पितामह:। प्रत्युवाच सुसन्त्रस्तान्कृतान्तबलमोहितान्।।1.40.1।।
translation: भगवान् the adorable one, पितामह: grandsire, Brahma, देवतानाम् devatas', वच: words, श्रुत्वा having heard, कृतान्तबलमोहितान् deprived of the activity of their senses by the prowess of fate, सुसन्त्रस्तान् exceedingly frightened, प्रत्युवाच replied back.
explanation: Having heard the devatas, extremely frightened, and deprived of their sensual perception by the prowess of fate. The adorable grandsire (Brahma) replied:
comments: Brahma consoles the devatas--sons of Sagara continue to excavate the earth in search of sacrificial horse-- trace the horse near Kapila--cursed by Kapila, Sagara's sons are reduced to ashes

shloka_text: यस्येयं वसुधा कृत्स्ना वासुदेवस्य धीमत:। कापिलं रूपमास्थाय धारयत्यनिशं धराम्।।1.40.2।। तस्य कोपाग्निना दग्धा भविष्यन्ति नृपात्मजा:।
translation: कृत्स्ना whole, इयं वसुधा this earth, यस्य whose, धीमत: sagacious, वासुदेवस्य Vasudeva's, कापिलं रूपम् the form of Kapila, आस्थाय assuming, अनिशम् always, धराम् earth, धारयति supports, नृपात्मजा: sons of Sagara, तस्य his, कोपाग्निना by the fire of wrath, दग्धा: भविष्यन्ति  will be burnt.
explanation: 'This whole earth belongs to sagacious Vasudeva. He always supports the earth assuming the form of Kapila. The princes will be burnt by the fire of his wrath.

shloka_text: पृथिव्याश्चापि निर्भेदोऽदृष्ट एव सनातन:।।1.40.3।। सगरस्य च पुत्राणां विनाशोऽदीर्घजीविनाम्।
translation: पृथिव्या this earth, निर्भेद: excavation, अदीर्घजीविनाम् of the short lived men, सगरस्य पुत्राणाम्  of the sons of Sagara, विनाशश्च destruction, सनातन: in ancient times, दृष्ट एव is     predestined.
explanation: The excavation of this earth and the destruction of the short lived sons of Sagara is predestined since eternity'.

shloka_text: पितामहवचश्श्रुत्वा त्रयस्त्रिंशदरिन्दम।।1.40.4।। देवा: परमसंहृष्टा: पुनर्जग्मुर्यथागतम्।
translation: अरिन्दम O Destroyer of enemies, पितामहवच: words of grandsire, Brahma, श्रुत्वा having heard, त्रयस्त्रिंशत् देवा: thirty three devatas, परमसंहृष्टा: exceedingly delighted, यथागतम् in the way they had come, पुन: again, जग्मु: returned.
explanation: "O Destroyer of enemies (Rama) On hearing the words of the grandsire (Brahma), the  thirtythree gods, exceedingly delighted returned the way they had come.

shloka_text: सगरस्य च पुत्राणां प्रादुरासीन्महात्मनाम्।।1.40.5।। पृथिव्यां भिद्यमानायां निर्घातसमनिस्वन:।
translation: महात्मनाम् of the noble, सगरस्य Sagara's, पुत्राणाम् sons, पृथिव्याम् when the earth, भिद्यमानायाम् when the earth was being riven, निर्घातसमनिस्वन: resembling the crash of thunder, प्रादुरासीत् emanated.
explanation: A sound like the resembling of thunder emanated while the earth was being riven by the noble sons of Sagara.

shloka_text: ततो भित्वा महीं सर्वे कृत्वा चाभिप्रदक्षिणम्।।1.40.6।। सहिता स्सगरास्सर्वे पितरं वाक्यमब्रुवन्।0
translation: तत: afterwards, सर्वे all of them, महीम् earth, भित्वा having riven, अभिप्रदक्षिणम् circumabulation, कृत्वा having made, सर्वे सगरा: all the sons of Sagara, सहिता together,  पितरम् addrerssing their father, वाक्यम् words, अब्रुवन् spoke.
explanation: Afterwards, all the sons of Sagara, having riven the earth approached their father and circumamulating him said:

shloka_text: परिक्रान्ता मही सर्वा सत्त्ववन्तश्च सूदिता:।।1.40.7।। देवदानवरक्षांसि पिशाचोरगकिन्नरा:। न च पश्यामहेऽश्वं तमश्वहर्तारमेव च।।1.40.8।। किं करिष्याम भद्रं ते बुद्धिरत्र विचार्यताम्।
translation: सर्वा entire, मही earth, परिक्रान्ता roamed about, सत्त्ववन्त: च mighty,  देवदानवरक्षांसि devatas, demons, rakshasas, पिशाचोरगकिन्नरा: pisachas, uragas, kinnaras, सूदिता: were killed, अश्वम् horse, तं अश्वहर्तारमेव च or the thief of the horse, न पश्यामहे च we could not see, किं करिष्याम what should we do?, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, अत्र in this matter, बुध्दि: विचार्यताम् reflect over this matter.
explanation: 'The entire earth was ransacked. Mighty devatas, demons, rakshasas, pisachas, uragas and kinnaras were killed. (Yet) we could neither see the horse nor the thief of the horse. Reflect over this matter and direct us. Prosperity to you'

shloka_text: परिक्रान्ता मही सर्वा सत्त्ववन्तश्च सूदिता:।।1.40.7।। देवदानवरक्षांसि पिशाचोरगकिन्नरा:। न च पश्यामहेऽश्वं तमश्वहर्तारमेव च।।1.40.8।। किं करिष्याम भद्रं ते बुद्धिरत्र विचार्यताम्।
translation: सर्वा entire, मही earth, परिक्रान्ता roamed about, सत्त्ववन्त: च mighty,  देवदानवरक्षांसि devatas, demons, rakshasas, पिशाचोरगकिन्नरा: pisachas, uragas, kinnaras, सूदिता: were killed, अश्वम् horse, तं अश्वहर्तारमेव च or the thief of the horse, न पश्यामहे च we could not see, किं करिष्याम what should we do?, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, अत्र in this matter, बुध्दि: विचार्यताम् reflect over this matter.
explanation: 'The entire earth was ransacked. Mighty devatas, demons, rakshasas, pisachas, uragas and kinnaras were killed. (Yet) we could neither see the horse nor the thief of the horse. Reflect over this matter and direct us. Prosperity to you'

shloka_text: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा पुत्राणां राजसत्तम:।।1.40.9।। समन्युरब्रवीद्वाक्यं सगरो रघुनन्दन।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Rama, तेषां पुत्राणाम् of those sons', तद्वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, राजसत्तम: magnanimous king, सगर: Sagara, समन्यु: incensed, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् said.
explanation: "O Rama incensed to fury at the words of his sons, magnanimous king Sagara replied":

shloka_text: भूय: खनत भद्रं वो निर्भिद्य वसुधातलम्।।1.40.10।। अश्वहर्तारमासाद्य कृतार्थाश्च निवर्तथ।
translation: वसुधातलम् the surface of the earth, निर्भिद्य after haing riven, भूय: again, खनत: for them who were excavating, अश्वहर्तारम् the thief of the horse, आसाद्य having traced, कृतार्था: having accomplished the purpose, निवर्तथ return, व:भद्रम् safety to you.
explanation: Rive the earth again and excavate, capture the one who has stolen the horse and return after having accomplished the purpose.  Safety to you

shloka_text: पितुर्वचनमासाद्य सगरस्य महात्मन:।।1.40.11।। षष्टि: पुत्रसहस्राणि रसातलमभिद्रवन्।
translation: पितु: of the royal sire, महात्मन: magnanimous, सगरस्य Sagara's, वचनम् words, आसाद्य having received, षष्टि: पुत्रसहस्राणि sixsty thousand sons, रसातलम् Rasatala(nether world), अभिद्रवन् ran towards.
explanation: Receiving the command of their father, the magnanimous Sagara, his sixty thousand sons ran towards Rasatala (nether world).

shloka_text: खन्यमाने ततस्तस्मिन् ददृशु: पर्वतोपमम्।।1.40.12।। दिशागजं विरूपाक्षं धारयन्तं महीतलम्।
translation: तत: Subsequently, तस्मिन् when that region, खन्यमाने was being excavated, पर्वतोपमम् in size equal to mountain, महीतलम् earth, धारयन्तम् supporting, विरूपाक्षम् named Virupaksha, दिशागजम् elephant of the quarter, ददृशु: beheld.
explanation: Then while they were excavating the region they beheld the elephant of the quarter named Virupaksha equal in size to a mountain, supporting the earth.

shloka_text: सपर्वतवनां कृत्स्नां पृथिवीं रघुनन्दन।।1.40.13।। शिरसा धारयामास विरूपाक्षो महागज:।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Rama, विरूपाक्ष: Virupaksha, महागज: mighty elephant, सपर्वतवनाम् together with mountains and forests, कृत्स्नाम् entire, महीम् earth, शिरसा on its head, धारयामास was holding.
explanation: O descendant of Raghu the  mighty elephant Virupaksha was holding on its head the entire earth with its mountains and forests.

shloka_text: यदा पर्वणि काकुत्स्थ विश्रमार्थं महागज:।।1.40.14।। खेदाच्चालयते शीर्षं भूमिकम्पस्तदाभवेत्।
translation: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, महागज: that mighty elephant, पर्वणि on certain sacred days, यदा when, विश्रमार्थम् for refreshing, खेदात् from weariness, शीर्षम् head, चालयते shakes, तदा then, भूमिकम्प: earthquake, भवेत् takes place.
explanation: O descendant of Kakustha when that mighty elephant shakes its head for rest from weariness on certain sacred days earthquake occurs.

shloka_text: तं ते प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा दिशापालं महागजम्।।1.40.15।। मानयन्तो हि ते राम जग्मुर्भित्त्वा रसातलम्।
translation: राम O Rama, ते they, दिशापालं protector of the quarter, तम् महागजम् that  mighty elephant, प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा having circumabulated, मानयन्त: honouring it,  भित्त्वा riving the earth, रसातलम् Rasatala, जग्मु: had gone.
explanation: O Rama having circumabulated and honoured that mighty elephant, the protector of the quarter they reached the Rasatala by riving the earth.

shloka_text: तत: पूर्वां दिशं भित्त्वा दक्षिणां बिभिदु: पुन:।।1.40.16।। दक्षिणस्यामपि दिशि ददृशुस्ते महागजम्। महापद्मं महात्मानं सुमहत्पर्वतोपमम्।।1.40.17।। शिरसा धारयन्तं ते विस्मयं जग्मुरुत्तमम्।
translation: तत: Subsequently, पूर्वाम् eastern, दिशम् region, भित्त्वा having dug, पुन: again, दक्षिणाम् southern region, बिभिदु: broken, ते they, दक्षिणस्याम् in the southern region also, सुमहत्पर्वतोपमम् resembling a great mountain, शिरसा with head, धारयन्तम् holding, महापद्मम् Mahapadma, महात्मानम् magnanimous, महागजम् mighty elephant, ददृशु: beheld, ते they, विस्मयम् astonishment, उत्तमम् great, जग्मु: obtained.
explanation: Subsequently, having dug the eastern region, they went on to southern and dug it too. In the southern region, they beheld a mighty elephant, magnanimous Mahapadma, resembling a great mountain. To their astonishment, they saw that elephant holding the earth on its head.

shloka_text: तत: पूर्वां दिशं भित्त्वा दक्षिणां बिभिदु: पुन:।।1.40.16।। दक्षिणस्यामपि दिशि ददृशुस्ते महागजम्। महापद्मं महात्मानं सुमहत्पर्वतोपमम्।।1.40.17।। शिरसा धारयन्तं ते विस्मयं जग्मुरुत्तमम्।
translation: तत: Subsequently, पूर्वाम् eastern, दिशम् region, भित्त्वा having dug, पुन: again, दक्षिणाम् southern region, बिभिदु: broken, ते they, दक्षिणस्याम् in the southern region also, सुमहत्पर्वतोपमम् resembling a great mountain, शिरसा with head, धारयन्तम् holding, महापद्मम् Mahapadma, महात्मानम् magnanimous, महागजम् mighty elephant, ददृशु: beheld, ते they, विस्मयम् astonishment, उत्तमम् great, जग्मु: obtained.
explanation: Subsequently, having dug the eastern region, they went on to southern and dug it too. In the southern region, they beheld a mighty elephant, magnanimous Mahapadma, resembling a great mountain. To their astonishment, they saw that elephant holding the earth on its head.

shloka_text: तत: प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा सगरस्य महात्मन:।।1.40.18।। षष्टि: पुत्रसहस्राणि पश्चिमां बिभिदुर्दिशम्।
translation: तत: thereafter, महात्मन: of the illustrious, सगरस्य Sagara's, षष्टि: पुत्रसहस्राणि sixty thousand sons, प्रदक्षिणं circumabulation, कृत्वा having made, पश्चिमम् western, दिशम् region, बिभिदु: dug up.
explanation: Thereafter, illustrious Sagara's sixty thousand sons, having circumabulated the elephant of the western region dug up that region.

shloka_text: पश्चिमायामपि दिशि महान्तमचलोपमम्।।1.40.19।। दिशागजं सौमनसं ददृशुस्ते महाबला:।
translation: महाबला: possessed of great strength, ते they, पश्चिमायां दिश्यपि in the western quarter also, महान्तम् great, अचलोपमम् resembling mountain, सौमनसम् named Saumanasa, दिशागजम् elephant of the quarter, ददृशु: beheld.
explanation: Possessed of great strength, they beheld also in the western quarter a  great elephant of the quarter named Saumanasa resembling a mountain.

shloka_text: तं ते प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा पृष्ट्वा चापि निरामयम्। खनन्त स्समुपक्रान्ता दिशं हैमवतीं तत:।।1.40.20।।
translation: ते they, तं प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा having circumambulated, निरामयम् as to its wellbeing, पृष्ट्वा having enquired, खनन्त: digging, तत: from there, हैमवतीम् northern, दिशम् region, समुपक्रान्ता: arrived.
explanation: Having paid homage and enquiring as to his wellbeing, they arrived at the northern  region by digging the earth.

shloka_text: उत्तरस्यां रघुश्रेष्ठ ददृशुर्हिमपाण्डुरम्।।1.40.21।। भद्रं भद्रेण वपुषा धारयन्तं महीमिमाम्।
translation: रघुश्रेष्ठ O Rama, उत्तरस्याम् northern region, हिमपाण्डुरम् white like snow, भद्रेण वपुषा with auspicious body, इमाम् महीम् this earth, धारयन्तम् holding, भद्रम् elephant named as Bhadra, ददृशु: beheld.
explanation: O Rama in the northern region, they beheld an auspicious elephant named Bhadra, who was white like snow, was holding that quater.

shloka_text: समालभ्य तत स्सर्वे कृत्वा चैनं प्रदक्षिणम्।।1.40.22।। षष्टि: पुत्रसहस्राणि बिभिदुर्वसुधातलम्।
translation: तत: afterwards, सर्वे all, षष्टि: पुत्रसहस्राणि sixty thousand sons, एनम् this one, समालभ्य having touched, प्रदक्षिणं च circumambulation, कृत्वा having made, वसुधातलम् earth, बिभिदु: penetrated.
explanation: Then all sixty thousand sons having touched the elephant and circumambulated it, penetrated the earth.

shloka_text: तत: प्रागुत्तरां गत्वा सागरा: प्रथितां दिशम्।।1.40.23।। रोषादभ्यखनन् सर्वे पृथिवीं सगरात्मजा:।
translation: तत: Subsequently, सागरा: sons of Sagara, प्रथिताम् celebrated, प्रागुत्तरां दिशम् towards northeastern region, गत्वा having gone, सर्वे all, सगरात्मजा: sons of Sagara, रोषात् with wrath, पृथिवीम् earth, अभ्यखनन् began to dig.
explanation: Subsequently, the sons of Sagara, having gone towards the celebrated northeastern region began to dig with wrath.

shloka_text: ते तु सर्वे महात्मानो भीमवेगा महाबला:।।1.40.24।। ददृशु: कपिलं तत्र वासुदेवं सनातनम्। हयं च तस्य देवस्य चरन्तमविदूरत:।।1.40.25।। प्रहर्षमतुलं प्राप्तास्सर्वे ते रघुनन्दन।
translation: महात्मान: magnanimous, भीमवेगा: those having dreadful speed, महाबला: exceedingly powerful, ते they, सर्वे all, तत्र there, कपिलम् of Kapila, सनातनम् eternal, वासुदेवम् Vasudeva, तस्य देवस्य that god's, अविदूरत: not far away, चरन्तम् grazing, हयं च horse, ददृशु: beheld,  रघुनन्दन O Rama, ते सर्वे all of them, अतुलम् unparalleled, प्रहर्षम् joy, प्राप्ता: experienced.
explanation: Great sons of  Sagara terribly swiftfooted and exceedingly powerful beheld the eternal Visnu in (sage) Kapila and not far away from him the horse grazing. O descendant of Raghu they all experienced unparalleled joy.

shloka_text: ते तु सर्वे महात्मानो भीमवेगा महाबला:।।1.40.24।। ददृशु: कपिलं तत्र वासुदेवं सनातनम्। हयं च तस्य देवस्य चरन्तमविदूरत:।।1.40.25।। प्रहर्षमतुलं प्राप्तास्सर्वे ते रघुनन्दन।
translation: महात्मान: magnanimous, भीमवेगा: those having dreadful speed, महाबला: exceedingly powerful, ते they, सर्वे all, तत्र there, कपिलम् of Kapila, सनातनम् eternal, वासुदेवम् Vasudeva, तस्य देवस्य that god's, अविदूरत: not far away, चरन्तम् grazing, हयं च horse, ददृशु: beheld,  रघुनन्दन O Rama, ते सर्वे all of them, अतुलम् unparalleled, प्रहर्षम् joy, प्राप्ता: experienced.
explanation: Great sons of  Sagara terribly swiftfooted and exceedingly powerful beheld the eternal Visnu in (sage) Kapila and not far away from him the horse grazing. O descendant of Raghu they all experienced unparalleled joy.

shloka_text: ते तं हयवरं ज्ञात्वा क्रोधपर्याकुलेक्षणा:।।1.40.26।। खनित्रलाङ्गलधरा नानावृक्षशिलाधरा:। अभ्यधावन्त सङ्क्रुद्धास्तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति चाब्रुवन्।।1.40.27।।
translation: ते they, तं हयवरम् that best of horses, ज्ञात्वा knowing, क्रोधपर्याकुलेक्षणा: with eyes reddened  with anger, खनित्रलाङ्गलधरा: armed with spades, ploughshares, नानावृक्षशिलाधरा: with every kind of trees, stones, सङ्क्रुद्धा: furious with anger, अभ्यधावन्त rushed towards him, तिष्ठ stay, तिष्ठ stay, इति अब्रुवन् च also said.
explanation: They recognised that best of horses. Their eyes were red with anger. Armed with spades, ploughshares and every kind of tree and stone and furious with wrath, they rushed towards Kapila shouting, wait, wait

shloka_text: ते तं हयवरं ज्ञात्वा क्रोधपर्याकुलेक्षणा:।।1.40.26।। खनित्रलाङ्गलधरा नानावृक्षशिलाधरा:। अभ्यधावन्त सङ्क्रुद्धास्तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति चाब्रुवन्।।1.40.27।।
translation: ते they, तं हयवरम् that best of horses, ज्ञात्वा knowing, क्रोधपर्याकुलेक्षणा: with eyes reddened  with anger, खनित्रलाङ्गलधरा: armed with spades, ploughshares, नानावृक्षशिलाधरा: with every kind of trees, stones, सङ्क्रुद्धा: furious with anger, अभ्यधावन्त rushed towards him, तिष्ठ stay, तिष्ठ stay, इति अब्रुवन् च also said.
explanation: They recognised that best of horses. Their eyes were red with anger. Armed with spades, ploughshares and every kind of tree and stone and furious with wrath, they rushed towards Kapila shouting, wait, wait

shloka_text: अस्माकं त्वं हि तुरगं यज्ञीयं हृतवानसि। दुर्मेधस्त्वं हि सम्प्राप्तान् विद्धि नस्सगरात्मजान् ।।1.40.28।।
translation: दुर्मेध: O Wicked minded one, त्वम् you, अस्माकम् our, यज्ञीयम् relating to sacrifice, तुरगम् horse, हृतवान् असि you have stolen, सम्प्राप्तान् those who have come here, न: us, सगरात्मजान् sons of Sagara, विद्धि you may know.
explanation: 'O Wickedminded one you have stolen our sacrificial horse. Know that those of us who have come here are the sons of Sagara'.

shloka_text: श्रुत्वा तु वचनं तेषां कपिलो रघुनन्दन। रोषेण महताऽऽविष्टो हुङ्कारमकरोत्तदा।।1.40.29।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Rama, कपिल: Kapila, तेषाम् their, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, तदा then, महता great, रोषेण wrath, आविष्ट: overwhelmed, हुङ्कारम् the sound "H'm", अकरोत् uttered.
explanation: "O descendant of Raghu Kapila, having heard their words, overwhelmed with great wrath, uttered the sound "H'm".

shloka_text: पुत्रांश्चिरगतान् ज्ञात्वा सगरो रघुनन्दन। नप्तारमब्रवीद्राजा दीप्यमानं स्वतेजसा।।1.41.1।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Rama, सगरो राजा king Sagara, पुत्रान् sons, चिरगतान् having gone for a long time, ज्ञात्वा realising, स्वतेजसा by his own lusture, दीप्यमानम् resplendent, नप्तारम् addressing grand son, अब्रवीत् said:
explanation: "O Delight of the Raghus, king Sagara, realising that his sons had left long ago  said to his grandson Anshuman resplendent with his own lustre:
comments: Anshuman brings back the horse.

shloka_text: शूरश्च कृतविद्यश्च पूर्वैस्तुल्योऽसि तेजसा। पितृ़णां गतिमन्विच्छ येन चाश्वोऽपवाहित:।।1.41.2।।
translation: शूरश्च valiant, कृतविद्यश्च acquired knowledge in various fields, तेजसा by lustre, पूर्वै: with your ancestors, तुल्य: असि you are equal, पितृ़णाम् your ancestors, गतिम् path, अन्विच्छ search, अश्व: horse, येन by whom, अपवाहित: is carried away.
explanation: 'You are valiant. You have acquired knowledge (in various fields). You are illustrious like  your ancestors. Pursue the track taken by your uncles and by the thief who ran away with the horse'.

shloka_text: अन्तर्भौमानि सत्त्वानि वीर्यवन्ति महान्ति च। तेषां त्वं प्रतिघातार्थं सास्त्रं गृह्णीष्व कार्मुकम्।।1.41.3।।
translation: अन्तर्भौमानि in the depths of earth, सत्त्वानि beings, वीर्यवन्ति possess prowess, महान्ति च are also mighty, त्वम् you, तेषाम् theirs, प्रतिघातार्थम् to destroy, सास्त्रम् with weapons, कार्मुकम् bow, गृह्णीष्व hold.
explanation: 'Creatures in the depths of the earth are powerful and mighty. Carry with you a bow and weapons to counter their attack'.

shloka_text: अभिवाद्याभिवाद्यांस्त्वं हत्वा विघ्नकरानपि। सिद्धार्थस्सन्निवर्तस्व मम यज्ञस्य पारग:।।1.41.4।।
translation: त्वम् you, अभिवाद्यान् men who deserve to be honoured, अभिवाद्य after honouring, विघ्नकरान् those causing obstacles to sacrifice, हत्वा by killing, सिद्धार्थ: सन् having accomplished  the purpose, मम my, यज्ञस्य sacrifice's, पारग: you ensure completion of my sacrifice, निवर्तस्व come back.
explanation: 'Honour those who deserve it. Kill those who cause obstacles to sacrifice. Come back with your mission accomplishing. And ensure the (successful) completion of my  sacrifice'.

shloka_text: एवमुक्तोंऽशुमान्सम्यक् सगरेण महात्मना। धनुरादाय खड्गं च जगाम लघुविक्रम:।।1.41.5।।
translation: अंशुमान् Anshuman, महात्मना by the magnanimous, सगरेण Sagara, एवम् in this way, सम्यक् thoroughly, उक्त: spoken, धनु: bow, खड्गं च scimitar, आदाय taking, लघुविक्रम: rapid strides, जगाम had set out.
explanation: "Having been throughly instructed by the highsouled Sagara in this way, Anshuman  left with rapid strides carrying a scimitar and a bow.

shloka_text: स खातं पितृभिर्मार्गमन्तर्भौमं महात्मभि:। प्रापद्यत नरश्रेष्ठ तेन राज्ञाऽभिचोदित:।।1.41.6।।
translation: नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, स: he, राज्ञा by king, अभिचोदित: directed, महात्मभि: by the noble, पितृभि: uncles, अन्तर्भौमम् in the depths of earth, खातम् dug, मार्गम् path, प्रापद्यत followed.
explanation: O Best among men directed by the king (Sagara), Anshuman followed the path taken by his noble uncles into the depths of the earth.

shloka_text: दैत्यदानवरक्षोभि: पिशाचपतगोरगै:। पूज्यमानं महातेजा दिशागजमपश्यत।।1.41.7।।
translation: महातेजा: exceedingly valiant, दैत्यदानवरक्षोभि: daityas, danavas, rakshasas, पिशाचपतगोरगै: pisachas, birds and serpents, पूज्यमानम् worshipped by, दिशागजम् elephant of the quarter, अपश्यत beheld.
explanation: Exceedingly valiant Ashuman beheld the elephant of the quarter worshipped by daityas, danavas, rakshasas, pisachas, birds and serpents.

shloka_text: स तं प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा पृष्ट्वा चापि निरामयम्। पितृ़न् स परिपप्रच्छ  वाजिहर्तारमेव च।।1.41.8।।
translation: स: he, तं प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा having circumambulated that elephant, निरामयम् wellbeing, पृष्ट्वा चापि having enquired, पितृ़न् about the younger brothers of his father, वाजिहर्तारमेव च about the person who had stolen the sacrificial horse, परिपप्रच्छ enquired.
explanation: Having circumambulated the elephant, he (Anshuman) enquired about his wellbeing, the where abouts of his uncles and also about the one who had stolen the sacrificial horse.

shloka_text: दिशागजस्तु तच्छ्रुत्वा प्रत्याहांशुमतो वच:। आसमञ्ज कृतार्थस्त्वं सहाश्वश्शीघ्रमेष्यसि।।1.41.9।।
translation: दिशागजस्तु elephant of the quarter, अंशुमत: Anshman's, तत् वचः those words, श्रुत्वा having listened to, प्रत्याह replied, आसमञ्ज O Son of Asamanjasa, Anshuman, त्वं you,  कृतार्थ: having gained the object, सहाश्व: with horse, श्रीघ्रम् soon, एष्यसि will go (back).
explanation: Having listened to the words of Anshuman the elephant of the quarter replied, 'O Anshuman, son of Asamanjasa having fulfilled your objective, you will go back soon with the horse'.

shloka_text: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सर्वानेव दिशागजान्। यथाक्रमं यथान्यायं प्रष्टुं समुपचक्रमे।।1.41.10।।
translation: तस्य his (elephant's), तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having listened to, सर्वानेव all of them,  दिशागजान् elephants of the quarters, यथाक्रमम् successively, यथान्यायम् with due respect, प्रष्टुम् to enquire, उपचक्रमे commenced.
explanation: Having listened to the words of the elephant, Anshuman started enquring the well being of each of the guardians (elephants) of the quarters successively with due respect:

shloka_text: तैश्च सर्वैर्दिशापालैर्वाक्यज्ञैर्वाक्यकोविदै:। पूजितस्सहयश्चैव गन्ताऽसीत्यभिचोदित:।।1.41.11।।
translation: वाक्यज्ञै: knowers of essence of words, वाक्यकोविदै: proficient in the application of words, सर्वै: by all, तै: दिशापालै: by those mighty elephants, पूजित: honoured, सहय: with the horse, गन्तासि इति you will go back, अभिचोदित: was directed.
explanation: All those elephants of the quarters were knowers of the essence of words and proficient in the right use of words. Treating him kindly the elephants encouraged him saying, 'You will go back with the horse'.

shloka_text: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा जगाम लघुविक्रम:। भस्मराशीकृता यत्र पितरस्तस्य सागरा:।।1.41.12।।
translation: तेषाम् their, तद्वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, लघुविक्रम: with quick paces, तस्य his, पितर: younger brothers of his father, सागरा: sons of Sagara, यत्र where, भस्मराशीकृता: were reduced  into heaps of ashes, जगाम had gone.
explanation: Hearing their words with a quick pace where he reached the place his uncles, sons of Sagara were reduced to heaps of ashes.

shloka_text: स दु:खवशमापन्नस्त्वसमञ्जसुतस्तदा। चुक्रोश परमार्तस्तु वधात्तेषां सुदु:खित:।।1.41.13।।
translation: तदा then, स: he, असमञ्जसुत: son of Asamanjasa, दु:खवशम् possessed by grief, आपन्न: having reached, परमार्त: greatly distressed, तेषाम् their, वधात् by destruction, सुदु:खित: greatly grieved, चुक्रोश cried out.
explanation: Then the son of Asamanjasa, overwhelmed with sorrow and deeply distressed at their destruction, bewailed with great grief.

shloka_text: यज्ञीयं च हयं तत्र चरन्तमविदूरत:। ददर्श पुरुषव्याघ्रो दु:खशोकसमन्वित:।।1.41.14।।
translation: दु:खशोकसमन्वित: possessed by grief and sorrow, पुरुषव्याघ्र: that tiger like brave one among men, अविदूरत: nearby, चरन्तम् grazing, यज्ञीयम् sacrificial, हयम् horse, ददर्श beheld.
explanation: Possessed by grief and tears, Anshuman, that tiger among men, beheld the sacrificial horse grazing nearby.

shloka_text: स तेषां राजपुत्राणां कर्तुकामो जलक्रियाम् । सलिलार्थी महातेजा न चापश्यज्जलाशयम् ।।1.41.15।।
translation: महातेजा: highly lustrous, स: he, तेषाम् for those, राजपुत्राणाम् princes, जलक्रियाम् presenting  libations of waters (to the manes of the deceased), कर्तुकाम: with intention of doing, सलिलार्थी seeking water, जलाशयम् reservoir of water, न च अपश्यत् could not see.
explanation: With the intention of performing traditional funeral rites with water for the deceased princes, highly lustrous Anshuman looked around for water but could not see any reservoir of water (in the neighbourhood).

shloka_text: विसार्य निपुणां दृष्टिं ततोऽपश्यत्खगाधिपम् । पितृ़णां मातुलं राम सुपर्णमनिलोपमम्।।1.41.16।।
translation: राम O Rama, तत: afterwards, निपुणाम् intelligent, दृष्टिम् glances, विसार्य extending, पितृ़णाम्  uncles', मातुलम् maternal uncle, खगाधिपम् lord of the eagles, अनिलोपमम् resembling wind in swiftness, सुपर्णम् Garuda (brother of Suparna, the mother of princes), अपश्यत् beheld.
explanation: O Rama with his keen eyes, he (Anshuman) marked Suparna, the maternal uncle of his uncles, lord of the eagles (Garuda) bestowed with the swiftness of the wind.

shloka_text: स चैवमब्रवीद्वाक्यं वैनतेयो महाबल :। मा शुच: पुरुषव्याघ्र वधोऽयं लोकसम्मत:।।1.41.17।।
translation: महाबल: highly powerful, स: वैनतेय: Garuda, son of Vinata, (एनम् addressing him), वाक्यम् words, एवं thus, अब्रवीत् said, पुरुषव्याघ्र O Tiger among men, मा शुच: do not grieve, अयं वध: this act of assasination, लोकसम्मत: is aimed for the welfare of the three worlds.
explanation: Highly powerful Garuda, son of Vinata, addressing Anshuman said 'O Tiger among men do not grieve. This act of assasination is meant for the welfare of the three worlds'.

shloka_text: कपिलेनाप्रमेयेन दग्धा हीमे महाबला:। सलिलं नार्हसि प्राज्ञ दातुमेषां हि लौकिकम्।।1.41.18।।
translation: महाबला: highly valiant, इमे these, अप्रमेयेन by one who has boundless power, कपिलेन by Kapila, दग्धा: हि have been burnt indeed, प्राज्ञ O Sagacious one, लौकिकम् worldly (ordinary), सलिलम् water, दातुम् to offer, नार्हसि is not proper on your part.
explanation: 'Your valiant uncles have been burnt by Kapila of boundless power. O Sagcious one performing traditional rites with ordinary water is not proper'.

shloka_text: गङ्गा हिमवतो ज्येष्ठा दुहिता पुरुषर्षभ। तस्यां कुरु महाबाहो पितृ़णां तु जलक्रियाम्।।1.41.19।।
translation: पुरुषर्षभ O Best among men, हिमवत: Himavan's, ज्येष्ठा eldest daughter, गङ्गा Ganga, महाबाहो O Mighty armed one, पितृ़णाम् yours uncles', जलक्रियाम् traditional rites with water, तस्याम्  in her (those waters), कुरु perform.
explanation: 'O Best among men O Mightyarmed one perform  the traditional rites of your uncles with water from river Ganga, the eldest daughter of Himavat'.

shloka_text: भस्मराशीकृतानेतान् प्लावयेल्लोकपावनी। तया क्लिन्नमिदं भस्म गङ्गया लोककान्तया।।1.41.20।। षष्टिं पुत्रसहस्राणि स्वर्गलोकं च नेष्यति।
translation: लोकपावनी purifier of the three worlds, that Ganga, भस्मराशीकृतान् reduced to heaps of ash, एतान् these, प्लावयेत् will sanctify, लोककान्तया by the beloved one of the world, तया गङ्गया by that Ganga, क्लिन्नम् inundated, इदं भस्म these heaps of ash, षष्टिं पुत्रसहस्राणि sixty thousand sons, स्वर्गलोकम् heavens च नेष्यति will take also.
explanation: Ganga, the purifier of the three worlds, will sanctify your uncles reduced to heaps of ashes. These heaps when inundated by waters of Ganga, beloved of the worlds, will take  all the sixty thousand sons to heaven.

shloka_text: गच्छ चाश्वं महाभाग तं गृह्य पुरुषर्षभ।।1.41.21।। यज्ञं पैतामहं वीर संवर्तयितुमर्हसि।
translation: महाभाग O Highly fortunate one, पुरुषर्षभ O Best among men, तम् अश्वम् that horse, गृह्य taking, गच्छ go back, वीर O hero, पैतामहम् grand father's, यज्ञम् sacrifice, संवर्तयितुम् to  complete, अर्हसि it behoves of you.
explanation: 'O Highly fortunate one O Best among men go back with that horse. O Hero It behoves of you to complete the sacrifice undertaken by  your grandfather'.

shloka_text: सुपर्णवचनं श्रुत्वा सोंऽशुमानतिवीर्यवान् ।।1.41.22।। त्वरितं हयमादाय पुनरायान्महायशा:।
translation: अतिवीर्यवान् exceedingly powerful, महायशा: highly renowned, अंशुमान् Anshuman, सुपर्णवचनम् words of Suparna, श्रुत्वा having heard, त्वरितम् quickly, हयम् horse, आदाय taking hold of, पुन: again, आयात् returned.
explanation: Exceedingly powerful and highly renowned Anshuman, on hearing the words of Garuda returned quickly to the capital with the horse৷৷

shloka_text: ततो राजानमासाद्य दीक्षितं रघुनन्दन।।1.41.23।। न्यवेदयद्यथावृत्तं सुपर्णवचनं तथा।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Rama, दीक्षितम् one who is initiated into ceremony, राजानम् king, आसाद्य having reached, यथावृत्तम् in conformity with what had happened, तथा faithfully, सुपर्णवचनम् words of Suparna, न्यवेदयत् communicated.
explanation: O Descendant of the Raghus (Rama), having reached the king who had been initiated into the ceremony, Anshuman communicated faithfully to him all that had happened. He also reported the words Suparna had said.

shloka_text: तच्छ्रुत्वा घोरसङ्काशं वाक्यमंशुमतो नृप:।।1.41.24।। यज्ञं निवर्तयामास यथाकल्पं यथाविधि।
translation: नृप: king, अंशुमत: Anshuman's, घोरसङ्काशम् aweful, वाक्यम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, यथाकल्पम् in accordance with rules of Kalpa, the vedanga, यथाविधि in accordance with the scriptures and tradition, यज्ञम् sacrifice ,निवर्तयामास performed.
explanation: The king heard (was stunned to hear) the awful words of Anshuman, (yet) he performed the sacrifice in accordance with traditional scriptures and Kalpa, the Vedanga.

shloka_text: स्वपुरं चागमच्छ्रीमानिष्टयज्ञोमहीपति:।।1.41.25।। गङ्गायाश्चागमे राजा निश्चयं नाध्यगच्छत।
translation: श्रीमान् auspicious, महीपति: lord of earth, king Sagara, इष्टयज्ञ: had completed the performance of the sacrifice, स्वपुरम् to his own capital, आगमत् reached, राजा king, गङ्गाया: Ganga, आगमे in the matter of descent, निश्चयम् decision, नाध्यगच्छत did not arrive (at any).
explanation: The great lord of the earth (king Sagara) after performing the sacrifice reached his capital. (But) He could not devise any means to bring Ganga down to the earth.

shloka_text: अकृत्वा निश्चयं राजा कालेन महता महान्  । त्रिंशद्वर्षसहस्राणि राज्यं कृत्वा दिवं गत:।।1.41.26।।
translation: महान् mighty, राजा king, महता कालेन for a long time, निश्चयं अकृत्वा without arriving at any decision (in the matter of bringing Ganga down to earth), त्रिंशद्वर्षसहस्राणि thirty thousand years, राज्यम् kingdom, कृत्वा having ruled, दिवं गत: ascended heaven.
explanation: The mighty king (Sagara), over a long period of time without being able to devise means (to bring Ganga down to the earth), ruled the kingdom for thirty thousand years and ascended to heaven". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे एकचत्वारिंशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the fortyfirst sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: कालधर्मं गते राम सगरे प्रकृतीजना:। राजानं रोचयामासुरंशुमन्तं सुधार्मिकम्।।1.42.1।।
translation: राम O Rama, सगरे when king Sagara, कालधर्मम् duty of nature, death, गते obtained, प्रकृतीजना: ministers and subjects, सुधार्मिकम् highly virtuous, अंशुमन्तम् Anshuman, राजानम् as king, रोचयामासु: accepted.
explanation: "O Rama when Sagara died, the subjects installed the highly virtuous Anshuman as king.
comments: Anshuman performs penance to bring Ganga to the earth-- Bhagiratha follows --receives boon from Brahma--Brahma informs Anshuman that only lord Siva is capable to hold Ganga.

shloka_text: स राजा सुमहानासीदंशुमान् रघुनन्दन । तस्य पुत्रो महानासीद्दिलीप इति विश्रुत:।।1.42.2।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Descendent of Raghu, Rama, स: अंशुमान् that Anshuman, सुमहान् very great, राजा आसीत् was a monarch, तस्य for him, दिलीप इति by name Dilipa, विश्रुत: celebrated, महान् great, पुत्र: आसीत् a son was born.
explanation: O descendnt of the Raghus that Anshuman became a very great monarch. He had a great son, Dilipa who became famous.

shloka_text: तस्मिन् राज्यं समावेश्य दिलीपे रघुनन्दन। हिमवच्छिखरे पुण्ये तपस्तेपे सुदारुणम्।।1.42.3।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Rama, तस्मिन् दिलीपे in that Dilipa, राज्यम् kingdom, समावेश्य vesting, पुण्ये pious, हिमवच्छिखरे on the peak of Himavat mountain, सुदारुणम् rigid, तप: penance, तेपे he  performed.
explanation: O Delight of the Raghus having vested the kingdom with Dilipa, Anshuman performed rigid penance on the sacred peak of the Himavat mountain.

shloka_text: द्वात्रिंशच्च सहस्राणि वर्षाणि सुमहायशा:। तपोवनं गतो राम स्वर्गं लेभे तपोधन:।।1.42.4।।
translation: राम O Rama, सुमहायशा: highly renowned Anshuman, द्वात्रिंशत् सहस्राणि thirty two  thousand,  वर्षाणि years, तपोवनं गत: having reached tapovana, तपोधन: one who had asceticism as wealth, स्वर्गम् heaven, लेभे attained.
explanation: O Rama highly renowned Anshuman, having lived for thirtytwo thousand years in the  tapovana, turned an ascetic and attained heaven (without accomplishing his objective).

shloka_text: दिलीपस्तु महातेजाश्श्रुत्वा पैतामहं वधम्। दु:खोपहतया बुद्ध्या निश्चयं नाध्यगच्छत।।1.42.5।।
translation: महातेजा: exceedingly lustrous, दिलीपस्तु Dilipa on his part, पैतामहम् relating to his grandfathers, वधम् killing, श्रुत्वा having heard, दु:खोपहतया overtaken by grief, बुद्ध्या with his intellect, निश्चयम् conclusion, नाध्यगच्छत did not arrive at.
explanation: When exceedingly brilliant Dilipa heard about the death of his grandfathers, he was overtaken by grief but could not arrive at any conclusion with his intellect (regarding means of bringing down the sacred river).

shloka_text: कथं गङ्गावतरणं कथं तेषां जलक्रिया। तारयेयं कथं चैतानिति चिन्तापरोऽभवत्।।1.42.6।।
translation: गङ्गावतरणम् descent of Ganga, कथम् how to do?, तेषाम् their, जलक्रिया funeral rites with water, कथम् how to do?, एतान् them, कथम् how to, तारयेयम् इति (help them to cross the wordly sea of suffering and reach heaven) liberate, चिन्तापर: thoughtful, अभूत् became.
explanation: How to bring about the descent of Ganga? How to perform funeral rites of the ancestors with Ganga water? How to liberate them Thus Dilipa was constantly engaged in such thoughts.

shloka_text: तस्य चिन्तयतो नित्यं धर्मेण विदितात्मन:। पुत्रो भगीरथो नाम जज्ञे परमधार्मिक:।।1.42.7।।
translation: विदितात्मन: wellknown for his intelligence, धर्मेण with righteousness, नित्यम् constantly, चिन्तयत: while reflecting, तस्य for him, भगीरथो नाम named Bhagiratha, परमधार्मिक: highly virtuous, पुत्र: son, जज्ञे was born.
explanation: As Dilipa known for his knowledge of the soul constantly reflected righteously on (this matter of Ganga), a highly virtuous son named Bhagiratha was born to him.

shloka_text: दिलीपस्तु महातेजा यज्ञैर्बहुभिरिष्टवान्। त्रिंशद्वर्षसहस्राणि राजा राज्यमकारयत्।।1.42.8।।
translation: महातेजा: most brilliant, दिलीपस्तु Dilipa on his part, बहुभि: by any, यज्ञै: sacrifices, इष्टवान्  performed, राजा king, त्रिंशद्वर्षसहस्राणि thirty thousand years, राज्यम् kingdom, अकारयत् ruled.
explanation: Most brilliant king Dilipa ruled the kingdom for thirty thousand years performing many sacrifices.

shloka_text: अगत्वा निश्चयं राजा तेषामुद्धरणं प्रति । व्याधिना नरशार्दूल कालधर्ममुपेयिवान्।।1.42.9।।
translation: नरशार्दूल O Tiger among men, राजा king Dilipa, तेषाम् their, उद्धरणं प्रति about salvation, निश्चयम् conclusion, अगत्वा not able to arrive, व्याधिना by suffering illness, कालधर्मम् death, उपेयिवान् effected.
explanation: O Tiger among men king Dilipa was unable to arrive at a conclusion regarding the salvation of his ancestors.He was affected by illness and died.

shloka_text: इन्द्रलोकं गतो राजा स्वार्जितेनैव कर्मणा। राज्ये भगीरथं पुत्रमभिषिच्य नरर्षभ:।।1.42.10।।
translation: नरर्षभ: the best among men, राजा king Dilipa, पुत्रम् son, भगीरथम् Bhagiratha, राज्ये in the kingdom, अभिषिच्य having conducted coronation, स्वार्जितेनैव with selfearned, कर्मणा एव  acts only, इन्द्रलोकम् towards the region of Indra, गत: had gone.
explanation: The king (Dilipa) performed the coronation of his son Bhagiratha and reached the region of Indra as a reward for virtuous acts done by him.

shloka_text: भगीरथस्तु राजर्षिर्धार्मिको रघुनन्दन। अनपत्यो महातेजा: प्रजाकामस्स चाप्रज:।।1.42.11।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Rama, धार्मिक: righteous one, महातेजा: highly lustrous, राजर्षि: royal sage, भगीरथस्तु Bhagiratha, अनपत्य: without sons, स: he, प्रजाकाम: desirous of progeny, अप्रजा: did not beget children.
explanation: O delight of the Raghus righteous Bhagiratha who was highly lustrous rajarshi was without sons. He was desirous of progeny but did not beget children.

shloka_text: मन्त्रिष्वाधाय तद्राज्यं गङ्गावतरणे रत:। स तपो दीर्घमातिष्ठद्गोकर्णे रघुनन्दन।।1.42.12।। ऊर्ध्वबाहु: पञ्चतपा मासाहारो जितेन्द्रिय:।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Rama, स: he, गङ्गावतरणे for the descent of Ganga, रत: keenly desiring, तद्राज्यम् that kingdom, मन्त्रिषु in his ministers, आधाय after entrusting, ऊर्ध्वबाहु: with arms held upwards, पञ्चतपा: surrounded by four fires in the hot season and standing under the sun, the fifth fire, मासाहार: partaking food once a month, जितेन्द्रिय: with his senses controlled, गोकर्णे at the sacred spot, Gokarna, दीर्घम् for long years, तप: yogic penance, आतिष्ठत् practised.
explanation: O son of the Raghus (Rama), Bhagiratha, with a determination to bring down Ganga entrusted the kingdom to his ministers and went to a sacred place known as Gokarna.
