There with arms uplifted surrounded by four fires, partaking food once a month, with his senses controlled, carried out panchatapa for a number of years.

shloka_text: तस्य वर्षसहस्राणि घोरे तपसि तिष्ठत:।।1.42.13।। अतीतानि महाबाहो तस्य राज्ञो महात्मन:। सुप्रीतो भगवान् ब्रह्मा प्रजानां पतिरीश्वर:।।1.42.14।।
translation: महाबाहो O Mighty armed Rama, तस्य while he was, घोरे तपसि amidst rigid austerities, तिष्ठत: while he was determined to carry on, वर्षसहस्राणि thousands of years, अतीतानि passed away, प्रजानाम् for all men, पति: lord, ईश्वर: lord, भगवान् ब्रह्मा god Brahma, तस्य his, महात्मन: illustrious, राज्ञ: for king, सुप्रीत: was highly pleased.
explanation: O mightyarmed, (Rama) Bhagiratha continued in that state for a thousand years amidst rigid austerities. Lord of  all creatures, Brahma was highly pleased with that illustrious king.

shloka_text: तस्य वर्षसहस्राणि घोरे तपसि तिष्ठत:।।1.42.13।। अतीतानि महाबाहो तस्य राज्ञो महात्मन:। सुप्रीतो भगवान् ब्रह्मा प्रजानां पतिरीश्वर:।।1.42.14।।
translation: महाबाहो O Mighty armed Rama, तस्य while he was, घोरे तपसि amidst rigid austerities, तिष्ठत: while he was determined to carry on, वर्षसहस्राणि thousands of years, अतीतानि passed away, प्रजानाम् for all men, पति: lord, ईश्वर: lord, भगवान् ब्रह्मा god Brahma, तस्य his, महात्मन: illustrious, राज्ञ: for king, सुप्रीत: was highly pleased.
explanation: O mightyarmed, (Rama) Bhagiratha continued in that state for a thousand years amidst rigid austerities. Lord of  all creatures, Brahma was highly pleased with that illustrious king.

shloka_text: ततस्सुरगणैस्सार्धमुपागम्य पितामह:। भगीरथं महात्मानं तप्यमानमथाब्रवीत्।।1.42.15।।
translation: तत: thereafter, पितामह: grandsire, सुरगणै: with groups of devatas, उपागम्य having arrived, अथ thereafter, तप्यमानम् engaged in austerities, महात्मानम् illustrious, भगीरथम् Bhagiratha, अब्रवीत् said.
explanation: Thereafter, the Grandsire arrived with the gods and spoke to the noble Bhagiratha engaged in austerities.

shloka_text: भगीरथ महाभाग प्रीतस्तेऽहं जनेश्वर। तपसा च सुतप्तेन वरं वरय सुव्रत।।1.42.16।।
translation: महाभाग O Highly distinguished one, जनेश्वर O Mighty monarch, भगीरथ O Bhagiratha, ते  by you, सुतप्तेन by properly disciplined, तपसा austerities, अहम् I, प्रीत: pleased, सुव्रत O You of excellent vows, वरम् boon, वरय ask for.
explanation: 'O distinguished one O mighty monarch O Bhagiratha of excellent vows I am pleased with your  welldisciplined austerities. Ask for a boon'.

shloka_text: तमुवाच महातेजा: सर्वलोकपितामहम्। भगीरथो महाभाग: कृताञ्जलिरुपस्थित:।।1.42.17।।
translation: महातेजा: most brilliant one, महाभाग: highly glorious, भगीरथः Bhagiratha, कृताञ्जलि: with folded palms, उपस्थित: having approached, तं सर्वलोकपितामहम् grandsire for all the worlds, उवाच spoke.
explanation: Brilliant, glorious Bhagiratha, stood before the Grandsire of all the worlds with folded palms and spoke":

shloka_text: यदि मे भगवन् प्रीतो यद्यस्ति तपस: फलम्। सगरस्यात्मजास्सर्वे मत्तस्सलिलमाप्नुयु:।।1.42.18।।
translation: भगवन् O Adorable one, मे with me, प्रीत: यदि if you are pleased, तपस: of austerities, फलम् अस्ति यदि if worthy reward is possible, सगरस्य king Sagara's, आत्मजा: sons, सर्वे all, मत्त: from me, सलिलम् funeral rites with water, आप्नुयु: may receive.
explanation: 'O Lord if you are pleased with my austerities and if they are worthy of a reward, grant me the boon whereby all the sons of Sagara will receive from me funeral rites with the waters (of Ganga)'.

shloka_text: गङ्गायास्सलिलक्लिन्ने भस्मन्येषां महात्मनाम्। स्वर्गं गच्छेयुरत्यन्तं सर्वे मे प्रपितामहा:।।1.42.19।।
translation: एषाम् these, महात्मनाम् eminent ones, भस्मनि in ashes, गङ्गाया: Ganga's, सलिलक्लिन्ने immersed by the waters, मे my, सर्वे all, प्रपितामहा: uncles of my grand father, अत्यन्तम् ultimately, स्वर्गम् towards heaven, गच्छेयु: may go.
explanation: 'The ashes of these eminent uncles of my grandfather, immersed by the waters of Ganga may ultimately go to heaven'.

shloka_text: देया च सन्ततिर्देव नावसीदेत्कुलं च न:। इक्ष्वाकूणां कुले देव एष मेऽस्तु वर:पर:।।1.42.20।।
translation: देव O Divine lord, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् for Ikshvakus, कुले in the dynasty, सन्तति: progeny, देया should be bestowed, न: our, कुलम् race, नावसीदेत् let it not be terminated, एष: this, मे  my, पर: another, वर: अस्तु let it be a boon.
explanation: 'O Lord let the progeny be perpuated in our race of the Ikshvakus. Let not that dynasty be terminated with me. This is another boon I seek'.

shloka_text: उक्तवाक्यं तु राजानं सर्वलोकपितामह:। प्रत्युवाच शुभां वाणीं मधुरां मधुराक्षराम्।।1.42.21।।
translation: सर्वलोकपितामह: grandsire for all the worlds, उक्तवाक्यम् him who has spoken these words, राजानम् addressing the king, शुभाम् auspicious, मधुराम् sweet, मधुराक्षराम् with agreeable letters, वाणीम् words, प्रत्युवाच replied.
explanation: To this the Grandsire of all the worlds replied with a sweet voice full of good wishes and sweet words.

shloka_text: मनोरथो महानेष भगीरथ महारथ। एवं भवतु भद्रं ते इक्ष्वाकुकुलवर्धन।।1.42.22।।
translation: महारथ O Great charioteer, भगीरथ Bhagiratha, एष: this, मनोरथ desire, महान् great, इक्ष्वाकु कुलवर्धन perpetuator of dynasty of Ikshvaku, एवम् in this way, भवतु may happen, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you.
explanation: 'O Great charioteer Bhagiratha, your desire is great. O Perpetuator of dynasty of the Ikshvakus, let your wish be fulfilled. Prosperity to you'.

shloka_text: इयं हैमवती गङ्गा ज्येष्ठा हिमवतस्सुता। तां वै धारयितुं शक्तो हरस्तत्र नियुज्यताम्।।1.42.23।।
translation: हैमवती Haimavati, the daughter of Himavat, इयम् this, गङ्गा Ganga, हिमवत: Himavat's, ज्येष्ठा सुता eldest daughter, ताम् her, धारयितुम् to hold, शक्त: capable, हर: lord Shiva, तत्र there, नियुज्यताम् may be entreated.
explanation: 'This Hymavati (Ganga) is Himavat's eldest daughter and only lord Siva is capable to hold (the force of her descent to earth). Therefore let Siva be entreated'.

shloka_text: गङ्गाया: पतनं राजन् पृथिवी न सहिष्यति। तां वै धारयितुं वीर नान्यं पश्यामि शूलिन:।।1.42.24।।
translation: राजन् O King, गङ्गाया: Ganga's, पतनम् descent, पृथिवी earth, न सहिष्यति cannot sustain, वीर O Hero, ताम् her, धारयितुम् to hold, शूलिन: other than Siva, the wielder of trident, अन्यम् any other person, न पश्यामि I do not see.
explanation: 'O King Ganga's descent cannot be sustained by earth. O Hero I do not see any other person to hold her than the wielder of the trident (Siva)'.

shloka_text: तमेवमुक्त्वा राजानं गङ्गां चाभाष्य लोककृत्। जगाम त्रिदिवं देवस्सहदेवैर्मरुद्गणै:।।1.42.25।।
translation: लोककृत् (देवः) the creator of the worlds, तं राजानम् addressing that king, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having spoken, गङ्गां च Ganga also, आभाष्य after conversing, सह देवै: along with  devatas, मरुद्गणै: with groups of maruts, त्रिदिवम् towards heaven, जगाम had gone.
explanation: The Creator of the worlds having thus addressed the king and conversing with Ganga went towards heaven along with devatas and maruts". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे द्विचत्वारिंशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the fortysecond sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: देवदेवे गते तस्मिन् सोऽङ्गुष्ठाग्रनिपीडिताम्। कृत्वा वसुमतीं राम संवत्सरमुपासत।।1.43.1।।
translation: राम O Rama, तस्मिन् देवदेवे when that god of gods, Brahma, गते had departed, स: he, वसुमतीम् earth, अङ्गुष्ठाग्रनिपीडिताम् pressing with the tip of his great toe, कृत्वा having made, संवत्सरम् for one year, उपासत meditated upon.
explanation: "O Rama when that God of the gods (Brahma) departed, Bhagiratha, pressing the earth with the tip of his big toe (standing supported by the big toe) penanced (meditated upon Siva) for one year.
comments: Pleased with the austerities of Bhagiratha, Siva holds Ganga on his head during her descent and releases in Bindu lake--Ganga branches into  seven streams--following Bhagiratha, Ganga reaches the nether world and delivers the souls of Sagara's sons.

shloka_text: अथ संवत्सरे पूर्णे सर्वलोकनमस्कृत:। उमापति: पशुपती राजानमिदमब्रवीत्।।1.43.2।।
translation: अथ thereafter, संवत्सरे when one year, पूर्णे was completed, सर्वलोकनमस्कृत: he, worshipped by all in all worlds, उमापति: husband of Uma, पशुपति: Iswara, राजानम् addressing king, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
explanation: After one full year was completed, Iswara who is worshipped by all in all the worlds said to king Bhagiratha:

shloka_text: प्रीतस्तेऽहं नरश्रेष्ठ करिष्यामि तव प्रियम्। शिरसा धारयिष्यामि शैलराजसुतामहम्।।1.43.3।।
translation: नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, अहम् I, ते with you, प्रीत: pleased, तव to you, प्रियम् dear,  करिष्यामि I shall do, अहम् I, शैलराजसुताम् daughter of the king of mountains, शिरसा with my head, धारयिष्यामि will hold.
explanation: "O Best of men  I am pleased with your devotion. I will hold Ganga on my head, the daughter of the king of mountains (to reduce  the force of her descent). I shall do your wish.

shloka_text: ततो हैमवती ज्येष्ठा सर्वलोकनमस्कृता। तदा सातिमहद्रूपं कृत्वा वेगं च दुस्सहम्।।1.43.4।। आकाशादपतद्राम  शिवे शिवशिरस्युत।
translation: राम O Rama, तत: thereafter, हैमवती daughter of Himvat, सर्वलोकनमस्कृता adored by all worlds, ज्येष्ठा  eldest (गङ्गा Ganga), तदा then, अति महत् mighty, रूपं form, दस्सहम् unbearable, वेगं speed, कृत्वा having assumed, आकाशात् from the sky, शिवे on the auspicious, शिवशिरसि on the head of Siva, अपतत् उत fell down.
explanation: Then Ganga, the eldest daughter of Himavat who is adored by all the worlds, assuming the form of a mighty river descended from the sky with unbearable speed on the auspicious head of Siva.

shloka_text: अचिन्तयच्च सा देवी गङ्गा परमदुर्धरा।।1.43.5।। विशाम्यहं हि पातालं स्रोतसा गृह्य शङ्करम्।
translation: परमदुर्धरा extremely difficult to contain, सा देवी that goddess, गङ्गा Ganga, अचिन्तयच्च also thought over, अहम् I, स्रोतसा by my flow, शङ्करम् Siva, गृह्य seizing, पातालम् lower regions of earth, विशामि I shall enter.
explanation: "Goddess Ganga, extremely difficult to contain, thought that seizing Siva with her flow she would enter the lower regions of the earth.

shloka_text: तस्यावलेपनं ज्ञात्वा क्रुद्धस्तु भगवान् हर:।।1.43.6।। तिरोभावयितुं बुद्धिं चक्रे त्रिनयनस्तदा।
translation: त्रिनयन: threeeyed, भगवान् worshipful, हर: Iswara, तस्या: her, अवलेपनम् proud intentions, ज्ञात्वा having come to know, तदा then, तिरोभावयितुम् to send her back,  बुद्धिम् determination, चक्रे made.
explanation: Then the threeeyed Lord Siva, aware of her proud intentions applied his intelligence to conceal her.

shloka_text: सा तस्मिन् पतिता पुण्या पुण्ये रुद्रस्य मूर्धनि।।1.43.7।। हिमवत्प्रतिमे राम जटामण्डलगह्वरे।
translation: राम O Rama, सा पुण्या that sacred river Ganga, हिमवत्प्रतिमे resembling Himavat mountain, जटामण्डलगह्वरे cave of the locks of hair, तस्मिन् on that, रुद्रस्य Siva's, पुण्ये sacred, मूर्धनि head, पतिता fell.
explanation: O Rama that sacred river (Ganga), descended on to the depths of the matted locks on the holy head of Siva resembling the mount Himavan.

shloka_text: सा कथञ्चिन्महीं गन्तुं नाशक्नोद्यत्नमास्थिता।।1.43.8।। नैव निर्गमनं लेभे जटामण्डलमोहिता।
translation: सा that Ganga, यत्नम् effort, आस्थिता having put in, कथञ्चित् by any means, महीम् earth, गन्तुम् to reach, न अशक्नोत् was not poweful, जटामण्डलमोहिता enveloped by matted locks of hair, निर्गमनम् exit, न लेभे did not obtain.
explanation: Trapped in the matted locks, she (Ganga) could not come out. With all her efforts she could not reach the earth.

shloka_text: तत्रैवाबम्भ्रमद्देवी संवत्सरगणान् बहून्।।1.43.9।। तामपश्यन्पुनस्तत्र तप: परममास्थित:।
translation: देवी Ganga, बहून् many, संवत्सरगणान् for a number of years, तत्रैव there alone, अबम्भ्रमत् went round and round, ताम् that Ganga, अपश्यन् without seeing, पुन: again, तत्र there, परमम् great, तप: austerities, आस्थित: adopted.
explanation: There the golden Ganga wandered about for many years. Bhagiratha not finding Ganga, once again resorted to great penance.

shloka_text: अनेन तोषितश्चाभूदत्यर्थं रघुनन्दन।।1.43.10।। विससर्ज ततो गङ्गां हरो बिन्दुसर: प्रति।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Rama, अनेन by this penance, हर: Iswara, अत्यर्थम् immensely, तोषित: अभूत् was gratified, तत: afterwards, गङ्गाम् Ganga, बिन्दुसर: प्रति forming Bindusara, विससर्ज released (drop by drop).
explanation: O Son of the Raghus (Rama) Siva was immensely pleased with the penace and thereafter released Ganga (drop by drop) forming Bindusara.

shloka_text: तस्यां विसृज्यमानायां सप्तस्रोतांसि जज्ञिरे।।1.43.11।। ह्लादिनी पावनी चैव नलिनी च तथाऽपरा। तिस्र: प्राचीं दिशं जग्मु: गङ्गाश्शिवजलाश्शुभा:।।1.43.12।।
translation: तस्याम् when that Ganga, विसृज्यमानायाम् was being released, सप्त seven, स्रोतांसि streams, जज्ञिरे were born, ह्लादिनी Hladini, पावनी Pavani, तथा and, अपरा another, नलिनी च Nalini,  शिवजला: possessing auspicious waters, तिस्र: three, शुभा: auspicious, गङ्गा: streams of Ganga, प्राचीम् दिशं eastwards, जग्मु: had flowed.
explanation: As she (Ganga) was released, she branched out into seven streams. Three streams known as Hladini, Pavani and Nalini having auspicious waters and conferring prosperity flowed eastwards.

shloka_text: तस्यां विसृज्यमानायां सप्तस्रोतांसि जज्ञिरे।।1.43.11।। ह्लादिनी पावनी चैव नलिनी च तथाऽपरा। तिस्र: प्राचीं दिशं जग्मु: गङ्गाश्शिवजलाश्शुभा:।।1.43.12।।
translation: तस्याम् when that Ganga, विसृज्यमानायाम् was being released, सप्त seven, स्रोतांसि streams, जज्ञिरे were born, ह्लादिनी Hladini, पावनी Pavani, तथा and, अपरा another, नलिनी च Nalini,  शिवजला: possessing auspicious waters, तिस्र: three, शुभा: auspicious, गङ्गा: streams of Ganga, प्राचीम् दिशं eastwards, जग्मु: had flowed.
explanation: As she (Ganga) was released, she branched out into seven streams. Three streams known as Hladini, Pavani and Nalini having auspicious waters and conferring prosperity flowed eastwards.

shloka_text: सुचक्षुश्चैव सीता च सिन्धुश्चैव महानदी। तिस्रस्त्वेता दिशं जग्मु: प्रतीचीं तु शुभोदका:।।1.43.13।।
translation: सुचक्षु: Suchakshu, सीता च Sita, सिन्धु: called Sindhu, महानदी च a great river, शुभोदका: having auspicious waters, एता: तिस्र: these three, प्रतीचीं दिशम् westwards, जग्मु: had gone
explanation: Auspicious Suchakshu, Sita and a great river Sindhu, these three great rivers flowed  westwards.

shloka_text: सप्तमी चान्वगात्तासां भगीरथमथो नृपम्। भगीरथोऽपि राजर्षिर्दिव्यं स्यन्दनमास्थित:।।1.43.14।। प्रायादग्रे महातेजा गङ्गा तं चाप्यनुव्रजत्।
translation: अथः downwards, तासाम् among them, सप्तमी seventh, भगीरथम् Bhagiratha, नृपम् king, अन्वगात् followed, महातेजाः most brilliant, राजर्षि: royal sage, भगीरथोऽपि Bhagiratha also,  दिव्यम् divine, स्यन्दनम् chariot, आस्थित: mounting, अग्रे प्रायात् marched forward, गङ्गा च Ganga, अनुव्रजत् followed.
explanation: The seventh stream among them followed Bhagiratha. The most brilliant rajarshi Bhagiratha also mounting on divine chariot raced forward and Ganga followed him.

shloka_text: गगनाच्छङ्करशिरस्ततो धरणिमाश्रिता।।1.43.15 ।। व्यसर्पत जलं तत्र तीव्रशब्दपुरस्कृतम्।
translation: गगनात् from sky, शङ्करशिर: on the head of Shankara, तत: from there, धरणिम् earth, आश्रिता resorted, तत्र there, जलम् waters, तीव्रशब्दपुरस्कृतम् culminating in intense sounds, व्यसर्पत had flown.
explanation: From the sky on to the head of Shankara and thence Ganga resorted to the earth. There it flowed forward with a roaring sound.

shloka_text: मत्स्यकच्छपसङ्घैश्च शिंशुमारगणैस्तदा।।1.43.16।। पतद्भि: पतितैश्चान्यैर्व्यरोचत वसुन्धरा।
translation: तदा then, वसुन्धरा earth, पतितै: by the fallen, पतद्भिश्च by the falling, मत्स्यकच्छपसङ्घैश्च by shoals of fish, turtles, शिंशुमारगणैश्च by multitudes of sea animals, अन्यै: by other  animals, व्यरोचत shone.
explanation: Then the earth looked bright with the fallen and falling shoals of fish, turtles and multitudes  of other seaanimals.

shloka_text: ततो देवर्षिगन्धर्वा यक्षसिद्धगणास्तदा।।1.43.17।। व्यलोकयन्त ते तत्र गगनाद्गां गतां तथा।
translation: तत: then, देवर्षिगन्धर्वा: devarshis, gandharvas, यक्ष: yakshas, ते सिद्धगणा: those hosts of siddhas, तदा then, तथा in that way, गगनात् from the sky, गाम् the earth, गताम् reached, व्यलोकयन्त looked on with astonishment.
explanation: Then devarshis, gandharvas, yakshas and hosts of siddhas looked on with astonishment at Ganga falling from the sky and descending on the earth.

shloka_text: विमानैर्नगराकारैर्हयैर्गजवरैस्तदा।।1.43.18।। पारिप्लवगतैश्चापि देवतास्तत्र विष्ठिता:।
translation: तदा then, देवता: devatas, नगराकारै: as large as cities, विमानै: aerial chariots, पारिप्लवगतै: in restless movements, हयै: by horses, गजवरै: by excellent elephants, तत्र there, विष्ठिता: were stationed.
explanation: Then, gods in a state of excitement in their aerial chariots as large as cities, on horses and on big elephants were stationed there (in the sky).

shloka_text: तदद्भुततमं लोके गङ्गापतनमुत्तमम्।।1.43.19।। दिदृक्षवो देवगणा: समीयुरमितौजस:।
translation: लोके In this world, अद्भुततमं most wonderful, उत्तमम् great, गङ्गापतनम् descent of Ganga, दिदृक्षव: desirous of witnessing, अमितौजस: beings with great lustre, देवगणा: hosts of devatas, समीयु: arrived.
explanation: Gods with great lustre arrived to witness the most wonderful, grand descent of Ganga.

shloka_text: सम्पतद्भिस्सुरगणैस्तेषां चाभरणौजसा।।1.43.20।। शतादित्यमिवाभाति गगनं गततोयदम्।
translation: गततोयदम् devoid of clouds, गगनम् sky, सम्पतद्भि: by those arriving with speed, सुरगणै: by  multitudes of devatas, तेषाम् आभरणौजसा with the effulgence of their ornaments, शतादित्यमिव hundred suns, आभाति shines (at that moment).
explanation: The cloudless sky shone with the radiance of the ornaments of the gods alighting speedily to witness Ganga. It appeared as though the sky was filled with a hundred Suns.

shloka_text: शिंशुमारोरगगणैर्मीनैरपि च चञ्चलै:।।1.43.21।। विद्युद्भिरिव विक्षिप्तमाकाशमभवत्तदा।
translation: तदा then, शिंशुमारोरगगणै: by multitudes of sea animals and serpents, चञ्चलै: which had fickle movements, मीनैरपि च with the fish also, आकाशम् the sky, विद्युद्भिः with flashes of lightening, विक्षिप्तमिव as if scattered, अभवत् became.
explanation: The sky strewn with lightnings appeared as if it was inhabited by seaanimals, serpents and fishes fickle.

shloka_text: पाण्डरैस्सलिलोत्पीडै: कीर्यमाणैस्सहस्रधा।।1.43.22।। शारदाभ्रैरिवाकीर्णं गगनं हंससम्प्लवै:।
translation: सहस्रधा in thousand ways, कीर्यमाणै: scattered, पाण्डरै: by the white, सलिलोत्पीडै: foams of water, गगनम् sky, हंससम्प्लवै: with flocks of swans, शारदाभ्रै: by autumnal clouds, अकीर्णमिव  as if spread over.
explanation: White foams of water were scattered in a thousand ways. It appeared as if the sky was  spread over with autumnal clouds flocks of swans.

shloka_text: क्वचिद्द्रुततरं याति कुटिलं क्वचिदायतम्।।1.43.23।। विनतं क्वचिदुद्धूतं क्वचिद्याति शनैश्शनै:।
translation: क्वचित् at some places, द्रुततरम् very rapidly, याति it was flowing, क्वचित् at some other  places, कुटिलम् याति flowing in curved ways, क्वचित् at some other places, आयतम् it was wide, क्वचित् at some places, विनतम् inclined, क्वचित् at some places, उध्दूतम् was rising  high, क्वचित् at some places, शनै: शनै: very slowly, याति flowing.
explanation: Ganga was flowing now rapid, now slow, now wide, now meandering, now low, now high.

shloka_text: सलिलेनैव सलिलं क्वचिदभ्याहतं पुन:।।1.43.24।। मुहुरूर्ध्वमुखं गत्वा पपात वसुधातलम्।
translation: क्वचित् at some places, सलिलम् water, सलिलेनैव with waters alone, अभ्याहतम् was dashing  against, मुहु: repeatedly, ऊर्ध्वमुखम् upwards, गत्वा having gone, पुन: again, वसुधातलम् on the ground, पपात fell down.
explanation: Sometimes waves dashed against waves. They rose repeatedly upwards and fell down on the ground.

shloka_text: तच्छङ्करशिरोभ्रष्टं भ्रष्टं भूमितले पुन:।।1.43.25।। व्यरोचत तदा तोयं निर्मलं गतकल्मषम्।
translation: शङ्करशिरोभ्रष्टम् descended on the Shankara's head, पुन: again, भूमितले on the earth, भ्रष्टम्  fallen, गतकल्मषम् freed from impurities, निर्मलम् pure, तत् तोयम् those waters, तदा then, व्यरोचत looked splendid.
explanation: The waters of Ganga descended on Shankara's head and from there to the earth. Freed from all impurities, the waters looked pure and clean.

shloka_text: तत्र देवर्षिगन्धर्वा वसुधातलवासिन:।।1.43.26।। भवाङ्गपतितं तोयं पवित्रमिति पस्पृशु:।
translation: तत्र there, देवर्षिगन्धर्वा: devatas, rishis and gandharvas, वसुधातलवसिन: those living on the earth, भवाङ्गपतितम् fallen from the body of Siva, तोयम् waters, पवित्रमिति sacred, पस्पृशु: touched.
explanation: Considering the waters fallen from the head of Siva sacred, devatas, rishis and gandharvas and those living on earth touched it (with reverence).

shloka_text: शापात्प्रपतिता ये च गगनाद्वसुधातलम्।।1.43.27।। कृत्वा तत्राभिषेकं ते बभूवुर्गतकल्मषा:।
translation: ये च those, शापात् due to the curse, गगनात् from the sky,  वसुधातलम् earth, प्रपतिता: had fallen, ते they, तत्र there, अभिषेकम् bath, कृत्वा having taken, गतकल्मषा: बभूवु: were absolved  of their sins.
explanation: Those cursed to fall from heaven to earth were absolved of their sins after bathing there (in the waters of Ganga).

shloka_text: धूतपापा: पुनस्तेन तोयेनाथ सुभास्वता।।1.43.28।। पुनराकाशमाविश्य स्वान् लोकान् प्रतिपेदिरे।
translation: तेन by that, सुभास्वता excellently shining, तोयेन waters, धूतपापा: cleansed of their sins, पुन: again, आकाशम् sky, आविश्य having entered, अथ thereafter, पुन: again, स्वान् their own, लोकान् celestial worlds, प्रतिपेदिरे attained.
explanation: Cleansed of their sins by the sparkling waters, they ascended through the sky once again to their own (celestial) worlds.

shloka_text: मुमुदे मुदितो लोकस्तेन तोयेन भास्वता।।1.43.29।। कृताभिषेको गङ्गायां बभूव विगतक्लम:।
translation: लोक: people, भास्वता by the shining, तेन that, तोयेन by waters, मुमुदे rejoiced, मुदित: pleased, गङ्गायाम् in that Ganga, कृताभिषेक: having performed bath, विगतक्लम: बभूव were  removed of fatigue.
explanation: People rejoiced at the sight of those shining waters. They were happy  to have a dip in Ganga and their fatigue was gone.

shloka_text: भगीरथोऽपि राजार्षिर्दिव्यं स्यन्दनमास्थित:। प्रायादग्रे महातेजास्तं गङ्गा पृष्ठतोऽन्वगात्।।1.43.30।
translation: महातेजा: most brilliant, राजर्षि: royal sage, भगीरथोऽपि Bhagiratha also, दिव्यम् divine, स्यन्दनम् chariot, आस्थित: mounting, अग्रे प्रायात् marched forward, गङ्गा च Ganga, तम् him, पृष्ठत: from behind, अन्वगात् followed.
explanation: Most brilliant rajarshi Bhagiratha also mounting the divine chariot moved forward and Ganga followed him.

shloka_text: देवास्सर्षिगणा: सर्वे दैत्यदानवराक्षसा:।।1.43.31।। गन्धर्वयक्षप्रवरास्सकिन्नरमहोरगा:। सर्वाश्चाप्सरसो राम भगीरथरथानुगाम्।।1.43.32।। गङ्गामन्वगमन् प्रीतास्सर्वे जलचराश्च ये।
translation: राम O Rama, सर्षिगणा: with hosts of Saints, देवा: devatas, सर्वे all, दैत्यदानवराक्षसा: daityas, danavas, rakshasas, सकिन्नरमहोरगा: with kinnaras, serpents, गन्धर्वयक्षप्रवरा: foremost of gandharvas, yakshas, सर्वा: all, अप्सरस: apsaras, भगीरथरथानुगाम् following the chariot of Bhagiratha, गङ्गाम् Ganga, अन्वगमन् followed, ये जलचराश्च those acquatic creatures, सर्वे all (followed ).
explanation: O Rama besides acquatic beings, rishis, devatas, daityas, danavas, rakshasas along with kinnaras, serpents, foremost of gandharvas, yakshas and apsaras all followed the chariot of Bhagiratha. They were happy to follow Ganga.

shloka_text: देवास्सर्षिगणा: सर्वे दैत्यदानवराक्षसा:।।1.43.31।। गन्धर्वयक्षप्रवरास्सकिन्नरमहोरगा:। सर्वाश्चाप्सरसो राम भगीरथरथानुगाम्।।1.43.32।। गङ्गामन्वगमन् प्रीतास्सर्वे जलचराश्च ये।
translation: राम O Rama, सर्षिगणा: with hosts of Saints, देवा: devatas, सर्वे all, दैत्यदानवराक्षसा: daityas, danavas, rakshasas, सकिन्नरमहोरगा: with kinnaras, serpents, गन्धर्वयक्षप्रवरा: foremost of gandharvas, yakshas, सर्वा: all, अप्सरस: apsaras, भगीरथरथानुगाम् following the chariot of Bhagiratha, गङ्गाम् Ganga, अन्वगमन् followed, ये जलचराश्च those acquatic creatures, सर्वे all (followed ).
explanation: O Rama besides acquatic beings, rishis, devatas, daityas, danavas, rakshasas along with kinnaras, serpents, foremost of gandharvas, yakshas and apsaras all followed the chariot of Bhagiratha. They were happy to follow Ganga.

shloka_text: यतो भगीरथो राजा ततो गङ्गायशस्विनी।।1.43.33।। जगाम सरितां श्रेष्ठा सर्वपापप्रणाशिनी।
translation: राजा king, भगीरथ: Bhagiratha, यत: wherever, यशस्विनी renowned, सरितां श्रेष्ठा foremost of rivers, सर्वपापप्रणाशिनी destroyer of all sins, गङ्गा Ganga, तत: in the same direction, जगाम  flowed.
explanation: Ganga, famous and foremost of rivers, destroyer of all sins, flowed in the direction  king Bhagiratha moved.

shloka_text: ततो हि यजमानस्य जह्नोरद्भुतकर्मण:।।1.43.34।। गङ्गा सम्प्लावयामास यज्ञवाटं महात्मन:।
translation: तत: subsequently, गङ्गा Ganga, यजमानस्य of the performer of sacrifice, अद्भुतकर्मण: of great deeds, महात्मन: of the eminent, जह्नो: of sage Jahnu, यज्ञवाटम् sacrificial ground, सम्प्लावयामास inundated.
explanation: Then while Ganga was flowing, it inundated the sacrificial ground of the great sage Jahnu. Jahnu who used to work wonders was performing a sacrifice.

shloka_text: तस्यावलेपनं ज्ञात्वा क्रुद्धो यज्वा तु राघव।।1.43.35।। अपिबच्च जलं सर्वं गङ्गाया: परमाद्भुतम्।
translation: राघव O Rama, यज्वा the performer of  the sacrifice, sage Jahnu, तस्या: her, अवलेपनम् pride, ज्ञात्वा having known, क्रुध्द: furious with anger, गङ्गाया: Ganga's, सर्वम् entire, जलम् waters, परमाद्भुतम् astonishingly, अपिबत् drank.
explanation: O Descendant of the Raghu dynasty sage Jahnu who was performing the sacrifice, observed her pride and grew  furious. And astonishingly drank the entire waters of Ganga.

shloka_text: ततो देवास्सगन्धर्वा ऋषयश्च सुविस्मिता:।।1.43.36।। पूजयन्ति महात्मानं जह्नुं पुरुषसत्तमम्। गङ्गां चापि नयन्ति स्म दुहितृत्वे महात्मन:।।1.43.37।।
translation: तत: afterwards, सगन्धर्वा: along with gandharvas, देवा: devatas, ऋषयश्च rishis, सुविस्मिता: highly amazed, पुरुषसत्तमम् best amog men, महात्मानम् eminent, जह्नुम् sage Jahnu, पूजयन्ति worshipped, गङ्गां च Ganga also, महात्मन: illustrious Juhnu's, दुहितृत्वे as daughter, नयन्ति considered.
explanation: Devatas, rishis and gandharvas stood amazed (at this act). They worshipped the magnanimous Jahnu, noblest among men. The devatas entreated the illustrious Jahnu to treat Ganga as his daughter.

shloka_text: ततो देवास्सगन्धर्वा ऋषयश्च सुविस्मिता:।।1.43.36।। पूजयन्ति महात्मानं जह्नुं पुरुषसत्तमम्। गङ्गां चापि नयन्ति स्म दुहितृत्वे महात्मन:।।1.43.37।।
translation: तत: afterwards, सगन्धर्वा: along with gandharvas, देवा: devatas, ऋषयश्च rishis, सुविस्मिता: highly amazed, पुरुषसत्तमम् best amog men, महात्मानम् eminent, जह्नुम् sage Jahnu, पूजयन्ति worshipped, गङ्गां च Ganga also, महात्मन: illustrious Juhnu's, दुहितृत्वे as daughter, नयन्ति considered.
explanation: Devatas, rishis and gandharvas stood amazed (at this act). They worshipped the magnanimous Jahnu, noblest among men. The devatas entreated the illustrious Jahnu to treat Ganga as his daughter.

shloka_text: ततस्तुष्टो महातेजाश्श्रोत्राभ्यामसृजत् पुन:।।1.43.38।। तस्माज्जह्नुसुता गङ्गा प्रोच्यते जाह्नवीतिच।
translation: तत: thence, तुष्ट: highly pleased, महातेजा: highly lustrous Jahnu, पुन: again, श्रोत्राभ्याम् from both his ears, असृजत् released, तस्मात् therefore, गङ्गा Ganga, जह्नुसुता daughter of Jahnu, जाह्नवीति Jahnavi, प्रोच्यते is being called.
explanation: The brilliant (Jahnu) was pleased. He released her through both his both ears. Hence Ganga is called Jahnavi, daughter of Jahnu.

shloka_text: जगाम च पुनर्गङ्गा भगीरथरथानुगा। सागरं चापि सम्प्राप्ता सा सरित्प्रवरा तदा।।1.43.39।। रसातलमुपागच्छत्सिद्ध्यर्थं तस्य कर्मण:।
translation: गङ्गा Ganga, पुन: again, भगीरथरथानुगा following the chariot of Bhagiratha, जगाम had proceeded, तदा then, सा she, सरित्प्रवरा best among rivers, Ganga, सागरम् ocean, सम्प्राप्ता अपि having reached also, तस्य कर्मण: of his desires, सिद्ध्यर्थम् forfulfillment, रसातलम्  nether regions, उपागच्छत् reached.
explanation: Ganga, best among rivers, following the chariot of Bhagiratha, reached the ocean. She entered the nether regions of the earth in order to fulfil his mission (salvation of the sons of Sagara).

shloka_text: भगीरथोऽपि राजर्षि: गङ्गामादाय यत्नत:। पितामहान् भस्मकृतानपश्यद्दीनचेतन:।।1.43.40।।
translation: राजर्षि: royal saint, भगीरथोऽपि Bhagiratha also, यत्नत: with supreme efforts, गङ्गाम् Ganga, आदाय having brought, दीनचेतन: with grieved mind, भस्मकृतान् reduced to ashes, पितामहान् grand fathers, अपश्यत् beheld.
explanation: Rajarshi Bhagiratha, having brought Ganga with supreme efforts, saw with a sad heart his grandfathers reduced to ashes.

shloka_text: अथ तद्भस्मनां राशिं गङ्गासलिलमुत्तमम्। प्लावयद्धूतपाप्मानस्स्वर्गं प्राप्ता रघूत्तम।।1.43.41।।
translation: रघूत्तम O Rama, अथ thereafter, उत्तमम् excellent, गङ्गासलिलम् waters of Ganga, तत् भस्मनाम् those ashes, राशिम् heap, प्लावयत् inundated, धूतपापा: purged of sins, स्वर्गम् heaven, प्राप्ता: obtained.
explanation: O Best of the Raghus thereafter the holy waters of Ganga inundated those heaps of ashes and the sons of Sagara, purged of their sins, reached heaven" (said Viswamitra). इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे त्रिचत्वारिंशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the fortythird sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: स गत्वा सागरं राजा गङ्गयाऽनुगतस्तदा । प्रविवेश तलं भूमेर्यत्र ते भस्मसात्कृता:।।1.44.1।।
translation: स: राजा that king, तदा then, गङ्गया by Ganga, अनुगत: followed by, सागरम् ocean, गत्वा having gone, यत्र where, ते they (sons of Sagara), भस्मसात् into ashes, कृता: had been made, भूमे: earth's, तलम् lower regions, प्रविवेश entered.
explanation: Thereupon that king followed by Ganga reached the ocean and entered the lower regions of the earth where the sons of Sagara were found reduced to ashes.
comments: King Bhagiratha performs funeral rites of his ancestors.

shloka_text: भस्मन्यथाऽप्लुते राम गङ्गायास्सलिलेन वै। सर्वलोकप्रभुर्ब्रह्मा राजानमिदमब्रवीत्।।1.44.2।।
translation: अथ then, भस्मनि when the ashes, गङ्गाया: Ganga's, सलिलेन with waters, आप्लुते were  inundated, सर्वलोकप्रभु: lord of the world, ब्रह्मा Brahma, राजानम् addressing the king, इदम् अब्रवीत् spoke these words.
explanation: After the ashes were inundated by the waters of Ganga, Brahma, lord of the world,   appeared before king Bhagiratha and said:

shloka_text: तारिता नरशार्दूल दिवं याताश्च देववत्। षष्ठि: पुत्रसहस्राणि सगरस्य महात्मन:।।1.44.3।।
translation: नरशार्दूल O Best among men, महात्मन: of the illustrious, सगरस्य Sagara's, षष्टि: sixty पुत्रसहस्राणि thousand sons, तारिता: were liberated, देववत् like devatas, दिवम् towards heaven, याता: had gone.
explanation: "O Tiger among men sixty thousand sons of illustrious Sagara having been liberated, had gone towards heaven like devatas.

shloka_text: सागरस्य जलं लोके यावत्स्थास्यति पार्थिव। सगरस्यात्मजास्तावत्स्वर्गे स्थास्यन्ति देववत्।।1.44.4।।
translation: पार्थिव O King, सागरस्य ocean's, जलम् waters, लोके in this world, यावत् as long as, स्थास्यति remain, तावत् till such time, सगरस्य आत्मजा: sons of Sagara, देववत् like devatas, स्वर्गे in heavens, स्थास्यन्ति will stay.
explanation: O King as long as the waters in the ocean exist in this world, shall the sons of Sagara, live in heavens like gods.

shloka_text: इयं च दुहिता ज्येष्ठा तव गङ्गा भविष्यति । त्वत्कृतेन च नाम्नाऽथ लोके स्थास्यति विश्रुता।।1.44.5।।
translation: इयम् this, गङ्गा Ganga, तव your, ज्येष्ठा eldest, दुहिता daughter, भविष्यति will become, अथ from now onwards, त्वत्कृतेन formed out of your, नाम्ना name, लोके in this world, विश्रुता wellknown, स्थास्यति will stay on.
explanation: This Ganga will become your eldest daughter and from now on she will be wellknown in this world (as Bhagirathi) after your name.

shloka_text: गङ्गा त्रिपथगा राजन् दिव्या भागीरथीति च। त्रीन् पथो भावयन्तीति ततस्त्रिपथगा स्मृता।।1.44.6।।
translation: राजन् O King, दिव्या divine, गङ्गा Ganga, त्रिपथगा known as Tripathaga, भागीरथीति च also as Bhagirathi, त्रीन् in three, पथ: paths, भावयन्ती इति since she covers by flowing and  purifying, तत: therefore, त्रिपथगा Tripathaga, स्मृता has been known as.
explanation: O King divine Ganga will be called Tripathaga as well as Bhagirathi. Since she flows in the three worlds (heaven, earth and the lower world: Patala), she will be known as Tripathaga.

shloka_text: पितामहानां सर्वेषां त्वमत्र मनुजाधिप । कुरुष्व सलिलं राजन् प्रतिज्ञामपवर्जय।।1.44.7।।
translation: मनुजाधिप O Lord of men, राजन् O King, त्वम् you, अत्र here, सर्वेषाम् for all, पितामहानाम्  ancestors, सलिलं offerings with waters, कुरुष्व perform, प्रतिज्ञाम् your vow, अपवर्जय fulfil.
explanation: O Lord of men O King you may offer the waters of  Ganga here to all your ancestors and thereby fulfil your vow.

shloka_text: पूर्वकेण हि ते राजंस्तेनातियशसा तदा। धर्मिणां प्रवरेणापि नैष प्राप्तो मनोरथ:।।1.44.8।।
translation: राजन् O King, ते your, पूर्वकेण ancestor, अतियशसा by the highly renowned, धर्मिणाम् among righteous ones, प्रवरेणा foremost, तेनापि even by him, तदा then, एष: this, मनोरथ: desire, न प्राप्त: was not obtained.
explanation: O King by the highly renowned ancestors of yours, the foremost among righteous ones (even Sagara) this desire has not been fulfilled.

shloka_text: तथैवांशुमता तात लोकेऽप्रतिमतेजसा। गङ्गां प्रार्थयतानेतुं प्रतिज्ञा नापवर्जिता।।1.44.9।।
translation: तात O Child, तथैव similarly, लोके in this world, अप्रतिमतेजसा by the one possessing unparalleled prowess, गङ्गाम् Ganga, आनेतुम् for bringing, प्रार्थयता cherished, अंशुमता by Anshuman's, प्रतिज्ञा vow, नापवर्जिता could not be completed.
explanation: O Child similarly though Anshuman possessed unparalleled prowess in this world his prayer to Ganga, his vow could not be fulfilled.

shloka_text: राजर्षिणा गुणवता महर्षिसमतेजसा। मत्तुल्यतपसा चैव क्षत्रधर्मस्थितेन च।।1.44.10।। दिलीपेन महाभाग तव पित्राऽति तेजसा। पुनर्न शङ्किताऽनेतुं गङ्गां प्रार्थयताऽनघ।।1.44.11।।
translation: अनघ O Sinless one, महाभाग O Blessed one, राजार्षिणा by the royal saint, गुणवता virtuous, महर्षिसमतेजसा possessing the splendour of a maharshi, मत्तुल्यतपसा equal to me in austerities, क्षत्रधर्मस्थितेन abiding in the duties of a Kshatriya, अतितेजसा by the highly lustrous, गङ्गाम् Ganga, प्रार्थयता beseeching, तव your, पित्रा by father, दिलीपेन by Dilipa, महाभाग O Distinguished one, आनेतुं पुन: for bringing, न शङ्किता it was not made possible.
explanation: O Sinless one (Bhagiratha) O Distinguished one on the part of Dilipa brilliant your father who had the virtuous of a rajarshi, who was equal to a maharshi in splendour, and to me in austerities and abiding to the duties of a kshatriya it was even not possible to bring Ganga through prayer.

shloka_text: राजर्षिणा गुणवता महर्षिसमतेजसा। मत्तुल्यतपसा चैव क्षत्रधर्मस्थितेन च।।1.44.10।। दिलीपेन महाभाग तव पित्राऽति तेजसा। पुनर्न शङ्किताऽनेतुं गङ्गां प्रार्थयताऽनघ।।1.44.11।।
translation: अनघ O Sinless one, महाभाग O Blessed one, राजार्षिणा by the royal saint, गुणवता virtuous, महर्षिसमतेजसा possessing the splendour of a maharshi, मत्तुल्यतपसा equal to me in austerities, क्षत्रधर्मस्थितेन abiding in the duties of a Kshatriya, अतितेजसा by the highly lustrous, गङ्गाम् Ganga, प्रार्थयता beseeching, तव your, पित्रा by father, दिलीपेन by Dilipa, महाभाग O Distinguished one, आनेतुं पुन: for bringing, न शङ्किता it was not made possible.
explanation: O Sinless one (Bhagiratha) O Distinguished one on the part of Dilipa brilliant your father who had the virtuous of a rajarshi, who was equal to a maharshi in splendour, and to me in austerities and abiding to the duties of a kshatriya it was even not possible to bring Ganga through prayer.

shloka_text: सा त्वया समनुक्रान्ता प्रतिज्ञा पुरुषर्षभ। प्राप्तोऽसि परमं लोके यश: परमसम्मतम्।।1.44.12।।
translation: पुरुषर्षभ O Best among men, सा प्रतिज्ञा that vow, त्वया by you, समनुक्रान्ता has been kept up, लोके in this world, परमसम्मतम् highly acceptable, परमम् supreme, यश: fame, प्राप्त: असि  you have obtained.
explanation: O Best among men you have fulfilled that vow. You have achieved supreme renown and reverence in this world.

shloka_text: यच्च गङ्गावतरणं त्वया कृतमरिन्दम। अनेन च भवान् प्राप्तो धर्मस्यायतनं महत्।।1.44.13।।
translation: अरिन्दम O Destroyer of  enemies, त्वया by you, यत् since, गङ्गावतरणम् descent of Ganga, कृतम् has been materialised, अनेन by this, भवान् you, धर्मस्य of dharma, महत् great, आयतनम् sacred place, प्राप्त: have obtained.
explanation: O Destroyer of enemies by bringing about the descent of Ganga, you have secured a great abode in dharma.

shloka_text: प्लावयस्व त्वमात्मानं नरोत्तम सदोचिते। सलिले पुरुषव्याघ्र शुचि: पुण्यफलो भव।।1.44.14।।
translation: नरोत्तम O Best among men, पुरुषव्याघ्र O Tiger among men, उचिते in a befitting, सलिले waters, सदा always, त्वम् you, आत्मानम् yourself, प्लावयस्व take bath by dipping and floating later, शुचि: purifying yourself, पुण्यफल: भव acquire holiness.
explanation: O Best among men O Tiger among men take a dip in the eternally sacred waters,  purify yourself and acquire holiness.

shloka_text: पितामहानां सर्वेषां कुरुष्व सलिलक्रियाम्। स्वस्ति तेऽस्तु गमिष्यामि स्वं लोकं गम्यतां नृप।।1.44.15।।
translation: सर्वेषां for all, पितामहानाम् forefathers, सलिलक्रियाम् rites with waters, कुरुष्व perform, ते to you, स्वस्ति safety, गमिष्यामि I shall go, नृप O King, स्वं लोकम् towards your region, गम्यताम् you shall go.
explanation: O King perform the rites of all your forefathers with the waters (of Ganga), farewell. I shall return to my world (now). Go back, O King" (said Grandsire)

shloka_text: इत्येवमुक्त्वा देवेश: सर्वलोकपितामह:। यथाऽऽगतं तथाऽगच्छत् देवलोकं महायशा:।।1.44.16।।
translation: सर्वलोकपितामह: Grandsire of all the worlds, महायशा: highly renowned, देवेश: lord of the gods, इत्येवम् in this manner, उक्त्वा having spoken, यथाऽऽगतं तथा the way he came, देवलोकम् to heaven, अगच्छत् returned.
explanation: "The Grandsire of all the worlds, highly renowned lord of the gods, having Said this, returned to heaven the way he had come.

shloka_text: भगीरथोऽपि राजर्षि: कृत्वा सलिलमुत्तमम्। यथाक्रमं यथान्यायं सागराणां महायशा:।।1.44.17।। कृतोदकश्शुची राजा स्वपुरं प्रविवेश ह। समृद्धार्थो रघुश्रेष्ठ स्वराज्यं प्रशशास ह।।1.44.18।।
translation: राजर्षि: royal saint, महायशा: highly famous, राजा king, भगीरथोऽपि Bhagiratha also, यथाक्रमम् following proper order, यथान्यायम् following the tradition, सागराणाम् for the sons of Sagara, उत्तमम् highest, सलिलम् rites with sacred water, कृत्वा having performed, कृतोदक: having performed ablutions, शुचि: a purified man, स्वपुरम् his own city, प्रविवेश ह entered, रघुश्रेष्ठ O Rama, समृद्धार्थ: having fulfilled his desire, स्वराज्यम् his kingdom, प्रशशास ह ruled.
explanation: The illustrious rajarshi Bhagiratha, performed the rites of offering the sacred water of Ganga, in accordance with proper order and tradition for the sons of Sagara. Purified with the ablutions entered his own city." O Best of the Raghus his desire thus fulfilled he continued to rule the kingdom thereafter".

shloka_text: भगीरथोऽपि राजर्षि: कृत्वा सलिलमुत्तमम्। यथाक्रमं यथान्यायं सागराणां महायशा:।।1.44.17।। कृतोदकश्शुची राजा स्वपुरं प्रविवेश ह। समृद्धार्थो रघुश्रेष्ठ स्वराज्यं प्रशशास ह।।1.44.18।।
translation: राजर्षि: royal saint, महायशा: highly famous, राजा king, भगीरथोऽपि Bhagiratha also, यथाक्रमम् following proper order, यथान्यायम् following the tradition, सागराणाम् for the sons of Sagara, उत्तमम् highest, सलिलम् rites with sacred water, कृत्वा having performed, कृतोदक: having performed ablutions, शुचि: a purified man, स्वपुरम् his own city, प्रविवेश ह entered, रघुश्रेष्ठ O Rama, समृद्धार्थ: having fulfilled his desire, स्वराज्यम् his kingdom, प्रशशास ह ruled.
explanation: The illustrious rajarshi Bhagiratha, performed the rites of offering the sacred water of Ganga, in accordance with proper order and tradition for the sons of Sagara. Purified with the ablutions entered his own city." O Best of the Raghus his desire thus fulfilled he continued to rule the kingdom thereafter".

shloka_text: प्रमुमोद ह लोकस्तं नृपमासाद्य राघव। नष्टशोकस्समृद्धार्थो बभूव विगतज्वर:।।1.44.19।।
translation: राघव O Rama, तम् him, नृपम् as king, आसाद्य having obtained, लोक: the world, प्रमुमोद rejoiced, समृद्धार्थ: having achieved his desire, विगतज्वर: freed from mental afflictions, नष्टशोक: with his sorrows mitigated, बभूव became.
explanation: "O Best of the Raghus the world rejoiced having Bhagiratha as king. With his purpose achieved, he was freed from all mental afflictions and sorrows and thereafter lived happily.

shloka_text: एष ते राम गङ्गाया विस्तरोऽभिहितो मया। स्वस्ति प्राप्नुहि भद्रं ते संध्याकालोऽतिवर्तते।।1.44.20।।
translation: राम O Rama, गङ्गाया: Ganga's, एष: this, विस्तर: detailed story, मया by me, ते to you, अभिहित: has been mentioned, स्वस्ति wellbeing to you, प्राप्नुहि you may receive, ते to you, भद्रम् prosperity, संध्याकाल: evening time (proper for doing ablutions ), अतिवर्तते is passing by.
explanation: O Rama I have related you the story of Ganga in detail. Evening time is passing by (and we shall perform the ablutions) farewell.

shloka_text: धन्यं यशस्यमायुष्यं पुत्र्यं स्वर्ग्यमतीव च। यश्श्रावयति विप्रेषु क्षत्रियेष्वितरेषु च।।1.44.21।। प्रीयन्ते पितरस्तस्य प्रीयन्ते दैवतानि च।
translation: धन्यम् conferring prosperity, यशस्यम् brings fame, आयुष्यम् confers longevity, पुत्र्यम् is capable of leading to progeny, अतीव very much, स्वर्ग्यम् leading to heaven, य: this story, विप्रेषु for brahmins, क्षत्रियेषु Kshatriyas, इतरेषु च others also, श्रावयति relates, तस्य his, पितर: forefathers, प्रीयन्ते would be pleased, दैवतानि च devatas also, प्रीयन्ते will be pleased.
explanation: He will be blessed with fame, longevity, progeny and (after death) heaven brahmins One who recites this story of Ganga to the kshatriyas and others, the gods and his forefathers would be pleased with him.

shloka_text: इदमाख्यानमव्यग्रो गङ्गावतरणं शुभम्।।1.44.22।। यश्शृणोति च काकुत्स्थ सर्वान् कामानवाप्नुयात्। सर्वे पापा: प्रणश्यन्ति आयु: कीर्तिश्च वर्धते।।1.44.23।।
translation: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, इदम् this, शुभम् sacred, गङ्गावतरणम् relating to the descent of Ganga, आख्यानम् story, य: who, अव्यग्र: with concentration of mind, शृणोति listens, सर्वान् all, कामान् desires, अवाप्नुयात् he may obtain, सर्वे all, पापा: sins, प्रणश्यन्ति are destroyed, आयु: longevity, कीर्तिश्च fame also, वर्धते will increase.
explanation: O Son of the Kakusthas whosoever listens to this auspicious story relating to the descent of Ganga with concentration, all his desires will be achieved, his sins will be destroyed and his longevity and fame will increase". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे चतुश्चत्वारिंशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the fortyfourth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: विश्वामित्रवचश्श्रुत्वा राघव स्सहलक्ष्मण:। विस्मयं परमं गत्वा विश्वामित्रमथाब्रवीत्।।1.45.1।।
translation: सहलक्ष्मण: together with Lakshmana, राघव: Rama, विश्वामित्रवच: words of Visvamitra, श्रुत्वा having listened, परमम् great, विस्मयम् astonishment, गत्वा having obtained, अथ thereafter, विश्वामित्रम् addressing Visvamitra, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: On hearing the words of Viswamitra, Rama along with Lakshmana, filled with astonishment said to him:
comments: Devatas and daityas churn the ocean of milk -- Rudra swallows venom -- Visnu assumes the form of tortoise and supports Mandara mountain on his back -- emergence of Dhanvantari, apsarasas, etc -- battle between devas and daityas for possession of nectar.

shloka_text: अत्यद्भुतमिदं ब्रह्मन् कथितं परमं त्वया। गङ्गावतरणं पुण्यं सागरस्यापि पूरणम्।।1.45.2।।
translation: ब्रह्मन् O Knower of Brahma, त्वया by you, कथितम् is narrated, परमम् great, इदम् this, गङ्गावतरणम् descent of Ganga, पुण्यम् sacred, सागरस्य ocean's, पूरणम् replenishment, अत्यद्भुतम् exceedingly wonderful.
explanation: "O Knower of the Brahman this story narrated by you relating to the descent of the sacred Ganga and the fullness of the ocean  (due to Ganga's fall) is very wonderful".

shloka_text: तस्य सा शर्वरी सर्वा सह सौमित्रिणा तदा। जगाम चिन्तयानस्य विश्वामित्रकथां शुभाम् ।।1.45.3।।
translation: तदा then, तस्य Rama, सौमित्रिणा सह together with Lakshmana, शुभाम् holy, विश्वामित्रकथाम् the story narrated by Visvamitra, चिन्तयानस्य while thinking, सा that, सर्वा completely, शर्वरी night, जगाम passed away.
explanation: Then Rama along with Lakshmana spent the whole night reflecting on the auspicious story narrated by Viswamitra.

shloka_text: तत: प्रभाते विमले विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम्। उवाच राघवो वाक्यं कृताह्निकमरिन्दम:।।1.45.4।।
translation: तत: afterwards, अरिन्दम: the destroyer of enemies, राघव: Rama, विमले clear, प्रभाते early morning, कृताह्निकम् after completing daily religious and spiritual rites, महामुनिम् great ascetic, विश्वामित्रम् addressing Visvamitra, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said.
explanation: Thereafter, the progeny of the Raghus, the destroyer of enemies (Rama) addressed Viswamitra in the clear early morning after Viswamitra had completed his routine rites:

shloka_text: गता भगवती रात्रिश्श्रोतव्यं परमं श्रुतम्। क्षणभूतेव नौ रात्रि स्सम्वृत्तेयं महातप:।।1.45.5।। इमां चिन्तयतस्सर्वां निखिलेन कथां तव।
translation: महातप: O Great performer of austerities, परमम् supreme, श्रोतव्यम् fit to be listened, श्रुतम् has been heard, भगवती glorious, रात्रि: night, गता has passed, तव your, इमाम् this, सर्वाम् complete, कथाम् story, चिन्तयत: pondering over, नौ for both of us, इयम् this, रात्रि: night, क्षणभूतेव like a moment, सम्वृत्ता has turned out to be.
explanation: "O Noble ascetic we have heard this great story worthy to be listened. As we both lay pondering over the entire story (narrated by you), the glorious night passed off just like a moment.

shloka_text: तराम सरितां श्रेष्ठां पुण्यां त्रिपथगां नदीम्।।1.45.6।। नौरेषा हि सुखास्तीर्णा ऋषीणां पुण्यकर्मणाम्। भगवन्तमिह प्राप्तं ज्ञात्वा त्वरितमागता।।1.45.7।।
translation: सरिताम् among rivers, श्रेष्ठाम् excellent, पुण्याम् holy, त्रिपथगाम् flowing in three directions, नदीम् river Ganga, तराम let us cross over, सुखास्तीर्णा spread comfortably, पुण्यकर्मणाम् of men of pious acts, ऋषीणाम् saints, एषा this, नौ: boat, भगवन्तम् you venerable, इह here, प्राप्तम् had arrived, ज्ञत्वा knowing, त्वरितम् speedily, आगता हि has come.
explanation: We will cross over Ganga, the best of rivers, the sacred river that flows in three directions.This boat of pious saints which is well laidout has come here swiftly, having come to know that you, O Venerable one have arrived".

shloka_text: तराम सरितां श्रेष्ठां पुण्यां त्रिपथगां नदीम्।।1.45.6।। नौरेषा हि सुखास्तीर्णा ऋषीणां पुण्यकर्मणाम्। भगवन्तमिह प्राप्तं ज्ञात्वा त्वरितमागता।।1.45.7।।
translation: सरिताम् among rivers, श्रेष्ठाम् excellent, पुण्याम् holy, त्रिपथगाम् flowing in three directions, नदीम् river Ganga, तराम let us cross over, सुखास्तीर्णा spread comfortably, पुण्यकर्मणाम् of men of pious acts, ऋषीणाम् saints, एषा this, नौ: boat, भगवन्तम् you venerable, इह here, प्राप्तम् had arrived, ज्ञत्वा knowing, त्वरितम् speedily, आगता हि has come.
explanation: We will cross over Ganga, the best of rivers, the sacred river that flows in three directions.This boat of pious saints which is well laidout has come here swiftly, having come to know that you, O Venerable one have arrived".

shloka_text: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राघवस्य महात्मन:। सन्तारं कारयामास सर्षिसङ्घ स्सराघव:।।1.45.8।।
translation: तस्य महात्मन: of that illustrious, राघवस्य Rama's, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, सर्षिसङ्घ: accompanied by hosts of sages, सराघव: together with Rama and Lakshmana, सन्तारम् to cross over, कारयामास made (arrangements).
explanation: Hearing the words of noble Rama, he (Viswamitra), accompanied by hosts of sages besides Rama and Lakshmana made arrangements to cross (the river).

shloka_text: उत्तरं तीरमासाद्य सम्पूज्यर्षिगणं तदा। गङ्गाकूले निविष्टास्ते विशालां ददृशु: पुरीम्।।1.45.9।।
translation: उत्तरं तीरम् northern bank, आसाद्य having reached, तदा then, ऋषिगणम् groups of sages, सम्पूज्य having paid homage, गङ्गाकूले on the bank of river Ganga, निविष्टा: encamped, ते they, विशालां पुरीम् city of Vishala, ददृशु: beheld.
explanation: Having reached the northern bank, they paid homage to the sages encamped on the bank of  Ganga and beheld the city of Vishala.

shloka_text: ततो मुनिवरस्तूर्णं जगाम सह राघव: । विशालां नगरीं रम्यां दिव्यां स्वर्गोपमां तदा।।1.45.10।।
translation: तत: subsequently, मुनिवर: best among ascetics, Visvamitra, सह राघव: together with Rama and Lakshmana, तदा then, रम्याम् enchanting, दिव्याम् splendid, स्वर्गोपमाम् like unto heaven, विशालाम् towards Vishala, नगरीम् city, तूर्णम् speedily, जगाम went.
explanation: Thereupon Viswamitra, the best of ascetics, accompanied by Rama and Lakshmana soon proceeded towards the enchanting and splendid city of Vishala comparable to heaven.

shloka_text: अथ रामो महाप्राज्ञो विश्वामित्रं महामुनिम् । पप्रच्छ प्राञ्जलिर्भूत्वा विशालामुत्तमां पुरीम्।।1.45.11।।
translation: अथ thereafter, महाप्राज्ञ: great intellectual, राम: Rama, प्राञ्जलि: भूत्वा with folded palms, महामुनिम् eminent ascetic, विश्वामित्रम् Visvamitra, उत्तमाम् excellent, विशालां पुरीम् about the city of Vishala, पप्रच्छ enquired.
explanation: Thereafter great intellectual, Rama, with folded palms enquired of eminent ascetic Viswamitra, about the excellent city of Vishala.

shloka_text: कतरो राजवंशोऽयं विशालायां महामुने। श्रोतुमिच्छामि भद्रं ते परं कौतूहलं हि मे।।.1.45.12।।
translation: महामुने O Distinguished ascetic, विशालायाम् in this city of Vishala, अयम् this, राजवंश: royal lineage, कतर: whose, श्रोतुम् to listen, इच्छामि I am desirous, ते भद्रम् may you prosper, मे to me, परम् great, कौतूहलं हि is my curiosity.
explanation: "O Distinguished ascetic, which royal dynasty is ruling this city of Vishala? Could you tell me? Great is my curiosity. May you prosper"

shloka_text: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा रामस्य मुनिपुङ्गव:। आख्यातुं तत्समारेभे विशालस्य पुरातनम्।।1.45.13।।
translation: मुनिपुङ्गव: preeminent among ascetics, तस्य रामस्य Rama's, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having listened, विशालस्य city of Vishala's, पुरातनम् ancient, तत् that, आख्यातुम् to relate, समारेभे commenced.
explanation: Viswamitra, preeminent among ascetics, hearing the words of Rama commenced to relate the history of the ancient city of Vishala.

shloka_text: श्रूयतां राम शक्रस्य कथां कथयतश्शुभाम्। अस्मिन् देशे तु यद्वृत्तं तदपि शृणु राघव।।1.45.14।।
translation: राम O Rama, शक्रस्य Indra's, शुभाम् auspicious, कथाम् legendary story, कथयत: being related by me, श्रूयताम् may be heard, अस्मिन् देशे in this country, यत् what, वृत्तम् had happened, तदपि that also, शृणु you may listen.
explanation: "O Rama hear the auspicious legend of Indra. Listen, too, what had happened to this country.

shloka_text: पूर्वं कृतयुगे राम दिते: पुत्रा महाबला:। अदितेश्च महाभाग वीर्यवन्तस्सुधार्मिका:।।1.45.15।।
translation: महाभाग राम O Blessed Rama, पूर्वम् formerly, कृतयुगे in Krita yuga, दिते: पुत्रा: sons of Diti, अदितेश्च sons of Aditi, महाबला: highly powerful, वीर्यवन्त: possessed of valour, सुधार्मिका: highly virtuous (used to live).
explanation: O Blessed Rama in kritayuga, the sons of Diti were very strong and those of Aditi were spirited and righteous.

shloka_text: ततस्तेषां नरश्रेष्ठ बुद्धिरासीन्महात्मनाम् । अमरा अजराश्चैव कथं स्याम निरामया:।।1.45.16।।
translation: तत: then, नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, महात्मनाम् of the illustrious, तेषाम् for them, अजरा: free from old age, अमराश्चैव free from death, निरामया: free from disease, कथम् how, स्याम we will be, बुद्धि: आसीत् a thought came.
explanation: O Best among men a thought came to those illustrious ones, 'how can we be  free from old age, death and disease'?

shloka_text: तेषां चिन्तयतां राम बुद्धिरासीन्महात्मनाम्। क्षीरोदमथनं कृत्वा रसं प्राप्स्याम तत्र वै।।1.45.17।।
translation: राम O Rama, चिन्तयताम् while they were reflecting over this matter, तेषाम् for them, महात्मनाम् noble ones, बुद्धि: a thought, आसीत् came, क्षीरोदमथनम् churning the ocean of milk, कृत्वा having made, तत्र from there, रसम् nectar of immortality, प्राप्स्याम we will obtain.
explanation: "O Rama While the noble sons were reflecting over this matter an idea flashed across their minds to get nectar by churning the ocean of milk.

shloka_text: ततो निश्चित्य मथनं योक्त्रं कृत्वा च वासुकिम्। मन्थानं मन्दरं कृत्वा ममन्थुरमितौजस:।।1.45.18।।
translation: तत: there upon, अमितौजस: those men who were very powerful, मथनम् to churn, निश्चित्य having decided, वासुकिम् Vasuki, योक्त्रम् as rope of the churning rod, कृत्वा having made, मन्दरम् Mandara mountain, मन्थानम् as churning rod, कृत्वा having made, ममन्थु: churned.
explanation: Thereupon, having decided to churn (the ocean mind) those very powerful ones, made Vasuki, (the great snake), as a rope and Mandara mountain as the churning rod.And started churning it.

shloka_text: अथ वर्षसहस्रेण योक्त्रसर्पशिरांसि च। वमन्त्यति विषं तत्र ददंशुर्दशनैश्शिला:।।1.45.19।।
translation: अथ thereafter, वर्षसहस्रेण in a thousand years, योक्त्रसर्पशिरांसि the hoods of the serpent made as rope, तत्र there, अतिविषम् virulent poison, वमन्ति vomitting, शिला: rocks, दशनै: with teeth, ददंशु: had bitten.
explanation: After a thousand years, the hoods of the snake made as rope vomitted venom and started biting the rocks of the Mandara mountain with their teeth.

shloka_text: उत्पपाताग्निसङ्काशं हालाहलमहाविषम्। तेन दग्धं जगत्सर्वं सदेवासुरमानुषम्।।1.45.20।।
translation: अग्निसङ्काशम् resembling fire, हालाहलमहाविषम् virulent venom known as HalaHala, उत्पपात was sprung up, तेन by that, सदेवासुरमानुषम् with devatas, asuras, mortals, सर्वम् entire, जगत् world, दग्धम् was burnt.
explanation: Therefrom was produced halahala, virulent venom resembling fire.The entire universe  consisting of devatas, asuras and mortals was burnt down.

shloka_text: अथ देवा महादेवं शङ्करं शरणार्थिन:। जग्मु: पशुपतिं रुद्रं त्राहि त्राहीति तुष्टुवु:।।1.45.21।।
translation: अथ then, देवा: devatas, शरणार्थिन: seeking refuge, महादेवम् great god, शङ्करम् the god causing happiness, पशुपतिम् lord of all living beings, रुद्रम् to Rudra, जग्मु: had gone, त्राहि त्राहि इति save us, save us, तुष्टुवु: they extolled.
explanation: The devatas sought refuge in the great god Rudra who causes happiness, the Lord of all living beings. 'Save us, Save us', the cried.

shloka_text: एवमुक्तस्ततो देवैर्देवदेवेश्वर: प्रभु:। प्रादुरासीत्ततोऽत्रैव शङ्खचक्रधरो हरि:।।1.45.22।।
translation: तत: thereupon, प्रभु: lord, देवदेवेश्वर: the overlord, who is god of gods, देवै: by devatas, एवम् in this way, उक्त: having been spoken, तत: thereafter, शङ्खचक्रधर: bearing the conch and discus, हरि: Hari, अत्रैव here itself, प्रादुरासीत् appeared.
explanation: Thereupon, Hari the Lord of celestial beings extolled by the devatas appeared bearing the conch and discus.

shloka_text: उवाचैनं स्मितं कृत्वा रुद्रं शूलभृतं हरि:। दैवतैर्मथ्यमाने तु यत्पूर्वं समुपस्थितम् ।।1.45.23।। त्वदीयंहि सुरश्रेष्ठ सुराणामग्रजोऽसि यत् । अग्रपूजामिमां मत्वा गृहाणेदं विषं प्रभो।।1.45.24।।
translation: हरि: Hari, स्मितं कृत्वा having smiled, शूलभृतम् god bearing the Trident, एनं रुद्रम् addressing Rudra, उवाच spoke, सुरश्रेष्ठ O Chief of celestials, दैवतै: by devatas, मथ्यमाने while churning, यत् whichever, पूर्वम् earlier, समुपस्थितम् is produced, त्वदीयं हि is yours, सुराणाम् among devatas, अग्रज: असि were born earliest, प्रभो O Capable one, इमाम् this one,    अग्रपूजाम् the first offering to the most distinguished, मत्वा thinking, इदम् this, विषम् venom, गृहाण receive.
explanation: Hari, smiling said to the tridentbearing Rudra "O Chief of celestial beings you were born the earliest among the devatas. Therefore, while churning the ocean whichever is produced first shall be offered to you. Considering it the first offering, O Lord accept this venom."

shloka_text: उवाचैनं स्मितं कृत्वा रुद्रं शूलभृतं हरि:। दैवतैर्मथ्यमाने तु यत्पूर्वं समुपस्थितम् ।।1.45.23।। त्वदीयंहि सुरश्रेष्ठ सुराणामग्रजोऽसि यत् । अग्रपूजामिमां मत्वा गृहाणेदं विषं प्रभो।।1.45.24।।
translation: हरि: Hari, स्मितं कृत्वा having smiled, शूलभृतम् god bearing the Trident, एनं रुद्रम् addressing Rudra, उवाच spoke, सुरश्रेष्ठ O Chief of celestials, दैवतै: by devatas, मथ्यमाने while churning, यत् whichever, पूर्वम् earlier, समुपस्थितम् is produced, त्वदीयं हि is yours, सुराणाम् among devatas, अग्रज: असि were born earliest, प्रभो O Capable one, इमाम् this one,    अग्रपूजाम् the first offering to the most distinguished, मत्वा thinking, इदम् this, विषम् venom, गृहाण receive.
explanation: Hari, smiling said to the tridentbearing Rudra "O Chief of celestial beings you were born the earliest among the devatas. Therefore, while churning the ocean whichever is produced first shall be offered to you. Considering it the first offering, O Lord accept this venom."

shloka_text: इत्युक्त्वा च सुरश्रेष्ठस्तत्रैवान्तरधीयत। देवतानां भयं दृष्टवाश्रुत्वा वाक्यं तु शार्ङ्गिण:। हालाहलविषं घोरं स जग्राहामृतोपमम्।।1.45.25।।
translation: सुरश्रेष्ठ: excellent among devatas, इति in this manner, उक्त्वा having spoken, तत्रैव there alone, अन्तरधीयत vanished, स: Shiva, देवतानाम् devatas', भयम् fear, दृष्टवा having seen,    शार्ङ्गिण: वाक्यम् Visnu's word, श्रुत्वा having heard, घोरम् dreadful, हालाहलविषम् HalaHala venom, अमृतोपमम् treating it as nectar, जग्राह received.
explanation: Visnu, the highest among the devatas having the spoken, vanished. Siva who had heard Visnu's words and seen the fear of the gods received that  dreadful halahala treating it as nectar.

shloka_text: देवान्विसृज्य देवेशो जगाम भगवान् हर:। ततो देवासुरास्सर्वे ममन्थू रघुनन्दन ।।1.45.26।।
translation: देवेश: lord of devatas, भगवान् venerable, हर: Siva, देवान् devatas, विसृज्य leaving behind, जगाम had gone, रघुनन्दन O Descendent of Raghu, तत: then, सर्वे all, देवासुरा: devatas and asuras, ममन्थु: churned.
explanation: Lord of the gods, venerable Siva went away to his abode leaving behind the devatas. O Descendant of Raghu then all the devatas and asuras resumed churning.

shloka_text: प्रविवेशाथ पातालं मन्थान: पर्वतोऽनघ। ततो देवास्सगन्धर्वास्तुष्टुवुर्मधुसूदनम्।।1.45.27।।
translation: अनघ O Sinless one, अथ after that, मन्थान: पर्वत: mountain Mandara used as churning rod, पातालम् to Patala, प्रविवेश entered (sank down), तत: thereupon, सगन्धर्वा: along with gandharvas, देवा: devatas, मधुसूदनम् Vishnu, तुष्टुवु: extolled.
explanation: 'O Sinless one after the mountain (Mandara) used as churning rod sank down to nether world (patala) the devatas along with the gandharvas invoked Visnu'.

shloka_text: त्वं गति: सर्वभूतानां विशेषेण दिवौकसाम्। पालयास्मान्महाबाहो गिरिमुद्धर्तुमर्हसि।।1.45.28।।
translation: महाबाहो O Strong armed one, त्वम् you, सर्वभूतानाम् for all living beings, गति: ultimate refuge, विशेषेण specially, दिवौकसाम् for devatas, अस्मान् us, पालय protect, गिरिम् mountain, उद्धर्तुम् अर्हसि fit to lift it.
explanation: "O mightyarmed Visnu you are the ultimate refuge for all living beings, specially for the devatas. Protect us, you (alone) are fit to lift up the Mandara mountain".

shloka_text: इति श्रुत्वा हृषीकेश: कामठं रूपमास्थित:। पर्वतं पृष्ठत: कृत्वा शिश्ये तत्रोदधौ हरि:।।1.45.29।।
translation: हृषीकेश: controller of sense organs, हरि: Visnu, इति these words, श्रुत्वा having heard, कामठम् रूपम् form of tortoise, आस्थित: assuming, पर्वतम् mountain, पृष्ठत: on its back, कृत्वा having made, तत्र there, उदधौ in the ocean, शिश्ये reclined.
explanation: Having heard these words, the controller of the sense organs, Visnu, assumed the form of a tortoise reclined in the ocean supporting the mountain on its back.

shloka_text: पर्वताग्रे तु लोकात्मा हस्तेनाक्रम्य केशव:। देवानां मध्यत: स्थित्वा ममन्थ पुरुषोत्तम:।।1.45.30।।
translation: लोकात्मा omnipresent, पुरुषोत्तम: supreme Purusha, केशव: Visnu, देवानाम् devatas, मध्यत: amidst, स्थित्वा standing, पर्वताग्रे on the peak of mountain, हस्तेन with his hand, आक्रम्य occupying, ममन्थ churned.
explanation: Visnu, the Supreme being, the soul of the universe standing amidst the devatas took hold of the peak of mountain with his hand and continued to churn the ocean.

shloka_text: अथ वर्षसहस्रेण सदण्डस्सकमण्डलु:। पूर्वं धन्वन्तरिर्नाम अप्सराश्च सुवर्चस:।।1.45.31।।
translation: अथ there after, वर्षसहस्रेण in thousand years, सदण्ड: holding staff, सकमण्डलु: with water pot (carried by ascetics), धन्वन्तरिर्नाम named Danvantari, सुवर्चस: of high lustre, अप्सराश्च apsaras, पूर्वम् in the begining (came out).
explanation: In this way thousand years rolled by. In the beginining came out Dhanvantari holding a staff and a water pot (carried by ascetics) and apsaras of high lustre.

shloka_text: अप्सु निर्मथनादेव रसास्तस्माद्वरस्त्रिय:। उत्पेतुर्मनुजश्रेष्ठ तस्मादप्सरसोऽभवन्।।1.45.32।।
translation: मनुजश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, अप्सु waters, निर्मथनात् churning, तस्मात् रसात् from that essence, वरस्त्रिय: excellent women, उत्पेतु: emerged, तस्मात् for that reason, अप्सरस: apsaras, अभवन् became.
explanation: O Best among men excellent women emerged out of the essence produced by churning of waters. Therefore they are known as apsarasas.

shloka_text: षष्टि: कोट्योऽभवंस्तासाम् अप्सराणां सुवर्चसाम्। असङ्ख्येयास्तु काकुत्स्थ यास्तासां परिचारिका:।।1.45.33।।
translation: काकुत्स्थ O Kakutstha, सुवर्चसाम् highly lustrous, तासाम् अप्सराणाम् those apsarasas, षष्टि: कोट्य: sixty crores, अभवन् produced, तासाम् their, या: परिचारिका: those attendants, असङ्ख्येया: countless in number.
explanation: O Kakutstha there appeared sixty crore highly lustrous apsarasas. Their  attendants were countless in number.

shloka_text: न तास्स्म परिगृह्णन्ति सर्वे ते देवदानवा:। अप्रतिग्रहणात्ताश्च सर्वास्साधारणास्स्मृता:।।1.45.34।।
translation: सर्वे all, ते देवदानवा: devas or danavas, ता: them, न परिगृह्णन्ति स्म did not accept in marriage, अप्रतिग्रहणात् unmarried as they were, ता: सर्वा: all of them, साधारणा: belonging to all, स्मृता: have been called.
explanation: Neither devas nor danavas accept them in marriage. Unmarried, all of them have been regarded as belonging to all.

shloka_text: वरुणस्य तत: कन्या वारुणी रघुनन्दन । उत्पपात महाभागा मार्गमाणा परिग्रहम्।।1.45.35।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Joys of Raghus, Rama, तत: thereafter, वरुणस्य Varuna's, कन्या daughter, वारुणी Vaaruni, परिग्रहम् seeking consort, मार्गमाणा searching, उत्पपात fell out.
explanation: O Joy of the Raghus (Rama) thereafter Varuna's daughter Varuni (goddess of wine) came out searching for a consort.

shloka_text: दिते: पुत्रा न तां राम जगृहुर्वरुणात्मजाम्। अदितेस्तु सुता वीर जगृहुस्तामनिन्दिताम्।।1.45.36।।
translation: राम O Rama, तां वरुणात्मजाम् that Varuni, दिते: Diti's, पुत्रा: sons, न जगृहु: did not accept, वीर O heroic one, अनिन्दिताम् blemishless, ताम् her, अदिते: सुता: sons of Aditi, जगृहु:   received.
explanation: O Rama while Diti's sons did not accept the unblemished Varuni, O heroic one, the sons of Aditi did.

shloka_text: असुरास्तेन दैतेयास्सुरास्तेनादितेस्सुता:। हृष्टा: प्रमुदिताश्चासन् वारुणीग्रहणात्सुरा:।।1.45.37।।
translation: तेन for that reason, दैतेया: sons of Diti, असुरा: Asuras (without wine), अदिते: Aditi's, सुता: sons, सुरा: Suras, सुरा: devatas, वारुणीग्रहणात् for having accepted Vaaruni, हृष्टा: (प्रमुदिताः च) आसन् became glad.
explanation: For that reason, sons of Diti were called asuras. Aditi's sons were known as suras. Devatas grew exceedingly glad for having Varuni.

shloka_text: उच्चैश्श्रवा हयश्रेष्ठो मणिरत्नं च कौस्तुभम्। उदतिष्ठन्नरश्रेष्ठ तथैवामृतमुत्तमम्।।1.45.38।।
translation: नरश्रेष्ठ O Foremost among men, उच्चैश्श्रवा: Ucchaishravas, the celestial horse,  हयश्रेष्ठ: best of horses, कौस्तुभम् Kausthubham, मणिरत्नं च best among Jewels, तथैव and also, उत्तमम् excellent, अमृतम् nectar, उदतिष्ठन् arose (out of foam).
explanation: O Foremost among men (Rama) ucchaishravas, the best of horses (the celestial horse), kausthubham, the best jewel and also nectar came (from churning).

shloka_text: अथ तस्य कृते राम महानासीत्कुलक्षय:। अदितेस्तु तत: पुत्रा दिते: पुत्रानसूदयन्।।1.45.39।।
translation: राम O Rama, अथ thereafter, तस्य कृते for it's sake, महान् great, कुलक्षय: आसीत् destructin of race took place, तत: thereafter, अदिते: Aditi's, पुत्रा: sons, दिते: Diti's, पुत्रान् sons, असूदयन् killed.
explanation: O Rama the race of devatas and daityas suffered great destruction because of (their fight for) that nectar. Thereafter Aditi's sons, the devatas killed Diti's sons, the daityas.

shloka_text: एकतोऽभ्यागमन् सर्वे ह्यसुरा राक्षसैस्सह। युद्धमासीन्महाघोरं वीर त्रैलोक्यमोहनम्।।1.45.40।।
translation: वीर O Heroic Rama, सर्वे all, असुरा: asuras, राक्षसै: सह along with rakshasas, एकत: on one side, अभ्यागमन् joined, त्रैलोक्यमोहनम् striking confusion (delusion) among the three worlds, महाघोरम् violently dreadful, युद्धम् battle, आसीत् took place.
explanation: O Heroic Rama all the asuras along with the rakshasas joined on one side. A violent and a dreadful battle which threw the three worlds in to a great confusion, ensued.

shloka_text: यदा क्षयं गतं सर्वं तदा विष्णुर्महाबल:। अमृतं सोऽहरत्त्तूर्णं मायामास्थाय मोहिनीम्।।1.45.41।।
translation: यदा when, सर्वम् everything, क्षयं गतम् was perished, तदा then, महाबल: endowed with great power, स: विष्णु: Vishnu, मोहिनीम् Mohini form (elusivedelusive ), मायाम् illusion (maya), आस्थाय assuming, तूर्णम् speedily, अमृतम् nectar, आहरत् had stolen.
explanation: When everything was destroyed completely, the exceedingly powerful Visnu assuming the form of Mohini a charming woman (elusive form) with the power of illusion quickly stole away the nectar.

shloka_text: ये गताऽभिमुखं विष्णुमक्षयं पुरुषोत्तमम्। सम्पिष्टास्ते तदा युद्धे विष्णुना प्रभविष्णुना।।1.45.42।।
translation: अक्षयम् imperishable, पुरुषोत्तमम् supreme purusha, विष्णुम् Vishnu, ये those, युद्धे in the battle, अभिमुखम् in front of him, गता: had gone, ते they, प्रभविष्णुना by the capable, विष्णुना by Vishnu, सम्पिष्टा: were grounded.
explanation: Those who opposed the imperishable, supreme purusha, Visnu, in the battle were crushed by all powerful Visnu.

shloka_text: अदितेरात्मजा वीरा दिते: पुत्रान्निजघ्निरे। तस्मिन् घोरे महायुद्धे दैतेयादित्ययोर्भृशम्।।1.45.43।।
translation: दैतेयादित्ययो: of the daityas and adityas, तस्मिन् in that, घोरे महायुद्धे great battle, वीरा: heroic, अदिते: Aditi's, आत्मजा: sons, दिते: Diti's, पुत्रान् sons, निजघ्निरे killed.
explanation: In that great and terrible battle between daityas and devatas, Aditi's sons killed Diti's.

shloka_text: निहत्य दितिपुत्रांश्च राज्यं प्राप्य पुरन्दर:। शशास मुदितो लोकान् सर्षिसङ्घान् सचारणान्।।1.45.44।।
translation: पुरन्दर: Indra, दितिपुत्रान् the sons of Diti, निहत्य having killed, राज्यम् kingdom, प्राप्य having gained, मुदित: pleased, सर्षिसङ्घान् in the company of rishis, सचारणान् celestial singers, लोकान् worlds, शशास ruled.
explanation: Indra, having killed the sons of Diti was happy with the kingdom gained. He ruled the worlds in the company of rishis and celestial singers". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे पञ्चचत्वारिंशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the fortyfifth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: हतेषु तेषु पुत्रेषु दिति: परमदु:खिता। मारीचं काश्यपं राम भर्तारमिदमब्रवीत्।।1.46.1।।
translation: राम O Rama, तेषु पुत्रेषु when those sons, हतेषु were killed, दिति: Diti, परमदु:खिता afflicted with great grief, भर्तारम् husband, मारीचम् Maricha, काश्यपम् Kasyapas's son, इदम् अब्रवीत् spoke these words.
explanation: "O Rama! afflicted with great grief when her sons were killed, Diti said to her husband Kasyapa, son of Maricha:
comments: Diti undergoes mortifications for the birth of a son with the consent of Kasyapa-- Indra serves her on an occasion when she was impure enters her womb and severes the embryo into seven parts.

shloka_text: हतपुत्राऽस्मि भगवंस्तव पुत्रैर्महाबलै:। शक्रहन्तारमिच्छामि पुत्रं दीर्घतपोऽर्जितम्।।1.46.2।।
translation: भगवन् O Adorable one, महाबलै: by the highly powerful, पुत्रै: by your sons, devatas, हतपुत्रा  अस्मि my sons have been killed, शक्रहन्तारम् capable of slaying Indra, दीर्घतपोऽर्जितम् acquire through long austerities, पुत्रम् mighty son, इच्छामि I desire.
explanation: "O adorable one, your highly powerful sons, (devatas) have killed mine through extensive austerities. I am desirous of obtaining a (mighty) son capable of killing Indra.

shloka_text: साऽहं तपश्चरिष्यामि गर्भं मे दातुमर्हसि। ईश्वरं शक्रहन्तारं त्वमनुज्ञातुमर्हसि।।1.46.3।।
translation: सा अहम् I, तप: austerities, चरिष्यामि I shall practise, त्वम् you, ईश्वरम् a supreme ruler of the world, शुक्रहंतारम् capable of slaying Indra, गर्भम् embryo (son), मे to me, दातुम् to give, अर्हसि behoves of you, अनुज्ञातुम् to give consent, अर्हसि behoves.
explanation: I shall practise austerities. You ought to grant me a son who would be the supreme ruler of the world and capable of killing Indra. You can say yes (if you will)".

shloka_text: तस्यास्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा मारीच: काश्यपस्तदा। प्रत्युवाच महातेजा दितिं परमदु:खिताम्।।1.46.4।।
translation: तदा then, मारीच: Maricha's son, महातेजा: exceedingly lustrous, काश्यप: Kashyapa, तस्या: her, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, परमदुखि:ताम् deeply grieved, दितिम् addressing Diti, प्रत्युवाच replied.
explanation: Then, Maricha's son, exceedingly bright Kasyapa on hearing the words of Diti who was deeply grieved replied:

shloka_text: एवं भवतु, भद्रं ते शुचिर्भव तपोधने। जनयिष्यसि पुत्रं त्वं शक्रहन्तारमाहवे।।1.46.5।।
translation: तपोधने O One having austerities as wealth, एवं भवतु 'Be it so', ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, शुचि: भव become pure, त्वम् you, आहवे in the battle, शक्रहन्तारम् slayer of Indra, पुत्रम् son, जनयिष्यसि will give birth.
explanation: "O one vested with the wealth of austerities be it so. Prosperity to you Remain chaste, you will deliver a son who will kill Indra in the battle.

shloka_text: पूर्णे वर्षसहस्रे तु शुचिर्यदि भविष्यसि। पुत्रं त्रैलोक्यभर्तारं मत्तस्त्वं जनयिष्यसि।।1.46.6।।
translation: त्वम् you, शुचि: भविष्यसि यदि if you remain pure and clean, वर्षसहस्रे thousand years, पूर्णे after completion, मत्त: through me, त्रैलोक्यभर्तारम् lord of three worlds, पुत्रम् son, जनयिष्यसि will give birth.
explanation: "If you remain pure and clean, on completion of a thousand years you will give birth to a son through me who will be the lord of the three worlds".

shloka_text: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजा: पाणिना स ममार्ज ताम्। समालभ्य ततस्स्वस्तीत्युक्त्वा स तपसे ययौ।।1.46.7।।
translation: महातेजा: highly energetic, स: Kasyapa, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having spoken, ताम् her, पाणिना with his palm, ममार्ज touched her body gently stroking, समालभ्य having touched her, तत: then, स्वस्ति इति "May good be with thee", उक्त्वा having spoken, स: Kashyapa, तपसे to perform austerities, ययौ had gone.
explanation: Highly brilliant Kasyapa, having thus spoken, touched her gently with his palm, stroked her body and said, "May good betide thee". Having said this, Kasyapa went away to perform austerities.

shloka_text: गते तस्मिन्नरश्श्रेष्ठ दिति: परमहर्षिता। कुशप्लवनमासाद्य तपस्तेपे सुदारुणम्।।1.46.8।।
translation: नरश्श्रेष्ठ O Foremost of men, तस्मिन् when that Kasyapa, गते (सति) had gone, दिति: Diti, परमहर्षिता was exceedingly delighted, कुशप्लवनम् sacred spot named Kushaplavana, आसाद्य having reached, सुदारुणम् intense, तप: mortifications, तेपे practised.
explanation: "O foremost among men after Kasyapa had left, Diti exceedingly delighted (at the prospect of having sons) reached Kushaplavana, and practised intense mortifications.

shloka_text: तपस्तस्यां हि कुर्वन्त्यां परिचर्यां चकार  ह। सहस्राक्षो नरश्श्रेष्ठ परया गुणसम्पदा।।1.46.9।।
translation: नरश्श्रेष्ठ O Foremost of men, Rama, तस्याम् when she, तप: austerities, कुर्वन्त्याम् while doing, सहस्राक्ष: thousandeyed Indra, परया with great, गुणसम्पदा treasure of virtues, परिचर्याम् service, चकार had made.
explanation: O foremost of men great treasure of virtues while she was practising austerities, the thousandeyed Indra  began to serve her.

shloka_text: अग्निं कुशान् काष्ठमप: फलं मूलं तथैव च। न्यवेदयत्सहस्राक्षो यच्चान्यदपि काङ्क्षितम्।।1.46.10।।
translation: सहस्राक्ष: Devendra, अग्निम् fire, कुशान् Kusha grass, काष्ठम् sticks for burning, अप: water, फलम् fruits, तथैव च and, मूलम् roots, काङ्क्षितम् desired, अन्यत् all other things, यच्च whichever, न्यवेदयत् provided her.
explanation: The thousandeyed Indra served her by providing fire, Kusha grass, sticks for burning, water, fruits, roots and all other things desired by her.

shloka_text: गात्रसंवहनश्चैव श्रमापनयनैस्तथा। शक्रस्सर्वेषु कालेषु दितिं परिचचार ह ।।1.46.11।।
translation: शक्र: Devendra, गात्रसंवहनै: च एव stroking her limbs gently to regain their suppleness, तथा and, श्रमापनयनै: alleviating her fatigue, सर्वेषु कालेषु at all times, दितिम् Diti, परिचचार ह attended on her.
explanation: Indra attended on Diti, stroking her limbs gently from time to time to help her regain their  suppleness and alleviate her fatigue.

shloka_text: अथ वर्षसहस्रे तु दशोने रघुनन्दन । दिति: परमसम्प्रीता सहस्राक्षमथाब्रवीत्।।1.46.12।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Joy of Raghus, Rama, अथ thereafter, वर्षसहस्रे when thousand years, दशोने short of ten, दिति: Diti, परमसम्प्रीता highly pleased, सहस्राक्षम् addressing Indra, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: O son of the Raghus ten years before completion of a thousand years. Diti, highly pleased with the services rendered by Indra, addressed him", saying:

shloka_text: याचितेन सुरश्रेष्ठ तव पित्रा महात्मना। वरो वर्षसहस्रान्ते दत्तो मम सुतं प्रति।।1.46.13।।
translation: सुरश्रेष्ठ O Excellent among devatas, Indra, याचितेन having been sought, महात्मना by the illustrious, तव your, पित्रा father, वर्षसहस्रान्ते after completion of thousand years, सुतं प्रति about a son, मम to me, वर: boon, दत्त: granted.
explanation: "O best of the gods your illustrious father granted me a boon for a son I sought on completion of a thousand years (of penance).

shloka_text: तपश्चरन्त्या वर्षाणि दश वीर्यवतां वर। अवशिष्टानि भद्रं ते भ्रातरं द्रक्ष्यसे तत:।।1.46.14।।
translation: वीर्यवताम् among those having prowess, वर excellent, तप: austerities, चरन्त्या: performing, दश ten, वर्षाणि years, अवशिष्टानि remaining, तत: afterwards, भ्रातरम् brother, द्रक्ष्यसे you will see, ते भद्रम् may prosperity to you.
explanation: O the best of the brave ten years is yet to go (for completion of austerities). You will  have a brother. May you prosper

shloka_text: तमहं त्वत्कृते पुत्र समाधास्ये जयोत्सुकम्। त्रैलोक्यविजयं पुत्र सह भोक्ष्यसि विज्वर:।।1.46.15।।
translation: पुत्र O Son, तम् him, त्वत्कृते for you, जयोत्सुकम् having fortitude for victory, (अहं) समाधास्ये I shall unite him, पुत्र O Son, विज्वर: relieved of grief, त्रैलोक्यविजयम् victory over three worlds, सह भोक्ष्यसि you will enjoy together with him.
explanation: O Child I'll create in him eagerness victory. Together with him you will gain victory over the three worlds. Relieved of sorrows, enjoy you'll with him".

shloka_text: एवमुक्त्वा दितिश्शक्रं प्राप्ते मध्यं दिवाकरे। निद्रयाऽपहृता देवी पादौ कृत्वाऽथ शीर्षत:।।1.46.16।।
translation: दिति: देवी Diti devi,  शक्रम् to Indra, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having spoken, दिवाकरे when  Sun, मध्यम् midday, प्राप्ते having reached, अथ thereafter, पादौ feet, शीर्षत: head side, कृत्वा having placed, निद्रया by sleep, अपहृता has been overcome.
explanation: After speaking thus to Indra, goddess Diti overpowered with sleep around midsday dropped off, her feet towards her head.

shloka_text: दृष्ट्वा तामशुचिं शक्र: पादत: कृतमूर्धजाम्। शिरस्स्थाने कृतौ पादौ जहास च मुमोद च।।1.46.17।।
translation: शक्र: Indra, पादत: towards her feet, कृतमूर्धजाम् with the hairs falling, अशुचिम् impure posture, तां दृष्ट्वा having seen her, शिरस्स्थाने in the place where she should place her head, कृतै placed, पादौ feet (having  seen), जहास laughed, मुमोद च was pleased.
explanation: Indra laughed. He rejoiced at the sight of her ominous posture of sleeping with her feet towards her head and her hair falling on her feet.

shloka_text: तस्याश्शरीरविवरं विवेश च पुरन्दर:। गर्भं च सप्तधा राम बिभेद परमात्मवान्।।1.46.18।।
translation: राम O Rama, पुरन्दर: Indra, तस्या: her, शरीरविवरं womb, विवेश च entered, परम् great, आत्मवान् courageous one, गर्भम् embryo, सप्तधा seven pieces, बिभेद severed it.
explanation: O Rama with great courage Indra entered her womb and severed her embryo into  seven pieces.

shloka_text: भिद्यमानस्ततो गर्भो वज्रेण शतपर्वणा। रुरोद सुस्वरं राम ततो दितिरबुध्यत।।1.46.19।।
translation: राम O Rama, तत: then, शतपर्वणा by the hundred edged, वज्रेण by Vajra, भिद्यमान: being severed, गर्भ: embryo, सुस्वरम् at high pitch, रुरोद cried, तत: then, दिति: Diti, अबुध्यत woke up.
explanation: O Rama that embryo, being severed by Vajra having a hundred edges, cried at high pitch which awakened Diti".

shloka_text: मा रुदो मा रुदश्चेति गर्भं शक्रोऽभ्यभाषत। बिभेद च महातेजा रुदन्तमपि वासव:।।1.46.20।।
translation: मा रुद: "Do not weep", मा रुद: "Do not weep", इति शक्र: Indra, गर्भम् addressing embryo, अभ्यभाषत spoke, महातेजा: highly powerful, वासव: Indra, रुदन्तमपि even though crying, बिभेद severed it.
explanation: Highly powerful Indra, even while saying to the crying embryo  "Do not weep, Do not weep" severed it.

shloka_text: न हन्तव्यो न हन्तव्य इत्येवं दितिरब्रवीत्। निष्पपात ततश्शक्रो मातुर्वचनगौरवात्।।1.46.21।।
translation: दिति Diti, न हन्तव्य: "Sould not be killed", न हन्तव्य:" should not be killed ", इत्येवम् in this way, अब्रवीत् said, तत: subsequently, शक्र: Indra, मातु: वचनगौरवात् in deference to the words of his mother, निष्पपात came out.
explanation: "Do not kill", "Do not kill", said Diti. Subsequently Indra, in deference to the words of his mother, emerged out of the womb.

shloka_text: प्राञ्जलिर्वज्रसहितो दितिं शक्रोऽभ्यभाषत। अशुचिर्देवि सुप्ताऽसि पादयो: कृतमूर्धजा।।1.46.22।।
translation: वज्रसहित: armed with Vajra, शक्र: Indra, प्राञ्जलि: with folded palms, दितिम् Diti, अभ्यभाषत spoke, देवि O Devi, पादयो: feet, कृतमूर्धजा hairs falling( on her feet ), अशुचि: becoming impure, सुप्ता असि slept.
explanation: Armed with Vajra, Indra addressed Diti with folded palms, saying, "O Devi you have slept,  with your head towards your feet and your hair falling on your feet".

shloka_text: तदन्तरमहं लब्ध्वा शक्रहन्तारमाहवे। अभिदं सप्तधा देवि तन्मे त्वं क्षन्तुमर्हसि।।1.46.23।।
translation: अहम् I, तत् that, अन्तरम् opportunity, लब्ध्वा having seized, आहवे in war, शक्रहन्तारम् that one who was to be slayer of Indra, सप्तधा into seven parts, अभिदम् severed, देवि O Devi, त्वम् you, क्षंतुम् to forgive, अर्हसि it is proper.
explanation: "I have seized the opportunity and severed into seven pieces the foetus who would have been a slayer of Indra. O Devi shoudn't you forgive me"? इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे षट्चत्वारिंशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the fortysixth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: सप्तधातु कृते गर्भे दिति: परमदु:खिता। सहस्राक्षं दुराधर्षं वाक्यं सानुनयाऽब्रवीत्।।1.47.1।।
translation: गर्भे when the embryo, सप्तधा into seven pieces,  कृते having been cut, दिति: Diti, परमदु:खिता highly distressed, दुराधर्षम् unassailable, सहस्राक्षम् Indra, सानुनया affectionate, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: Deeply distressed Diti, having come to know that the embryo had been severed into seven pieces, humbly spoke to the unassailable Indra.
comments: Origin of marutsVishala constructs the city Diti practises her austerities--Sumati  honours Viswamitra.

shloka_text: ममापराधाद्गर्भोऽयं सप्तधा विफलीकृत:। नापराधोऽस्ति देवेश तवात्र बलसूदन।।1.47.2।।
translation: बलसूदन O Slayer of Balasura, देवेश Devendra, मम my, अपराधात् by the fault, अयम् this,  गर्भ: embryo, सप्तधा into seven pieces, विफलीकृत: rendered useless, अत्र in this matter, तव your, अपराध: fault, नास्ति was not there.
explanation: "O Indra, Slayer of Balasura, because of my fault this embryo has been made into seven pieces and rendered useless. In this matter you have not committed any fault.

shloka_text: प्रियं तु कर्तुमिच्छामि मम गर्भविपर्यये। मरुतां सप्तसप्तानां स्थानपाला भवन्त्विमे।।1.47.3।।
translation: गर्भविपर्यये this misfortune to embryo, मम for me, प्रियम् favour, कर्तुम् to do, इच्छामि I am desiring, इमे this, सप्त seven pieces, सप्तानां seven, मरुताम् maruts, स्थानपाला guardians of regions, भवन्तु become.
explanation: This disaster to the embryo has happened contrary to expectations. Hence, I seek a favour from you. Let these seven pieces become seven guardians of marut regions (regions of the wind).

shloka_text: वातस्कन्धा: इमे सप्त चरन्तु दिवि पुत्रक । मारुता इति विख्याता दिव्यरूपा ममात्मजा:।।1.47.4।।
