shloka_text: सोऽभिगम्य महात्मनस्सर्वानेव गुरोस्सुतान्।।1.57.15।। अभिवाद्यानुपूर्व्येण ह्रिया किञ्चिदवाङ्मुख:। अब्रवीत्सुमहाभगान्सर्वानेव कृताञ्जलि:।।1.57.16।।
translation: स: he (the king), महात्मन: illustrious, सर्वानेव all, गुरो: सुतान् sons of spiritual guide, अभिगम्य having approached, आनुपूर्व्येण in the order of the age, अभिवाद्य having paid obeisance, ह्रिया in humility, किञ्चित् a little, अवाङ्मुख: bowing down his face, कृताञ्जलि: with folded palms, सर्वानेव all those, (सु)महाभागान् distinguished ones, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: The king, having approached all the illustrious sons of his spiritual guide, paid obeisance to them in order of seniority. Bowing down his face in humility and with folded palms, he addressed all those distinguished sons of Vasishta saying:

shloka_text: शरणं व: प्रपद्येऽहं शरण्यान् शरणागत:। प्रत्याख्यातोऽस्मि भद्रं वो वसिष्ठेन महात्मना।।1.57.17।।
translation: शरणागत: seeking refuge, अहम् I, शरण्यान् protectors, व: you, शरणं प्रपद्ये seeking refuge, व: to you, भद्रम् prosperity, महात्मना by the magnanimous, वसिष्ठेन by Vasishta, प्रत्याख्यात: अस्मि I have been refused.
explanation: O protectors of those who seek refuge in you, protect me. Wish you well. I have been refused by the great Vasishta.

shloka_text: यष्टुकामो महायज्ञं तदनुज्ञातुमर्हथ। गुरुपुत्रानहं सर्वान्नमस्कृत्य प्रसादये।।1.57.18।।
translation: महायज्ञम् great sacrifice, यष्टुकाम: desire to perform, तत् for that reason, अनुज्ञातुम् to give consent, अर्हथ fit and proper, अहम् I, गुरुपुत्रान् sons of spiritual guide, सर्वान् all of you,  नमस्कृत्य having paid my homage, प्रसादये I will please you.
explanation: 'I wish to perform a great sacrifice. You are worthy enough to tender your consent. I pay homage to all the sons of my spiritual guide oblige.

shloka_text: शिरसा प्रणतो याचे ब्राह्मणान् तपसि स्थितान्। ते मां भवन्तस्सिद्ध्यर्थं याजयन्तु समाहिता:।।1.57.19।। सशरीरो यथाऽहं हि देवलोकमवाप्नुयाम्।
translation: शिरसा with my head,  प्रणत: saluting by bowing down, तपसि स्थितान् you established in austerity, ब्राह्मणान् you, Brahmins, याचे beg, ते such, भवन्त: all of you, समाहिता: with composed minds, माम् me, सिद्ध्यर्थम् for achieving the purpose, याजयन्तु direct me in performing the sacrifice, अहम् I, सशरीर: in physical form, यथा in such manner, देवलोकम् heaven, अवाप्नुयाम् will reach.
explanation: You, brahmins are established in austerity. I bow to you. I beg all of you to direct me with composed minds to direct me in order to attain heaven in physical form'.

shloka_text: प्रत्याख्यातो वसिष्ठेन गतिमन्यां तपोधना:।।1.57.20।। गुरुपुत्रानृते सर्वान्नाहं पश्यामि काञ्चन।
translation: तपोधना: O Men having asceticism for your wealth, वसिष्ठेन by Vasishta, प्रत्याख्यात: refused, अहम् I, सर्वान् all, गुरुपुत्रानृते other than sons of spiritual guide, अन्यान् others, गतिम् way, काञ्चन anything, न पश्यामि do not see.
explanation: O Ascetocs after having been rejected by Vasishta. I do not see any way other than the sons of my spiritual guide to help me achieve my purpose.

shloka_text: इक्ष्वाकूणां हि सर्वेषां पुरोधा: परमा गति:।।1.57.21।। पुरोधसस्तु विद्वांसस्तारयन्ति सदा नृपान्। तस्मादनन्तरं सर्वे भवन्तो दैवतं मम।।1.57.22।।
translation: सर्वेषाम् for all, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् descendants of Ikshvaku, पुरोधा: spiritual preceptor, परमा गति: हि is indeed supreme salvation, विद्वांस: learned, पुरोधस: spiritual preceptors, सदा always, नृपान् kings, तारयन्ति liberated, तस्मात् for that reason, अनन्तरम् after him, भवन्त: you, सर्वे all, मम to me, दैवतम् gods.
explanation: For all the descendants of Ikshvakus the spiritual preceptor is the supreme resort for  salvation. Learned spiritual preceptors have always liberated kings. Hence you are all gods to me only next to Vasishta". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे सप्तपञ्चाशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the fiftyseventh sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: ततस्त्रिशङ्कोर्वचनं श्रुत्वा क्रोधसमन्वितम् । ऋषिपुत्रशतं राम राजानमिदमब्रवीत्।।1.58.1।।
translation: राम O Sri Rama, त्रिशङ्को: Trishanku's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, तत: afterwards, ऋषिपुत्रशतम् hundred sons of Vasishta, क्रोधसमन्वितम् filled with wrath, राजानम् addressing king, इदम् this word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: "O Rama to these words of king Trisanku, the hundred sons of the sage angrily reacted:
comments: Cursed by Vasishta's sons Trisanku  takes refuge in Viswamitra

shloka_text: प्रत्याख्यातो हि दुर्बुद्धे गुरुणा सत्यवादिना। तं कथं समतिक्रम्य शाखान्तरमुपेयिवान्।।1.58.2।।
translation: दुर्बुद्धे O Evil minded one, सत्यवादिना by the truth speaking, गुरुणा by spiritual preceptor, प्रत्याख्यात: refused, तम् him, अतिक्रम्य having by passed, शाखान्तरम् other branch, कथम् how, उपेयिवान् you have reached.
explanation: 'O Evilminded one having been refused by the Guru true to his word, how could you bypass him and approach us who are mere off shoots (of the main).

shloka_text: इक्ष्वाकूणां हि सर्वेषां पुरोधा: परमो गुरु:। न चातिक्रमितुं शक्यं वचनं सत्यवादिन:।।1.58.3।।
translation: सर्वेषाम् for all, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् kings of Ikshwaku race, पुरोधा: their spiritual preceptor, परम: is highly, गुरु: venerable one, सत्यवादिन: truthspeaking one, वचनम् word, अतिक्रमितुम् to by pass, न शक्यम् not capable of being done.
explanation: For all the kings of the Ikshvakus race, their chief priest is their Guru. It is not possible to bypass the spiritual preceptor who is true to his word preceptor.

shloka_text: अशक्यमिति चोवाच वसिष्ठो भगवानृषि:। तं वयं वै समाहर्तुं क्रतुं शक्ता:कथं तव।।1.58.4।।
translation: भगवान् adorable, वसिष्ठ: ऋषि: sage Vasistha, अशक्यमिति incapable(of being accompished) to, उवाच said, तम् such, क्रतुम् sacrifice, तव to you, समाहर्तुम् to perform, वयम् we, कथम् how, शक्ता: are capable.
explanation: When an adorable sage like Vasishta has already said, it is not possible, how can we help you conduct such a sacrifice?

shloka_text: बालिशस्त्वं नरश्रेष्ठ गम्यतां स्वपुरं पुन:। याजने भगवाञ्छक्तस्त्रैलोक्यस्यापि पार्थिव।।1.58.5।। अवमानं च तत्कर्तुं तस्य शक्ष्यामहे कथम्।
translation: नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, त्वम् you, बालिश: childish, पुन: again, स्वपुरम् your capital, गम्यताम् return, पार्थिव O Monarch, भगवान् venerable, त्रैलोक्यस्य of the three worlds, याजनेऽपि to perform sacrifices, शक्त: is capble, तत् for that reason, तस्य his, अवमानम् dishonour, कर्तुम् to do, कथम् how, शक्ष्यामहे can we be capable of.
explanation: O Best one among men you are childish. Return to your capital. O Monarch the most venerable Vasishta is capable of conducting sacrifices performed by anybody in the three worlds. How can we dishonour him'?

shloka_text: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा क्रोधपर्याकुलाक्षरम्।।1.58.6।। स राजा पुनरेवैतानिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।
translation: स: राजा that king, क्रोधपर्याकुलाक्षरम् confused speech due to anger, तत् that, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा having listened, पुनरेव again, इदम् this, वचनम् word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: Having heard the confused words uttered by the sages in a state of anger, the king said again:

shloka_text: प्रत्याख्यातोऽस्मि गुरुणा गुरुपुत्रैस्तथैव च।।1.58.7।। अन्यां गतिं गमिष्यामि स्वस्ति वोऽस्तु तपोधना:।
translation: तपोधना: O Men having asceticism as wealth, गुरुणा by spiritual preceptor, तथैव च as also, गुरुपुत्रैश्च by the sons of spiritual preceptor, प्रत्याख्यात: अस्मि I am disregarded, अन्याम् another, गतिम् way, गमिष्यामि shall seek, व: to you, स्वस्ति अस्तु farewell to you.
explanation: "O Men endowed with the wealth of asceticism I was rejected by my guru and now by his sons. I shall seek another way. Farewell to you".

shloka_text: ऋषिपुत्रास्तु तच्छ्रुत्वा वाक्यं घोराभिसंहितम्।।1.58.8।। शेपु: परमसङ्कृद्धाश्चण्डालत्वं गमिष्यसि।
translation: ऋषिपुत्रास्तु saint's sons, घोराभिसंहितम् with fierce intent, तत् that, वाक्यम् word, श्रुत्वा having listened, परमसङ्कृद्धा: highly furious, चण्डालत्वम् chandalahood, गमिष्यसि will obtain, शेपु: cursed.
explanation: Having seen his fierce intent, the saint's sons were infuriated. They cursed him saying, "Be a Chandala"

shloka_text: एवमुक्त्वा महात्मनो विविशुस्ते स्वमाश्रमम्।।1.58.9।। अथ रात्र्यां व्यतीतायां राजा चण्डालतां गत:।
translation: महात्मान: magnanimous, ते they, एवम् thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, स्वम् their own, आश्रमम् hermitage, विविशु: entered, अथ thereafter, रात्र्याम् night, व्यतीतायाम् having passed, राजा king, चण्डालताम् Chandalahood, गत: obtained.
explanation: With this the highsouled sons of Vasishta entered their hermitage. And one night after the king became a Chandala (a lowcaste man).

shloka_text: नीलवस्त्रधरो नील: पुरुषो ध्वस्तमूर्धज:।।1.58.10।। चित्यमाल्यानुलेपश्च आयसाभरणोऽभवत्।
translation: नीलवस्त्रधरो wearing black garment, नील: dark complexioned, परुष: dirty, ध्वस्तमूर्धज: dishevelled hair, चित्यमाल्यानुलेपश्च besmeared with ashes and wearing wreaths from the cemetery, आयसाभरण: wearing ornaments made of iron, अभवत् became.
explanation: The king was tranformed into a darkcomplexioned dirty man with dishevelled hair. His body was besmeared with ashes and on his robes lay wreath collected from the cemetery. He had on him dark (soiled) clothes, and ornaments made of iron.

shloka_text: तं दृष्टवा मन्त्रिणस्सर्वे त्यज्य चण्डालरूपिणम्।।1.58.11।। प्राद्रवन् सहिता राम पौरा येऽस्यानुगामिन:।
translation: राम O Rama, चण्डालरूपिणम् in the form of Chadala, तम् him, दृष्टवा having seen, सर्वे all, मन्त्रिण: counsellors, पौरा: inhabitants of city, ये who, अस्य his, अनुगामिन: सहिता: including followers, प्राद्रवन् fled away.
explanation: "O Rama seeing him in the form of a chandala, all his counsellors, inhabitants of the city including his followers fled away.

shloka_text: एको हि राजा काकुत्स्थ जगाम परमात्मवान्।।1.58.12।। दह्यमानो दिवारात्रं विश्वामित्रं तपोनिधिम्।
translation: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, परम् great, आत्मवान् courageous, राजा king, एक: moving alone, दिवारात्रम्  day and night, दह्यमान: burning, तपोनिधिम् rich in asceticism, विश्वामित्रम् towards Visvamitra, जगाम went.
explanation: O Descendant of Kakustha wandering alone burning with distress night and day the king went to Viswamitra who was rich in asceticism.

shloka_text: विश्वामित्रस्तु तं दृष्ट्वा राजानं विफलीकृतम्। चण्डालरूपिणं राम मुनि: कारुण्यमागत:।।1.58.13।।
translation: राम O Rama, मुनि: sage, विश्वामित्रस्तु Visvamitra, विफलीकृतम् made worthless, चण्डालरूपिणम् found in the form of Chandala, तम् that, राजानम् king, दृष्ट्वा having seen, कारुण्यम् pity, आगत: obtained.
explanation: O Rama on seeing the king reduced to a useless a chandala, sage Viswamitra was touched with pity".

shloka_text: कारुण्यात्स महातेजा वाक्यं परमधार्मिक:। इदं जगाद भद्रं ते राजानं घोररूपिणम्।।1.58.14।।
translation: महातेजा: exceedingly energetic, परमधार्मिक: highly pious, स: he, कारुण्यात् out of compassion, घोररूपिणम् frightful to look, राजानम् king, ते भद्रम् welfare to you, इदम् this word, जगाद spoke.
explanation: Exceedingly energetic and deeply pious, he looked at the king who was frightful in appearance and addressed him with compassion saying, "welfare to you".

shloka_text: किमागमनकार्यं ते राजपुत्र महाबल। अयोध्याधिपते वीर शापाच्चण्डालतां गत:।।1.58.15।।
translation: महाबल mighty, राजपुत्र O Prince, ते your, आगमनकार्यम् purpose of coming, किम् what,  अयोध्याधिपते O Lord of Ayodhya, वीर hero, शापात् from the curse, चण्डालताम् chandalahood, गत: you have obtained.
explanation: "O Mighty prince what brings your here, for you are the heroic lord of Ayodhya? Whose curse turned you into a chandala"?

shloka_text: अथ तद्वाक्यमाज्ञाय राजा चण्डालतां गत:। अब्रवीत्प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं वाक्यज्ञो वाक्यकोविदम्।।1.58.16।।
translation: अथ thereafter, चंण्डालताम् chandala hood, गत: obtained, वाक्यज्ञ: knower of words, राजा king, तद्वाक्यम् that word, आज्ञाय having come to know, प्राञ्जलि: with folded hands in supplication, वाक्यकोविदम् proficient in speech, वाक्यम् word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: In response to his words the king,  who had fallen into the state of a chandala yet proficient in expression, spoke to one (Viswamitra) expert in speech, with folded hands.

shloka_text: प्रत्याख्यातोऽस्मि गुरुणा गुरुपुत्रैस्तथैव च। अनवाप्यैव तं कामं मया प्राप्तो विपर्यय:।।1.58.17।।
translation: गुरुणा by the spiritual preceptor, तथैव च and also, गुरुपुत्रै: by his sons, प्रत्याख्यात: अस्मि  I was rejected, तम् that, कामम् desire, अनवाप्यैव without attaining, मया by me, विपर्यय: contrary reward, प्राप्त: obtained.
explanation: "Rejected by my guru and his sons, what I achieved was disaster and what I could not was the fulfilment of my wish.

shloka_text: सशरीरो दिवं यायामिति मे सौम्यदर्शनम्। मया चेष्टं क्रतुशतं तच्च नाऽवाप्यते फलम्।।1.58.18।।
translation: सौम्य O Gentle sage, सशरीर: with my physical body, दिवम् heaven, यायाम् I may enter, इति thus, मे my, दर्शनम् intention, मया by me, क्रतुशतम् a hundred sacrifices, इष्टम् performed,   तत् that, फलम् fruit of it, नावाप्यते च was not obtained.
explanation: O Gentle sage it is my intention to enter heaven with my physical body. I performed a hundred sacrifices but  did not reap its fruit.

shloka_text: अनृतं नोक्तपूर्वं मे न च वक्ष्ये कदाचन। कृच्छ्रेष्वपि गत स्सौम्य क्षत्रधर्मेण ते शपे।।1.58.19।।
translation: सौम्य O Gentle sage, मे by me, अनृतम् untruth, न उक्तपूर्वम् was not uttered earlier, कदाचन never, कृच्छ्रेषु गत: अपि inspite of troubled circumstances, न वक्ष्ये I shall not speak, क्षत्रधर्मेण by kshatriya morality, ते to you, शपे I swear.
explanation: O Gentle sage I have never told a lie in spite of troubled circumstances, I shall never dabble in falsehood. I swear upon it by kshatriya morality .

shloka_text: यज्ञैर्बहुविधैरिष्टं प्रजा धर्मेण पालिता:।।1.58.20।। गुरवश्च महात्मान श्शीलवृत्तेन तोषिता:।
translation: बहुविधै: by various kinds of, यज्ञै: with sacrifices, इष्टम् favourite gods were worshipped, प्रजा: my people, धर्मेण with law of righteousness, पालिता: are ruled, महात्मान: eminent, गुरवश्च elders, शीलवृत्तेन by my character and conduct, तोषिता: were pleased.
explanation: I have performed various sacirifices and ruled over my people guided by the law of righteousness. I have pleased eminent elders with my conduct and character.

shloka_text: धर्मे प्रयतमानस्य यज्ञं चाहर्तुमिच्छत:।।1.58.21।। परितोषं न गच्छन्ति गुरवो मुनिपुङ्गव ।
translation: मुनिपुङ्गव O Preeminent among sages, धर्मे in my duty, प्रयतमानस्य endeavouring, यज्ञम् sacrifice, आहर्तुम् to perform, इच्छतश्च intending, गुरव: spiritual preceptors, परितोषम् pleasure, न गच्छन्ति do not get.
explanation: O Preeminent among sages I endeavour to do my duty. I intend to perform a sacrifice. My gurus do not appreciate this.

shloka_text: दैवमेव परं मन्ये पौरुषं तु निरर्थकम्।।1.58.22।। दैवेनाक्रम्यते सर्वं दैवं हि परमा गति:।
translation: दैवमेव destiny alone, परम् is allpowerful, मन्ये I am thinking, पौरुषम् तु the effort of a man, निरर्थकम् is invain, सर्वम् everything, दैवेन by destiny, आक्रम्यते is occupied, दैवम् destiny, परमा supreme, गति: हि way indeed.
explanation: I consider destiny to be allpowerful. The effort of a man goes in vain. Everything is controlled by destiny. It is the supreme resort.

shloka_text: तस्य मे परमार्तस्य प्रसादमभिकाङ्क्षत:।।1.58.23।। कर्तुमर्हसि भद्रं ते दैवोपहतकर्मण:।
translation: परमार्तस्य highly afflicted, ते your, प्रसादम् favour, अभिकाङ्क्षत: desiring, दैवोपहतकर्मण: with my actions hit by destiny, तस्य such, मे to me, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि fit and proper, भद्रम् prosperity to you.
explanation: My merits have been destroyed by destiny. Deeply afflicted, I crave a favour from you. You are fit to grant it. Wish you well

shloka_text: नान्यां गतिं गमिष्यामि नान्यश्शरणमस्ति मे।।1.58.24।। दैवं पुरुषकारेण निवर्तयितुमर्हसि।।
translation: अन्याम् other, गतिम् refuge, न गमिष्यामि I will not obtain, मे to me, अन्य: other person, शरणम् protector, नास्ति does not exist, दैवम् destiny, पुरुषकारेण with human effort, निवर्तयितुम् to avert, अर्हसि you are capable.
explanation: I will not take refuge in anybody. There is no other protector for me. You are capable of averting my reverses in fate with human effort". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे अष्टपञ्चाशस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the fiftyeighth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: उक्तवाक्यं तु राजानं कृपया कुशिकात्मज:। अब्रवीन्मधुरं वाक्यं साक्षाच्चण्डालरूपिणम्।।1.59.1।।
translation: उक्तवाक्यम् having the words spoken, साक्षात् evident to the senses, चण्डालरूपिणम् chandala form, राजानम् king, कृपया out of pity, कुशिकात्मज: Visvamitra, मधुरम् sweet, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoken.
explanation: What the king said was proved by his chandala form which the son of Kushika (Viswamitra) heard and out of compassion spoke these sweet words:
comments: Viswamitra  invites the sages to perform the sacrifice  curses the sons of Vasishta and Mahodaya.

shloka_text: ऐक्ष्वाक स्वागतं वत्स जानामि त्वां सुधार्मिकम् । शरणं ते भविष्यामि मा भैषीर्नृपपुङ्गव।।1.59.2।।
translation: ऐक्ष्वाक O Descendant of Ikshvakus, वत्स child, स्वागतम् welcome, त्वाम् you, सुधार्मिकम् as highly righteous one, जानामि I know you, नृपपुङ्गव O Eminent among kings, माभैषी: fear not, ते to you, शरणम् refuge, भविष्यामि I shall become.
explanation: "O Descendant of Ikshvakus, O child, welcome. I know you as highly righteous. O eminent among kings fear not. I offer you refuge.

shloka_text: अहमामन्त्रये सर्वान्महर्षीन्पुण्यकर्मण:। यज्ञसाह्यकरान् राजन् ततो यक्ष्यसि निर्वृत:।।1.59.3।।
translation: अहम् I, पुण्यकर्मण: men of pious deeds, यज्ञसाह्यकरान् to assist in the sacrifice, सर्वान् all, महर्षीन् maharshis, आमन्त्रये I shall invite, निर्वृत: with relief, यक्ष्यसि you will perform the sacrifice.
explanation: O king I shall invite pious maharshis to assist you in the sacrifice which you will be able to perform with great relief.

shloka_text: गुरुशापकृतं रूपं यदिदं त्वयि वर्तते । अनेन सह रूपेण सशरीरो गमिष्यसि।।1.59.4।।
translation: गुरुशापकृतम् as a result of the curse of spiritual preceptor, यत् which, रूपम् form, त्वयि in you, वर्तते existing, अनेन by  this, रूपेण सह with form, सशरीर: with the physical body, गमिष्यसि you shall go.
explanation: With the present physical body disfigured by the curse of your spiritual preceptor, you shall go to heaven.

shloka_text: हस्तप्राप्तमहं मन्ये स्वर्गं तव नराधिप। यस्त्वं कौशिकमागम्य शरण्यं शरणागत:।।1.59.5।।
translation: नराधिप O King, य: such that, त्वम् you, शरण्यम् fit to take refuge in, कौशिकम् Visvamitra, आगम्य having reached, शरणागतः have taken refuge, तव for you, स्वर्गम् heaven, हस्तप्राप्तम्  already in your hand, मन्ये I consider.
explanation: O King since you have taken refuge in Viswamitra who is the protector of those who resort to him, I think heaven is already within your reach".

shloka_text: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजा: पुत्रान् परमधार्मिकान्। व्यादिदेश महाप्राज्ञान् यज्ञसम्भारकारणात्।।1.59.6।।
translation: महातेजा: most brilliant, एवम् thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, परमधार्मिकान् highly virtuous, महाप्राज्ञान् great intellectuals, पुत्रान् sons, यज्ञसम्भारकारणात् to make preparations for sacrifice, व्यादिदेश ordered.
explanation: Most brilliant Viswamitra having thus spoken, ordered his deeply religious and highly learned sons to make preparations for the sacrifice.

shloka_text: सर्वान् शिष्यान् समाहूय वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह। सर्वानृषिगणान्वत्सा आनयध्वं ममाज्ञया। सशिष्यसुहृदश्चैव सर्त्विज स्सबहुश्रुतान्।।1.59.7।।
translation: सर्वान् all, शिष्यान् disciples, समाहूय having summoned, एतत् this, वाक्यम् word, उवाच च said, वत्सा: O Children, मम my, आज्ञया with the order, सशिष्यसुहृदश्चैव with their disciples and friends, सर्त्विज: with the officiating priests, सुबहुश्रुतान् welllearned persons, सर्वानृषिगणान् hosts of rishis, आनयध्वम् you may bring them.
explanation: He summoned all his disciples, and said, "Children bring here hosts of rishis along with their disciples and friends, officiating priests and persons wellversed in the Srutis. This is my order.

shloka_text: यदन्यो वचनं ब्रूयान्मद्वाक्यबलचोदित:। तत्सर्वमखिलेनोक्तं ममाख्येयमनादृतम्।।1.59.8।।
translation: अन्य: any other one, मद्वाक्यबलचोदित: incited by the strength of my words, यत् which , वचनम् word, ब्रूयातथ may speak, अखिलेन entirely, उक्तम् spoken, अनादृतम् with disrespect, तत् सर्वम् all that, मम to me, अख्येयम् should be reported.
explanation: If any one should speak with disrespect in response to my order, you may report the matter to me in full".

shloka_text: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा दिशो जग्मुस्तदाज्ञया। आजग्मुरथ देशेभ्य स्सर्वेभ्यो ब्रह्मवादिन:।।1.59.9।।
translation: तस्य his, तत् वचनम् that word, श्रुत्वा having listened, तदाज्ञया by his order, दिश: in different directions, जग्मु: went, अथ thereafter, सर्वेभ्य: from all, देशेभ्य: countries, ब्रह्मवादिन: expounders of veda, आजग्मु: arrived.
explanation: At his command the disciples set out in different directions. And as a result, expounders of the vedas began arriving from various countries.

shloka_text: ते च शिष्या: समागम्य मुनिं ज्वलिततेजसम्। ऊचुश्चवचनं सर्वे सर्वेषां ब्रह्मवादिनाम्।।1.59.10।।
translation: ते शिष्या: those disciples, सर्वे all, समागम्य having returned, ज्वलिततेजसम् shining with splendour, मुनिम् sage visvamitra, सर्वेषाम् of all, ब्रह्मवादिनाम् of the expounders of veda, वचनम् words, ऊचुश्च told.
explanation: All the disciples on their return, communicated to the sage shining in splendour what the expounders of the vedas had said.

shloka_text: श्रुत्वा ते वचनं सर्वे समायान्ति द्विजातय:। सर्वदेशेषु चागच्छन् वर्जयित्वा महोदयम्।।1.59.11।।
translation: ते your, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, सर्वे all, द्विजातय: brahmins, समायान्ति are coming, महोदयं वर्जयित्वा except mahodaya, सर्वदेशेषु from all countries, आगच्छन् have arrived.
explanation: Having heard your words, all brahmins except Mahodaya have arrived from all countries.

shloka_text: वासिष्ठं तच्छतं सर्वं क्रोधपर्याकुलाक्षरम्। यदाह वचनं सर्वं शृणु त्वं मुनिपुङ्गव।।1.59.12।।
translation: मुनिपुङ्गव O Preeminent among ascetics, सर्वम् all, तत् शतम् वासिष्ठम् that hundred sons of Vasishta, क्रोधपर्याकुलाक्षरम् speech confused with anger, यत् which, वचनम् word, आह have spoken, सर्वम् all that, त्वम् you, शृणु listen.
explanation: O Preeminent among ascetics Here is what the hundred sons of Vasishta spoke in anger.

shloka_text: क्षत्रियो याजको यस्य चण्डालस्य विशेषत:। कथं सदसि भोक्तारो हविस्तस्य सुरर्षय:।।1.59.13।।
translation: यस्य for whom, क्षत्रिय: kshatriya, याजक: priest of the sacrifice, विशेषत: particularly, चण्डालस्य of a chandala, तस्य for him, सदसि in the sacrifice, सुरर्षय: devatas and sages, हवि: offerings, कथम् how, भोक्तार: will partake.
explanation: When a kshatriya acts as a priest for the sacrifice, particularly for a chandala, how can gods and sages partake the offerings?

shloka_text: ब्राह्मणा वा महात्मानो भुक्त्वा चण्डालभोजनम्। कथं स्वर्गं गमिष्यन्ति विश्वामित्रेण पालिता:।।1.59.14।।
translation: विश्वामित्रेण by Visvamitra, पालिता: ruled, महात्मान: magnanimous, ब्राह्मणा: वा brahmins, चाण्डालभोजनम् food offered by a chandala, भुक्त्वा having partaken, स्वर्गम् heaven, कथम् how, गमिष्यन्ति will attain.
explanation: Joining Viswamitra, (in chanting the mantras during the yaga) how will the great brahmins attain heaven after partaking the food offered by of Chandala?

shloka_text: एतद्वचननैष्ठुर्यमूचु स्संरक्तलोचना:। वासिष्ठा मुनिशार्दूल सर्वे ते समहोदया:।।1.59.15।।
translation: मुनिशार्दूल O Best among ascetics, समहोदया: along with mahodaya, ते सर्वे all of those, वासिष्ठा: sons of Vasishta, संरक्तलोचना: with reddened eyes, एतत् this, वचननैष्ठुर्यम् harsh word, ऊचु: spoke.
explanation: O Best among ascetics all the sons of Vasishta along with Mahodaya with their eyes reddened in anger spoke these harsh words":

shloka_text: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा सर्वेषां मुनिपुङ्गव:। क्रोधसंरक्तनयन स्सरोषमिदमब्रवीत्।।1.59.16।।
translation: मुनिपुङ्गव: preeminent among ascetics, तेषां सर्वेषाम् all their, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, क्रोधसंरक्तनयन: with eyes reddened with anger, सरोषम् with fury, इदम् this word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: On hearing the words (of the hundred sons of Vasishta uttered in anger) Viswamitra, preeminent among ascetics, spoke furiously with eyes reddened in anger.

shloka_text: ये दूषयन्त्यदुष्टं मां तप उग्रं समास्थितम्। भस्मीभूता दुरात्मानो भविष्यन्ति न संशय:।।1.59.17।।
translation: उग्रम् rigorous, तप: penance, आस्थितम् adopted, अदुष्टम् free from blemish, माम् me, ये who, दूषयन्ति abused, दुरात्मान: wickedminded ones, भस्मीभूता: reduced to ashes, भविष्यन्ति will become, संशय: न no doubt.
explanation: "I am blameless. I have practised rigorous penance. These wicked ones who have abused (a sage like me) will be reduced to ashes.

shloka_text: अद्य ते कालपाशेन नीता वैवस्वतक्षयम्। सप्तजातिशतान्येव मृतपस्सन्तु सर्वश:।।1.59.18।।
translation: ते they, अद्य today itself, कालपाशेन by noose of death, वैवस्वतक्षयम् to the abode of Yama, नीता: having been brought, सप्तजातिशतान्येव seven hundred births, सर्वश: in all ways, मृतपा: feeding on corpses, सन्तु shall become.
explanation: Caught by the noose of death this day, they shall be brought  to the abode of Yama  and for seven hundred births, feed on corpses.

shloka_text: श्वमांसनियताहारा मुष्टिका नाम निर्घृणा:। विकृताश्च विरूपाश्च लोकाननुचरन्त्विमान्।।1.59.19।।
translation: निर्घृणा: merciless, मुष्टिका नाम born in the race of mushtikas, श्वमांसनियताहारा feeding on the flesh of dogs, विकृताश्च hideous, विरूपाश्च deformed, इमान् लोकान् in these worlds, अनुचरन्तु shall wander.
explanation: Reborn as the merciless race of mushtikas, feeding on the flesh of dogs, hideous and deformed, they shall wander in these worlds.

shloka_text: महोदयस्तु दुर्बुद्धिर्मामदूष्यं ह्यदूषयत्। दूषित स्सर्वलोकेषु निषादत्वं गमिष्यति।।1.59.20।।
translation: दुर्बुद्धि: wickedminded, महोदयस्तु as for Mahodaya, अदूष्यम् not fit to be blamed, माम् me, अदूषयत् हि blamed me, सर्वलोकेषु in all the worlds, दूषित: having been blamed, निषादत्वम् nishadahood, गमिष्यति will attain.
explanation: The wicked Mahodaya, who blamed a sage like me so faultless shall be reborn in the race of the nishadas vulnerable to abuse by all.

shloka_text: प्राणातिपातनिरतो निरनुक्रोशतां गत:। दीर्घकालं मम क्रोधाद्दुर्गतिं वर्तयिष्यति।।1.59.21।।
translation: मम my, क्रोधात् because of anger, प्राणातिपातनिरतो depriving others of their life regularly, निरनुक्रोशताम् devoid of mercy, गत: attaining, दीर्घकालम् for a long time, दुर्गतिम् wretched life, वर्तयिष्यति will pursue.
explanation: As a consequence of my anger that Mahodaya, devoid of mercy and  taking pleasure in depriving others of their life, will pursue a wretched life for a long time".

shloka_text: एतावदुक्त्वा वचनं विश्वामित्रो महातपा:। विरराम महातेजा ऋषिमध्ये महामुनि:।।1.59.22।।
translation: महातपा: possessing fierce asceticism, महातेजा: highly powerful, महामुनि: mighty ascetic, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, ऋषिमध्ये in the assembly of rishis, एतावत् to this extent, वचनम् words, उक्त्वा having spoken, विरराम became silent.
explanation: The most powerful sage Viswamitra of fierce asceticism fell silent after after uttering this curse in the assembly of rishis. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे एकोनषष्टितमस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the fiftyninth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: तपोबलहतान् कृत्वा वासिष्ठान् समहोदयान्। ऋषिमध्ये महातेजा विश्वामित्रोऽभ्यभाषत।।1.60.1।।
translation: महातेजा: most brilliant, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, समहोदयान् together with Mahodaya, वासिष्ठान् sons of Vasishta, तपोबलहतान् having destroyed by his power of asceticism, कृत्वा made, ऋषिमध्ये seated in the midst of saints, अभ्यभाषत said.
explanation: The most brilliant Viswamitra, having destroyed the sons of Vasishta including Mahodaya by his ascetic power, said this in the midst of saints:
comments: Trisanku ascends to heaven and gets  expelled by IndraViswamitra  creates another heaven for him

shloka_text: अयमिक्ष्वाकुदायादस्त्रिशंकुरिति विश्रुत:। धर्मिष्ठश्च वदान्यश्च मां चैव शरणं गत:।।1.60.2।। तेनानेन शरीरेण देवलोकजिगीषया।
translation: इक्ष्वाकुदायाद: born in the Ikshavaku race, त्रिशङ्कुरिति as Trishanku by name, विश्रुत: wellknown, धर्मिष्ठ: virtuous, वदान्यश्च munificient, अयम् this person, तेन such, अनेन  शरीरेण with this physical body, देवलोकजिगीषया with the intention of conquering deva loka, माम् me, शरणं गत: sought refuge.
explanation: "This religious and generous king born in the Ikshvaku race, wellknown as Trisanku sought my refuge to gain heaven with his physical body,

shloka_text: यथाऽयं स्वशरीरेण स्वर्गलोकं गमिष्यति।।1.60.3।। तथा प्रवर्त्यतां यज्ञे भवद्भिश्च मया सह।
translation: अयम् this (king), स्वशरीरेण with his physical body, स्वर्गलोकम् to heaven, यथा in whichever manner, गमिष्यति will go, तथा in that manner, भवद्भि: by you, मया सह along with me, यज्ञ: sacrifice, प्रवर्त्यताम् be performed.
explanation: Join me in the performance of this sacrifice in a manner by which he (Trisanku) attains  heaven with his physical body".

shloka_text: विश्वामित्रवच श्श्रुत्वा सर्व एव महर्षय:।।1.60.4।। ऊचुस्समेत्य सहिता धर्मज्ञा धर्मसंहितम्।
translation: धर्मज्ञा: knowers of spiritual law, सहिता: assembled there, सर्व एव all, महर्षय: rishis, विश्वामित्रवच: words of Visvamitra, श्रुत्वा having listened, समेत्य in harmony, धर्मसंहितम् endowed with righteousness, ऊचु: said.
explanation: Agreeing to these words of Viswamitra all the rishis, knowers of spiritual order and endowed with righteousness assembled there said:

shloka_text: अयं कुशिकदायादो मुनि: परमकोपन:।।1.60.5।। यदाह वचनं सम्यगेतत्कार्यं न संशय:। अग्निकल्पो हि भगवान् शापं दास्यति रोषित:।।1.60.6।।
translation: कुशिकदायाद: born in the line of Kusika, परमकोपन: is one extremely angry, अयम् this man,  मुनि: ascestic, यत् वचनम् whichever word, आह speaks, एतत् all that, सम्यक् properly, कार्यम् should be performed, न संशय: no doubt, अग्निकल्प: he is like fire, भगवान् venerable, रोषित: if angered, शापम् curse, दास्यति will give.
explanation: "Born in the line of Kusika, this sage is extremely cholerictempered. Whatever he says must be properly carried out. There should be no resitation on this score. The venerable sage is like fire. He will curse us if angered.

shloka_text: अयं कुशिकदायादो मुनि: परमकोपन:।।1.60.5।। यदाह वचनं सम्यगेतत्कार्यं न संशय:। अग्निकल्पो हि भगवान् शापं दास्यति रोषित:।।1.60.6।।
translation: कुशिकदायाद: born in the line of Kusika, परमकोपन: is one extremely angry, अयम् this man,  मुनि: ascestic, यत् वचनम् whichever word, आह speaks, एतत् all that, सम्यक् properly, कार्यम् should be performed, न संशय: no doubt, अग्निकल्प: he is like fire, भगवान् venerable, रोषित: if angered, शापम् curse, दास्यति will give.
explanation: "Born in the line of Kusika, this sage is extremely cholerictempered. Whatever he says must be properly carried out. There should be no resitation on this score. The venerable sage is like fire. He will curse us if angered.

shloka_text: तस्मात्प्रवर्त्यतां यज्ञ स्सशरीरो यथा दिवम्। गच्छेदिक्ष्वाकुदायादो विश्वामित्रस्य तेजसा।।1.60.7।। तथा प्रवर्त्यतां यज्ञ स्सर्वे समधितिष्ठत।
translation: तस्मात् for that reason, यज्ञ: sacrifice, प्रवर्त्यताम् be performed, इक्ष्वाकुदायाद: descendent of Ikshvaku, विश्वामित्रस्य Visvamitra's, तेजसा by spiritual power, सशरीर: with his physical frame, यथा in whatever manner, दिवम् heaven, गच्छेत् may attain, तथा in that manner, यज्ञ: sacrifice, प्रवर्त्यताम् may be performed, सर्वे all, समधितिष्ठत commence.
explanation: Hence let the sacrifice be performed in such a manner that the descendant of the Ikshvakus would attain heaven with his physical body through the spiritual power of Viswamitra. All of you commence the sacrifice".

shloka_text: एवमुक्त्वा महर्षयः चक्रुस्तास्ता:क्रियास्तदा।।1.60.8।। याजकश्च महातेजा विश्वामित्रोऽभवत्क्रतौ।
translation: महर्षय: mahasrhis, एवम् thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, तदा then, तास्ता: different, क्रिया: activities, चक्रु: performed, क्रतौ in that sacrifice, महातेजा: highly lustrous, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, याजक: अभवत् became the chief officiating priest.
explanation: The maharshis having resolved performed their respective activities relating to the sacrifice. The brilliant Viswamitra acted as the chief officiating priest.

shloka_text: ऋत्विजश्चानुपूर्व्येण मन्त्रवन्मन्त्रकोविदा:।।1.60.9।। चक्रु: कर्माणि सर्वाणि यथाकल्पं यथाविधि।
translation: मन्त्रकोविदा: proficient in sacred prayers, ऋत्विजश्च officiating priests, मन्त्रवत् in accordance with mantras, यथाकल्पम् according to prescribed kalpa, यथाविधि according to rules and tradition, सर्वाणि all, कर्माणि rites, आनुपूर्व्येण in accordance with their respective ranks, चक्रु: performed.
explanation: The officiating priests proficient in chanting mantras performed in order of their respective ranks all the rites in accordance with the Yojanakalpa adhering to codes and traditions.

shloka_text: तत: कालेन महता विश्वामित्रो महातपा:।।1.60.10।। चकारावाहनं तत्र भागार्थं सर्वदेवता:।
translation: तत: thereafter, महातपा: mighty ascetic, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, महताकालेन after a long time,  तत्र there, सर्वदेवता: all devatas, भागार्थम् to partake their share, आवाहनं चकार invoked.
explanation: Long after, the mighty ascetic Viswamitra  invoked all the gods to partake their share of offerings.

shloka_text: नाभ्यागमंस्तदाहूता भागार्थं सर्वदेवता:।।1.60.11।। तत: क्रोधसमाविष्टो विश्वामित्रो महामुनि:। स्रुवमुद्यम्य सक्रोधस्त्रिशङ्कुमिदमब्रवीत्।।1.60.12।।
translation: तदा then, आहूता: invited by him, सर्वदेवता: all devatas, भागार्थम् for their share of offerings, नाभ्यागमन् did not come, तत: thereafter, क्रोधसमाविष्ट: seized of anger, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, महामुनि: great ascetic, स्रुवम् sacrificial ladle, उद्यम्य having lifted, सक्रोध: with anger, त्रिशङ्कुम् addressing Trishanku, इदम् this word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: When, the gods invited by him did not come to receive their share of offerings, the great ascetic Viswamitra seized with anger lifted the sacrificial ladle and said to Trisanku:

shloka_text: नाभ्यागमंस्तदाहूता भागार्थं सर्वदेवता:।।1.60.11।। तत: क्रोधसमाविष्टो विश्वामित्रो महामुनि:। स्रुवमुद्यम्य सक्रोधस्त्रिशङ्कुमिदमब्रवीत्।।1.60.12।।
translation: तदा then, आहूता: invited by him, सर्वदेवता: all devatas, भागार्थम् for their share of offerings, नाभ्यागमन् did not come, तत: thereafter, क्रोधसमाविष्ट: seized of anger, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, महामुनि: great ascetic, स्रुवम् sacrificial ladle, उद्यम्य having lifted, सक्रोध: with anger, त्रिशङ्कुम् addressing Trishanku, इदम् this word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: When, the gods invited by him did not come to receive their share of offerings, the great ascetic Viswamitra seized with anger lifted the sacrificial ladle and said to Trisanku:

shloka_text: पश्य मे तपसो वीर्यं स्वार्जितस्य नरेश्वर । एष त्वां सशरीरेण नयामि स्वर्गमोजसा।।1.60.13।। दुष्प्रापं सशरीरेण दिवं गच्छ नराधिप।
translation: नरेश्वर O King, स्वार्जितस्य selfearned, मे my, तपस: asceticism's, वीर्यम् prowess, पश्य behold, एष: ओजसा (तेजसा) with my might, त्वाम् you, सशरीरेण with your physical body, स्वर्गम् heaven, नयामि I shall send, नराधिप O king, दुष्प्रापम् difficult to achieve, दिवम् heaven, सशरीरेण with physical body, गच्छ go.
explanation: "O King behold the prowess of my selfearned asceticism. With my spiritual might, I shall send you to heaven with your physical body O King go to heaven with physical body which is not possible for anybody to accomplish.

shloka_text: स्वार्जितं किञ्चिदप्यस्ति मया हि तपस:फलम्।।1.60.14।। राजन् स्वतेजसा तस्य सशरीरो दिवं व्रज।
translation: राजन् O King, मया by me, स्वार्जितम् selfearned, तपस: फलम् fruit of austerities, किञ्चिदपि even little, अस्ति हि is remaining, तस्य its, स्वतेजसा by its power, सशरीर: with physical body, दिवम् heaven, व्रज you may go.
explanation: By the power of what little fruit of austerities I have earned, I shall send to heaven with your body".

shloka_text: उक्तवाक्ये मुनौ तस्मिन् सशरीरो नरेश्वर:।।1.60.15।। दिवं जगाम काकुत्स्थ मुनीनां पश्यतां तदा।
translation: काकुत्स्थ O Rama, तस्मिन् मुनौ when that ascetic, उक्तवाक्ये had spoken these words,  नरेश्वर: king, सशरीर: with his physical body, तदा then, मुनीनाम् saints, पश्यताम् while seeing, दिवम् towards heaven, जगाम went.
explanation: "O Descendant of Kakustha (Rama) when the sage had said these words, the king with his physical body ascended to heaven in the presence of the sages.

shloka_text: देवलोकगतं दृष्ट्वा त्रिशङ्कुं पाकशासन:।।1.60.16।। सह सर्वैस्सुरगणैरिदं वचनमब्रवीत्।
translation: देवलोकगतम् ascending to heaven, त्रिशङ्कुम् Trishanku, दृष्ट्वा having seen, सर्वै: all, सुरगणै:  (सह) with hosts of devatas, पाकशासन: devendra who destroyed the demon Paka,  इदम् वचनम् this word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: On ascending to heaven Trisanku saw Indra (destroyer of Paka) along with hosts of  gods. Indra said to him:

shloka_text: त्रिशङ्को गच्छ भूयस्त्वं नासि स्वर्गकृतालय:।।1.60.17।। गुरुशापहतो मूढ पत भूमिमवाक्छिरा:।
translation: त्रिशङ्को O Trishanku, स्वर्गकृतालय: inhabitant of heaven, न असि you are not fit, त्वम् you, भूय: again, गच्छ go back, गुरुशापहतः doomed by the curse of your spiritual preceptor, मूढ O Fool, अवाक्छिरा: with head downwards, भूमिम् to earth, पत fall down.
explanation: "O Trisanku you are not fit to inhabit heaven. Go back, you fool Doomed by the curse of your spiritual preceptor, fall on earth, head down.

shloka_text: एवमुक्तो महेन्द्रेण त्रिशङ्कुरपतत्पुन:।।1.60.18।। विक्रोशमानस्त्राहीति विश्वामित्रं तपोधनम्।
translation: महेन्द्रेण by Indra, एवम् thus, उक्त: spoken, त्रिशङ्कु: Trishanku, त्राहि protect me, इति so, तपोधनम् one having asceticism as wealth, विश्वामित्रम् Viswamitra, विक्रोशमान: wailing, पुन: again, अपतत् fell down.
explanation: Thus spoken to by Indra, Trisanku crying, "O Viswamitra, Protect me, Protect me" started falling down.

shloka_text: तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं तस्य क्रोशमानस्य कौशिक:।।1.60.19।। रोषमाहारयत्तीव्रं तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति चाब्रवीत्।
translation: कौशिक: Visvamitra, क्रोशमानस्य crying, तस्य his, तत् वचनम् that word, श्रुत्वा having listened, तीव्रम् severe, रोषम् anger, आहारयत् fetched, तिष्ठ इति "Stay, Stay", अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: Having heard the wailing Trisanku, the enraged Viswamitra shouted, "Stay, Stay".

shloka_text: ऋषिमध्ये स तेजस्स्वी प्रजापतिरिवापर:।।1.60.20।। सृजन् दक्षिणमार्गस्थान् सप्तर्षीनपरान् पुन:। नक्षत्रमालामपरामसृजत्क्रोधमूर्च्छित:।।1.60.21।। दक्षिणां दिशमास्थाय मुनिमध्ये महायशा:।
translation: ऋषिमध्ये in the midst of ascetics, स: तेजस्वी that mighty asctic, अपर: second, प्रजापति इव like Brahma, दक्षिणमार्गस्थान् stationed in the southern quarter, अपरान् other, सप्तर्षीन् the constellation of seven new rishis (stars),  सृजन् while creating, ऋषिमध्ये in the midst of ascetics, क्रोधमूर्च्छित: swooned by  anger, दक्षिणां southern, दिशम् direction, आस्थाय after  resorting to, महायशा: illustrious, अपराम् another, नक्षत्रमालाम् group of stars, असृजत् created.
explanation: Standing in the midst of the ascetics, that  mighty sage who conjured up a constellation of seven new rishis (stars) looked like another creator Brahma. Overcome by anger the illustrious sage created a new group of stars in the southern direction.

shloka_text: ऋषिमध्ये स तेजस्स्वी प्रजापतिरिवापर:।।1.60.20।। सृजन् दक्षिणमार्गस्थान् सप्तर्षीनपरान् पुन:। नक्षत्रमालामपरामसृजत्क्रोधमूर्च्छित:।।1.60.21।। दक्षिणां दिशमास्थाय मुनिमध्ये महायशा:।
translation: ऋषिमध्ये in the midst of ascetics, स: तेजस्वी that mighty asctic, अपर: second, प्रजापति इव like Brahma, दक्षिणमार्गस्थान् stationed in the southern quarter, अपरान् other, सप्तर्षीन् the constellation of seven new rishis (stars),  सृजन् while creating, ऋषिमध्ये in the midst of ascetics, क्रोधमूर्च्छित: swooned by  anger, दक्षिणां southern, दिशम् direction, आस्थाय after  resorting to, महायशा: illustrious, अपराम् another, नक्षत्रमालाम् group of stars, असृजत् created.
explanation: Standing in the midst of the ascetics, that  mighty sage who conjured up a constellation of seven new rishis (stars) looked like another creator Brahma. Overcome by anger the illustrious sage created a new group of stars in the southern direction.

shloka_text: सृष्ट्वा नक्षत्रवंशं च क्रोधेन कलुषीकृत:।।1.60.22।। अन्यमिन्द्रं करिष्यामि लोको वा स्यादनिन्द्रक:। दैवतान्यपि स क्रोधा त्स्रष्टुं समुपचक्रमे।।1.60.23।।
translation: नक्षत्रवंशं च system of stars, सृष्टवा having created, क्रोधेन out of wrath, कलुषीकृत: having his vision blurred, अन्यम् another, इन्द्रं Indra, करिष्यामि I will create, लोक: this world, अनिन्द्रक: वा स्यात् or will be without Indra (saying so), स: he दैवतान्यपि even devatas,  क्रोधात् with anger, स्रष्टुम् to create, समुपचक्रमे commenced.
explanation: Having created a constellation of stars, Viswamitra out of anger said, "I will create  another Indra or this world will be without Indra" and commenced to create even gods.

shloka_text: सृष्ट्वा नक्षत्रवंशं च क्रोधेन कलुषीकृत:।।1.60.22।। अन्यमिन्द्रं करिष्यामि लोको वा स्यादनिन्द्रक:। दैवतान्यपि स क्रोधा त्स्रष्टुं समुपचक्रमे।।1.60.23।।
translation: नक्षत्रवंशं च system of stars, सृष्टवा having created, क्रोधेन out of wrath, कलुषीकृत: having his vision blurred, अन्यम् another, इन्द्रं Indra, करिष्यामि I will create, लोक: this world, अनिन्द्रक: वा स्यात् or will be without Indra (saying so), स: he दैवतान्यपि even devatas,  क्रोधात् with anger, स्रष्टुम् to create, समुपचक्रमे commenced.
explanation: Having created a constellation of stars, Viswamitra out of anger said, "I will create  another Indra or this world will be without Indra" and commenced to create even gods.

shloka_text: तत: परमसम्भ्रान्तास्सर्षिसङ्घास्सुरासुरा:। विश्वामित्रं महात्मानमूचु: सानुनयं वच:।।1.60.24।।
translation: तत: thereafter, परमसम्भ्रान्ता: extremely wonderstruck, सर्षिसङ्घा: hosts of rishis, सुरासुरा: with suras and asuras, महात्मानम् magnanimous, विश्वामित्रम् Viswamitra, सानुनयम् in apropitiatory tone, वच: this word, ऊचु: said.
explanation: Struck with wonder and fear, hosts of rishis, suras and asuras humbly addressed Viswamitra.

shloka_text: अयं राजा महाभाग गुरुशापपरिक्षत: । सशरीरो दिवं यातुं नार्हत्येव तपोधन ।।1.60.25।।
translation: तपोधन O Maharshi, महाभाग O Glorious one, गुरुशापपरिक्षत: cursed by spiritual preceptor, अयम् राजा this king, सशरीर: with his physical body, दिवं to heaven, यातुम् to go, नार्हत्येव is not at all worthy of.
explanation: "O Glorious maharshi, this king cursed by his spiritual preceptor is not worthy of going to heaven with his physical body".

shloka_text: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा देवानां मुनिपुङ्गव: । अब्रवीत्सुमहद्वाक्यं कौशिक: सर्वदेवता:।।1.60.26।।
translation: मुनिपुङ्गव: preeminent among ascetics, कौशिक: Visvamitra, तेषाम् देवानाम् those devatas', तत् वचनम् that word, श्रुत्वा having heard, सर्वदेवता: all devatas, सुमहत् extremely great, वाक्यम् this word, अब्रवीत् said.
explanation: The son of Kushika (Viswamitra), the preeminent ascetic heard the gods and said these praiseworthy words:

shloka_text: सशरीरस्य भद्रं वस्त्रिशङ्कोरस्य भूपते:। आरोहणं प्रतिज्ञाय नानृतं कर्तुमुत्सहे।।1.60.27।।
translation: व: to you, भद्रम् prosperity, सशरीरस्य with physical form, अस्य त्रिशङ्को: भूपते: of this king Trishanku, आरोहणम् ascent to heaven, प्रतिज्ञाय having promised, अनृतम् false, कर्तुम् to make, न उत्सहे I do not wish.
explanation: "I wish you well Having promised king Trisanku ascent to heaven with his  physical form, I do not wish to go back on my word.

shloka_text: स्वर्गोऽस्तु सशरीरस्य त्रिशङ्कोरस्य शाश्वत:। नक्षत्राणि च सर्वाणि मामकानि ध्रुवाण्यथ।।1.60.28।। यावल्लोका धरिष्यन्ति तिष्ठन्त्वेतानि सर्वश:। मत्कृतानि सुरा स्सर्वे तदनुज्ञातुमर्हथ।।1.60.29।।
translation: अस्य त्रिशङ्को: for this Trishanku, सशरीरस्य with his physical form, शाश्वत: eternal, स्वर्ग: अस्तु let the heaven exist, अथ मत्कृतानि now created by me, एतानि सर्वाणि all these, नक्षत्राणि stars, मामकानि as mine, सर्वश: entirely, लोका: worlds, यावत् as long as, धरिष्यन्ति shall be holding (till such time), ध्रुवाणि shall be stable, तिष्ठन्तु shall remain, सुरा: O Devatas, तत् अनुज्ञातुम् to give consent, अर्हथ it behoves of you.
explanation: Let this heaven be an eternal abode for Trisanku in his physical form All these stars created by me shall endure as long as the worlds survive. O gods it behoves of you to accord consent to this".

shloka_text: स्वर्गोऽस्तु सशरीरस्य त्रिशङ्कोरस्य शाश्वत:। नक्षत्राणि च सर्वाणि मामकानि ध्रुवाण्यथ।।1.60.28।। यावल्लोका धरिष्यन्ति तिष्ठन्त्वेतानि सर्वश:। मत्कृतानि सुरा स्सर्वे तदनुज्ञातुमर्हथ।।1.60.29।।
translation: अस्य त्रिशङ्को: for this Trishanku, सशरीरस्य with his physical form, शाश्वत: eternal, स्वर्ग: अस्तु let the heaven exist, अथ मत्कृतानि now created by me, एतानि सर्वाणि all these, नक्षत्राणि stars, मामकानि as mine, सर्वश: entirely, लोका: worlds, यावत् as long as, धरिष्यन्ति shall be holding (till such time), ध्रुवाणि shall be stable, तिष्ठन्तु shall remain, सुरा: O Devatas, तत् अनुज्ञातुम् to give consent, अर्हथ it behoves of you.
explanation: Let this heaven be an eternal abode for Trisanku in his physical form All these stars created by me shall endure as long as the worlds survive. O gods it behoves of you to accord consent to this".

shloka_text: एवमुक्ता: सुरास्सर्वे प्रत्यूचुर्मुनिपुङ्गवम्। एवं भवतु भद्रं ते तिष्ठन्त्वेतानि सर्वश:।।1.60.30।। गगने तान्यनेकानि वैश्वानरपथाद्बहि:। नक्षत्राणि मुनिश्रेष्ठ तेषु ज्योतिष्षु जाज्वलन्।।1.60.31।। अवाक्छिरास्त्रिशङ्कुश्च तिष्ठत्वमरसन्निभ:।
translation: एवम् thus, उक्ता: addressed, सर्वे सुरा: all devatas, मुनिपुङ्गवम् to the preeminent among ascetics, प्रत्यूचु: replied, एवम् भवतु 'be it so', मुनिश्रेष्ठ O best among ascetics, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, एतानि तानि those celebrated, अनेकानि many , नक्षत्राणि stars, वैश्वानरपथात् from the path of Vaisvanara (zodiac), बहि: outside, गगने in the firmament, सर्वश: in all sides, तिष्ठन्तु shall stary on, तेषु ज्योतिष्षु  amidst those stars, जाज्वलन् shining brilliantly, त्रिशङ्कुश्च Trishanku also, अमरसन्निभ: as if immortal, अवाक्छिरा: head downwards, तिष्ठतु shall stay on.
explanation: Thus addressed, all the gods, replied to the preeminent ascetic, "O Best among sages, be blessed let thy will be donel. Those many celebrated stars shall stay on all sides outside the path of Vaisvanara (zodiac) in the firmament. Amidst those stars, Trisanku, shining brilliantly like an immortal, shall stay on, head down".

shloka_text: एवमुक्ता: सुरास्सर्वे प्रत्यूचुर्मुनिपुङ्गवम्। एवं भवतु भद्रं ते तिष्ठन्त्वेतानि सर्वश:।।1.60.30।। गगने तान्यनेकानि वैश्वानरपथाद्बहि:। नक्षत्राणि मुनिश्रेष्ठ तेषु ज्योतिष्षु जाज्वलन्।।1.60.31।। अवाक्छिरास्त्रिशङ्कुश्च तिष्ठत्वमरसन्निभ:।
translation: एवम् thus, उक्ता: addressed, सर्वे सुरा: all devatas, मुनिपुङ्गवम् to the preeminent among ascetics, प्रत्यूचु: replied, एवम् भवतु 'be it so', मुनिश्रेष्ठ O best among ascetics, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, एतानि तानि those celebrated, अनेकानि many , नक्षत्राणि stars, वैश्वानरपथात् from the path of Vaisvanara (zodiac), बहि: outside, गगने in the firmament, सर्वश: in all sides, तिष्ठन्तु shall stary on, तेषु ज्योतिष्षु  amidst those stars, जाज्वलन् shining brilliantly, त्रिशङ्कुश्च Trishanku also, अमरसन्निभ: as if immortal, अवाक्छिरा: head downwards, तिष्ठतु shall stay on.
explanation: Thus addressed, all the gods, replied to the preeminent ascetic, "O Best among sages, be blessed let thy will be donel. Those many celebrated stars shall stay on all sides outside the path of Vaisvanara (zodiac) in the firmament. Amidst those stars, Trisanku, shining brilliantly like an immortal, shall stay on, head down".

shloka_text: अनुयास्यन्ति चैतानि ज्योतींषि नृपसत्तमम्।।1.60.32।। कृतार्थं कीर्तिमन्तं च स्वर्गलोकगतं यथा।
translation: एतानि ज्योतींषि these stars, कृतार्थम् having gained his object, कीर्तिमन्तं च illustrious, नृपसत्तमम् best of kings, स्वर्गलोकगतं यथा as if he had attained heaven, अनुयास्यन्ति will follow.
explanation: These stars will follow this illustrious one (Trisanku), the best of kings who gained his object, as if he had attained heaven.

shloka_text: विश्वामित्रस्तु धर्मात्मा सर्वदेवैरभिष्टुत:।।1.60.33।। ऋषिभिश्च महातेजा बाढमित्याह देवता:।
translation: सर्वदेवै: by all devatas, ऋषिभिश्च by rishis also, अभिष्टुत: extolled, महातेजा: exceedingly energetic, धर्मात्मा virtuous, विश्वामित्रस्तु Visvamitra, देवता: to devatas, बाढम् इत्येव so be it, आह said.
explanation: In this manner extolled by all devatas and rishis, mighty and righteous Viswamitra said, 'well let it be so'.

shloka_text: ततो देवा महात्मानो मुनयश्च तपोधना:। जग्मुर्यथाऽऽगतं सर्वे यज्ञस्यान्ते नरोत्तम।।1.60.34।।
translation: नरोत्तम O Best among men, Rama, तत: then, यज्ञस्य अन्ते at the conclusion of sacrifice, महात्मान: magnanimous, देवा: devatas, तपोधना: whose asceticism is their wealth, मुनयश्च saints, यथागतम् in the way they had come, जग्मु: went.
explanation: "O Best among men (Rama) then at the conclusion of the sacrifice the great gods and saints went the way they had come". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे षष्टितमस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the sixtieth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: विश्वामित्रो महात्माथ प्रस्थितान् प्रेक्ष्य तानृषीन्। अब्रवीन्नरशार्दूलस्सर्वांस्तान्वनवासिन:।।1.61.1।।
translation: नरशार्दूल O Tiger (great) among men, अथ thereafter, महात्मा magnanimous, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, प्रस्थितान् those who had set on their journey, वनवासिन: inhabitants of the forest, तान् सर्वान् all those, ऋषीन् sages, प्रेक्ष्य seeing, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: O Tiger among men (Rama) thereafter great Viswamitra seeing the departing sages of the forest said:
comments: Indra steals King Ambarisha 's sacrificial horse -- sage Richika's middle son offers himself for sacrifice.

shloka_text: महान्विघ्न: प्रवृत्तोऽयं दक्षिणामास्थितो दिशम्। दिशमन्यां प्रपत्स्यामस्तत्र तप्स्यामहे तप:।।1.61.2।।
translation: दक्षिणां दिशं In southern quarter, आस्थित: taking hold of, अयम् महान् this great, विघ्न: obstruction, प्रवृत्त: taken place, अन्याम् another, दिशम् region, प्रपत्स्याम: we will take, तत्र there, तप: austerities, तप्स्यामहे we will perform.

shloka_text: पश्चिमायां विशालायां पुष्करेषु महात्मन:। सुखं तपश्चरिष्याम: परं तद्धि तपोवनम्।।1.61.3।।
translation: महात्मन: O Magnanimous ones, विशालायाम् in the vast, पश्चिमायाम् western region, पुष्करेषु in the sacred spot known as Pushkara, सुखम् in peace, तप: austerities, चरिष्याम: we will perform, तत् that, परम् best, तपोवनम् हि forest.
explanation: "O Highsouled sages, there is lake Pushkara in the vast western region. There in the forest fit for austerities we shall practise penance peacefully".

shloka_text: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजा: पुष्करेषु महामुनि:। तप उग्रं दुराधर्षं तेपे मूलफलाशन:।।1.61.4।।
translation: महातेजा: exceedingly powerful, महामुनि: great muni, एवम् thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, पुष्करेषु in pushkara land, मूलफलाशन: living of fruits and roots, दुराधर्षम् unsurpassable, उग्रम् intense, तप: austerities, तेपे performed.
explanation: With this the most powerful sage Viswamitra reached Pushkara where living on fruits and roots, he carried out intense, unsurpassable,  austerities.

shloka_text: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु अयोध्याधिपतिर्नृप:। अम्बरीष इति ख्यातो यष्टुं समुपचक्रमे।।1.61.5।।
translation: एतस्मिन् at that, काले एव time itself, अम्बरीष: इति as Ambarisha, ख्यात: wellknown, अयोध्याधिपति: lord of Ayodhya, नृप: king, यष्टुम् to perform sacrifice, समुपचक्रमे commneced.
explanation: At this time Ambarisha, a wellknown king of Ayodhya, launched preparations for a  sacrifice.

shloka_text: तस्य वै यजमानस्य पशुमिन्द्रो जहार ह। प्रणष्टे तु पशौ विप्रो राजानमिदमब्रवीत्।।1.61.6।।
translation: यजमानस्य the performer's, तस्य पशुम् his (sacrificial) animal, इन्द्र: Indra, जहार ह stolen  away, पशौ when the animal, प्रणष्टे (सति) could not be seen, विप्र: the priest, राजानम् addressing the king, इदम् this word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: While he was performing the sacrifice Indra stole away the sacrificial animal. The animal could not be traced. Hence the priest said to the king:

shloka_text: पशुरद्य हृतो राजन् प्रणष्टस्तव दुर्नयात् । अरक्षितारं राजानं घ्नन्ति दोषा नरेश्वर ।।1.61.7।।
translation: राजन् O King, अद्य now, पशु: animal, हृत: stolen, तव your, दुर्नयात् due to wrong policies,  प्रणष्ट: could not be seen, नरेश्वर O King, अरक्षितारम् him who fails to protect, राजानम् king, दोषा: faults, घ्नन्ति is perished.
explanation: "O King the animal has been stolen away and because of your inability to enforce law, it could not be traced. O Lord of men the king who fails to protect (his dependents) perishes by his own faults.

shloka_text: प्रायश्चित्तं महद्ध्येतन्नरं वा पुरुषर्षभ । आनयस्व पशुं शीघ्रं यावत्कर्म प्रवर्तते।।1.61.8।।
translation: पुरुषर्षभ O Best of men, एतत् this one, महत् great, प्रायश्चित्तम् expiation, नरं वा either man, पशुम् as beast, शीघ्रम् speedily, आनयस्व bring, कर्म the sacrifice, यावत् प्रवर्तते may be completed.
explanation: "O Best of men you must pay a big price for this. Bring either the beast or a man immediately so that the sacrifice can be completed".

shloka_text: उपाध्यायवचश्श्रुत्वा स राजा पुरुषर्षभ। अन्वियेष महाबुद्धि: पशुं गोभिस्सहस्रश:।।1.61.9।।
translation: पुरुषर्षभ O Best of men, महाबुद्धि: great intellectual, स: राजा that king, उपाध्यायवच: the words of priest, श्रुत्वा having heard, सहस्रश: in thousands, गोभि: with cows, पशुम् animal, अन्वियेष searched.
explanation: "O Best of men (Rama) hearing the words of the high priest, the highly intellectual king searched for a human victim in exchange for thousands of cows.

shloka_text: देशान् जनपदांस्तां स्तान्नगराणि वनानि च। आश्रमाणि च पुण्यानि मार्गमाणो महीपति: ।।1.61.10।। स पुत्रसहितं तात सभार्यं रघुनन्दन । भृगुतुंदे समासीनमृचीकं सन्ददर्श ह।।1.61.11।।
translation: तात O Child, रघुनन्दन delight of the house of Raghu, Rama, स: महीपति: that king, तां स्तान् many, देशान् countries, जनपदान् villages, नगराणि च cities, वनानि च forests, पुण्यानि sacred, आश्रमाणि च hermitages, मार्गमाण: searching, भृगुतुङ्दे on the Bhrigutunda mountain, पुत्रसहितम् along with his sons, सभार्यम् with his wive, समासीनम् seated, ऋचीकम् Richika, a sage, सन्ददर्श ह beheld.
explanation: O Dear Rama, the delight of Raghu clan the king scoured countries, villages, cities, forests, sacred hermitages till he saw sage Richika in the Bhrigutunda mountain sitting with his sons and wie.

shloka_text: देशान् जनपदांस्तां स्तान्नगराणि वनानि च। आश्रमाणि च पुण्यानि मार्गमाणो महीपति: ।।1.61.10।। स पुत्रसहितं तात सभार्यं रघुनन्दन । भृगुतुंदे समासीनमृचीकं सन्ददर्श ह।।1.61.11।।
translation: तात O Child, रघुनन्दन delight of the house of Raghu, Rama, स: महीपति: that king, तां स्तान् many, देशान् countries, जनपदान् villages, नगराणि च cities, वनानि च forests, पुण्यानि sacred, आश्रमाणि च hermitages, मार्गमाण: searching, भृगुतुङ्दे on the Bhrigutunda mountain, पुत्रसहितम् along with his sons, सभार्यम् with his wive, समासीनम् seated, ऋचीकम् Richika, a sage, सन्ददर्श ह beheld.
explanation: O Dear Rama, the delight of Raghu clan the king scoured countries, villages, cities, forests, sacred hermitages till he saw sage Richika in the Bhrigutunda mountain sitting with his sons and wie.

shloka_text: तमुवाच महातेजा: प्रणम्याभिप्रसाद्य च। ब्रह्मर्षिं तपसा दीप्तं राजर्षिरमितप्रभ:।।1.61.12।। पृष्ट्वा सर्वत्र कुशलमृचीकं तमिदं वच:।
translation: महातेजा: most brilliant, अमितप्रभ: extremely resplendent, तपसा with penance, दीप्तम् shining, तम् ब्रह्मर्षिम् that Brahmarshi, प्रणम्य bowing before him, अभिप्रसाद्य च having propitiated him, सर्वत्र in all, कुशलम् welfare, पृष्ट्वा having enquired, तं ऋचीकम्  addressing that sage Richika, इदम् these, वच: words, उवाच spoke.
explanation: The most brilliant king(Ambarisha) bowing to sage Richika, a brahmarshi who looked extremely resplendent with penance, propitiated him, enquired about the welfare of all and finally said":

shloka_text: गवां शतसहस्रेण विक्रीणीषे सुतं यदि।।1.61.13।। पशोरर्थे महाभाग कृतकृत्योऽस्मि भार्गव।
translation: महाभाग भार्गव O Fortunate descendent of Bhrigu race, sage Richika, गवाम् cows, शतसहस्रेण hundred thousands, सुतम् your son, पशो: अर्थे as scrificial animal, विक्रीणीषे यदि if sold, कृतकृत्य: अस्मि I have fulfilled my purpose.
explanation: "O Fortunate descendent of the Bhrigu race if your son is sold as a sacrificial animal in exchange for a hundred thousand cows, my purpose will be answered.

shloka_text: सर्वे परिसृता देशा याज्ञीयं न लभे पशुम्।।1.61.14।। दातुमर्हसि मूल्येन सुतमेकमितो मम।4
translation: सर्वे all, देशा: countries, परिसृता: roamed about, याज्ञीयम् relating to sacrifice, पशुम् animal, न लभे I could not get, इत: from among them, एकम् one, सुतम् son, मूल्येन for a price, मम for me, दातुम् to give, अर्हसि it behoves of you.
explanation: I have roamed all countries but could not final the sacrificial animal. Should'nt you spare one of your sons for a price"?

shloka_text: एवमुक्तो महातेजा ऋचीकस्त्वब्रवीद्वच:।।1.61.15।। नाहं ज्येष्ठं नरश्रेष्ठ विक्रीणीयां कथञ्चन।
translation: एवम् thus, उक्त: spoken, महातेजाः exceedingly brilliant, ऋचीकस्तु Richika, वच: these words, अब्रवीत् spoke, नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, अहम् I, कथञ्चन in any way, ज्येष्ठम् eldest one, न विक्रीणीयाम् will not sell.
explanation: Thus addressed the exceedingly brilliant Richika said, "O Best among men in no way shall I sell my first born".

shloka_text: ऋचीकस्य वचश्श्रुत्वा तेषां माता महात्मनाम्।।1.61.16।। उवाच नरशार्दूलमम्बरीषं तपस्विनी।
translation: ऋचीकस्य Richika's, वच: words, श्रुत्वा having listened, महात्मनाम् of illustrious ones, तेषाम् theirs, माता mother, तपस्विनी a woman in misery, नरशार्दूलम् foremost of men, अम्बरीषम् addressing Ambarisha, उवाच spoke.
explanation: Having heard Richika, the miserable mother of great sons, addressed Ambarisha, the foremost of men, saying:

shloka_text: अविक्रेयं सुतं ज्येष्ठं भगवानाह भार्गव:।।1.61.17।। ममापि दयितं विद्धि कनिष्ठं शुनकं नृप। तस्मात्कनीयसं पुत्रं न दास्ये तव पार्थिव ।।1.61.18।।
translation: भगवान् venerable, भार्गव: descendent of Bhrugu, sage Richika, ज्येष्ठम् eldest, सुतम् son, अविक्रेयम् cannot be sold, आह is telling, नृप O King, शुनकम् named Sunaka, कनिष्ठम् 	youngest, मम for me, दयितम् beloved son, विद्धि you may  better know, पार्द्धिव O King, तस्मात् for that reason, कनीयसं पुत्रम् yougest son, तव to you, न दास्ये I will not give.
explanation: Venerable descendant of the Bhrugus (sage Richika) said that the eldest son cannot be sold. "O King the youngest son, Sunaka, is my beloved son. You know, O King for that reason I will not give my yougest son".

shloka_text: अविक्रेयं सुतं ज्येष्ठं भगवानाह भार्गव:।।1.61.17।। ममापि दयितं विद्धि कनिष्ठं शुनकं नृप। तस्मात्कनीयसं पुत्रं न दास्ये तव पार्थिव ।।1.61.18।।
translation: भगवान् venerable, भार्गव: descendent of Bhrugu, sage Richika, ज्येष्ठम् eldest, सुतम् son, अविक्रेयम् cannot be sold, आह is telling, नृप O King, शुनकम् named Sunaka, कनिष्ठम् 	youngest, मम for me, दयितम् beloved son, विद्धि you may  better know, पार्द्धिव O King, तस्मात् for that reason, कनीयसं पुत्रम् yougest son, तव to you, न दास्ये I will not give.
explanation: Venerable descendant of the Bhrugus (sage Richika) said that the eldest son cannot be sold. "O King the youngest son, Sunaka, is my beloved son. You know, O King for that reason I will not give my yougest son".

shloka_text: प्रायेण हि नरश्रेष्ठ ज्येष्ठा: पितृषु वल्लभा:। मातृ़णां तु कनीयांसस्तस्माद्रक्षे कनीयसम् ।।1.61.19।।
translation: नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, प्रायेण generally, ज्येष्ठा: eldest sons, पितृषु for their fathers, वल्लभा: beloved, मातृ़णां तु for mothers, कनीयांस: yougest are beloved, तस्मात् for that reason, कनीयसम् yougest son, रक्षे I shall protect.
explanation: "O Best among men generally, the eldest sons are the favourites of their fathers, the youngest their mothers: For that reason, I shall keep my youngest son.

shloka_text: उक्तवाक्ये मुनौ तस्मिन् मुनिपत्न्यां तथैव च। शुनश्शेफस्स्वयं राम मध्यमो वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।1.61.20।।
translation: राम O Rama, तस्मिन् मुनौ: when that sage, उक्तवाक्ये having spoken thus, तथैव च in the same way, मुनिपत्न्याम् by wife of sage, मध्यम: middle son, शुन:शेफ: Sunas sepha, स्वयम् on his own, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: O Rama the sage and his wife having spoken thus, their middle son Sunassepha said on his own:

shloka_text: पिता ज्येष्ठमविक्रेयं माता चाह कनीयसम्। विक्रीतं मध्यमं मन्ये राजन् पुत्रं नयस्व माम्।।1.61.21।।
translation: राजन् O King, पिता my father, ज्येष्ठम् eldest son, अविक्रेयम् cannot be sold, आह said, माता च mother, कनीयसम् youngest one, मध्यमं पुत्रम् middle son, विक्रीतम् is sold, मन्ये I consider, माम् me, नयस्व you may take me.
explanation: O King my father says his eldest son cannot be sold, mother says that her  youngest son cannot be spared. From this I think middle son is already sold away. Therefore, take me"

shloka_text: गवां शतसहस्रेण शुनश्शेफं नरेश्वर:। गृहीत्वा परमप्रीतो जगाम रघुनन्दन ।।1.61.22।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Delighter of Raghus, Rama, नरेश्वरः that king, गवाम् of cows, शतसहस्रेण by  hundred thousands, शुनश्शेफम् Sunassepha, गृहीत्वा having received, परमप्रीत: immensely pleased, जगाम went.
explanation: "O Delight of the Raghus (Rama) having purchased Sunassepha for a hundred thousands of cows the king refurned immensely pleased.

shloka_text: शुनश्शेफं नरश्रेष्ठ गृहीत्वा तु महायशा:। व्यश्राम्यत् पुष्करे राजा मध्याह्ने रघुनन्दन।।1.62.1।।
translation: नरश्रेष्ठ O Foremost of men, रघुनन्दन O Rama, महायशा: illustrious, राजा king, शुन:शेफम् Sunassepha, गृहीत्वा having taken, मध्याह्ने by noon, पुष्करे in the Pushkara, व्यश्राम्यत् rested.
explanation: O Foremost of men, O Delight of the Raghus (Rama) the illustrious king (Ambarisha) took Sunassepha with him. (On the way) at Pushkara he took some rest at noon.
comments: Viswamitra protects Sunassepha and continues his austerities.

shloka_text: तस्य विश्रममाणस्य शुनश्शेफो महायशा:। पुष्करक्षेत्रमागम्य विश्वामित्रं ददर्श ह।।1.62.2।। तप्यन्तमृषिभिस्सार्धं मातुलं परमातुर:।
translation: तस्य as he, विश्रममाणस्य was resting, महायशा: highly famous, शुन:शेफ: Sunassepha, परमातुर: greately aggrieved, पुष्करक्षेत्रम् sacred Pushkara, आगम्य having approached, ऋषिभि:सार्धम्  in the company of other sages, तप्यन्तम् performing austerities, मातुलम् maternal uncle,  विश्वामित्रम् Visvamitra, ददर्श ह beheld.
explanation: While the king was resting at Pushkara, the famous Sunassepha, very much distressed, happened to see his maternal uncle Viswamitra in the company of other sages performing austerities.

shloka_text: विवर्णवदनो दीनस्तृष्णया च श्रमेण च।।1.62.3।। पपाताङ्के मुनेराशु वाक्यं चेदमुवाच ह।
translation: तृष्णया with thirst, श्रमेण च and fatigue, विवर्णवदन: with discoloured face, दीन: piteous, आशु immediately, मुने: sage's, अङ्के lap, पपात fell, इदम् these, वाक्यम् words, उवाच ह spoke.
explanation: With his face discoloured due to thirst and fatigue, he (Sunassepha) immediately fell into the sage's lap in a pitiable condition and said:

shloka_text: न मेऽस्ति माता न पिता ज्ञातयो बान्धवा: कुत:।।1.62.4।। त्रातुमर्हसि मां सौम्य धर्मेण मुनिपुङ्गव।
translation: सौम्य O Gentle man, मुनिपुङ्गव O Preeminent among ascetics, मे to me, माता mother, नास्ति does no exist, पिता father, न not, ज्ञातय: agnate relations, बान्धवा: relatives, कुत: where?, माम् me, धर्मेण in accordance with righteousness, त्रातुम् to protect, अर्हसि behoves of you.
explanation: "O Noble man O Preeminent among ascetics I have no mother nor father nor friends nor relatives. You should protect me according to dharma.

shloka_text: त्राता त्वं हि मुनिश्रेष्ठ सर्वेषां त्वं हि भावन:।।1.62.5।। राजा च कृतकार्यस्स्यादहं दीर्घायुरव्यय:। स्वर्गलोकमुपाश्नीयां तपस्तप्त्वाह्यनुत्तमम्।।1.62.6।।
translation: मुनिश्रेष्ठ O Best among ascetics, त्वम् you, सर्वेषाम् to everybody, त्राता हि protector, त्वम् you, भावन: हि promoter of others' welfare, राजा king, कृतकार्य: fulfilling the purpose, स्यात् become, अहम् I, दीर्घायु: one who has long life, अव्यय: imperishable, अनुत्तमम् great, तप: austerities, तप्त्वा having performed, स्वर्गलोकम् heaven, उपाश्नीयाम् I may enjoy.
explanation: O Best among ascetics you are the protecor of everybody. You are promoter of others' welfare. May the king fulfil his purpose. May I live long and become immortal and attain heaven after performing great penance. May I enjoy heaven.

shloka_text: त्राता त्वं हि मुनिश्रेष्ठ सर्वेषां त्वं हि भावन:।।1.62.5।। राजा च कृतकार्यस्स्यादहं दीर्घायुरव्यय:। स्वर्गलोकमुपाश्नीयां तपस्तप्त्वाह्यनुत्तमम्।।1.62.6।।
translation: मुनिश्रेष्ठ O Best among ascetics, त्वम् you, सर्वेषाम् to everybody, त्राता हि protector, त्वम् you, भावन: हि promoter of others' welfare, राजा king, कृतकार्य: fulfilling the purpose, स्यात् become, अहम् I, दीर्घायु: one who has long life, अव्यय: imperishable, अनुत्तमम् great, तप: austerities, तप्त्वा having performed, स्वर्गलोकम् heaven, उपाश्नीयाम् I may enjoy.
explanation: O Best among ascetics you are the protecor of everybody. You are promoter of others' welfare. May the king fulfil his purpose. May I live long and become immortal and attain heaven after performing great penance. May I enjoy heaven.

shloka_text: त्वं मे नाथो ह्यनाथस्य भव भव्येन चेतसा। पितेव पुत्रं धर्मात्मं स्त्रातुमर्हसि किल्बिषात्।।1.62.7।।
translation: अनाथस्य an orphan as i am, मे to me, त्वम् you, भव्येन with auspicious, चेतसा mind, नाथ: lord, भव be, धर्मात्मन् O virtuous one, पिता father, पुत्रमिव like son, किल्बिषात् from sin, त्रातुम् to protect, अर्ह्रसि behoves of you.
explanation: O Virtuous one with a kind heart protect this orphan. Like a father who protects his son, save me from this peril".

shloka_text: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा विश्वामित्रो महातपा:। सान्त्वयित्वा बहुविधं पुत्रानिदमुवाच ह।।1.62.8।।
translation: महातपा: mighty ascetic, विश्वामित्र: Viswamitra, तस्य his, तत् बहुविधम् वचनम् those different kinds of words, श्रुत्वा having listened, सान्त्वयित्वा after consoling him, पुत्रान् addressing his sons, इदम् this word, उवाच spoke.
explanation: Having heard Sunassepha, mighty ascetic Viswamitra consoled him in many ways and said to his sons:

shloka_text: यत्कृते पितर: पुत्रान् जनयन्ति शुभार्थिन:। परलोकहितार्थाय तस्य कालोऽयमागत:।।1.62.9।।
translation: शुभार्थिन: men desiring auspiciousness, पितर: parents, यत्कृते for whichever reason, परलोकहितार्थाय for your wellbeing in other worlds, पुत्रान् sons, जनयन्ति begetting, तस्य for that, अयम् काल: the proper time, आगत: has come.

shloka_text: अयं मुनिसुतो बालो मत्तश्शरणमिच्छति। अस्य जीवितमात्रेण प्रियं कुरुत पुत्रका:।।1.62.10।।
translation: मुनिसुत: son of sage, अयम् this, बाल: young boy, मत्त: from me, शरणम् refuge, इच्छति is  strongly desiring, पुत्रका: O Sons, अस्य for him, जीवितमात्रेण by mere offering of life, प्रियम् dear act, कुरुत you may do.
explanation: O sons of the sage this young boy has sought my protection. O Sons you may grant him his desire by merely offering your life.

shloka_text: सर्वे सुकृतकर्माणस्सर्वे धर्मपरायणा: । पशुभूता नरेन्द्रस्य तृप्तिमग्ने: प्रयच्छत ।।1.62.11।।
translation: सर्वे all of you, सुकृतकर्माण: have done virtuous deeds, सर्वे all of you, धर्मपरायणा: are engaged in the observance of righteousness, नरेन्द्रस्य for the king, पशुभूता: becoming sacrificial animals, अग्ने for Agni, तृप्तिम् satisfaction, प्रयच्छत give.
explanation: Engaged in the observance of righteousness, all of you have done virtuous deeds. By becoming sacrificial animals for the king, you may satisfy Agni.

shloka_text: नाथवांश्च शुनश्शेफो यज्ञश्चाविघ्नितो भवेत्। देवतास्तर्पिताश्चस्युर्मम चापि कृतं वच:।।1.62.12।।
translation: शुनशेफ: Sunassepha, नाथवान् च will have a protector, यज्ञश्च sacrifice also, अविघ्नत: without hindrance, भवेत् will become, देवता: devatas, तर्पिता: gratified, स्यु: will become, मम my, वच: च words also, कृतम् will be done.
explanation: Then Sunassepha will be protected. The king's sacrifice will continue without hindrance. The gods will be gratified. My words also will come true".

shloka_text: मुनेस्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा मधुच्छन्दादय स्सुता:। साभिमानं नरश्रेष्ठ सलीलमिदमब्रुवन्।।1.62.13।।
translation: नरश्रेष्ठ O Best of men, मधुच्छन्दादय: Madhuchanda and others, सुता: sons, मुने: ascetics's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having listened, साभिमानम् with selfesteem, सलीलम् with ease, इदम् these words, अब्रुवन् spoke.
explanation: "O Best of men (Rama) in response to the words of the sage Madhuchanda and others said thus in a casual way with selfesteem.

shloka_text: कथमात्मसुतान् हित्वा त्रायसेऽन्यसुतं विभो। अकार्यमिव पश्याम श्श्वमांस इव भोजने।।1.62.14।।
translation: विभो O Lord, आत्मसुतान् ones own sons, हित्वा abandoning, अन्यसुतम् other's son, कथम् how, त्रायसे you rescue, भोजने in partaking, श्वमांस इव like the flesh of dog, अकार्यमिव as if a prohibited act, पश्याम: we find.
explanation: O Lord protecting other's son by abandoning one' own is like partaking the flesh of a dog. We consider it a prohibited act".

shloka_text: तेषां तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा पुत्राणां मुनिपुङ्गव:। क्रोधसंरक्तनयनो व्याहर्तुमुपचक्रमे।।1.62.15।।
translation: मुनिपुङ्गव: eminent ascetic, तेषाम् पुत्राणाम् of those sons', तद् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, क्रोधसंरक्तनयन: with eyes reddened with anger, व्याहर्तुम् to speak, उपचक्रमे commenced.
explanation: On hearing the words of his sons Viswamitra, the eminent ascetic, eyes reddened with anger began to speak:

shloka_text: निस्साध्वसमिदं प्रोक्तं धर्मादपि विगर्हितम्। अतिक्रम्य तु मद्वाक्यं दारुणं रोमहर्षणम्।।1.62.16।।
translation: मद्वाक्यम् my words, अतिक्रम्य having trangressed, धर्मादपि even according to morality, विगर्हितम् censurable, दारुणम् dreadful, रोमहर्षणम् causing the hair to stand on end, इदम् these words, निस्साध्वसम् audacious, प्रोक्तम् have been uttered.
explanation: "(You have) not only trangressed my words but also (you are) censurable according to dharma. You have uttered such audacious and dreadrul words causing the hair to stand on end.

shloka_text: श्वमांसभोजिनस्सर्वे वासिष्ठा इव जातिषु। पूर्णं वर्षसहस्रं तु पृथिव्यामनुवत्स्यथ।।1.62.17।।
translation: सर्वे all of you, श्वमांसभोजिन: feeding on the flesh of dog, पूर्णं complete, वर्षसहस्रम् thousand years, पृथिव्याम् on this earth, वासिष्ठा: इव like sons of Vasishta, जातिषु in (Mushtika) race, अनुवत्स्यथ shall dwell.
explanation: All of you shall live on earth for a thousand years, like the sons of Vasishta feeding on the flesh of dogs".

shloka_text: कृत्वा शापसमायुक्तान् पुत्रान् मुनिवरस्तथा। शुनश्शेफमुवाचार्तं कृत्वा रक्षां निरामयम्।।1.62.18।।
translation: मुनिवर: best of ascetics, पुत्रान् his sons, शाप समायुक्तान् doomed with curse, कृत्वा having made, तथा then, निरामयम् free from pain, रक्षाम् protection, कृत्वा having made, आर्तम् filled with distress, शुन:शेफम् addressing Sunassepha, (इदम् these words), उवाच spoke.
explanation: Viswamitra the best of ascetics, thus cursed his sons. Sunassepha, (now) was filled with distress. To relieve him of his pain he said:

shloka_text: पवित्रपाशैरासक्तो रक्तमाल्यानुलेपन:। वैष्णवं यूपमासाद्य वाग्भिरग्निमुदाहर ।।1.62.19।।
translation: वैष्णवं यूपम् Vaishnava sacrificial post, आसाद्य having reached, पवित्रपाशै: with sacred ropes, आसक्त: having bound with, रक्तमाल्यानुलेपन: bedaubing your body with red sandal paste and adorned with red garlands, वाग्भि: with the hymns, अग्निम् Agni, उदाहर invoke.
explanation: "Bedaubing your person with red sandal paste and adorned with red garlands, you will be bound to a Vaishnava, sacrificial post with sacred ropes. There invoke Agni with these hymns.

shloka_text: इमे तु गाथे द्वे दिव्ये गायेथा मुनिपुत्रक। अम्बरीषस्य यज्ञेऽस्मिंस्तत स्सिद्धिमवाप्स्यसि।।1.62.20।।
translation: मुनिपुत्रक: O Son of the sage, अम्बरीषस्य Ambarisha's, अस्मिन् यज्ञे in this sacrifice, इमे द्वे these two, दिव्ये sacred, गाथे verses, गायेथा: chant, तत: there after, सिद्धिम् success, अवाप्स्यसि you will achieve.
explanation: O Son of sage chant thse two sacred mantras in the sacrifice of Ambarisha.There after you will achieve success (long life)".

shloka_text: शुनश्शेफो गृहीत्वा ते द्वे गाथे सुसमाहित:। त्वरया राजसिंहं तमम्बरीषमुवाच ह।।1.62.21।।
translation: शुनश्शेफ: Sunassepha, सुसमाहित: with concentration of mind, ते द्वे those two, गाथे verses, गृहीत्वा after securing, राजसिंहम् the lion among kings, तम् अम्बरीषम् that Amabarisha, त्वरया quickly, उवाच ह spoke.
explanation: Sunassepha memorized the two verses with concentration of mind and hastened towards Amabarisha, a lion among kings. And said:

shloka_text: राजसिंह महासत्त्व शीघ्रं गच्छावहे सद:। निर्वर्तयस्व राजेन्द्र दीक्षां च समुपाविश।।1.62.22।।
translation: महासत्त्व endowed with great strength, राजसिंह lion among kings, सद: sacrificial assembly, शीघ्रम् without dealy, गच्छावहे we shall both go, राजेन्द्र O Indra of monarchs,  निर्वर्तयस्व perform, दीक्षाम् initiatory rites, समुपाविश take up.
explanation: "Endowed with great strength, you are a lion among kings. We shall go to the sacrificial assembly without delay. O Indra among monarchs, take up initiatory rites and  perform the sacrifice".

shloka_text: तद्वाक्यमृषिपुत्रस्य श्रुत्वा हर्षसमुत्सुक: । जगाम नृपति श्शीघ्रं यज्ञवाटमतन्द्रित:।।1.62.23।।
translation: नृपति: king, ऋषिपुत्रस्य sage's son's, तत् वाक्यम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, हर्षसमुत्सुक:   rejoiced with delight, अतन्द्रित: promptly, यज्ञवाटम् sacrificial ground, जगाम went.
explanation: At the words of the sage's son, the king, eager with delight hastened towards the sacrificial ground.

shloka_text: सदस्यानुमते राजा पवित्रकृतलक्षणम्। पशुं रक्ताम्बरं कृत्वा यूपे तं समबन्धयत्।।1.62.24।।
translation: राजा king, सदस्यानुमते with the consent of officiating priests, तम् that Sunassepha,  पवित्रकृतलक्षणम् forming sacred knots of Kusa grass, रक्ताम्बरम् with red apparel, पशुम् as sacrificial animal, कृत्वा having made, यूपे to the sacrificial post, समबन्धयत् tied.
explanation: With the consent of the officiating priests the king invested Sunasepha with the sacred symbols with Kusa grass, dressed him in red apparel and tied him to the sacrificial post as a sacrificial animal.

shloka_text: सबद्धो वाग्भिरग्य्राभिरभितुष्टाव वै सुरौ। इन्द्रमिन्द्रानुजं चैव यथावन्मुनिपुत्रक:।।1.62.25।।
translation: बद्ध: having been bound, स: मुनिपुत्रक: the son of sage, इन्द्रम् Indra, इन्द्रानुजं चैव Upendra, सुरौ two devatas, अग्य्राभि: with excellent, वाग्भि: words, यथावत् properly, अभितुष्टाव praised.
explanation: Thus bound, the son of the sage praised the two devatas, Indra and Upendra with moving words.

shloka_text: तत: प्रीत स्सहस्राक्षो रहस्यस्तुतितर्पित:। दीर्घमायुस्तदा प्रादाच्छुनश्शेफाय राघव ।।1.62.26।।
translation: राघव O Rama, तत: then, रहस्यस्तुतितर्पित: gratified with secret praise, सहस्राक्ष: Indra, प्रीत: pleased, तदा then, शुन:शेफाय for Sunasepha, दीर्घम् long, आयु: life, प्रादात् gave.
explanation: "O Descendant of Raghu (Rama) Indra, gratified with the secret hymn granted Sunassepha long life.

shloka_text: स च राजा नरश्रेष्ठ यज्ञस्य च समाप्तवान्। फलं बहुगुणं राम सहस्राक्षप्रसादजम्।।1.62.27।।
translation: नरश्रेष्ठ O Foremost of men, राम Rama, स: राजा च that king also, सहस्राक्षप्रसादजम् through  the grace of Indra, बहुगुणम् several times, यज्ञस्य   of sacrifice, फलम् fruits, समाप्तवान् obtained.
explanation: O Foremost of men O Rama the king also obtained from the sacrifics innumerable rewards by the grace of Indra several times greater than expected.

shloka_text: विश्वामित्रो ऽपि धर्मात्मा भूयस्तेपे महातपा:। पुष्करेषु नरश्रेष्ठ दशवर्षशतानि च।।1.62.28।।
translation: नरश्रेष्ठ O Best among men, धर्मत्मा the righteous, महातपा: mighty ascetic, विश्वामित्र: अपि Visvamitra also, पुष्करेषु in that sacred spot name Pushkara, दशवर्षशतानि thousand years, भूय: again, तेपे continued his austerities.
explanation: O Best among men the righteous and mighty ascetic Viswamitra also continued his austerities at Pushkara for a thousand years". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे द्विषष्टितमस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the sixtysecond sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: पूर्णे वर्षसहस्रे तु व्रतस्नातं महामुनिम्। अभ्यागच्छन् सुरास्सर्वे तप: फलचिकीर्षव:।।1.63.1।।
translation: वर्षसहस्रे when thousand years, पूर्णे had been completed, सर्वे all, सुरा: devatas, तप: फलचिकीर्षव: desiring to bestow the fruits of his austerities, व्रतस्नातम् who had taken the ritual bath after completion of the ritual, महामुनिम् mighty ascetic, अभ्यागच्छन् approached.
explanation: All the gods wanted to bestow the fruits of austerties on the mighty ascetic (Viswamitra). They approached him after a thousand years of penace and his final ritual bath.
comments: Viswamitra obtains the title of Maharshi -- Menaka creates impediments to his penance -- Viswamitra performs intense austerities to obtain the rank of Brahmarshi.

shloka_text: अब्रवीत्सुमहातेजा ब्रह्मा सुरुचिरं वच:। ऋषिस्त्वमसि भद्रं ते स्वार्जितै: कर्मभिश्शुभै:।।1.63.2।।
translation: सुमहातेजा: exceedingly effulgent, ब्रह्मा Brahma, सुरुचिरम् attractive, वच: words, अब्रवीत् spoke, त्वम् you, स्वार्जितै: with selfearned, शुभै: कर्मभि: sacred deeds, ऋषि: असि have become Rishi, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you.
explanation: Exceedingly effulgent Brahma spoke to him, "You have become a rishi through the selfearned sacred deeds. Fare you well".

shloka_text: तमेवमुक्त्वा देवेशस्त्रिदिवं पुनरभ्यगात् । विश्वामित्रो महातेजा भूयस्तेपे महत्तप:।।1.63.3।।
translation: देवेश: lord of devatas, तम् him, एवम् thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, पुन: again, त्रिदिवम् towards heaven, अभ्यगात् went, महातेजा: a man of mighty effulgence, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, भूय: again, महत् great, तप: austerities, तेपे performed.
explanation: Brahma, the lord of the gods, having said this returned to heaven. The brilliant Viswamitra continues his austerities.

shloka_text: तत: कालेन महता मेनका परमाऽप्सरा:। पुष्करेषु नरश्रेष्ठ स्नातुं समुपचक्रमे।।1.63.4।।
translation: नरश्रेष्ठ O foremost of men, तत: thereafter, महता great, कालेन after a great lapse of time, मेनका one named Menaka, परमाप्सरा: freatest among nymphs, पुष्करेषु in the spot at Pushkara, स्नातुम् to bathe, समुपचक्रमे commenced.
explanation: "O Foremost of men after a long lapse of time a chief nymph called Menaka came to bathe at Pushkara.

shloka_text: तां ददर्श महातेजा मेनकां कुशिकात्मज:। रूपेणाप्रतिमां तत्र विद्युतं जलदे यथा।।1.63.5।।
translation: महातेजा: highly lustrous, कुशिकात्मज: son of Kusika, Visvamitra, तत्र in that Pushkara, जलदे in the clouds, विद्युतं यथा like lightening, रूपेण in beauty, अप्रतिमाम् incomparable, ताम्  मेनकाम् that Menaka, ददर्श beheld.
explanation: There the most brilliant son of Kusika Viswamitra saw Menaka whose beauty was incomparable. She looked like lightning in the clouds.

shloka_text: दृष्ट्वा कन्दर्पवशगो मुनिस्तामिदमब्रवीत्। अप्सरस्स्वागतं तेऽस्तु वस चेह ममाश्रमे।।1.63.6।। अनुगृह्णीष्व भद्रं ते मदनेन सुमोहितम्।
translation: दृष्ट्वा having seen, मुनि: sage Visvamitra, कन्दर्पवशग: under the influence of Kandarpa,  Cupid, ताम् her, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke, अप्सर: O Apsarasa, ते to you, स्वागतम् अस्तु wecome, मम my, इह here, आश्रमे hermitage, वस च dwell, मदनेन by Manmatha,  सुमोहितम् highly infatuated, अनुगृह्णीष्व favour me, ते भद्रम् safety to you.
explanation: On seeing her (Menaka) Viswamitra came under the influence of the god of love (fell in love with her). He said, O Apsara welcome to my hermitage stay here. I am infatuated with you: Oblige me. Wish you well.

shloka_text: इत्युक्ता सा वरारोहा तत्र वासमथाकरोत्।।1.63.7।। तस्यां वसन्त्यां वर्षाणि पञ्च पञ्च च राघव । विश्वामित्राश्रमे राम सुखेन व्यतिचक्रमु:।।1.63.8।।
translation: राघव O Rama, सा वरारोहा that women of exalted breeding, इति thus, उक्ता having been spoken, अथ thereafter, तत्र there, वासम् habitation, अकरोत् made, राम O Rama, तस्याम्  while she, विश्वामित्राश्रमे in the hermitage of Visvamitra, वसन्त्याम् while living, पञ्च पञ्च च ten, वर्षाणि years, सुखेन happily, व्यतिचक्रमु: passed away.
explanation: "O Descendant of Raghu while that woman of an exalted race lived in the hermitage of Viswamitra, ten years rolled by happily".

shloka_text: इत्युक्ता सा वरारोहा तत्र वासमथाकरोत्।।1.63.7।। तस्यां वसन्त्यां वर्षाणि पञ्च पञ्च च राघव । विश्वामित्राश्रमे राम सुखेन व्यतिचक्रमु:।।1.63.8।।
translation: राघव O Rama, सा वरारोहा that women of exalted breeding, इति thus, उक्ता having been spoken, अथ thereafter, तत्र there, वासम् habitation, अकरोत् made, राम O Rama, तस्याम्  while she, विश्वामित्राश्रमे in the hermitage of Visvamitra, वसन्त्याम् while living, पञ्च पञ्च च ten, वर्षाणि years, सुखेन happily, व्यतिचक्रमु: passed away.
explanation: "O Descendant of Raghu while that woman of an exalted race lived in the hermitage of Viswamitra, ten years rolled by happily".
