shloka_text: अथ काले गते तस्मिन्विश्वामित्रो महामुनि:। सव्रीड इव सम्वृत्तश्चिन्ताशोकपरायण:।।1.63.9।।
translation: अथ there after, तस्मिन् काले when that period, गते was spent, महामुनि: mighty ascetic, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, चिन्ताशोकपरायण: filled with grief and sorrowful thought, सव्रीड इव as though with shame, सम्वृत्त: became.
explanation: As the period passed, Viswamitra the mighty ascetic was filled with grief, anxiety and remorse.

shloka_text: बुद्धिर्मुनेस्समुत्पन्ना सामर्षा रघुनन्दन। सर्वं सुराणां कर्मैतत्तपोपहरणं महत्।।1.63.10।।
translation: राघुनन्दन O Rama, मुने: for the ascetic, सामर्षा filled with indignation, बुद्धि: a thought, समुत्पन्ना arose, एतत् सर्वम् all this, महत् great, तपोपहरणम् taking away tapas, सुराणाम् devatas', कर्म deed.
explanation: O Delight of the Raghus (Rama) a sense of indignation filled the mind of the ascetic. 'All this is the conspiracy of the gods to deprive me of my great austerities', he thought.

shloka_text: अहोरात्रापदेशेन गतास्संवत्सरा दश। काममोहाभिभूतस्य विघ्नोऽयं समुपस्थित:।।1.63.11।।
translation: काममोहाभिभूतस्य for me possessed by lust and delusion, दश संवत्सरा: ten years, अहोरात्रापदेशेन under the pretext of day and night, गता: have passed by, अयम् विघ्न: this hindrance, समुपस्थित: has befallen.
explanation: Night and day deluded by lust I have wasted ten years. A hindrance has been posed (to my tapas).

shloka_text: विनिश्श्वसन्मुनिवर: पश्चात्तापेन दु:खित:। भीतामप्सरसं दृष्ट्वा वेपन्तीं प्राञ्जलिं स्थिताम्।।1.63.12।। मेनकां मधुरैर्वाक्यैर्विसृज्य कुशिकात्मज:। उत्तरं पर्वतं राम विश्वामित्रो जगाम ह।।1.63.13।।
translation: राम O Rama, मुनिवर: best of ascetics, कुशिकात्मज: son of Kusika, विश्वामित्र: Viswamitra, पश्चात्तापेन with repentence, दु:खित: distressed, विनिश्वसन् sighing, भीताम् freightened,  प्राञ्जलिं स्थिताम् standing with folded palms, वेपन्तीम् trembling, अप्सरसम् apsara, मेनकाम् Menaka, दृष्ट्वा having seen, मधुरै: with sweet, वाक्यै: words, विसृज्य after permitting her to leave, उत्तरं पर्वतम् northern mountain, जगाम ह went.
explanation: "O Rama Viswamitra, the best of ascetics sighed with repentance, distressed with grief. On seeing him, the apsara started trembling in fear. She stood before him with folded palms. (But) with sweet words the son of Kushika left her and proceeded towards the northern mountains.

shloka_text: विनिश्श्वसन्मुनिवर: पश्चात्तापेन दु:खित:। भीतामप्सरसं दृष्ट्वा वेपन्तीं प्राञ्जलिं स्थिताम्।।1.63.12।। मेनकां मधुरैर्वाक्यैर्विसृज्य कुशिकात्मज:। उत्तरं पर्वतं राम विश्वामित्रो जगाम ह।।1.63.13।।
translation: राम O Rama, मुनिवर: best of ascetics, कुशिकात्मज: son of Kusika, विश्वामित्र: Viswamitra, पश्चात्तापेन with repentence, दु:खित: distressed, विनिश्वसन् sighing, भीताम् freightened,  प्राञ्जलिं स्थिताम् standing with folded palms, वेपन्तीम् trembling, अप्सरसम् apsara, मेनकाम् Menaka, दृष्ट्वा having seen, मधुरै: with sweet, वाक्यै: words, विसृज्य after permitting her to leave, उत्तरं पर्वतम् northern mountain, जगाम ह went.
explanation: "O Rama Viswamitra, the best of ascetics sighed with repentance, distressed with grief. On seeing him, the apsara started trembling in fear. She stood before him with folded palms. (But) with sweet words the son of Kushika left her and proceeded towards the northern mountains.

shloka_text: स कृत्वा नैष्ठिकीं बुद्धिं जेतुकामो महायशा:। कौशिकीतीरमासाद्य तपस्तेपे सुदारुणम्।।1.63.14।।
translation: महायशा: highly illustrious, स: he (that Visvamitra), नैष्ठिकीम् life long abstinence and chastity, बुद्धिम् mind, कृत्वा having made, जेतुकाम: with a view to control his senses, कौशिकीतीरम् the banks of the Kausiki river, आसाद्य having reached, सुदारुणम् highly rigid, तप: austerities, तेपे performed.
explanation: Illustrious Viswamitra took a vow of celibacy in order to control his senses. And performed rigid austerities on reaching the bank of river Kausiki.

shloka_text: तस्य वर्षसहस्रं तु घोरं तप उपासत:। उत्तरे पर्वते राम देवतानामभूद्भयम्।।1.63.15।।
translation: राम O Rama, तस्य for him, उत्तरे पर्वते on the northern mountains, वर्षसहस्रम् a thousand years, घोरम् fearful, तप: penance, उपासत: while performing, देवतानाम् to devatas, भयम्  अभूत् fear arose.
explanation: O Rama while he was performing rigorous penance for a thousand years on the northern mountains, the gods were gripped with fear. (lest he should exceed them).

shloka_text: आमन्त्रयन् समागम्य सर्वे सर्षिगणा स्सुरा:। महर्षिशब्दं लभतां साध्वयं कुशिकात्मज:।।1.63.16।।
translation: सर्षिगणा: along with hosts of rishis, सर्वे all, सुरा: devatas, समागम्य having met together, अयम् कुशिकात्मज: this Viswamitra, साधु rightly, महर्षिशब्दम् title of Maharshi, लभताम् be obtained, आमन्त्रयन् thought over.
explanation: After consultations the gods and sages decided that this son of Kushika (Viswamitra)  deserved the status of a Maharshi".

shloka_text: देवतानां वच श्शृत्वा सर्वलोकपितामह:। अब्रवीन्मधुरं वाक्यं विश्वामित्रं तपोधनम्।।1.63.17।।
translation: सर्वलोकपितामह: grandsire of the worlds, Brahma, देवतानाम् devatas, वच: words, श्रुत्वा haivng heard, तपोधनम् great ascetic, विश्वामित्रम् Visvamitra, मधुरम् sweet, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: Having heard the gods, the Grandsire of the worlds (Brahma) addressed  Viswamitra whose wealth was his ascetism in these sweet words.

shloka_text: महर्षे स्वागतं वत्स तपसोग्रेण तोषित:। महत्त्वमृषिमुख्यत्वं ददामि तव कौशिक ।।1.63.18।।
translation: महर्षे O Maharshi, वत्स O Child, स्वागतम् welcome, उग्रेण with intense, तपसा austerities, तोषित: I have been pleased, कौशिक O Son of Kusika, Visvamitra, तव your, महत्त्वम् eminenence, ऋषिमुख्यत्वम् preeminence among sages (maharshi hood), ददामि I here by give.
explanation: "O Maharshi O Child welcome Pleased with your intense austerities, O Son of Kushika I confer upon you the eminent rank of a great rishi (maharshi)".

shloka_text: ब्रह्मणस्स वचश्श्रुत्वा सर्वलोकेश्वरस्य ह। न विषण्णो न सन्तुष्टो विश्वामित्रस्तपोधन:।।1.63.19।।
translation: तपोधन: the great ascetic, स: विश्वामित्र: afterwards, सर्वलोकेश्वरस्य of the lord of all worlds, ब्रह्मण: Brahma, वच: words, श्रुत्वा having heard, न विषण्ण: not dejected, न सन्तुष्ट: not pleased.
explanation: Having heard the words Brahman, the lord of all the worlds, Viswamitra whose wealth was his asceticism was neither dejected nor delighted.

shloka_text: प्राञ्जलि: प्रणतो भूत्वा सर्वलोकपितामहम्। प्रत्युवाच ततो वाचं विश्वामित्रो महामुनि:।।1.63.20।।
translation: तत: then, महामुनि: mighty ascetic, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, प्राञ्जलि: with folded hands, प्रणत:  भूत्वा having bowed, सर्वलोकपितामहम् grandsire of all worlds, वाचम् words, प्रत्युवाच replied.
explanation: Then the mighty ascetic Viswamitra bowed to Brahma, the Grandsire of all the worlds with folded hands and replied:

shloka_text: महर्षिशब्दमतुलं स्वार्जितै: कर्मभिश्शुभै:। यदि मे भगवानाह ततोऽहं विजितेन्द्रिय:।।1.63.21।।
translation: भगवान् adorable one, स्वार्जितै: earned by me, शुभै: by the auspicious, कर्मभि: deeds, अतुलम् incomparble, महर्षिशब्दम् title of Maharshi, मे to me, आह यदि if it has been told, तत: then, अहम् I, विजितेन्द्रिय: have conquered my senses.
explanation: "O Adorable one, if you have conferred the incomparable title of 'Maharshi' earned by my auspicious deeds, I feel I have conquered the senses."

shloka_text: तमुवाच ततो ब्रह्मा न तावत् त्त्वं जितेन्द्रिय:। यतस्व मुनिशार्दूल इत्युक्त्वा त्रिदिवं गत:।।1.63.22।।
translation: तत: then, ब्रह्मा Brahma, तम् addressing him, उवाच said, त्त्वम् you, जितेन्द्रियस्तावत् having conquered the senses, न not, मुनिशार्दूल O Best among ascestics, यतस्व strive still, इति thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, त्रिदिवम् towards heaven, गत: went.
explanation: Then Brahma said to him, 'You have not conquered the senses yet. O Tiger among ascetics, strive still.' Having said this he went toward heaven.

shloka_text: विप्रस्थितेषु देवेषु विश्वामित्रो महामुनि:। ऊर्ध्वबाहुर्निरालम्बो वायुभक्षस्तपश्चरन्।।1.63.23।।
translation: देवेषु when devatas, विप्रस्थितेषु सत्सु after having departed, महामुनि: mighty ascetic, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, ऊर्ध्वबाहु: with arms raised upwards, निरालम्ब: without support, वायुभक्ष: subsisting on air, तपश्चरन् while performimg.
explanation: After the departure of the gods, mighty ascetic Viswamitra raised his arms up, stood without support, subsisting on air, continuing with his austerities.

shloka_text: घर्मे पञ्चतपा भूत्वा वर्षास्वाकाशसंश्रय:। शिशिरे सलिलस्थायी रात्र्यहानि तपोधन:।।1.63.24।। एवं वर्षसहस्रं हि तपो घोरमुपागमत्।
translation: तपोधन: that Visvamitra whose asceticism was his wealth, घर्मे in summer, पञ्चतपा: भूत्वा performing penance amidst five fires, वर्षासु during rainy season, आकाशसंश्रयः taking refuge under the open sky, शिशिरे in the cold season, रात्र्यहानि day and night, सलिलस्थायी immersed in water, एवम् thus, वर्षसहस्रम् for a thousand years, घोरम् rigid, तप: austerities, उपागमत् performed.
explanation: Viswamitra whose wealth was his penance carried on his rigid austerities for a thousand years amidst five fires, in summer, under the open sky in monsoon, and   immersed in ater night and day in winter.

shloka_text: तस्मिन् सन्तप्यमाने तु विश्वामित्रे महामुनौ।।1.63.25।। सम्भ्रमस्सुमहानासीत्सुराणां वासवस्य च।
translation: महामुनौ when the mighty ascestic, तस्मिन् विश्वामित्रे that Visvamitra, सन्तप्यमाने while peforming penance, सुराणाम् for devatas, वासवस्य च for Indra also, सुमहान् greatly, संभ्रम: आसीत् perturbance over took.
explanation: When the mighty asetic Viswamitra was peforming penance, the gods as well as Indra  got deeply perturbed.

shloka_text: रम्भामप्सरसं शक्र स्सह सर्वैर्मरुद्गणै:। उवाचात्महितं वाक्यमहितं कौशिकस्य च।।1.63.26।।
translation: शक्र: Indra, सर्वै: all, मरुद्गणै: सह along with maruts, आत्महितम् promoting his welfare, कौशिकस्य for Kausika, अहितं च against his welfare, वाक्यम् words, रम्भाम् named Rambha, अप्सरसम् celestial nymph, उवाच said.
explanation: Indra along with all the maruts spoke to the celestial nymph Rambha, words that augured well for them and not for kaushika (Viswamitra). इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे त्रिषष्टितमस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the sixtythird sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: सुरकार्यमिदं रम्भे कर्तव्यं सुमहत्त्वया। लोभनं कौशिकस्येह काममोहसमन्वितम्।।1.64.1।।
translation: रम्भे O Rambha, इह now, कौशिकस्य Kausika's, काममोहसमन्वितम् possessed by lust and passions, लोभनम् enticing, सुमहत् highly great, इदम् this, सुरकार्यम् work of devatas, त्वया by you, कर्तव्यम् fit to be done.
explanation: "O Rambha you must entice Viswamitra by lust and passion. This important work must be done by you in the interest of the gods".
comments: Viswamitra curses Rambha.

shloka_text: तथोक्ता साऽप्सरा राम सहस्राक्षेण धीमता। व्रीडिता प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं प्रत्युवाच सुरेश्वरम्।।1.64.2।।
translation: राम O Rama, धीमता by the sagacious, सहस्राक्षेण by Indra, तथा thus, उक्ता having been spoken, सा अप्सरा: that apsara, व्रीडिता bashfully, प्रञ्जलि: with folded palms in supplication, सुरेश्वरम् leader of gods Indra, वाक्यम् words, प्रत्युवाच replied.
explanation: O Rama, to these words of the sagacious, thousandeyed Lord of the gods (Indra) that apsara with folded hands bashfully replied:

shloka_text: अयं सुरपते घोरो विश्वामित्रो महामुनि:। घोरमुत्सृजते क्रोधं मयि देव न संशय:।।1.64.3।। ततो हि मे भयं देव प्रासादं कर्तुमर्हसि।
translation: सुरपते O Lord of devatas, अयम् महामुनि: this mighty ascetic, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, घोर: is a frightful person, देव O Lord, मयि in me, घोरम् fearful, क्रोधम् wrath, उत्सृजते will release, संशय: न no doubt, तत: for that reason, मे my, भयम् fear, देव O lord, प्रसादम् favour, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हसि behoves of you.
explanation: 'Lord of the devatas this mighty ascetic Viswamitra is a terrible person. He will ceratinly release on his dreadful anger (curse me). O Lord this is my apprehension. You should excuse me'.

shloka_text: एवमुक्तस्तया राम रम्भया भीतया तदा।।1.64.4।। तामुवाच सहस्राक्षो वेपमानां कृताञ्जलिम्।
translation: राम O Rama, भीतया with fear, तया रम्भया by that Rambha, तदा then, एवम् thus, उक्त: spoken, सहस्राक्ष: Indra, वेपमानाम् trembling, कृताञ्जलिम् standing with folded palms, ताम् addressing her, उवाच said.
explanation: O Rama having heard Rambha trembling in fear and standing with folded palms, Indra spoke:

shloka_text: माभैषी रम्भे भद्रं ते कुरुष्व मम शासनम्।।1.64.5।। कोकिलो हृदयग्राही माधवे रुचिरद्रुमे। अहं कन्दर्पसहित स्स्थास्यामि तव पार्श्वत:।।1.64.6।।
translation: रम्भे O Rambha, मा भैषी: have no fear, ते भद्रम् safety to you, मम my, शासनम् order, कुरुष्व carry out, अहम् I, रुचिरद्रुमे with booming trees, माधवे in the season of Spring, हृदयग्राही captivating the heart, कोकिल: cuckoo, कन्दर्पसहित: in the company of Kandarpa, Cupid, तव your, पार्श्वत: side, स्थास्यामि will stay.
explanation: 'O Rambha have no fear. Feel safe. Carry out my order. When the trees look so beautiful in spring I shall in captivating the form of a cuckoo, stay by your side in the company of Kamadeva (Cupid).

shloka_text: माभैषी रम्भे भद्रं ते कुरुष्व मम शासनम्।।1.64.5।। कोकिलो हृदयग्राही माधवे रुचिरद्रुमे। अहं कन्दर्पसहित स्स्थास्यामि तव पार्श्वत:।।1.64.6।।
translation: रम्भे O Rambha, मा भैषी: have no fear, ते भद्रम् safety to you, मम my, शासनम् order, कुरुष्व carry out, अहम् I, रुचिरद्रुमे with booming trees, माधवे in the season of Spring, हृदयग्राही captivating the heart, कोकिल: cuckoo, कन्दर्पसहित: in the company of Kandarpa, Cupid, तव your, पार्श्वत: side, स्थास्यामि will stay.
explanation: 'O Rambha have no fear. Feel safe. Carry out my order. When the trees look so beautiful in spring I shall in captivating the form of a cuckoo, stay by your side in the company of Kamadeva (Cupid).

shloka_text: त्वं हि रूपं बहुगुणं कृत्वा परमभास्वरम्। तमृषिं कौशिकं रम्भे भेदयस्व तपस्विनम्।।1.64.7।।
translation: रम्भे O Rambha, त्वम् you, बहुगुणम् displaying many romantic gestures, परमभास्वरम् highly shining, रूपम् form, कृत्वा having assumed, तपस्विनम् mighty ascestic, तम् ऋषिम् that rishi, कौशिकम् Visvamitra, भेदयस्व break him (from penance).
explanation: O Rambha displaying many (romantic) gestures and assuming a fascinating form, distract the mighty ascetic, Kausika (Viswamitra)'.

shloka_text: सा श्रुत्वा वचनं तस्य कृत्वा रूपमनुत्तमम्। लोभयामास ललिता विश्वामित्रं शुचिस्मिता।।1.64.8।।
translation: सा she, तस्य his, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having listened, अनुत्तमम् highly excellent, रूपम् form, कृत्वा having asumed, ललिता beautiful, शुचिस्मिता with bright smile, विश्वामित्रम् Visvamitra, लोभयामास allured.
explanation: At these words (of Indra), Rambha, assumed any form of excellent beauty and with a bright smile set out to allure Viswamitra.

shloka_text: कोकिलस्य च शुश्राव वल्गु व्याहरत: स्वनम्। सम्प्रहृष्टेन मनसा तत एनामुदैक्षत।।1.64.9।।
translation: वल्गु sweet, charming, व्याहरत: making notes, कोकिलस्य cuckoo's, स्वनम् voice of, शुश्राव heard, तत: afterwards, सम्प्रहृष्टेन with a delighted, मनसा mind, एनाम् her, उदैक्षत beheld.
explanation: Excited by the charming warble of the cuckoo, Viswamitra opened his eyes.

shloka_text: अथ तस्य च शब्देन गीतेनाप्रतिमेन च। दर्शनेन च रम्भाया मुनिस्सन्देहमागत:।।1.64.10।।
translation: अथ afterwards, तस्य that cuckoo's, शब्देन sounds, अप्रतिमेन incomparable, गीतेन song, रम्भाया: with the Rambha's, दर्शनेन च presence also, मुनि: the ascetic, सन्देहम् doubt,  आगत: arose.
explanation: On hearing the sound of the incomparable song of the cuckoo along with the  sight of Rambha, a doubt arose in the mind of the ascetic.

shloka_text: सहस्राक्षस्य तत्कर्म विज्ञाय मुनिपुङ्गव:। रम्भां क्रोधसमाविष्ट श्शशाप कुशिकात्मज:।।1.64.11।।
translation: मुनिपुङ्गव: eminent ascetic, कुशिकात्मज: son of Kusika, सहस्राक्षस्य Indra's, तत् that one, कर्म work, विज्ञाय having recognised, क्रोधसमाविष्ट: seized of anger, रम्भाम् Rambha, शशाप cursed.
explanation: Son of Kushika, the eminent ascetic knew it was the work of Indra. Seized with anger, he cursed Rambha:

shloka_text: यन्मां लोभयसे रम्भे कामक्रोधजयैषिणम्। दशवर्षसहस्राणि शैली स्थास्यसि दुर्भगे ।।1.64.12।।
translation: दुर्भगे O Unfortunate one, रम्भे Rambha, कामक्रोधजयैषिणम् with a desire to conquer wrath and passion, माम् me, यत् since, लोभयसे seduce me (for that reason), दश वर्षसहस्राणि ten thousand years, शैली as rock, स्थास्यसि shall become.
explanation: 'O luckless Rambha, since you have endeavoured to distract me from my desire to conquer  wrath and passion, you shall turn into a rock and remain so for ten thousand years'.

shloka_text: ब्राह्मण स्सुमहातेजा स्तपोबलसमन्वित:। उद्धरिष्यति रम्भे त्वां मत्क्रोधकलुषीकृताम्।।1.64.13।।
translation: रम्भे O Rambha, सुमहातेजा: highly splendrous, तपोबलसमन्वित: endowed with the power of asceticism, ब्राह्मण: Brahmana, मत्क्रोधकलुषीकृताम् fouled on account of my anger, त्वाम् you, उद्धरिष्यति will liberate.
explanation: 'O Rambha an effulgent brahmin, endowed with the power of asceticism, will liberate you from this state into which you have fallen on account of my anger'.

shloka_text: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजा विश्वामित्रो महामुनि:। अशक्नुवन् धारयितुं क्रोधं सन्तापमागत:।।1.64.14।।
translation: महातेजा: exceedingly lustrous, महामुनि: great sage, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, क्रोधम् anger, धारयितुम् to contain, अशक्नुवन् unable, एवम् thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, सन्तापम् distress, आगत: experienced.
explanation: The brilliant Viswamitra, the great ascetic, now experienced remorse for his inability to contain anger.

shloka_text: तस्य शापेन महता रम्भा शैली तदाऽभवत्। वचश्शृत्वा च कन्दर्पो महर्षेस्स च निर्गत:।।1.64.15।।
translation: तदा then, तस्य his महता by great, शापेन (because of )curse, रम्भा Rambha, शैली अभवत् became a rock, महर्षे: maharshi's, वच: words, श्रुत्वा having listened, कन्दर्प: Kandarapa, स: च devendra, निर्गत: fled away.
explanation: This mighty curse, of the great saint transformed Rambha into a rock and sent Kamadeva and Indra to their heels.

shloka_text: कोपेन स महातेजास्तपोऽपहरणे कृते। इन्द्रियैरजितै राम न लेभे शान्तिमात्मन:।।1.64.16।।
translation: राम O Rama, महातेजा: highly powerful, स: Visvamitra, कोपेन with anger, तपोपहरणे in deprivation of his ascetic merit, कृते having been made, अजितै: with unconquered,  इन्द्रियै: senses, आत्मन: his own, शान्तिम् peace, न लेभे did not get.
explanation: "O Rama highly powerful Viswamitra was deprived of his ascetic merit due to his anger. He had no peace of mind for his inability to control his senses.

shloka_text: बभूवास्य मनश्चिन्ता तपोऽपहरणे कृते । नैव क्रोधं गमिष्यामि न च वक्ष्ये कथञ्चन।।1.64.17।।
translation: तपोपहरणे कृते having been deprived of his ascetic merit, अस्य for him, मनश्चिन्ता बभूव thought arose in his mind, क्रोधम् anger, नैव गमिष्यामि never shall I obtain, कथञ्चन in what  so ever manner, न च वक्ष्ये I shall not speak also.
explanation: Having been deprived of his ascetic merit, he resolved not to lose his temper nor ever breathe a word".

shloka_text: अथवा नोच्छवसिष्यामि संवत्सरशतान्यपि। अहं विशोषयिष्यामि ह्यात्मानं विजितेन्द्रिय:।।1.64.18।।
translation: अथवा further, संवत्सरशतान्यपि even for hundreds of years, नोच्छवसिष्यामि I shall not breathe, अहम् I, विजितेन्द्रिय: having conquered my senses, आत्मानम् this body, विशोषयिष्यामि will emaciate.
explanation: "Further, I shall not even inhale for hundreds of years. I shall conquer my senses and dry up this body.

shloka_text: तावद्यावद्धि मे प्राप्तं ब्राह्मण्यं तपसाऽऽर्जितम्। अनुच्छवसन्नभुञ्जान स्तिष्ठेयं शाश्वतीस्समा:।।1.64.19।। न हि मे तप्यमानस्य क्षयं यास्यन्ति मूर्तय:।
translation: मे for me, तपसा by austerities, आर्जितम् earned, ब्राह्मण्यम् brahminhood, यावत् until, प्रप्तम् is obtained, तावत् till then, अनुच्छवसन् suspending my breath, अभुञ्जान: abstaining from  food, शाश्वती: समा: for innumerable years, तिष्ठेयम् I shall stay, तप्यमानसय while performing austerities, मे my, मूर्तय: limbs, क्षयम् deterioration, न यास्यन्ति will not get.
explanation: Until brahminhood is obtained by my austerities, I shall stay without breathing or eating for innumerable years. While performing penance, my limbs shall not undergo deterioration".

shloka_text: एवं वर्षसहस्रस्य दीक्षां स मुनिपुङ्गव:।।1.64.20।। चकाराप्रतिमां लोके प्रतिज्ञां रघुनन्दन।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Rama, स: मुनिपुङ्गव: that eminent ascetic, एवम् in this way, लोके in this world, अप्रतिमाम् unparalleled, वर्षसहस्रस्य दीक्षाम् religious practices for a thousand years,  प्रतिज्ञां vow, चकार made.
explanation: "O Descendant of Raghu in this way that eminent ascetic took an unprecedented vow to practise penance for a thousand years". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे चतुष्षष्टितमस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the sixtyfourth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: अथ हैमवतीं राम दिशं त्यक्त्वा महामुनि:। पूर्वां दिशमनुप्राप्य तपस्तेपे सुदारुणम्।।1.65.1।।
translation: राम O Rama, अथ thereafter, महामुनि: great ascetic Visvamitra, हैमवतीम् relating to Himavat mountain, दिशम् quarter, त्यक्त्वा abandoning, पूर्वां दिशम् eastern quarter, अनुप्राप्य having reached, सुदारुणम् rigorous, तप: austerities, तेपे performed.
explanation: "O Rama thereafter the great ascetic (Viswamitra), abandoning the north of the Himavat mountain reached the eastern quarter and performed rigorous austerities.
comments: Satananda completes his narration of how Viswamitra attains Brahmarshi status.

shloka_text: मौनं वर्षसहस्रस्य कृत्वा व्रतमनुत्तमम्। चकाराप्रतिमं राम तप: परमदुष्करम्।।1.65.2।।
translation: राम O Rama, वर्षसहस्रस्य for a thousand years, अनुत्तमम् immense, मौनं व्रतं vow of silence, कृत्वा having observed, अप्रतिमम् unprecedented, परमदुष्करम् extremely difficult, तप: austerities, चकार practised.
explanation: Having observed a unique vow of silence for a thousand years, O Rama he practised unprecedented and extremely difficult austerities.

shloka_text: पूर्णे वर्षसहस्रे तु काष्ठभूतं महामुनिम्। विघ्नैर्बहुभिराधूतं क्रोधो नान्तर आविशत्।।1.65.3।। स कृत्वा निश्चयं राम तप आतिष्टदव्ययम्।
translation: वर्षसहस्रे when thousand years, पूर्णे were completed, काष्ठभूतम् almost like a piece of wood, महामुनिम् mighty ascetic, बहुभि: several, विघ्नै: with impediments, आधूतम् unshaken, क्रोध: anger, अन्तरे in his mind, न आविशत् did not enter, राम O Rama, स: he, निश्चयम् determination, कृत्वा having made, अव्ययम् immense, तप: austerities, आतिष्ठत् practised.
explanation: After completion of a thousand years the great ascetic became a piece of wood. In spite of many impediments, he was unshaken, anger did not enter into his mind. O Rama with firm determination he practised  austerities.

shloka_text: तस्य वर्षसहस्रस्य व्रते पूर्णे महाव्रत:।।1.65.4।। भोक्तुमारब्धवानन्नं तस्मिन् काले रघूत्तम। इन्द्रो द्विजातिर्भूत्वा तं सिद्धमन्नमयाचत।।1.65.5।।
translation: रघूत्तम O Rama, तस्य for him, वर्षसहस्रस्य of a thousand years, व्रते when the vow, पूर्णे had been completed, महाव्रत: one rigidly observing vows, अन्नम् cooked rice, भोक्तुम् to partake,  आरब्धवान् commenced, तस्मिन् काले that moment, इन्द्र: Indra, द्विजाति: भूत्वा assuming the guise of a brahmin, तम् him, सिद्धम् cooked and set ready for consumption, अन्नम् rice, अयाचत asked.
explanation: O Best of Raghus dynasty (Rama) when the thousandyearold vow was over (Viswamitra) the great practitioner of vows began to partake cooked rice. At this moment Indra assumed the guise of a brahmin and asked him for the rice (he was going to eat).

shloka_text: तस्य वर्षसहस्रस्य व्रते पूर्णे महाव्रत:।।1.65.4।। भोक्तुमारब्धवानन्नं तस्मिन् काले रघूत्तम। इन्द्रो द्विजातिर्भूत्वा तं सिद्धमन्नमयाचत।।1.65.5।।
translation: रघूत्तम O Rama, तस्य for him, वर्षसहस्रस्य of a thousand years, व्रते when the vow, पूर्णे had been completed, महाव्रत: one rigidly observing vows, अन्नम् cooked rice, भोक्तुम् to partake,  आरब्धवान् commenced, तस्मिन् काले that moment, इन्द्र: Indra, द्विजाति: भूत्वा assuming the guise of a brahmin, तम् him, सिद्धम् cooked and set ready for consumption, अन्नम् rice, अयाचत asked.
explanation: O Best of Raghus dynasty (Rama) when the thousandyearold vow was over (Viswamitra) the great practitioner of vows began to partake cooked rice. At this moment Indra assumed the guise of a brahmin and asked him for the rice (he was going to eat).

shloka_text: तस्मै दत्वा तदा सिद्धं सर्वं विप्राय निश्चित:। निश्शेषितेऽन्ने भगवानभुक्तैव महातपा:।।1.65.6।। न किञ्चिदवदद्विप्रं मौनव्रतमुपस्थित:। अथ वर्षसहस्रं वै नोच्छ्वसन्मुनिपुङ्गव:।।1.65.7।।
translation: भगवान् adorable, महातपा: mighty ascetic, मौनव्रतम् vow of silence, उपास्थित: having adopted, निश्चित: firmly determined, तदा then, सिद्धम् kept ready, सर्वम् all that rice, तस्मै  विप्राय for that Brahmin, दत्वा having given, अन्ने when the cooked rice, निश्शेषिते without remainder was consumed, अभुक्तैव without eating food, विप्रम् brahmin, किञ्चित् little, न अवदत् did not utter a word, अथ thereafter, मुनिपुङ्गव: best of ascetics, वर्षसहस्रं thousand years, नोच्छ्वसत् did not breathe.
explanation: This mighty, adorable ascetic having adopted a vow of silence decided to give all the cooked rice to the Brahmin. The brahmin finished all the rice. Viswamitra went without food but did not utter a single word to the brahmin. Thereafter the distinguished ascetic practised austerities for another period of thousand years, his breath suspended.

shloka_text: तस्मै दत्वा तदा सिद्धं सर्वं विप्राय निश्चित:। निश्शेषितेऽन्ने भगवानभुक्तैव महातपा:।।1.65.6।। न किञ्चिदवदद्विप्रं मौनव्रतमुपस्थित:। अथ वर्षसहस्रं वै नोच्छ्वसन्मुनिपुङ्गव:।।1.65.7।।
translation: भगवान् adorable, महातपा: mighty ascetic, मौनव्रतम् vow of silence, उपास्थित: having adopted, निश्चित: firmly determined, तदा then, सिद्धम् kept ready, सर्वम् all that rice, तस्मै  विप्राय for that Brahmin, दत्वा having given, अन्ने when the cooked rice, निश्शेषिते without remainder was consumed, अभुक्तैव without eating food, विप्रम् brahmin, किञ्चित् little, न अवदत् did not utter a word, अथ thereafter, मुनिपुङ्गव: best of ascetics, वर्षसहस्रं thousand years, नोच्छ्वसत् did not breathe.
explanation: This mighty, adorable ascetic having adopted a vow of silence decided to give all the cooked rice to the Brahmin. The brahmin finished all the rice. Viswamitra went without food but did not utter a single word to the brahmin. Thereafter the distinguished ascetic practised austerities for another period of thousand years, his breath suspended.

shloka_text: तस्यानुच्छ्वसमानस्य मूर्ध्नि धूमो व्यजायत। त्रैलोक्यं येन सम्भ्रान्तमादीपितमिवाभवत्।।1.65.8।।
translation: अनुच्छ्वसमानस्य while he was suspending his breath, तस्य Visvamitra's, मूर्ध्नि on his head, धूम: smoke, व्यजायत emanated, येन by which, त्रैलोक्यम् three worlds, सम्भ्रान्तम् agitated, आदीपितमिव अभवत् was as thoughset on fire.
explanation: While his breath, was suspended, smoke emanated from his head which frightened the three worlds. It appeared as though they were on fire.

shloka_text: ततो देवास्सगन्धर्वा: पन्नगोरगराक्षसा:। मोहितास्तेजसा तस्य तपसा मन्दरश्मय:।।1.65.9।। कश्मलोपहता स्सर्वे पितामहमथाब्रुवन्।
translation: तत: thereupon, देवा: devatas, सगन्धर्वा: along with gandharvas, पन्नगोरगरराक्षसा: pannagas, uragas, rakshasas, तस्य his, तेजसा by ascetic energy, मोहिता: bewildered, तपसा by his penance, मन्दरश्मय: with dimmed glory, कश्मलोपहता: afflicted with anguish, अथ thereafter, सर्वे all, पितामहम् addressing grandsire, अब्रुवन् spoke.
explanation: Thereupon devatas along with gandharvas, pannagas, uragas, and rakshasas, stood bewildered by his ascetic energy. Their own glory was dimmed in his lustre". Afflicted with anguish, they spoke to the Grandsire (Brahma):

shloka_text: बहुभि: कारणैर्देव विश्वामित्रो महामुनि:।।1.65.10।। लोभित: क्रोधितश्चैव तपसा चाभिवर्धते।
translation: देव O Divine lord, महामुनि: great ascetic, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, बहुभि: with various, कारणै: by reasons, लोभित: having been lured, क्रोधितश्चैव having been angered, तपसा with his austerities, अभिवर्धते is growing:
explanation: "O Lord the great sage Viswamitra was lured and angered in various ways. But his austerities continued to grow:

shloka_text: न ह्यस्य वृजिनं किञ्चिद्दृश्यते सूक्ष्ममप्यथ।।1.65.11।। न दीयते यदि त्वस्य मनसा यदभीप्सितम्। विनाशयति त्रैलोक्यं तपसा सचराचरम्।।1.65.12।।
translation: अथ also, अस्य his, सूक्ष्ममपि even minute, वृजिनम् sin, किञ्चित् a little, न दृश्यते not to be seen, अस्य his, मनसा by mind, यत् which, अभीप्सितम् is desired, न दीयते यदि if not given,  तपसा with his austerities, सचराचरम् moveable and immoveable, त्रैलोक्यम् the three worlds together, विनाशयति will destroy.
explanation: His penance was flawless. If his wishes were not granted, he will  surely destroy by his austerities the three worlds with all movables and immovables.

shloka_text: न ह्यस्य वृजिनं किञ्चिद्दृश्यते सूक्ष्ममप्यथ।।1.65.11।। न दीयते यदि त्वस्य मनसा यदभीप्सितम्। विनाशयति त्रैलोक्यं तपसा सचराचरम्।।1.65.12।।
translation: अथ also, अस्य his, सूक्ष्ममपि even minute, वृजिनम् sin, किञ्चित् a little, न दृश्यते not to be seen, अस्य his, मनसा by mind, यत् which, अभीप्सितम् is desired, न दीयते यदि if not given,  तपसा with his austerities, सचराचरम् moveable and immoveable, त्रैलोक्यम् the three worlds together, विनाशयति will destroy.
explanation: His penance was flawless. If his wishes were not granted, he will  surely destroy by his austerities the three worlds with all movables and immovables.

shloka_text: व्याकुलाश्च दिशस्सर्वा न च किञ्चित्प्रकाशते। सागरा: क्षुभितास्सर्वे विशीर्यन्ते च पर्वता:।।1.65.13।।
translation: सर्वा: all, दिश: quarters, व्याकुला: bewildered, किञ्चित् even a little, न प्रकाशते is not shining, सर्वे all, सागरा: seas, क्षुभिता: are agitated, पर्वता: mountains, विशीर्यन्ते are riven.
explanation: There is bewilderment everywhere. It is dark all over. The oceans are disturbed. The mountains have cracked.

shloka_text: प्रकम्पते च पृथिवी वायुर्वाति भृशाकुल:। बृह्मन्न प्रतिजानीमोनास्तिको जायते जन:।।1.65.14।।
translation: ब्रह्मन् O Brahma, पृथिवी earth, प्रकम्पते is trembling, वायु: wind, भृशाकुल: is excessively affected, वाति is blowing, न प्रतिजानीम: we do not know what to do, जन: men, नास्तिक: atheist, जायते are becoming.
explanation: O Brahma the earth trembles. The wind blows fiercely. The people have ceased to believe in God. We do not know the way out.

shloka_text: सम्मूढमिव त्रैलोक्यं सम्प्रक्षुभितमानसम्। भास्करो निष्प्रभश्चैव महर्षेस्तस्य तेजसा।।1.65.15।।
translation: त्रैलोक्यम् three worlds put together, सम्प्रक्षुभितमानसम् with agitated minds, सम्मूढमिव looking as though fainted, तस्य महर्षे: by that maharshi's, तेजसा lustre, भास्करश्च even Sun also, निष्प्रभ: is devoid of brilliance.
explanation: The people of all the three worlds are agitated and confused in mind. The Sun, too, looks pale before the brilliance of the Maharshi.

shloka_text: बुद्धिं न कुरुते यावन्नाशे देव महामुनि:। तावत्प्रसाद्यो भगवा नग्निरूपोमहाद्युति:।।1.65.16।।
translation: देव O Lord, महामुनि: the mighty ascetic, नाशे in destruction, यावत् until, बुद्धिम् mind, न कुरुते does not make, तावत् till then, अग्निरूप: resembling fire, महाद्युति: highly effulgent, भगवान् venerable, Visvamitra, प्रसाद्य: should be appeased.
explanation: O Lord before this mighty, venerable ascetic, effulgent like fire decides to destroy the three worlds, he should be appeased.

shloka_text: कालाग्निना यथापूर्वं त्रैलोक्यं दह्यतेऽखिलम्। देवराज्यं चिकीर्षेत दीयतामस्य यन्मतम्।।1.65.17।।
translation: अखिलम् entire, त्रैलोक्यम् three worlds, पूर्वम् formerly, कालाग्निना by fire at the dissolution of worlds, यथा in that manner, दह्यते is burnt, देवराज्यम् kingdom of devatas, चिकीर्षेत if he  wants to rule, अस्य for him, यत् which, मतम् likes, दीयताम् be given.
explanation: All the three worlds are burning as though with the fire Pralaya (dissolution). His desire may be granted even if he wants to rule the kingdom of the gods.

shloka_text: ततस्सुरगणास्सर्वे पितामहपुरोगमा:। विश्वामित्रं महात्मानं मधुरं वाक्यमब्रुवन्।।1.65.18।।
translation: तत: thereafter, पितामहपुरोगमा: with Brahma in the forefront, सर्वे सुरगणा: hosts of devatas,  महात्मानम् magnanimous, विश्वामित्रम् Visvamitra, मधुरम् sweet, वाक्यम् words, अब्रुवन् spoke.
explanation: Thereafter, with Brahma in the forefront, the gods spoke to Viswamitra in pleasing words:

shloka_text: ब्रह्मर्षे स्वागतं तेऽस्तु तपसा स्म सुतोषिता:। ब्राह्मण्यं तपसोग्रेण प्राप्तवानसि कौशिक ।।1.65.19।।
translation: ब्रह्मर्षे O Brahmarshi, ते to you, स्वागतम् welcome, तपसा with your austerities, सुतोषिता: स्म: we are immensely pleased, कौशिक O Viswmitra, उग्रेण by intense, तपसा austerities, ब्राह्मण्यम् brahminhood, प्राप्तवान् असि you have attained.
explanation: "Welcome, O Brahmarshi. We are immensely pleased with your austerities. O Kausika you have attained brahminhood by means of your intense penance.

shloka_text: दीर्घमायुश्च ते ब्रह्मन् ददामि समरुद्गण:। स्वस्ति प्राप्नुहि भद्रं ते गच्छ सौम्य यथासुखम्।।1.65.20।।
translation: ब्रह्मन् O Brahmana, समरुद्गण: I, together with hosts of maruts, ते to you, दीर्घम् long, आयुश्च life, ददामि am giving, स्वस्ति wellbeing, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, प्राप्नुहि you may obtain, सौम्य O Gentle one, यथा सुखम् happily, गच्छ go.
explanation: O Brahmana I along with the maruts grant you long life. May you prosper O Gentle one now you may go happily".

shloka_text: पितामहवचश्शृत्वा सर्वेषां च दिवौकसाम्। कृत्वा प्रणामं मुदितो व्याजहार महामुनि:।।1.65.21।।
translation: महामुनि: mighty ascetic, पितामह वच: words of grand sire, सर्वेषाम् all, दिवौकसाम्च words of devatas, श्रुत्वा having heard, मुदित: delighted, प्रणामम् obeisance, कृत्वा having made, व्याजहार spoke.
explanation: Mighty ascetic Viswamitra was delighted to hear the words of the Grandsire and the gods. Bowing to all of them he thus spoke:

shloka_text: ब्राह्मण्यं यदि मे प्राप्तं दीर्घमायुस्तथैव च। ओङ्कारश्च वषट्कारो वेदाश्च वरयन्तु माम्।।1.65.22।।
translation: मे for me, ब्राह्मण्यम् brahminhood, प्राप्तम् यदि if acquired, तथैव च and similarly, दीर्घम् long, आयुश्च life, ओङ्कारश्च Omkara, वषट्कारश्च Vashatkara, वेदाश्च vedas, माम् me, वरयन्तु accept.
explanation: "If brahminhood and long life have been acquired by me by your grace, Omkara, Vashatkara and the Vedas shall accept me as Brahmarshi. (I shall acquire the right to interpret the Vedas and to perform sacrifices.)

shloka_text: क्षत्रवेदविदां श्रेष्ठो ब्रह्मवेदविदामपि। ब्रह्मपुत्रो वसिष्ठो मामेवं वदतु देवता:।।1.65.23।। यद्ययं परम: काम: कृतो यान्तु सुरर्षभा:।
translation: देवता: O devatas, क्षत्रवेदविदाम् knowledgeable in vedas worthy of kshatriyas like archery, etc, ब्रह्मवेदविदामपि knowledgeable in vedas worthy to brahmins, श्रेष्ठ: eminent, ब्रह्मपुत्र: son of Brahma, वसिष्ठ: Vasishta, माम् me, एवम् thus, वदतु speak, अयम् this, परम: supreme, काम: desire, कृत:यदि if done, सुरर्षभा: best of devatas, यान्तु you can go.
explanation: "O gods let the son of Brahma and eminent Vasishta who is knowledgeable in the vedas worthy of brahmins and archery worthy of kshatriyas address me as 'Brahmarshi'. If this supreme desire is granted, O Best of devatas all of you can go".

shloka_text: तत: प्रसादितो देवैर्वसिष्ठो जपतां वर:।।1.65.24।। सख्यं चकार ब्रह्मर्षिरेवमस्त्विति चाब्रवीत्।
translation: तत: there upon, देवै: by devatas, प्रसादित: propitiated, जपतां वर: the best among ascetics, वसिष्ठ: Vasishta, सख्यम् friendship, चकार made, एवम् thus, ब्रह्मर्षि: अस्तु become brahmarshi, इति in this manner saying so, अब्रवीत् च spoken.
explanation: Thereupon, pleased by the gods, Vasishta, the best among ascetics, lovingly said to Viswamitra "You are a Brahmarshi, let it be so".

shloka_text: ब्रह्मर्षिस्त्वं न सन्देहस्सर्वं सम्पत्स्यते तव।।1.65.25।। इत्युक्त्वा देवताश्चापि सर्वा जग्मुर्यथागतम्।
translation: त्वम् you, ब्रह्मर्षि: are a Brahmarshi, सन्देह: न no doubt, तव to you,सर्वम् all, सम्पत्स्यते will be achieved (ascetic perfection), इति so, उक्त्वा having said, सर्वा: all, देवता: devatas, यथागतम्  where they had come from, जग्मु: went away.
explanation: "You are a Brahmarshi, no doubt. You will achieve ascetic perfection", said the gods and returned to their respective places from where they had come.

shloka_text: विश्वामित्रोऽपि धर्मात्मा लब्ध्वा ब्राह्मण्यमुत्तमम्।।1.65.26।। पूजयामास ब्रह्मर्षिं वसिष्ठं जपतां वरम्।
translation: धर्मात्मा virtuous, विश्वामित्र: अपि Visvamitra also, उत्तमम् excellent, ब्रह्मण्यम् brahminhood, लब्ध्वा having attained, ब्रह्मर्षिम् brahmrshi, जपताम् वरम् the best of those who recite prayers, वसिष्ठम् Vasishta, पूजयामास worshipped.
explanation: Virtuous Viswamitra also, having attained excellent brahminhood, worshipped  Brahmrshi Vasishta who was the best of those who recite hymns".

shloka_text: कृतकामो महीं सर्वां चचार तपसि स्थित:।।1.65.27।। एवं त्वनेन ब्राह्मण्यं प्राप्तं राम महात्मना।
translation: कृतकाम: having fulfilled his desire, तपसि in asceticism, स्थित: fixed, सर्वाम् whole, महीम् earth, चचार wandered, राम O Rama, महात्मना by illustrious, अनेन by him, एवम् thus,        ब्राह्मण्यम् brahminhood, प्राप्तम् was acquired.
explanation: This illustrious sage having fulfilled his desire, wandered over the earth fixed in asceticism. O Rama  thus he acquired brahminhood.

shloka_text: एष राम मुनिश्रेष्ठ एष विग्रहवांस्तप:।।1.65.28।। एष धर्मपरो नित्यं वीर्यस्यैष परायणम्।
translation: राम O Rama, एष: he, मुनिश्रेष्ठ: is the foremost of ascetics, एष: he, विग्रहवान् embodiment of, तप: asceticism, एष: he, नित्यम् always, धर्मपर: intent on virtuous means, एष: he, वीर्यस्य for ascetic energy, परायणम् the goal (or the supreme goal).
explanation: O Rama he is the foremost of ascetics, an embodiment of asceticism, always intent on virtue. He is the ultimate repository of ascetic energy".

shloka_text: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजा विरराम द्विजोत्तम:।।1.65.29।। शतानन्दवच: श्रुत्वा रामलक्ष्मणसन्निधौ। जनक: प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यमुवाच कुशिकात्मजम्।।1.65.30।।
translation: महातेजा: most brilliant, द्विजोत्तम: excellent among brahmins, एवम् thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, विरराम became silent, जनक: Janaka, रामलक्ष्मणसन्निधौ in the presence of Rama and Lakshmana, शतानन्द वच: words of Sadananda, शृत्वा having listened, प्राञ्जलि: with folded palms, कुशिकात्मजम् son of Kusika, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच spoke.
explanation: Having thus spoken, the most brilliant and best among brahmins (Satananda) became silent. In the presence of Rama and Lakshmana, Janaka listened to the words of Satananda. And with folded palms said to the son of Kushika (Viswamitra):

shloka_text: एवमुक्त्वा महातेजा विरराम द्विजोत्तम:।।1.65.29।। शतानन्दवच: श्रुत्वा रामलक्ष्मणसन्निधौ। जनक: प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यमुवाच कुशिकात्मजम्।।1.65.30।।
translation: महातेजा: most brilliant, द्विजोत्तम: excellent among brahmins, एवम् thus, उक्त्वा having spoken, विरराम became silent, जनक: Janaka, रामलक्ष्मणसन्निधौ in the presence of Rama and Lakshmana, शतानन्द वच: words of Sadananda, शृत्वा having listened, प्राञ्जलि: with folded palms, कुशिकात्मजम् son of Kusika, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच spoke.
explanation: Having thus spoken, the most brilliant and best among brahmins (Satananda) became silent. In the presence of Rama and Lakshmana, Janaka listened to the words of Satananda. And with folded palms said to the son of Kushika (Viswamitra):

shloka_text: धन्योऽस्म्यनुगृहीतोऽस्मि यस्य मे मुनिपुङ्गव। यज्ञं काकुत्स्थसहित: प्राप्तवानसि धार्मिक।।1.65.31।।
translation: धर्मिक O Righteous one, मुनिपुङ्गव O Preeminent among ascetics, काकुत्स्थसहित: accompanied by Rama and Lakshmana, यस्य मे for my, यज्ञम् sacrifice, प्रप्तवान् असि you have arrived, धन्य: अस्मि blessed I am, अनुगृहीत: अस्मि I am greatly favoured.
explanation: "O Righteous one O Preeminent among ascetics you have come to my sacrifice accompanied by the descendants of Kakustha (Rama and Lakshmana). I am  blessed by your presence and am   highly favoured.

shloka_text: पावितोऽहं त्वया ब्रह्मन् दर्शनेन महामुने। गुणा बहुविधा: प्राप्तास्तव सन्दर्शनान्मया।।1.65.32।।
translation: महामुने O Excellent ascetic, ब्रह्मन् O Brahman, त्वया by you, दर्शनेन with presence, अहम् I, पावित: sanctified, तव your, सन्दर्शनात् from your visit, मया by me, बहुविधा: various, गुणा: qualities, प्राप्ता: are obtained.
explanation: O Excellent ascetic O Brahmana I am sanctified with your presence. I have derived immense benefits from your visit.

shloka_text: विस्तरेण च ते ब्रह्मन् कीर्त्यमानं महत्तप:। श्रुतं मया महातेजो रामेण च महात्मना।।1.65.33।।
translation: महातेज: O Highly powerful, ब्रह्मन् Brahmarshi, विस्तरेण in detail, कीर्त्यमानम् being related, ते your, महत् great, तप: austerities, मया by me, महात्मना distinguished, रामेण च Rama, श्रुतम् has been heard.
explanation: O powerful  Brahmarshi distinguished Rama and I have heard your great austerities which were related in detail (by Satananda).

shloka_text: सदस्यै: प्राप्य च सद: श्रुतास्ते बहवो गुणा:। अप्रमेयं तपस्तुभ्यमप्रमेयं च ते बलम्।।1.65.34।। अप्रमेया गुणाश्चैव नित्यं ते कुशिकात्मज ।
translation: सदस्यै: by members of the assembly, सद: sacrifice, प्राप्य having reached, ते your, बहव: many, गुणा: virtues, श्रुता: have been heard, तुभ्यम् for you, तप: austerities, अप्रमेयम् immeasurable, ते your, बलम् power, अप्रमेयम् immeasurable, कुशिकात्मज O son of Kusika, Visvamitra, ते your, गुण: च एव virtues also, नित्यम् always, अप्रमेया: immeasurable.
explanation: Many of your virtues have been heard by the members of the assembly present at the  sacrifice. Your austerities are immeasurable, your power is immense. O Son of Kushika (Viswamitra), your virtues cannot be measured.

shloka_text: तृप्तिराश्चर्यभूतानां कथानां नास्ति मे विभो।।1.65.35।। कर्मकालो मुनिश्रेष्ठ लम्बते रविमण्डलम्।
translation: विभो: O Lord, आश्चर्यभूतानाम् forming wonders, कथानाम् pertaining to the deeds, मे to me, तृप्ति: satisfaction, नास्ति is not there, मुनिश्रेष्ठ O Excellent of ascetics, रविमण्डलम् the halo around the Sun, लम्बते is hanging down, कर्मकाल: (It is time for) evening ablutions.
explanation: O Lord I am never tired of listening to your marvellous deeds. O Excellent among ascetics the Sun has set and it is time for evening prayers.

shloka_text: श्व: प्रभाते महातेजो द्रष्टुमर्हसि मां पुन:।।1.65.36।। स्वागतं तपतां श्रेष्ठ मामनुज्ञातुमर्हसि।
translation: महातेज: O Sage possessing great austerities, श्व: tomorrow, प्रभाते at dawn, माम् me, पुन: again, द्रष्टुम् to see, अर्हसि behoves of you, तपताम् in reciting religious prayers, श्रेष्ठ excellent one, स्वागतम् welcome, माम् to me, अनुज्ञातुम् अर्हसि give me your consent to leave.
explanation: O Sage of great austerities come to me tomorrow at dawn. O Excellent ascetic welcome And allow me to leave".

shloka_text: तत: प्रभाते विमले कृतकर्मा नराधिप:। विश्वामित्रं महात्मानं आजुहाव सराघवम्।।1.66.1।।
translation: तत: thereafter, विमले in the pure light, प्रभाते of dawn, नराधिप: king, कृतकर्मा having performed daily devotions, सराघवम् together with two Raghavas, महात्मानम् magnanimous Visvamitra, आजुहाव invited.
explanation: The day dawned bright and clear when the king (Janaka) performed his daily routine rites and welcomed the great Viswamitra with the two Raghavas (Rama and Lakshmana).
comments: King Janaka honours Viswamitra, Rama and Lakshmana--narrates the story about the bow of Mahadeva--declares he would give Sita in marriage to Rama if he strings the bow.

shloka_text: तमर्चयित्वा धर्मात्मा शास्त्रदृष्टेन कर्मणा। राघवौ च महात्मानौ तदा वाक्यमुवाच ह।।1.66.2।।
translation: धर्मात्मा virtuous Janaka, तम् that, Visvamitra, महात्मानौ magnanimous, राघवौ च Rama and Lakshmana, शास्त्रदृष्टेन in accordance with scriptures, कर्मणा acts, अर्चयित्वा having paid homage, तदा then, वाक्यम् words, उवाच ह spoke.
explanation: The virtuous Janaka paid respects to Viswamitra and the highsouled Rama and Lakshmana in accordance with the sastras and spoke:

shloka_text: भगवन् स्वागतं तेऽस्तु किं करोमि तवानघ। भवानाज्ञापयतु मामाज्ञाप्यो भवता ह्यहम्।।1.66.3।।
translation: भगवन् O Venerable one, ते to you, स्वागतम् अस्तु welcome, अनघ O Sinless one, तव to you, किम् करोमि what shall I do, भवान् you, माम् me, आज्ञापयतु my command, अहम् I, भवता by you, आज्ञाप्य: हि worthy of being commanded.
explanation: "Welcome, O Venerable one O Irreproachable one what can I do for you? Worthy of being commanded, I seek your orders.

shloka_text: एवमुक्तस्स धर्मात्मा जनकेन महात्मना। प्रत्युवाच मुनिर्वीरं वाक्यं वाक्यविशारद:।।1.66.4।।
translation: महात्मना by the magnanimous, जनकेन by Janaka, एवम् thus, उक्त: having been spoken, धर्मात्मा virtuous, वाक्यविशारद: wellversed in speech, स: that, मुनि: ascetic, वीरम्  addressing that warrior, वाक्यम् words, प्रत्युवाच replied.
explanation: At the words of the magnanimous Janaka, the virtuous sage wellversed in speech replied to the heroic king:

shloka_text: पुत्रौ दशरथस्येमौ क्षत्रियौ लोकविश्रुतौ। द्रुष्टुकामौ धनु श्श्रेष्ठं यदेतत्वयि तिष्ठति।।1.66.5।।
translation: दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, पुत्रौ sons, क्षत्रियौ kshatriyas, लोकविश्रुतौ renowned in the world, इमौ these two, यत् धनु: श्रेष्ठम् that great bow,  त्वयि in you, तिष्ठति remaining, एतत् that one, द्रुष्टुकामौ are eager to see.
explanation: Dasaratha's sons, (Rama and Lakshmana), kshatriyas renowned in the world are eager to see that great bow in your possession.

shloka_text: एतद्दर्शय भद्रं ते कृतकामौ नृपात्मजौ। दर्शनादस्य धनुषो यथेष्टं प्रतियास्यत:।।1.66.6।।
translation: एतत् this bow, दर्शय show, ते भद्रं prosperity to you, अस्य धनुष: this bow's, दर्शनात् on seeing it, कृतकामौ having fulfilled their desire, नृपात्मजौ these two princes, यथेष्टम् as they wish, प्रतियास्यत: will return.
explanation: Be blessed. Show this great bow to the princes. This is their desire. Once it is fulfilled, they will go back.

shloka_text: एवमुक्तस्तु जनक: प्रत्युवाच महामुनिम्। श्रूयतामस्य धनुषो यदर्थमिह तिष्ठति।।1.66.7।।
translation: एवम् thus, उक्त: having been addressed, जनक: Janaka, महामुनिम् mighty ascetic, प्रत्युवाच replied, इह here, यदर्थम् what for, तिष्ठति deposited, अस्य this, धनुष: an account of bow, श्रूयताम् let it be heard.
explanation: Thus addressed by the mighty ascetic Janaka replied, "I shall tell you how this bow came to be deposited here".

shloka_text: देवरात इति ख्यातो निमेष्षष्ठो महीपति:। न्यासोऽयं तस्य भगवन् हस्ते दत्तो महात्मना।।1.66.8।।
translation: भगवन् O Adorable one,  निमे: from Nimi, षष्ठ: sixth one in generation, देवरात इति named Devarata, ख्यात: famous, महीपति: इति (was) a king, स: अयम् this bow, तस्य that king's, हस्ते in the hands, न्यास: in trust, महात्मना by exalted (Shiva), दत्त: given.
explanation: "O Adorable one there was a famous king named Devarata, sixth in line from Nimi. This bow was kept with him in trust by the exalted lord (Shiva).

shloka_text: दक्षयज्ञवधे पूर्वं धनुरायम्य वीर्यवान्। रुद्रस्तु त्रिदशान् रोषात्सलीलमिदमब्रवीत्।।1.66.9।।
translation: पूर्वम् formerly, दक्षयज्ञवधे at the time of destruction of Daksha's sacrifice, वीर्यवान् possessing great prowess, रुद्र: Rudra, धनु: bow, आयम्य lifting, त्रिदशान् addressing devatas, रोषात् from anger, सलीलम् sportively, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: Earlier at the time of destruction of Daksha's sacrifice, Rudra endowed with  great prowess lifted this bow sportively and spoke to the gods.

shloka_text: यस्माद्भागार्थिनो भागान्नाकल्पयत मे सुरा:। वराङ्गाणि महार्हाणि धनुषा शातयामि व:।।1.66.10।।
translation: सुरा: O Devatas, भागार्थिन: desiring your share, मे to me, यस्मात् for which reason, भागान् share, नाकल्पयत did not provide, व: your, महार्हाणि highly worthy, वराङ्गाणि beautiful  limbs, धनुषा with bow, शातयामि sever.
explanation: 'O gods in your anxiety to partake your share of the sacrifie, you have failed to provide mine in the sacrificial offerings. Therefore, I shall sever your jewelled heads and beautiful limbs with this bow'.

shloka_text: ततो विमनसस्सर्वे देवा वै मुनिपुङ्गव। प्रसादयन्ति देवेशं तेषां प्रीतोऽभवद्भव:।।1.66.11।।
translation: मुनिपुङ्गव O Eminent ascetic, तत: thereater, सर्वे all, देवा: devatas, विमनस: with dejected  minds, देवेशम् lord of devatas, Siva, प्रसादयन्ति propitiated, भव: Siva, तेषाम् in their matter, प्रीत: अभवत् was pleased.
explanation: "O Eminent ascetic thereafter all the gods with agitated minds propitiated lord of the gods, Siva and he was pleased with them.

shloka_text: प्रीतियुक्तस्स सर्वेषां ददौ तेषां महात्मनाम्। तदेतद्देवदेवस्य धनूरत्नं महात्मन:। न्यासभूतं तदा न्यस्तमस्माकं पूर्व के विभो।।1.66.12।।
translation: स: Maheswara, प्रीतियुक्त: wellpleased, तेषाम् महात्मनाम् with those magnanimous ones, ददौ gave, विभो O Lord, महात्मन: of the exalted, देवदेवस्य lord of devatas, Siva's, तत् एतत्  धनूरत्नम् that gem of weapons, तदा then, अस्माकम् our, पूर्वके with the ancestor, न्यासभूतम् in trust, न्यस्तम् deposited.
explanation: O Lord that gem of a bow belonging to Siva was given to the great gods who in turn got it deposited in trust with our ancestor.

shloka_text: अथ मे कृषत: क्षेत्रं लाङ्गूलादुत्थिता मया। क्षेत्रं शोधयता लब्धा नाम्ना सीतेति विश्रुता।।1.66.13।।
translation: अथ thereafter, मे my, क्षेत्रम् the sacrificial ground, कृषत: while I was ploughing, लाङ्गूलात् by the blade of plough, उत्थिता lifted, नाम्ना by name, सीतेति Sita, विश्रुता wellknown, क्षेत्रम् that sacrificial ground, शोधयता purifying, मया by me, लब्धा obtained.
explanation: Thereupon while I was ploughing and cleaing the (sacrificial) ground, Sita, a wellknown name, was lifted up by the blade of the plough. Thus she was obtained by me.

shloka_text: भूतलादुत्थिता सा तु व्यवर्धत ममात्मजा। वीर्यशुल्केति मे कन्या स्थापितेयमयोनिजा।।1.66.14।।
translation: भूतलात् from the earth, उत्थिता has arisen, सा she, मम my, आत्मजा daughter, व्यवर्धत grew, अयोनिजा not born through womb (without mother), इयम् this, कन्या this maiden, वीर्यशुल्का prowess as marriage present, मे by me, स्थापिता established.
explanation: Arisen from the earth and not from a mother's womb, she grew up as my daughter. I made a stipulation that (this shall be the means to win this maiden as a gift) this shall be given in marriage only to the prince whose prowess is fully tried.

shloka_text: भूतलादुत्थितां तां तु वर्धमानां ममात्मजाम्। वरयामासुरागम्य राजानो मुनिपुंगव।।1.66.15।।
translation: मुनिपुङ्गव O Eminent ascetic, भूतलात् from the earth, उत्थिताम् arisen, वर्धमानां growing, ताम् that, आत्मजाम् my daughter, राजान: kings, आगम्य having arrived, वरयामासु: had sought.
explanation: O Eminent ascetic arisen from the earth and reared as my daughter, she has been sought after in marriage by many princes.

shloka_text: तेषां वरयतां कन्यां सर्वेषां पृथिवीक्षिताम्। वीर्यशुल्केति भगवन् न ददामि सुतामहम्।।1.66.16।।
translation: भगवन् O Worshipful one, तेषाम् सर्वेषाम् for all those, पृथिवीक्षिताम् monarchs, कन्याम् maiden,  वरयताम् seeking, वीर्यशुल्केति prowess as marriage offer, so, अहम् I, सुताम् daughter, न ददामि do not give.
explanation: O Worshipful one all those monarchs sought this maiden but I did not offer my daughter saying that the 'marriage offer' could be made only through the tried and tested prowess of a suitor.

shloka_text: ततस्सर्वे नृपतय स्समेत्य मुनिपुंगव। मिथिलामभ्युपागम्य वीर्यजिज्ञासवस्तदा।।1.66.17।।
translation: मुनिपुङ्गव O Preeminent among ascetics, तत: afterwards, सर्वे all, नृपतय: kings, समेत्य met together, तदा then, वीर्यजिज्ञासव: desirous of testing their prowess, मिथिलाम् to  Mithila, अभ्युपागम्य having come.
explanation: O Preeminent among ascetics thereafter many kings together came to Mithila to test their prowess.

shloka_text: तेषां जिज्ञासमानानां वीर्यं धनुरुपाहृतम्। न शेकुर्ग्रहणे तस्य धनुषस्तोलनेऽपि वा।।1.66.18।।
translation: वीर्यम् their strength, जिज्ञासमानानाम् of those who were curious to know, तेषाम् for them, धनु: bow, उपाहृतम् has been brought, तस्य that, धनुष: bow's, ग्रहणे in grasp, तोलनेऽपि in lifting (and measuring its weight), न शेकु: not competent.
explanation: The bow was brought and placed before those who were curious to test their strength but none was able to grasp or lift the bow.

shloka_text: तेषां वीर्यवतां वीर्यमल्पं ज्ञात्वा महामुने । प्रत्याख्याता नृपतयस्तन्निबोध तपोधन।।1.66.19।।
translation: महामुने O Mighty ascetic, तेषाम् वीर्यवताम् of those mighty kings', वीर्यम् strength, अल्पम् little, ज्ञात्वा after recognising, नृपतय: kings, प्रत्याख्याता: have been rejected, तपोधन O Maharshi, तत् that point, निबोध come to know.
explanation: O great ascetic I knew those mighty kings had little strength, so rejected them.

shloka_text: तत: परमकोपेन राजानो नृपपुङ्गव। न्यरुंधन्मिथिलां सर्वे वीर्यसंदेहमागता:।।1.66.20।।
translation: मुनिपुङ्गव O Mighty ascetic, तत: thereafter, सर्वे all, राजान: kings, वीर्यसन्देहम् entertaining doubt about their strength, आगता: have come, परमकोपेन inflammed with anger, मिथिलाम् Mithila, न्यरुन्धन् surrounded.
explanation: O Mighty ascetic, thereafter all the kings doubting their own strength in stringing the bow were inflamed with anger and laid siege on Mithila.

shloka_text: आत्मानमवधूतं ते विज्ञाय नृपपुङ्गवा:। रोषेण महताऽऽविष्टा: पीडयन्मिथिलां पुरीम्।।1.66.21।।
translation: ते those, नृपपुङ्गवा: eminent kings, आत्मानम् them, अवधूतम् have been insulted, विज्ञाय knowing, महता with great, रोषेण (कोपेन) with anger, आविष्टा: filled, मिथिलां पुरीम् city of Mithila, पीडयन् while tormenting.
explanation: Those eminent kings felt humiliated. Inflamed with anger, they tormented the city of Mithila.

shloka_text: ततस्संवत्सरे पूर्णे क्षयं यातानि सर्वश:। साधनानि मुनिश्रेष्ठ ततोऽहं भृशदु:खित:।।1.66.22।।
translation: मुनिश्रेष्ठ O Best among ascetics, तत: afterwards, संवत्सरे when one year, पूर्णे was completed, सर्वश: from every where, साधनानि all means of living, क्षयं यातानि were deteriorated, तत: thereafter, अहम् I, भृशदु:खित: was greatly aggrieved.
explanation: O Best among ascetics thus one year passed. Everywhere in the city all the means of living were exhausted. I felt deeply sad over this situation.

shloka_text: ततो देवगणान् सर्वान् तपसाऽहं प्रसादयम्। ददुश्च परमप्रीता श्चतुरङ्गबलं सुरा:।।1.66.23।।
translation: तत: thereafter, अहम् I, तपसा by austerities, सर्वान् all, देवगणान् multitude of devatas, प्रसादयम् propitiated them, सुरा: devatas, परमप्रीता: were highly pleased, चतुरङ्गबलम् (divine) army of four divisions, ददु: gave.
explanation: Thereafter, I propitiated the gods by my austerities. Highly pleased, they gave me an army of four divisions (chariots, elephants, horses and infantry ).

shloka_text: ततो भग्ना नृपतयो हन्यमाना दिशो ययु:। अवीर्या वीर्यसन्दिग्धा स्सामात्या: पापकर्मण:।।1.66.24।।
translation: तत: thereafter, अवीर्या: those without energy, वीर्यसन्दिग्धा: doubtful about their energy, पापकर्मण: the wicked, नृपतय: kings, हन्यमाना: were being beaten, भग्ना: broken, सामात्या: with their ministers, दिश: in different directions, ययु: fled away.
explanation: Then those wicked kings who were exhausted were doubtful about their energy. They were beaten and defeated. They fled away along with their ministers in different directions.

shloka_text: तदेतन्मुनिशार्दूल धनु: परमभास्वरम्। रामलक्ष्मणयोश्चापि दर्शयिष्यामि सुव्रत।।1.66.25।।
translation: सुव्रत one faithful to vows, मुनिशार्दूल O Best among ascetics, तत् एतत् परमभास्वरम् his highly effulgent, धनु: bow, रामलक्ष्मणयोश्चापि for Rama and Lakshmana also, दर्शयिष्यामि will show.
explanation: O Sage you are a tiger among asceties, you are faithful to your vows, I shall show this effulgent bow to your Rama and Lakshmana .

shloka_text: यद्यस्य धनुषो राम: कुर्यादारोपणं मुने। सुतामयोनिजां सीतां दद्यां दाशरथेरहम्।।1.66.26।।
translation: मुने O Sage, राम: Rama, अस्य this, धनुष: bow's, आरोपणम् lifting, कुर्याद्यदि if he could do, अयोनिजाम् this girl born without a mother, सुताम् daughter, सीताम् Sita, अहम् I, दाशरथे: for Rama, दद्याम् shall give.
explanation: O Sage if Rama could lift and string this bow I shall give my daughter Sita, not born from a woman, to him (son of Dasaratha)". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे षट्षष्टितमस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the sixtysixth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: . जनकस्य वचश्श्रुत्वा विश्वामित्रो महामुनि: । धनुर्दर्शय रामाय इति होवाच पार्थिवम्।।1.67.1।।
translation: महामुनि: great ascestic, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, जनकस्य Janaka's, वच: words, शृत्वा having listened, रामाय for Rama, धनु: bow, दर्शय show, इति saying so, पार्थिवम् addressing king, उवाच ह spoke.
explanation: At the words of Janaka, great ascetic Viswamitra said to the king, "Let the bow be shown to Rama".
comments: Rama strings the bow and breaks-- Janaka  sends counsellors to Ayodhya to bring king Dasaratha

shloka_text: ततस्स राजा जनक: सामन्तान्व्यादिदेश ह। धनुरानीयतां दिव्यं गन्धमाल्यविभूषितम्।।1.67.2।।
translation: तत: thereafter, स: राजा that king, जनक: Janaka, सामन्तान् feudatories, व्यादिदेश ह ordered, गन्धमाल्यविभूषितम् adorned with flowers and sandalwood, दिव्यम् divine, धनु: bow, आनीयताम् let it be brought.
explanation: Thereafter king Janaka said to his feudatories, "Let the divine bow adorned with flowers and sandalpaste be brought".

shloka_text: जनकेन समादिष्टा: सचिवा प्राविशन् पुरीम्। तद्धनु: पुरत: कृत्वा निर्जग्मु: पार्थिवाज्ञया।।1.67.3।।
translation: जनकेन by the king Janaka, समादिष्टा: commanded, सचिवा: ministers, पुरीम् city, प्राविशन् entered, तद्धनु: that bow, पार्थिवाज्ञया by the orders of king, पुरत: in their front, कृत्वा keeping, निर्जग्मु: departed.
explanation: Commanded by (king) Janaka, the ministers went to the city, put the bow in front of them and carried it as per the orders of the king.

shloka_text: नृणां शतानि पञ्चाशद्व्यायतानां महात्मनाम्। मञ्जूषामष्टचक्रां तां समूहुस्ते कथञ्चन।।1.67.4।।
translation: महात्मनाम् possessing great strength, व्यायतानाम् of stalwarts, नृणाम् of men, पञ्चाशत् fifty, शतानि hundreds, अष्टचक्राम् eight wheeled cart, मञ्जूषाम् box, समूहु: had drawn, ते they, ताम् that cart, कथञ्चन with great difficulty (had drawn).
explanation: Five thousand mighty stalwarts drew with great difficulty the eightwheeled cart on which the bow was placed in a box.

shloka_text: तामादाय तु मञ्जूषामायसीं यत्र तद्धनु:। सुरोपमं ते जनकमूचुर्नृपतिमन्त्रिण:।।1.67.5।।
translation: ते नृपतिमन्त्रिण: the counsellors of king, यत्र wherever, तत् धनु: that bow (was placed), ताम्  आयसीम् that iron, मञ्जूषाम् box, आदाय having brought, सुरोपमम् equal to devatas,जनकम् addressing Janaka, ऊचु: spoke.
explanation: The counsellors of the king, brought the iron casket containing the bow and said these words to Janaka comparable to a celestial:

shloka_text: इदं धनुर्वरं राजन् पूजितं सर्वराजभि:। मिथिलाधिप राजेन्द्र दर्शनीयं यदिच्छसि।।1.67.6।।
translation: राजेन्द्र O Most revered of kings, मिथिलाधिप O Lord of Mithila, राजन् O king, यत् which one, दर्शनीयम् to be shown, इच्छसि you are desiring, सर्वराजभि: by all kings, पूजितम् worshipped, धनुर्वरम् excellent bow, इदम् this one.
explanation: 'O Indra among kings O lord of Mithila here is the great bow, worshipped by all kings, which you intend to show (to Rama)'.

shloka_text: तेषां नृपो वच: श्रुत्वा कृताञ्जलिरभाषत। विश्वामित्रं महात्मानं तौ चोभौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।।1.67.7।।
translation: नृप: king, तेषाम् their, वच: words, श्रुत्वा having listened, कृताञ्जलि: with folded palms, महात्मानम् magnanimous, विश्वामित्रम् Viswamitra, तौ उभौ those two, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, अभाषत said.
explanation: Having heard this, the king with folded hands said to the great soul Viswamitra sitting with the two princes Rama and Lakshmana:

shloka_text: इदं धनुर्वरं ब्रह्मन् जनकैरभिपूजितम्। राजभिश्च महावीर्यै: अशक्तै: पूरितुं पुरा।।1.67.8।।
translation: ब्रह्मन् O Brahman, जनकै: by kings of Nimi dynasty, पुरा in the olden days, पूरितुम् to string it, अशक्तै: by being incapable, महावीर्यै: by those possessing great prowess, राजभिश्च by kings also, अभिपूजितम् having been worshipped, धनुर्वरम् famed bow, इदम् this one (is presented here.)
explanation: "O Brahman in the olden days, this great bow was worshipped by my forefathers. Powerful kings failed to string this bow.

shloka_text: नैतत्सुरगणास्सर्वे नासुरा न च राक्षसा:। गन्धर्वयक्षप्रवरा: सकिन्नरमहोरगा:।।1.67.9।।
translation: एतत् (for wielding ) this, सर्वे all, सुरगणा: hosts of devatas, न were not capable, असुरा: asuras, न not capable, राक्षसा: rakhasas, सकिन्नरमहोरगा: along with kinnaras and great serpents, गन्धर्वयक्षप्रवरा: best of gandharvas and yakshas, न not capable.
explanation: Hosts of devatas, asuras, rakhasas, kinnaras and great serpents, the best of gandharvas and yakshas, also failed (to wield this bow).

shloka_text: क्व गतिर्मानुषाणां च धनुषोऽस्य प्रपूरणे। आरोपणे समायोगे वेपने तोलनेऽपि वा।।1.67.10।।
translation: अस्य this bow's, प्रपूरणे to stretch, आरोपणे to string, समायोगे in fixing the arrow, वेपने to pull the string, तोलनेऽपि वा to lift and weigh, मानुषाणाम् for mortals, गति: course, क्व where?
explanation: How then can men bend, string, fix the arrow, pull the string and lift it?

shloka_text: तदेतद्धनुषां श्रेष्ठमानीतं मुनिपुङ्गव। दर्शयैतन्महाभाग अनयो: राजपुत्रयो:।।1.67.11।।
translation: मुनिपुङ्गव O Eminent ascetic, तत् such, एतत् this, धनुषाम् among bows, श्रेष्ठम् excellent  one, आनीतम् is brought, महाभाग O Highly fortunate one, एतत् this, अनयो: राजपुत्रयो: for these two princes, दर्शय show it.
explanation: O Eminent ascetic such heaviest bow is brought here, O Highly accomplished sage show this to the two princes".

shloka_text: विश्वामित्रस्तु धर्मात्मा श्रुत्वा जनकभाषितम्। वत्स राम धनु: पश्य इति राघवमब्रवीत्।।1.67.12।।
translation: धर्मात्मा righteous, विश्वामित्रस्तु Visvamitra on his part, जनकभाषितम् words of Janaka, श्रुत्वा having heard, वत्स O Child, राम O Rama, धनु: bow, पश्य see, इति saying so, राघवम् addressing Rama, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: Having heard the words of Janaka, the righteous Viswamitra said: "O Child O Descendant of Raghu look at this bow".

shloka_text: ब्रह्मर्षेर्वचनाद्रामो यत्र तिष्ठति तद्धनु:। मञ्जूषां तामपावृत्य दृष्ट्वा धनुरथाब्रवीत्।।1.67.13।।
translation: राम: Rama, ब्रह्मर्षे: Brahmarshi's, वचनात् by the words, तत् धनु: that bow, यत्र wherever, तिष्ठति is placed, ताम् that, मञ्जूषाम् box, अपावृत्य having opened, धनु: bow, दृष्ट्वा having seen, अथ thereater, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: At the words of the great rishi Viswamitra, Rama opened the casket, beheld  the bow and said:

shloka_text: इदं धनुर्वरं ब्रह्मन् संस्पृशामीह पाणिना। यत्नवांश्च भविष्यामि तोलने पूरणेऽपि वा।।1.67.14।।
translation: ब्रह्मन् O Brahmarshi, इह now, इदम् धनुर्वरम् this excellent bow, पाणिना with hand, संस्पृशामि  I shall touch, तोलने in raising (weighing ), पूरणेऽपि वा to string it, यत्नवान् भविष्यामि I shall endeavour.
explanation: "O Brahmarshi, shall I touch this great bow with my hands lift and string it".

shloka_text: बाढमित्येव तं राजा मुनिश्च समभाषत। लीलया स धनुर्मध्ये जग्राह वचनान्मुने:।।1.67.15।
translation: राजा king, मुनिश्च and also rishi, बाढम् इत्येव "Be it so" thus only, तम् addressing Rama, समभाषत spoke, स: Rama, मुने: rishi's, वचनात् from words, धनु: bow, मध्ये in the middle, लीलया with ease, जग्राह took hold of.
explanation: The king as also the rishi said "Be it so". At the words of the sage (Viswamitra), he (Rama) took hold of the bow by the its middle with ease:

shloka_text: पश्यतां नृपसहस्राणां बहूनां रघुनन्दन: । आरोपयत्स धर्मात्मा सलीलमिव तद्धनु:।।1.67.16।।
translation: धर्मात्मा virtuous, स: that, रघुनन्दन: Rama, बहूनाम् of several, नृपसहस्राणाम् thousands of men, पश्यताम् while seeing, तत् धनु: that bow, सलीलमिव as though with ease, आरोपयत्  fixed the string and drew it.
explanation: Virtuous Rama, the delight of the Raghus, in the presence of several thousands of men fixed the string to the bow and drew it as though with ease.

shloka_text: आरोपयित्वा धर्मात्मा पूरयामास तद्धनु:। तद्बभञ्ज धनुर्मध्ये नरश्रेष्ठो महायशा:।।1.67.17।।
translation: धर्मात्मा magnanimous, तत् धनु: that bow, आरोपयित्वा asfter stringing, पूरयामास drew it with a twang, महायशा: highly famous, नरश्रेष्ठ: best among men, तत् धनु: that bow, मध्ये in the middle, बभञ्ज broke.
explanation: Rama, the best among men, righteous and famous lifted the bow. Stringing it with a twang he drew it and broke it into two in the middle.

shloka_text: तस्य शब्दो महानासीत् निर्घातसमनिस्वन:। भूमिकम्पश्च सुमहान् पर्वतस्येव दीर्यत:।।1.67.18।।
translation: तस्य its, शब्द: sound, निर्घातसमनिस्वन: equalled to  the clap of a thunder, महान् great, आसीत् became, पर्वतस्य of a mountain, दीर्यत: as if splitting, सुमहान् great, भूमिकम्पश्च trembling of the earth.
explanation: It generated a loud sound like the clap of thunder, like the trembling of the earth and the splitting of a mountain.

shloka_text: निपेतुश्च नरा स्सर्वे तेन शब्देन मोहिता:। वर्जयित्वा मुनिवरं राजानं तौ च राघवौ।।1.67.19।।
translation: तेन शब्देन by that sound, मोहिता: fainted, मुनिवरम् best of ascetics, राजानम् king, तौ राघवौ  च the two Raghavas, वर्जयित्वा leaving, सर्वे all, नरा: men, निपेतु: fell down.
explanation: On hearing the sound, except Janaka, Viswamitra and the two raghavas (Rama and Lakshmana) the rest of the people around fell down and fainted.

shloka_text: प्रत्याश्वस्ते जने तस्मिन्राजा विगतसाध्वस:। उवाच प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यं वाक्यज्ञो मुनिपुङ्गवम्।।1.67.20।।
translation: तस्मिन् जने when those people, प्रत्याश्वस्ते were comforted, वाक्यज्ञ: knower of meaning of words, राजा king, विगतसाध्वस: without any apprehension, प्राञ्जलि: with folded palms, मुनिपुङ्गवम् eminent ascetic, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said:
explanation: When the people recovered the king skilful in the use  of words addressed the eminent ascetic  without apprehension with folded palms in the following words:

shloka_text: भगवन् दृष्टवीर्यो मे रामो दशरथात्मज:। अत्यद्भुतमचिन्त्यं च न तर्कितमिदं मया।।1.67.21।।
translation: भगवन् O Worshipful one, दशरथात्मज: son of Dasatha, राम: Rama, मे to me, दृष्टवीर्य: having prowess, अत्यद्भुतम् marvellous, अचिन्त्यं च unimaginable, इदं this, मया by me, न तर्कितम् not conjectured.
explanation: "O Worshipful one I have witnessed the prowess of Rama, son of Dasaratha. I had not imagined that this marvellous feat could be ever accomplished.

shloka_text: जनकानां कुले कीर्तिमाहरिष्यति मे सुता। सीता भर्तारमासाद्य रामं दशरथात्मजम्।।1.67.22।।
translation: मे my, सुता daughter, सीता Sita, दशरथात्मजम् son of Dasaratha, रामम् Rama, भर्तारम् as husband, आसाद्य after obtaining, जनकानाम् of Janaka's, कुले dynastry, कीर्तिम् glory, आहरिष्यति will bring.
explanation: By receiving Rama, son of Dasaratha, as her husband, my daughter Sita will bring glory to my dynasty.

shloka_text: मम सत्या प्रतिज्ञा च वीर्यशुल्केति कौशिक। सीता प्राणैर्बहुमता देया रामाय मे सुता।।1.67.23।।
translation: कौशिक O Son of Kusika, वीर्यशुल्केति as a reward of prowess, मम my, प्रतिज्ञा च vow also, सत्या has become true, प्राणै: more than vital life, बहुमता valued, मे my, सुता daughter, सीता Sita, रामाय for Rama, देया fit to given.
explanation: O Son of Kausika I announce Sita to be the 'Reward of prowess'. My vow has come true. She is more valuable than my life and fit to be given to Rama.

shloka_text: भवतोऽनुमते ब्रह्मन् शीघ्रं गच्छन्तु मन्त्रिण:। मम कौशिक भद्रं ते अयोध्यां त्वरिता रथै:।।1.67.24।।
translation: ब्रह्मन् O Brahman, कौशिक Kausika, भवत: your, अनुमते with the consent, मन्त्रिण: ministers, त्वरिता: hastily, रथै: in chariots, अयोध्याम् towards Ayodhya, शीघ्रम् immediately, गच्छन्तु may  go, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you.
explanation: O Brahmarshi Kausika, be blessed With your consent my ministers will take the chariots to Ayodhya immediately.

shloka_text: राजानं प्रश्रितैर्वाक्यैरानयन्तु पुरं मम। प्रदानं वीर्यशुल्काया: कथयन्तु च सर्वश:।।1.67.25।।
translation: वीर्यशुल्काया: Sita, the reward of prowess, प्रदानम् for offering to Rama, सर्वश: in detail, कथयन्तु they may be communicated, प्रश्रितै: with reverential, वाक्यै: words, राजानम् king Dasaratha, मम my, पुरम् city, आनयन्तु bring him here.
explanation: That Sita, the reward of prowess is to be given to Rama be reventially communicated in detail to king Dasaratha and he may be conveyed here.

shloka_text: मुनिगुप्तौ च काकुत्स्थौ कथयन्तु नृपाय वै। प्रीयमाणं तु राजानमानयन्तु सुशीघ्रगा:।।1.67.26।।
translation: काकुत्स्थौ Rama and Lakshmana, मुनिगुप्तौ protected by sage Visvamitra, नृपाय for king, कथयन्तु be informed, सुशीघ्रगा: men who can go with great speed, प्रीयमाणम् delighted, राजानम् king, आनयन्तु bring.
explanation: The welfare of the descendant of Kausika (Rama and Lakshmana) under the protection of sage (Viswamitra) be reported to the king. The king who will be happy to hear this be brought here by swiftfooted men".

shloka_text: कौशिकश्च तथेत्याह राजा चाभाष्य मन्त्रिण:।।1.67.27।। अयोध्यां प्रेषयामास धर्मात्मा कृतशासनान्। यथावृत्तं समाख्यातुमानेतुं च नृपं तदा।।1.67.28।।
translation: कौशिकश्च Visvamitra also, तथेति "So be it " thus, आह said, धर्मात्मा virtuous, राजा च king also, मन्त्रिण: ministers, आभाष्य having consulted, तदा then, यथावृत्तम् as it happened, समाख्यातुम् to communicate, नृपम् to the king, आनेतुं च and to bring him, कृतशासनान् counsellors who took orders (from him), अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, प्रेषयामास sent forth.
explanation: The son of Kausika (Viswamitra) also said, "So be it". The virtuous king, having consulted his ministers, despatched counsellors to Ayodhya to communicate to king Dasaratha all that had taken place and bring him (to Mithila). इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे सप्तषष्टितमस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the sixtyseventh sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: जनकेन समादिष्टा दूतास्ते क्लान्तवाहना:। त्रिरात्रमुषिता मार्गे तेऽयोध्यां प्राविशन् पुरीम्।।1.68.1।।
translation: जनकेन by Janaka, समादिष्टा: commanded by, ते they, दूता: messengers, मार्गे on the way, त्रिरात्रम् three nights, उषिताः had spent, क्लान्तवाहना: with their horses tired, अयोध्यां पुरीम् city of Ayodhya, प्राविशन् entered.
explanation: Commanded by Janaka the messengers travelled for three days, rested for three nights on the way and entered the city of Ayodhya along with their horses tired.
comments: After receiving the message from Janaka, king Dasaratha accompanied by his ministers arrives at Mithila.

shloka_text: राज्ञो भवनमासाद्य द्वारस्थानिदमब्रुवन्। शीघ्रं निवेद्यतां राज्ञे दूतान्नो जनकस्य च।।1.68.2।।
translation: राज्ञ: king's, भवनम् palace, आसाद्य having reached, द्वारस्थान् addressing the doorkeepers,  इदम् these words, अब्रुवन् spoke, जनकस्य Janaka's, दूतान् messengers, न: about us, शीघ्रम् immediately, राज्ञे for king, निवेद्यताम् be informed.
explanation: Reaching the king's palace the messengers said to the doorkeepers, "Let king Dasaratha be immediately informed that the messengers from Janaka have come".

shloka_text: इत्युक्ता द्वारपालास्ते राघवाय न्यवेदयन्। ते राजवचनाद्दूता राजवेश्मप्रवेशिता:। ददृशुर्देवसङ्काशं वृद्धं दशरथं नृपम्।।1.68.3।।
translation: इत्युक्ताः having (informed) spoken by them, द्वारपाला: doorkeepers, राघवाय for Dasaratha, न्यवेदयन् informed, ते दूता: those messengers, राजवचनात् obeying the words of king, राजवेश्म royal palace, प्रवेशिता: having been made to enter, देवसङ्काशम् resembling devatas, वृद्धम् aged, दशरथं नृपम् king Dasaratha, ददृशु: beheld.
explanation: Having heard their words, the doorkeepers informed the descendant of Raghu (king Dasaratha). Thereafter, with the the king's permission, the messengers entered the royal palace  and beheld the aged king Dasaratha who shone like a god.

shloka_text: बद्धाञ्जलिपुटा स्सर्वे दूता विगतसाध्वसा:। राजानं प्रयता वाक्यमब्रुवन्मधुराक्षरम्।।1.68.4।।
translation: सर्वे all, दूता: the messengers, बद्धाञ्जलिपुटा: folding the hands together in supplication, विगतसाध्वसा: freed from apprehensions, प्रयता: in reverence, राजानम् addressing king, मधुराक्षरम् in sweet (complimentary ), वाक्यम् words, अब्रुवन् said:
explanation: All the messengers, hands folded free from apprehensions, reverentially addressed the king in sweet words.

shloka_text: मैथिलो जनको राजा साग्निहोत्रपुरस्कृतम् । कुशलं चाव्ययं चैव सोपाध्यायपुरोहितम्।।1.68.5।। मुहुर्मुहुर्मधुरया स्नेहसंयुक्तया गिरा। जनकस्त्वां महाराज पृच्छते सपुरस्सरम्।।1.68.6।।
translation: महाराज O Great monarch, मैथिल: Mithila's lord, जनक: राजा king Janaka, साग्निहोत्रपुरस्कृतम् treating with sacred fire and oblations with resepect by placing the sacred fire in the forefront, सोपाध्यायपुरोहितम् with spiritual preceptors and priests, सपुरस्सरम् with attendants ahead of you, त्वाम् you, मधुरया sweet, स्नेहसंयुक्तया endowed with affection, गिरा with words, कुशलं च welfare, अव्ययं चैव imperishability, मुहु: महुः again and again, पृच्छते is enquiring.
explanation: "O Great monarch Mithila's lord, king Janaka, with the sacred fire in front again and again enquires about your health and the spiritual wellbeing of your preceptors, priests and attendants in words filled with sweetness and affection.

shloka_text: मैथिलो जनको राजा साग्निहोत्रपुरस्कृतम् । कुशलं चाव्ययं चैव सोपाध्यायपुरोहितम्।।1.68.5।। मुहुर्मुहुर्मधुरया स्नेहसंयुक्तया गिरा। जनकस्त्वां महाराज पृच्छते सपुरस्सरम्।।1.68.6।।
translation: महाराज O Great monarch, मैथिल: Mithila's lord, जनक: राजा king Janaka, साग्निहोत्रपुरस्कृतम् treating with sacred fire and oblations with resepect by placing the sacred fire in the forefront, सोपाध्यायपुरोहितम् with spiritual preceptors and priests, सपुरस्सरम् with attendants ahead of you, त्वाम् you, मधुरया sweet, स्नेहसंयुक्तया endowed with affection, गिरा with words, कुशलं च welfare, अव्ययं चैव imperishability, मुहु: महुः again and again, पृच्छते is enquiring.
explanation: "O Great monarch Mithila's lord, king Janaka, with the sacred fire in front again and again enquires about your health and the spiritual wellbeing of your preceptors, priests and attendants in words filled with sweetness and affection.

shloka_text: पृष्ट्वा कुशलमव्यग्रं वैदेहो मिथिलाधिप:। कौशिकानुमते वाक्यं भवन्तमिदमब्रवीत्।।1.68.7।।
translation: मिथिलाधिप: king of Mithila, वैदेह: Janaka, अव्यग्रम् diligently, कुशलम् welfare, पृष्ट्वा having ascertained, कौशिकानुमते with the permission of Viswamitra, भवन्तम् to you, इदम् this, वाक्यम् word, अब्रवीत् said.
explanation: Janaka, the king of Mithila with the enquiry about your welfare, with the permission of the son of Kausika (Viswamitra) sends you this message:

shloka_text: पूर्वं प्रतिज्ञा विदिता वीर्यशुल्का ममात्मजा। राजानश्च कृतामर्षानिर्वीर्या विमुखीकृता:।।1.68.8।।
translation: मम आत्मजा my daughter, वीर्यशुल्का as a reward of prowess, पूर्वम् formerly, प्रतिज्ञा vow, विदिता known to everybody, कृतामर्षा: made indignant, निर्वीर्या: powerless, राजान: kings also, विमुखीकृता: were made to turn back.
explanation: O King It is wellknown that formerly I had vowed to give my daughter to a groom as a reward for prowess. Disappointed when proved powerless, the kings became indignant and opposed me.

shloka_text: सेयं मम सुता राजन् विश्वामित्रपुरस्सरै:। यदृच्छयागतैर्वीरैर्निर्जिता तव पुत्रकै:।।1.68.9।।
translation: राजन् O King, सा इयम् that this, मम my, सुता daughter, विश्वामित्रपुरस्सरै: with Viswamitra at the forefront ahead, यदृच्छया casually, आगतै: who had come, तव your, वीरै: heroic ones, पुत्रकै: by your sons, निर्जिता has been won.
explanation: O King that this daughter of mine has been won by your heroic son Rama  who has come here casually led by Viswamitra.

shloka_text: तच्च राजन् धनुर्दिव्यं मध्ये भग्नं महात्मना। रामेण हि महाराज महत्यां जनसंसदि।।1.68.10।।
translation: महाराज O Great among kings, राजन् Dasaratha, तत् that, दिव्यम् divine, धनु: bow, महत्याम् in the illimitable glory, जनसंसदि in the assembly of people, महात्मना by the magnanimous, रामेण by Rama, मध्ये in the middle, भग्नम् is broken.
explanation: O Great king, Dasaratha the divine bow with its limitless glory was broken in the middle by the great self Rama in the assembly of people.

shloka_text: अस्मै देया मया सीता वीर्यशुल्का महात्मने। प्रतिज्ञां कर्तुमिच्छामि तदनुज्ञातुमर्हसि।।1.68.11।।
translation: वीर्यशुल्का the 'Reward for Prowess', सीता Sita, अस्मै to this, महात्मने eminent one, मया by me, देया fit to be given, प्रतिज्ञाम् vow, कर्तुम् to fufill, इच्छामि desiring, तत् for that reason, अनुज्ञातुम् to give your consent, अर्हसि behoves of you.
explanation: Sita is fit to be given in marriage to this eminent Rama as a reward for his prowess. I request you to give your consent to fulfil my vow.

shloka_text: सोपाध्यायो महाराज पुरोहितपुरस्सर:। शीघ्रमागच्छ भद्रं ते द्रष्टुमर्हसि राघवौ ।।1.68.12।।
translation: महाराज O Mighty king, सोपाध्याय: with your preceptors, पुरोहितपुरस्सर: with official priest walking ahead, शीघ्रम् speedily, आगच्छ come here, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, राघवौ Rama   and Lakshmana, द्रष्टुम् to behold, अर्हसि behoves of you.
explanation: O Mighty king be blessed. Come here soon with your preceptors and priest. You ought to be reumitd with Rama amd Lakshmana.

shloka_text: प्रीतिं च मम राजेन्द्र निर्वर्तयितुमर्हसि। पुत्रयोरुभयोरेव प्रीतिं त्वमपि लप्स्यसे।।1.68.13।।
translation: राजेन्द्र O Indra among kings, मम for me, प्रीतिम् pleasure, निर्वर्तयितुम् to cause, अर्हसि it behoves of you, त्वमपि you also, उभयो: both of your, पुत्रयो: sons, प्रीतिम् delight, लप्स्यसे will obtain.
explanation: O Indra among kings you will not only bring me pleasure, you will also be happy to see your sons.

shloka_text: एवं विदेहाधिपतिर्मधुरं वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।1.68.14।। विश्वामित्राभ्यनुज्ञात श्शतानन्दमते स्थित:। इत्युक्त्वा विरता दूता राजगौरवशङ्किता:।।1.68.15।।
translation: विदेहाधिपति: king of Videha, विश्वामित्राभ्यनुज्ञात: with Viwsamitra's approval, शतानन्दमते in line with Satananda's thinking, स्थित: staying, एवम् thus, मधुरम् sweet, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke, दूता: messengers, इति उक्त्वा having thus spoken, राजगौरवशङ्किता: fearing out of respect for king, विरता: concluded.
explanation: The king of Videha (Janaka) with Viswamitra's approval and in line with Satananda's thinking has conveyed these sweet words". The messengers having said so concluded  out of respect for their king (afraid that they might look overtalkative).

shloka_text: एवं विदेहाधिपतिर्मधुरं वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।1.68.14।। विश्वामित्राभ्यनुज्ञात श्शतानन्दमते स्थित:। इत्युक्त्वा विरता दूता राजगौरवशङ्किता:।।1.68.15।।
translation: विदेहाधिपति: king of Videha, विश्वामित्राभ्यनुज्ञात: with Viwsamitra's approval, शतानन्दमते in line with Satananda's thinking, स्थित: staying, एवम् thus, मधुरम् sweet, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke, दूता: messengers, इति उक्त्वा having thus spoken, राजगौरवशङ्किता: fearing out of respect for king, विरता: concluded.
explanation: The king of Videha (Janaka) with Viswamitra's approval and in line with Satananda's thinking has conveyed these sweet words". The messengers having said so concluded  out of respect for their king (afraid that they might look overtalkative).

shloka_text: दूतवाक्यं च तच्छ्रुत्वा राजा परमहर्षित:। वसिष्ठं वामदेवं च मन्त्रिणोऽन्यांश्च सोऽब्रवीत्।।1.68.16।।
translation: स: राजा that king, तत् that, दूतवाक्यम् words of messengers, श्रुत्वा having listened, परमहर्षित: exceedingly rejoiced, वसिष्ठम् Vasishta, वामदेवम् Vamadeva, अन्यान् other, मन्त्रिणश्च ministers, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: Exceedingly happy to hear the words of the messengers, the king said to Vasishta, Vamadeva and other ministers.

shloka_text: गुप्त: कुशिकपुत्रेण कौसल्यानन्दवर्धन:। लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा विदेहेषु वसत्यसौ।।1.68.17।।
translation: असौ this, कौसल्यानन्दवर्धन: enhancing the joy of Kausalya, कुशिकपुत्रेण by the son of Kusika, Visvamitra, गुप्त: protected, भ्रात्रा along with brother Lakshmana, विदेहेषु in the country of Videha, वसति living.
explanation: "The enhancer of the joy of Kausalya (Rama) along with hs brother Lakshmana under the protection of  Viswamitra  is now staying in the coutry of the Videhas."

shloka_text: दृष्टवीर्यस्तु काकुत्स्थो जनकेन महात्मना। सम्प्रदानं सुतायास्तु राघवे कर्तुमिच्छति।।1.68.18।।
translation: काकुत्स्थ: Rama, महात्मना by the illustrious, जनकेन by Janaka, दृष्टवीर्य: having proved the prowess (that Janaka), सुताया: daughter's, सम्प्रदानम् bestowal, राघवे to Rama, कर्तुम् to do, इच्छति is desiring.
explanation: Illustrious Janaka desires to bestow his daughter on the descendat of Kakustha (Rama) whose prowess he has witnessed.

shloka_text: यदि वो रोचते वृत्तं जनकस्य महात्मन:। पुरीं गच्छामहे शीघ्रं मा भूत्कालस्य पर्यय:।।1.68.19।।
translation: महात्मन: of the distinguished, जनकस्य Janaka's, वृत्तम् behaviour (character ), व: to you, रोचते यदि is approved (looked) by you with favour, शीघ्रम् immediately, पुरीम् city of Mithila, गच्छामहे shall go, कालस्य time's, पर्यय: delay, माभूत् let not be there.
explanation: If you approve the action, of the distinguished Janaka, let us hurry to the city of Mithila. Let there be no delay".

shloka_text: ततो रात्र्यां व्यतीतायां सोपाध्याय: सबान्धव:। राजा दशरथो हृष्ट स्सुमन्त्रमिदमब्रवीत्।।1.69.1।।
