translation: सोपाध्याय: accompanied by spiritual preceptors, सबान्धव: relations, राजा दशरथ: king Dasaratha, हृष्ट: highly pleased, तत: afterwards, रात्र्याम् when the night, व्यतीतायाम् had passed, सुमन्त्रम् addressing Sumantra, इदम् this word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: With the passing of the night king Dasaratha, accompanied by spiritual preceptors and relatives said to Sumantra:
comments: Accompanied by the army Dasaratha reaches Mithila Janaka honours him.

shloka_text: अद्य सर्वे धनाध्यक्षा धनमादाय पुष्कलम्। व्रजन्त्वग्रे सुविहिता नानारत्नसमन्विता:।।1.69.2।।
translation: अद्य today, सर्वे all, धनाध्यक्षा: officers of the treasury, पुष्कलम् abundance of, धनम् wealth, आदाय taking, नानारत्नसमन्विता: furnished with a variety gems, सुविहिता: wellprepared, अग्रे in advance, व्रजन्तु may go.
explanation: "Let all the officers of the treasury furnished with enough wealth and a variety gems go in advance under escort.

shloka_text: चतुरङ्गबलं चापि शीघ्रं निर्यातु सर्वश:। ममज्ञासमकालं च यानयुग्यमनुत्तमम्।।1.69.3।।
translation: मम my, अज्ञासमकालम् at command itself, चतुरङ्गबलम् four divisions of the army, सर्वश: from all the four quarters, निर्यातु many depart, अनुत्तमम् excelent, यानयुग्यम् also chariots, palanquins (march out).
explanation: Let the four divisions of the army from all the four quarters with elegant palanquins proceed at my command.

shloka_text: वसिष्ठो वामदेवश्च जाबालिरथ काश्यप:। मार्कण्डेयश्च दीर्घायु:ऋषि: कात्यायनस्तथा।।1.69.4।। एते द्विजा: प्रयान्त्वग्रे स्यन्दनं योजयस्व मे। यथा कालात्ययो न स्या द्दूता हि त्वरयन्ति माम्।।1.69.5।।
translation: वसिष्ठ: Vasishta, वामदेवश्च Vamadeva, अथ also, जाबालि: Jabali, काश्यप: Kasyapa, दीर्घायु: endowed with long life, मार्कण्डेयश्च Markandeya, तथा also, ऋषि: कात्यायन: rishi Katyayana, एते these, द्विजा: brahmins, अग्रे in advance, प्रयान्तु will go, मे my, स्यन्दनम् chariot, योजयस्व be yoked, कालात्यय passage of time, यथा as, न स्यात् will not happen, दूता: messengers, माम् me, त्वरयन्ति हि are hastening me up.
explanation: Let brahmins like Vasishta, Vamadeva, Jabali, Kasyapa, Markandeya endowed with long life, and rishi Katyayana depart in advance. My chariot be yoked and kept ready. Let there be no delay. The messengers (from Janaka) are hastening me up".

shloka_text: वसिष्ठो वामदेवश्च जाबालिरथ काश्यप:। मार्कण्डेयश्च दीर्घायु:ऋषि: कात्यायनस्तथा।।1.69.4।। एते द्विजा: प्रयान्त्वग्रे स्यन्दनं योजयस्व मे। यथा कालात्ययो न स्या द्दूता हि त्वरयन्ति माम्।।1.69.5।।
translation: वसिष्ठ: Vasishta, वामदेवश्च Vamadeva, अथ also, जाबालि: Jabali, काश्यप: Kasyapa, दीर्घायु: endowed with long life, मार्कण्डेयश्च Markandeya, तथा also, ऋषि: कात्यायन: rishi Katyayana, एते these, द्विजा: brahmins, अग्रे in advance, प्रयान्तु will go, मे my, स्यन्दनम् chariot, योजयस्व be yoked, कालात्यय passage of time, यथा as, न स्यात् will not happen, दूता: messengers, माम् me, त्वरयन्ति हि are hastening me up.
explanation: Let brahmins like Vasishta, Vamadeva, Jabali, Kasyapa, Markandeya endowed with long life, and rishi Katyayana depart in advance. My chariot be yoked and kept ready. Let there be no delay. The messengers (from Janaka) are hastening me up".

shloka_text: वचनात्तु नरेन्द्रस्य सा सेना चतुरङ्गिणी। राजानमृषिभि स्सार्धं व्रजन्तं पृष्ठतोऽन्वगात्।।1.69.6।।
translation: नरेन्द्रस्य of Indra among kings, Dasaratha's, वचनात् by the command, चतुरङ्गिणी having four divisions, सा that, सेना army, ऋषिभि: with sages, व्रजन्तम् while going, राजानम् king Dasaratha, पृष्ठत: behind, अन्वगात् followed.
explanation: While the Indra among kings (Dasaratha) proceeded with the sages, the four divisions of the army followed them at the command of the king.

shloka_text: गत्वा चतुरहं मार्गं विदेहानभ्युपेयिवान्। राजा तु जनक श्श्रीमान् श्श्रुत्वा पूजामकल्पयत्।।1.69.7।।
translation: चतुरहम् to be covered in four days, मार्गम् that path, गत्वा having passed, विदेहान् country of Videhas, अभ्युपेयिवान् arrived, राजा king, श्रीमान् the auspicious, जनक: Janaka, श्रुत्वा having heard, पूजाम् reverential hospitality, अकल्पयत् made.
explanation: Covering the distance in four days, they arrived in the country of the Videhas. The fortunate king Janaka, having heard about these tidings, made arangements to extend to them reverential hospitality.

shloka_text: ततो राजानमासाद्य वृद्धं दशरथं नृपम्। जनको मुदितो राजा हर्षं च परमं ययौ।।1.69.8।।
translation: तत: afterwards, राजा King, मुदित: immensely pleased, जनक: Janaka, नृपम् ruler of men, राजानम् king, वृद्धम् aged, दशरथम् Dasaratha, आसाद्य having approached, परमम् great, हर्षम् delight, ययौ obtained.
explanation: King Janaka approached the aged ruler of men, Dasaratha, and experienced great delight.

shloka_text: उवाच च नरश्रेष्ठो नरश्रेष्ठं मुदाऽन्वित:। स्वागतं ते महाराज दिष्ट्या प्राप्तोऽसि राघव।।1.69.9।। पुत्रयोरुभयो: प्रीतिं लप्स्यसे वीर्यनिर्जिताम्।
translation: नरश्रेष्ठ: best of men, मुदा with joy, अन्वित: filled, नरश्रेष्ठम् addressing the best of men Dasaratha, उवाच spoke, राघव O Descendant of Raghu, महाराज O Great king Dasaratha, ते to you, स्वागतम् welcome, दिष्ट्या fortunately, प्राप्त: असि you have come, उभयो: of the  two, पुत्रयो: sons', वीर्यनिर्जिताम् won through prowess, प्रीतिम् pleasure, लप्स्यसे you will experience.
explanation: Filled with joy the best of men (Janaka) addreseed the best of men Dasaratha: "O Descendant of the Raghus, O Great king welcome I am fortunate to have you, you will experience the pleasure of both your sons having won the  reward for their prowess.

shloka_text: दिष्ट्या प्राप्तो महातेजा वसिष्ठो भगवानृषि:।।1.69.10।। सह सर्वैर्द्विजश्रेष्ठैर्देवैरिव शतक्रतु:।
translation: महातेजा: highly lustrous, भगवान् adorable, ऋषि: ascetic Vasishta, सर्वै: all, द्विजश्रेष्ठै: (सह) with foremost of brahmins, देवै: with devatas, शतक्रतुरिव like Indra, दिष्ट्या by the grace of god, प्राप्त: has come here.
explanation: Most brilliant and adorable ascetic Vasishta surrounded by the foremost of brahmins like Indra by the gods has also arrived by the grace of God.

shloka_text: दिष्ट्या मे निर्जिता विघ्ना दिष्ट्या मे पूजितं कुलम्।।1.69.11।। राघवै स्सह सम्बन्धाद्वीर्यश्रेष्ठैर्महात्मभि:।
translation: वीर्यश्रेष्ठै: by the men who are distinguished because of prowess, महात्मभि: by the great, राघवै: सह along with Raghus, संबन्धात् through the alliance, दिष्ट्या मे by heaven's grace, मे विघ्ना: my impediments, निर्जिता: have been overcome, दिष्ट्या by the grace of god, कुलम् race, पूजितम् honoured.
explanation: By the grace of god, I have overcome all impediments. By the grace of God my race  has been honoured through alliance with the house of the Raghus distinguished by their valour.

shloka_text: श्व: प्रभाते नरेन्द्रेन्द्र निर्वर्तयितुमर्हसि।।1.69.12।। यज्ञस्यान्ते नरश्रेष्ठ विवाहमृषिसम्मतम्।
translation: नरश्रेष्ठ O Foremost of men, नरेन्द्रेन्द्र O Best of kings, श्व: tomorrow, प्रभाते at dawn, यज्ञस्य sacrifice's, अन्ते completion of, ऋषिसम्मतम् worthy of approval by sages, विवाहम् marriage, (आर्षविवाह) निर्वर्तयितुम् to perform, अर्हसि it behoves of you.
explanation: O Foremost of men, O Best of kings, tomorrow at dawn after the completion of the sacrifice, you should perform the marriage with approval by the sages".

shloka_text: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा ऋषिमध्ये नराधिप:।।1.69.13।। वाक्यं वाक्यविदां श्रेष्ठ: प्रत्युवाच महीपतिम्।
translation: वाक्यविदाम् among the knowledgeable men in words, श्रेष्ठः (वर:) excellent, नराधिप: king, तस्य his, तत् वचनम् those words, श्रुत्वा having heard, ऋषिमध्ये amidst sages, महीपतिम् addressing the king, वाक्यम् words, प्रत्युवाच replied.
explanation: At these words, the most eloquent king (Dasaratha) made his reply in the midst of sages:

shloka_text: प्रतिग्रहो दातृवश श्श्रृतमेतन्मया पुरा।।1.69.14।। यथा वक्ष्यसि धर्मज्ञ तत्करिष्यामहे वयम्।
translation: प्रतिग्रह: acceptance of a gift, दातृवश: as it may please the giver, एतत् this one, पुरा formerly, मया by me, श्रुतम् heard, धर्मज्ञ O Knower of righteousness, यथा whatever, वक्ष्यसि you may say, तत् that, वयम् we, करिष्यामहे will perform.
explanation: "I have heard that acceptance of a gift from the righteous is a pleasure. So we will act upon your word".

shloka_text: धर्मिष्ठं च यशस्यं च वचनं सत्यवादिन:।।1.69.15।। श्रुत्वा विदेहाधिपति: परं विस्मयमागत:।।
translation: सत्यवादिन: truth speaking Dasaratha's, धर्मिष्ठम् च conforming to morality, यशस्यं च conducive to fame, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having listened, विदेहाधिपति: Janaka, परम् extreme, विस्मयम् admiration, आगत: filled with.
explanation: Janaka was filled with extreme admiration to hear one who was truthful, righteous and famous (this Dasaratha).

shloka_text: तत स्सर्वे मुनिगणा: परस्परसमागमे।1.69.16। हर्षेण महता युक्तास्तां निशामवसन् सुखम्।।
translation: तत: afterwards, सर्वे all, मुनिगणा: hosts of sages, परस्परसमागमे in each other's company, महता by great, हर्षेण delight, युक्ता: filled with, ताम् that, निशाम् night, सुखम् comfortably, अवसन् lived.
explanation: Thereupon hosts of sages in one another's company, filled with great delight spent the night comfortably.

shloka_text: राजा च राघवौ पुत्रौ निशाम्य परिहर्षित:।।1.69.17।। उवास परमप्रीतो जनकेन सुपूजित:।
translation: राजा king Dasaratha, पुत्रौ sons, राघवौ Rama and Lakshmana, निशाम्य on beholding them, परिहर्षित: experienced supreme satisfaction, जनकेन by Janaka, सुपूजित: wellhonoured, परमप्रीत: greatly delighted, उवास lived.
explanation: The king (Dasaratha) was greatly delighted on being reunited with his sons Rama and Lakshmana. Honoured by Janaka, he spent the night with supreme satisfaction.

shloka_text: जनकोऽपि महातेजा: क्रियां धर्मेण तत्त्ववित्।।1.69.18।। यज्ञस्य च सुताभ्यां च कृत्वा रात्रिमुवास ह ।
translation: महातेजा: highly splendrous, तत्त्ववित् knower of prescibed duty and conduct, जनकोऽपि Janaka also, यज्ञस्य of sacrifice, सुताभ्यां च for both of his daughters, क्रियाम् acts, कृत्वा having made, रात्रिम् night, उवास ह lived.
explanation: Mighty philosopher Janaka also performed the  sacrificial rites and spent the night (there where the sacrificial ceremony was performed) with both his daughters. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे एकोनसप्ततितमस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the sixtynineth sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: तत: प्रभाते जनक: कृतकर्मा महर्षिभि:। उवाच वाक्यं वाक्यज्ञ श्शतानन्दं पुरोहितम्।।1.70.1।।
translation: तत: thereafter, प्रभाते at dawn, महर्षिभि: by maharshis, कृतकर्मा having performed daily (sacrificial) acts, वाक्यज्ञ: conversant in speech, जनक: Janaka, पुरोहितम् chief priest, शतानन्दम् Satananda, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said.
explanation: Thereafter at dawn after the maharshis had performed their daily (sacrificial) rites the eloquent Janaka said to the chief priest Satananda:
comments: Janaka sends messengers to fetch his brother Kusadhwaja -- at the request of Dasaratha Vasishta narrates the greatness of Ikshvaku dynasty.

shloka_text: भ्राता मम महातेजा यवीयानतिधार्मिक:। कुशध्वज इति ख्यात: पुरीमध्यवसच्छुभाम्।।1.70.2।। वार्याफलकपर्यन्तां पिबन्निक्षुमतीं नदीम्। साङ्काश्यां पुण्यसङ्काशां विमानमिव पुष्पकम्।।1.70.3।।
translation: अतिधार्मिक: extremely righteous, कुशध्वज: इति  named Kusadhwaja, ख्यात: renowned, महातेजा: most brilliant, मम my, यवीयान् younger, भ्राता brother, इक्षुमतीम् named Ikshumati, नदीम् river, पिबन् drinking, वार्याफलकपर्यन्ताम् darts planted in water as boundary, शुभाम् auspicious, पुण्यसङ्काशाम् sacred, साङ्काश्यां पुरीम् named Sankasya, पुष्पकम् Pushpaka, विमानमिव like chariot, अध्यवसत् is residing.
explanation: "The extremely righteous, renowned and most brilliant Kusadhwaja, my younger brother is (at present) ruling the sacred kingdom of Sankasya, which is like the aerial chariot Pushpaka, with darts planted in water as boundary on the bank of the auspicious, sacred river Ikshumati.

shloka_text: भ्राता मम महातेजा यवीयानतिधार्मिक:। कुशध्वज इति ख्यात: पुरीमध्यवसच्छुभाम्।।1.70.2।। वार्याफलकपर्यन्तां पिबन्निक्षुमतीं नदीम्। साङ्काश्यां पुण्यसङ्काशां विमानमिव पुष्पकम्।।1.70.3।।
translation: अतिधार्मिक: extremely righteous, कुशध्वज: इति  named Kusadhwaja, ख्यात: renowned, महातेजा: most brilliant, मम my, यवीयान् younger, भ्राता brother, इक्षुमतीम् named Ikshumati, नदीम् river, पिबन् drinking, वार्याफलकपर्यन्ताम् darts planted in water as boundary, शुभाम् auspicious, पुण्यसङ्काशाम् sacred, साङ्काश्यां पुरीम् named Sankasya, पुष्पकम् Pushpaka, विमानमिव like chariot, अध्यवसत् is residing.
explanation: "The extremely righteous, renowned and most brilliant Kusadhwaja, my younger brother is (at present) ruling the sacred kingdom of Sankasya, which is like the aerial chariot Pushpaka, with darts planted in water as boundary on the bank of the auspicious, sacred river Ikshumati.

shloka_text: तमहं द्रष्टुमिच्छामि यज्ञगोप्ता स मे मत:। प्रीतिं सोऽपि महातेजा इमां भोक्ता मया सह।।1.70.4।।
translation: अहम् I, तम् him, द्रष्टुम् to behold, इच्छामि I am desiring, स: he, मे my, यज्ञगोप्ता protector of  the sacrifice, मत: has been accepted, महातेजा: most glorious, सोऽपि he also, मया सह with me, इमाम् this, प्रीतिम् pleasure, भोक्ता will enjoy.
explanation: I desire to see Kusadhwaja who I have accepted as the protector of the sacrifice. I want that my glorious brother should share this pleasure, with me".

shloka_text: एवमुक्ते तु वचने शतानन्दस्य सन्निधौ। आगता: केचिदव्यग्रा जनकस्तान् समादिशत्।।1.70.5।।
translation: शतानन्दस्य Satananda's, सन्निधौ in the presence, एवम् thus, वचने words, उक्ते (सति) when he uttered, अव्यग्रा: undistracted, केचित् some (attendants), आगता: had come, जनक: Janaka, तान् them, समादिशत् commanded.
explanation: Janaka having said so in the presence of Satananda gave instructions to a few faithful  attendants who were present.

shloka_text: शासनात्तु नरेन्द्रस्य प्रययुश्शीघ्रवाजिभि:। समानेतुं नरव्याघ्रं विष्णुमिन्द्राज्ञया यथा।।1.70.6।।
translation: नरेन्द्रस्य king Janaka's, शासनात् by the command, इन्द्राज्ञया by the order of Indra, विष्णुं यथा like Visnu, नरव्याघ्रम् tiger among men, समानेतुम् to bring him, शीघ्रवाजिभि: on swift moving steeds, प्रययु: rode away.
explanation: In obedience to the command of Indra among men (king Janaka), the messengers rode away on swift horses to bring king Kusadhwaja, a tiger among men just like fetching Visnu by the orders of Indra.

shloka_text: साङ्काश्यां ते समागत्य ददृशुश्च कुशध्वजम्। न्यवेदयन्यथावृत्तं जनकस्य च चिन्तितम्।।1.70.7।।
translation: ते those messengers, साङ्काश्याम् city of Sankasya, समागम्य having reached, कुशध्वजम् Kusadhwaja, ददृशुश्च beheld him, यथावृत्तम् as happened, जनकस्य Janaka's, चिन्तितम् intention, न्यवेदयन् च informed.
explanation: The messengers reached Sankasya, met Kusadhwaja and related to him what had happened. They informed him the intention of (king) Janaka.

shloka_text: तद्वृत्तं नृपति श्शृत्वा दूतश्रेष्ठैर्महाबलै:। अज्ञायाऽथ नरेन्द्रस्य आजगाम कुशध्वज:।।1.70.8।।
translation: नृपति king, कुशध्वज: Kusadhwaja, महाबलै: by men endowed with strength, दूतश्रेष्ठै: by the loyal messengers, तत् that, वृत्तम् events, श्रुत्वा having learned, अथ thereafter, नरेन्द्रस्य king's, आज्ञया by order, आजगाम set out.
explanation: Kusadhwaja having heard the events from the loyal, mighty messengers set out for Mithila in compliance with the request of the king (Janaka).

shloka_text: स ददर्श महात्मानं जनकं धर्मवत्सलम्। सोऽभिवाद्य शतानन्दं राजानं चापि धार्मिकम्।।1.70.9।। राजार्हं परमं दिव्यमासनं चाऽध्यरोहत।
translation: स: he, धर्मवत्सलम् devoted to righteousness, महात्मानम् magnanimous, जनकम् Janaka, ददर्श beheld, स: he, शतानन्दम् Satananda, धार्मिकम् virtuous, राजानं च king also, अभिवाद्य having saluted with reverence, राजार्हम् befitting a king, परमम् great, दिव्यम् excellent, आसनम् seat, अध्यरोहत occupied.
explanation: There he saw the highsouled Janaka devoted to righteousness. Having paid his regards to Satananda and the virtuous king he occupied an exalted seat befitting a king.

shloka_text: उपविष्टावुभौ तौ तु भ्रातरावतितेजसौ।।1.70.10।। प्रेषयामासतुर्वीरौ मन्त्रिश्रेष्ठं सुदामनम्।
translation: अतितेजसौ possessing great splendour, तौ वीरौ those two heores, उभौ both, भ्रातरौ brothers, उपविष्टौ seated, मन्त्रिश्रेष्ठम् wisest of ministers, सुदामनम् Sudaman, प्रेषयामासतु: despatched.
explanation: The two heroic brothers endowed with great splendour seated beside each other, despatched Sudamana the wisest of ministers (to Dasaratha).

shloka_text: गच्छ मन्त्रिपते शीघ्रमैक्ष्वाकुममितप्रभम्।।1.70.11।। आत्मजैस्सह दुर्धर्षमानयस्व समन्त्रिणम्।
translation: मन्त्रिपते O Foremost of counsellors, शीघ्रम् speedily, गच्छ go, अमितप्रभम् immeasurable splendour, ऐक्ष्वाकुम् Ikshvaku king Dasaratha, दुर्धर्षम् invincible, समन्त्रिणम् together with ministers, आत्मजै: along with sons, समानयस्व bring him.
explanation: "O Foremost among counsellors, go speedily and bring along with his ministers and sons the invincible Dasaratha of the Ikshvakus dynasty whose splendour is immeasurable".

shloka_text: औपकार्यां स गत्वा तु रघूणां कुलवर्धनम्।।1.70.12।। ददर्श शिरसा चैनमभिवाद्येदमब्रवीत्।
translation: स: he, औपकार्याम् tent, गत्वा having gone, रघूणाम् of the race of Raghus, कुलवर्धनम् perpetuating, ददर्श saw, एनम् him, शिरसा bowing down his head, अभिवाद्य having saluted him, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: Having reached the tent, he (Sudamana) saw Dasaratha, perpetuator of the race of the Raghus and bowing down his head, said:

shloka_text: अयोध्याधिपते वीर वैदेहो मिथिलाधिप:।।1.70.13।। स त्वां द्रष्टुं व्यवसितस्सोपाध्यायपुरोहितम्।
translation: वीर O Heroic one, अयोध्याधिपते O Lord of Ayodhya, मिथिलाधिप: lord of Mithila, वैदेह: Janaka, सोपाध्यायपुरोहितम् along with spiritual preceptors and chief priest, त्वाम् you, द्रष्टुम् to see, सः he, व्यवसित: has decided.
explanation: "O Heroic lord of Ayodhya, Janaka, the lord of Mithila desires to see you along with preceptors and priest".

shloka_text: मंत्रिश्रेष्ठवच श्शृत्वा राजा सर्षिगणस्तदा।।1.70.14।। सबंधुरगमत्तत्र जनको यत्र वर्तते।
translation: तदा then, राजा king, मंत्रिश्रेष्ठवच: the words of the best of counsellors, श्रुत्वा having listened, सर्षिगण: with hosts of rishis, सबंधु: with relations, जनक: Janaka, यत्र where, वर्तते was waiting, तत्र there, अगमत् went.
explanation: King Dasaratha on hearing the words of the best of the counsellors reached the place where Janaka was waiting with hosts of rishis and relations.

shloka_text: स राजा मन्त्रिसहित स्सोपाध्याय: सबान्धव:।।1.70.15।। वाक्यं वाक्यविदां श्रेष्ठो वैदेहमिदमब्रवीत्।
translation: मन्त्रिसहित: along with counsellors, सबान्धव: with relations, स: king Dasaratha, वाक्यविदाम् among those skilled speech, श्रेष्ठ: excellent, राजा king, वैदेहम् addressing, इदम् these, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: The king (Dasaratha), skilled in speech, accompanied by counsellors and kins said to Janaka,the lord of the Videhas:

shloka_text: विदितं ते महाराज इक्ष्वाकुकुलदैवतम्।।1.70.16।। वक्ता सर्वेषु कृत्येषु वसिष्ठो भगवानृषि:।
translation: महाराज O Great king, भगवान् venerable, वसिष्ठ: Vasishta,  इक्ष्वाकुकुलदैवतम् spiritual protector of Ikshvaku race, सर्वेषु in all, कृत्येषु ceremonies, वक्ता spokesman, ते to you, विदितम् is known.
explanation: "O Great king venerable Vasishta is the spiritual protector of the Ikshvakus race and it is known that for all ceremonies he is our spokesman".

shloka_text: विश्वामित्राभ्यनुज्ञातस्सह सर्वैर्महर्षिभि:।।1.70.17।। एष वक्ष्यति धर्मात्मा वसिष्ठो मे यथाक्रमम्।
translation: सर्वै: by all, महर्षिभि: सह along with maharshis, विश्वामित्राभ्यनुज्ञात: having been permitted by Visvamitra, धर्मात्मा virtuous, एष: वसिष्ठ: this Vasishta, यथाक्रमम् in detailed order, मे my (race), वक्ष्यति will tell you.
explanation: "Having been permitted by Viswamitra, along with all maharshis virtuous Vasishta will tell you in detail about my race".

shloka_text: एवमुक्त्वा नरश्रेष्ठे राज्ञां मध्ये महात्मनाम्।।1.70.18।। तूष्णींभूते दशरथे वसिष्ठो भगवानृषि:। उवाच वाक्यं वाक्यज्ञो वैदेहं सपुरोधसम्।।1.70.19।।
translation: नरश्रेष्ठे when the best among men, दशरथे Dasaratha, महात्मनाम् of the distinguished, राज्ञाम् kings, मध्ये amidst, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having spoken, तूष्णींभूते remained silent, वाक्यज्ञ: wellversed in speech, भगवान् adorable, वसिष्ठ: ऋषिः Vasishta, सपुरोधसम् in the company of priests, वैदेहम् Janaka, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच spoke.
explanation: Having said this amidst the best of men and the most distinguished among kings, Dasaratha remained silent. Then Vasishta, the venerable sage, wellversed in speech spoke to the Lord of Videhas (Janaka) in the midst of priests.

shloka_text: एवमुक्त्वा नरश्रेष्ठे राज्ञां मध्ये महात्मनाम्।।1.70.18।। तूष्णींभूते दशरथे वसिष्ठो भगवानृषि:। उवाच वाक्यं वाक्यज्ञो वैदेहं सपुरोधसम्।।1.70.19।।
translation: नरश्रेष्ठे when the best among men, दशरथे Dasaratha, महात्मनाम् of the distinguished, राज्ञाम् kings, मध्ये amidst, एवम् in this way, उक्त्वा having spoken, तूष्णींभूते remained silent, वाक्यज्ञ: wellversed in speech, भगवान् adorable, वसिष्ठ: ऋषिः Vasishta, सपुरोधसम् in the company of priests, वैदेहम् Janaka, वाक्यम् these words, उवाच spoke.
explanation: Having said this amidst the best of men and the most distinguished among kings, Dasaratha remained silent. Then Vasishta, the venerable sage, wellversed in speech spoke to the Lord of Videhas (Janaka) in the midst of priests.

shloka_text: अव्यक्तप्रभवो ब्रह्मा शाश्वतो नित्य अव्यय:। तस्मान्मरीचि स्संजज्ञे मरीचे: काश्यप: सुत:।।1.70.20।।
translation: अव्यक्तप्रभव: the unmanifest, शाश्वत: eternal, नित्य: constant, अव्यय: Imperishable, ब्रह्मा Brahma, तस्मात् from him, मरीचि: Marichi, संजज्ञे was born, मरीचे: from Marichi, काश्यप: Kasyapa, सुत: son (sprang).
explanation: "From the unmanifest was born the eternal, the constant, the imperishable Brahma. To him was born Marichi and to Marichi, Kasyapa.

shloka_text: विवस्वान् काश्यपाज्जज्ञे मनुर्वैवस्वत स्स्मृत:। मनु: प्रजापति: पूर्वमिक्ष्वाकुस्तु मनोस्सुत:।।1.70.21।।
translation: काश्यपात् from Kasyapa, विवस्वान् Vivasvan, जज्ञे was begotten, वैवस्वत: as Vivasvata, मनु: Manu, स्मृत: said, मनु: Manu, पूर्वम् formerly, प्रजापति: prajapati, इक्ष्वाकु: Ikshavaku, मनो: Manu's, सुत: son.
explanation: Kasyapa begot Vivasvan and Vivasvan, Manu. Ikshavaku was the son of Manu otherwise called Prajapati or Vaivasvata.

shloka_text: तमिक्ष्वाकुमयोध्यायां राजानं विद्धि पूर्वकम्। इक्ष्वाकोस्तु सुतश्श्रीमान् कुक्षिरित्येव विश्रुत:।।1.70.22।।
translation: तम् इक्ष्वाकुम् him as Ikshvaku, अयोध्यायाम् in the city of Ayodhya, पूर्वकम् राजानम् ancestral  king, विद्धि be informed, श्रीमान् the glorious, कुक्षिरित्येव known as Kukshi, विश्रुत: wellknown, इक्ष्वाको: Ikshvaku's, सुत: son(was born).
explanation: It may be noted that Ikshvaku was the first ancestral king of Ayodhya whose son was the wellknown, glorious Kukshi.

shloka_text: कुक्षेरथात्मज: श्रीमान् विकुक्षिरुदपद्यत। विकुक्षेस्तु महातेजा बाण: पुत्र: प्रतापवान्।।1.70.23।।
translation: अथ thereafter, कुक्षे: Kushi's, श्रीमान् prosperous, विकुक्षि: Vikushi, आत्मज: as son, उदपद्यत was born, महातेजा: highly lustrous, प्रतापवान् valourous, बाण: Bana, विकुक्षे: Vikushi's, पुत्र: son.
explanation: Prosperous Vikukshi was Kukshi's son, who brought forth brilliant and powerful Bana.

shloka_text: बाणस्य तु महातेजा अनरण्य: प्रतापवान्। अनरण्यात्पृथुर्जज्ञे त्रिशङ्कुस्तु पृथोस्सुत:।।1.70.24।।
translation: महातेजा: highly splendrous, प्रतापवान् valourous, अनरण्य: Anaranya, बाणस्य Bana's, अनरण्यात् from Anaranya, पृथु: Pruthu, जज्ञे born, त्रिशङ्कु: तु Trishanku, पृथो Pruthu's, सुत: son.
explanation: Bana's son was the most brilliant and valiant Anaranya whose son Pruthu was succeeded by Trisanku.

shloka_text: त्रिशङ्कोरभवत्पुत्रो दुन्दुमारो महायशा:। युवनाश्वसुतस्त्वासीन्मान्धाता पृथिवीपति:।।1.70.25।।
translation: त्रिशङ्को: of Trishanku, महायशा: highly famous, दुन्दुमार: Dundumara, पुत्र: अभवत् born as a son, मान्धाता known as Mandhata, पृथिवीपति: king, युवनाश्वसुत: son of Yuvanashva, आसीत् was born.
explanation: Trisanku's famous son was Dundumara also known as Yuvanashva whose son was king Mandhata.

shloka_text: मान्धातुस्तु सुत श्श्रीमान् सुसन्धिरुदपद्यत। सुसन्धेरपि पुत्रौ द्वौ ध्रुवसन्धि: प्रसेनजित्।।1.70.26।।
translation: मान्धातु: for Mandhata, सुसन्धि: Susandhi, श्रीमान् venerable, उदपद्यत was born, सुसन्धेरपि for Susandhi, ध्रुवसन्धि: Dhruvasandhi, प्रसेनजित् Prasenajit, द्वौ two, पुत्रौ sons.
explanation: Mandhata's son was prosperous Susandhi who brought forth two sons Dhruvasandhi and Prasenajit.

shloka_text: यशस्वी ध्रुवसन्धेस्तु भरतो नाम नामत:। भरतात्तु महातेजा असितो नाम जातवान्।।1.70.27।।
translation: ध्रुवसन्धे: तु for Dhruvasandhi, नामत: by name, भरत: नाम known Bharata, यशस्वी illustrious, भरतात् from Bharata, महातेजा: highly vigoruos, असितो नाम named Asita, जातवान् begot.
explanation: To Dhruvasandhi was born the wellknown Bharata who begot the vigorous Asita.

shloka_text: यस्यैते प्रतिराजान उदपद्यन्त शत्रव:। हैहयास्तालजंघाश्च शूराश्च शशिबिन्दव:।।1.70.28।।
translation: यस्य for Asita, हैहया: Haihayas, तालजंघाश्च Talajanghas, शूरा: valiant men, शशिबिन्दवश्च Sasibindus, एते प्रतिराजान: kings fighting against him, शत्रव: enemies, उदपद्यन्त arose.
explanation: Valiant kings belonging to the races of the Haihayas, Talaiangha, and Sasibindus   became  the enemies to Asita.

shloka_text: तांस्तु स प्रतियुध्यन् वै युद्धे राजा प्रवासित:। हिमवन्तमुपागम्य भृगुप्रस्रवणेऽवसत्।।1.70.29।। असितोऽल्पबलो राजा मन्त्रिभिस्सहितस्तदा।
translation: स: राजा that king, तान् them, युद्धे in the conflict, प्रतियुध्यन् fighting against them, प्रवासित: was exiled from his kingdom, राजा असित: king Asita, अल्पबल: with relatively lesser strength, मन्त्रिभि: with counsellors, सहित: accompanied, तदा then, हिमवन्तम् towards Himavat mountain, उपागम्य having reached, भृगुप्रस्रवणे in a place known as Bhriguprasravana, अवसत् lived.
explanation: The king Asita who was a weakling was defeated in the conflict against the kings and was exiled. Along with his counsellors he lived at on the Bhriguprasravana Himavat mountain.

shloka_text: द्वे चास्य भार्ये गर्भिण्यौ बभूवतुरिति श्रुतम्।।1.70.30।। एका गर्भविनाशाय सपत्न्यै सगरं ददौ।
translation: अस्य his, द्वे two, भार्ये wives, गर्भिण्यौ pregnant, बभूवतु: became, इति thus, श्रुतम् is known, एका one, गर्भविनाशाय to destroy the embryo, सपत्नयै the other wife, सगरम् poison mixed in food, ददौ gave.
explanation: It is said that his (Asita's) two wives were pregnant. One gave food mixed with poison to the other with the intention of destroying her embryo.

shloka_text: तत श्शैलवरं रम्यं बभूवाभिरतो मुनि:।।1.70.31।। भार्गवश्च्यवनो नाम हिमवन्तमुपाश्रित:।
translation: तत: afterwards, रम्यम् delightful, शैलवरम् best of mountains, अभिरत: relished, भार्गव: of the family of Bhrigu, च्यवनो नाम named Chyavana, हिमवन्तम् Himavt, उपाश्रित: has taken refuge.
explanation: At that time Chyavana of the family of Bhrigu liked to stay at Himavat, the great, pleasant mountain.

shloka_text: तत्रैका तु महाभागा भार्गवं देववर्चसम्।।1.70.32।। ववन्दे पद्मपत्राक्षी काङ्क्षन्ती सुतमात्मन:।
translation: महाभागा highly accomplished, तत्र (तयो:) एका one of those two, पद्मपत्राक्षी lotuseyed, आत्मन: for her, सुतम् son, काङ्क्षन्ती desiring, देववर्चसम् resembling the lustre of devatas, भार्गवम् Chyavana, ववन्दे offered salutations.
explanation: That the lotuseyed and highly accomplished Kalindi, offered herself for a son to Chyavana who was glowing like a god.

shloka_text: तमृषिं साऽभ्युपागम्य कालिंदी चाभ्यवादयत्।।1.70.33।। स तामभ्यवदद्विप्र: पुत्रेप्सुं पुत्रजन्मनि।
translation: सा that, कालिंदी च Kalindi also, तम् that, ऋषिम् ascetic, अभ्युपागम्य after approaching, अभ्यवादयत् paid obeisance, स: that, विप्र: brahmin, ताम् her, पुत्रेप्सुम् desiring son, पुत्रजन्मनि concerning the birth of a son to her, अभ्यवदत् spoke.
explanation: Having approached the ascetic. Kalindi paid obeisance to him who said:

shloka_text: तव कुक्षौ महाभागे सुपुत्रस्सुमहाबल:।।1.70.34।। महावीर्यो महातेजा अचिरात्सञ्जनिष्यति। गरेण सहित श्श्रीमान् मा शुच: कमलेक्षणे।।1.70.35।।
translation: महाभागे O Prosperous one, तव your, कुक्षौ in womb, सुमहाबल: having great prowess, महातेजा: highly lustrous, सुपुत्र: virtuous child, श्रीमान् glorious, गरेण with poison, सहित: furnished, अचिरात् in a short time, सञ्जनिष्यति will be born, कमलेक्षणे O Lotus eyedone,  मा शुच: do not grieve.
explanation: 'O Great lady a child of high prowess, lustre and virtues is growing in your womb. In a short time this glorious son carrying with him the poison (administered to you) will be born. O Lotuseyed lady, do not grieve'.

shloka_text: तव कुक्षौ महाभागे सुपुत्रस्सुमहाबल:।।1.70.34।। महावीर्यो महातेजा अचिरात्सञ्जनिष्यति। गरेण सहित श्श्रीमान् मा शुच: कमलेक्षणे।।1.70.35।।
translation: महाभागे O Prosperous one, तव your, कुक्षौ in womb, सुमहाबल: having great prowess, महातेजा: highly lustrous, सुपुत्र: virtuous child, श्रीमान् glorious, गरेण with poison, सहित: furnished, अचिरात् in a short time, सञ्जनिष्यति will be born, कमलेक्षणे O Lotus eyedone,  मा शुच: do not grieve.
explanation: 'O Great lady a child of high prowess, lustre and virtues is growing in your womb. In a short time this glorious son carrying with him the poison (administered to you) will be born. O Lotuseyed lady, do not grieve'.

shloka_text: च्यवनं तु नमस्कृत्य राजपुत्री पतिव्रता। पतिशोकातुरा तस्मात्पुत्रं देवी व्यजायत।।1.70.36।।
translation: राजपुत्री princess, पतिव्रता chaste and virtuous one, पतिशोकातुरा afflicted with the sorrow due to loss of her husband, देवी that eldest queen, च्यवनम् Chyavana, नमस्कृत्य having saluted him, तस्मात् for that husband, पुत्रम् son, व्यजायत gave birth.
explanation: This eldest queen who was a devoted wife, afflicted with sorrow due to loss of her husband  gave birth to a son by the grace of  Chyavana.

shloka_text: सपत्न्या तु गरस्तस्यै दत्तो गर्भजिघांसया। सह तेन गरेणैव जात: स सगरोऽभवत्।।1.70.37।।
translation: सपत्न्या by her rival queen, तस्यै for her, गर्भजिघांसया with the intention of destroying embryo, गर: poison, दत्त: was given, तेन by that, गरेण सह एव with poison itself, जात: was born, स: that, सगर: sagara, अभवत् became.
explanation: Since poison was given to her by  her rival queen with the intention of destroying the   embryo, the son was born with poison and so came to be known as Sagara.

shloka_text: सगरस्यासमञ्जस्तु असमञ्जात्तथांऽशुमान्। दिलीपोंऽशुमत: पुत्रो दिलीपस्य भगीरथ:।।1.70.38।।
translation: असमञ्ज: Asamanjasa, सगरस्य Sagara's, तथा also, असमञ्जात् from Asamanja, अंशुमान् Anshuman, दिलीप: Dilipa, अंशुमत: Anshuman's, पुत्र: son, भगीरथ: Bhagiratha, दिलीपस्य Dilipa's (son).
explanation: Asamanja was the son of Sagara and to him was born Anshuman. Dilipa was the son of Anshuman and father of Bhagiratha.

shloka_text: भगीरथात्ककुत्स्थश्च ककुत्स्थस्य रघुस्सुत:। रघोस्तु पुत्रस्तेजस्वी प्रवृद्ध: पुरुषादक:।।1.70.39।। कल्माषपादो ह्यभवत्तस्माज्जातस्तु शंखण:।
translation: भगीरथात् from Bhagiratha, ककुत्स्थ: Kakutsthsa, रघु: Raghu, ककुत्स्थस्य Kakutsthsa's, सुत: son, तेजस्वी powerful, प्रवृद्ध: Pravriddha, रघो: Raghu's, पुत्र: son, पुरुषादक: Purushadaka, कल्माषपाद: Kalmashapada, अभवत् became, तस्मात् for him, शंखण: Samkhana, जात: was born.
explanation: Bhagiratha begot Kakustha whose son was Raghu. Powerful Pravriddha was Raghu's son. He became Purushadaka (cannibal), on the curse of Vasistha. He grasped water in order to retaliate Vasishta but was prevented by  his wife. The water fell on his feet and he came to be known as Kalmashapada (feet polluted with water). Samkhana was born to him.

shloka_text: सुदर्शन: शङ्घणस्य अग्निवर्ण स्सुदर्शनात्।।1.70.40।। शीघ्रगस्त्वग्निवर्णस्य शीघ्रगस्य मरु स्सुत:। मरो: प्रशुश्रुकस्त्वासीदम्बरीष: प्रशुश्रृकात्।।1.70.41।।
translation: शङ्घणस्य for Samkhana, सुदर्शन: Sudarsana, सुदर्शनात् from Sudarsana, अग्निवर्ण: Agnivarna, अग्निवर्णस्य for AgniVarna, शीघ्रग: Sighraga, शीघ्रगस्य for sighraga, मरु: Maru, सुत: son, मरो: for Maru, प्रशुश्रुक: Prasusruka, प्रशुश्रुकात् from Prasusukra, अम्बरीष: Ambarisha, आसीत् were born.
explanation: Sudarsana was the son of Samkhana. His son was Agnivarna. To Agnivarna was  born Sighraga and to Sighraga, Maru. To Maru, was born Prasusruka and to Prasrusuka, Ambarisha.

shloka_text: सुदर्शन: शङ्घणस्य अग्निवर्ण स्सुदर्शनात्।।1.70.40।। शीघ्रगस्त्वग्निवर्णस्य शीघ्रगस्य मरु स्सुत:। मरो: प्रशुश्रुकस्त्वासीदम्बरीष: प्रशुश्रृकात्।।1.70.41।।
translation: शङ्घणस्य for Samkhana, सुदर्शन: Sudarsana, सुदर्शनात् from Sudarsana, अग्निवर्ण: Agnivarna, अग्निवर्णस्य for AgniVarna, शीघ्रग: Sighraga, शीघ्रगस्य for sighraga, मरु: Maru, सुत: son, मरो: for Maru, प्रशुश्रुक: Prasusruka, प्रशुश्रुकात् from Prasusukra, अम्बरीष: Ambarisha, आसीत् were born.
explanation: Sudarsana was the son of Samkhana. His son was Agnivarna. To Agnivarna was  born Sighraga and to Sighraga, Maru. To Maru, was born Prasusruka and to Prasrusuka, Ambarisha.

shloka_text: अम्बरीषस्य पुत्रोऽभून्नहुष: पृथिवीपति:। नहुषस्य ययातिस्तु नाभागस्तु ययातिज:।।1.70.42।।
translation: पृथिवीपति: king, नहुष: Nahusha, अम्बरीषस्य Ambarisha's, पुत्र: son, अभूत् became, नहुषस्य Nahusha's, ययाति: Yayati was born, नाभाग: Nabhaga , ययातिज: was born to Yayati.
explanation: King Nahusha was the son of  Ambarisha. To Nahusha was born Yayati whose son was Nabhaga.

shloka_text: नाभागस्य बभूवाज: अजाद्दशरथोऽभवत्। अस्माद्दशरथाज्जातौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ।।1.70.43।।
translation: नाभागस्य Nabhaga's, अज: Aja, बभूव was born, अजात् from Aja, दशरथ: Dasaratha, अभवत् was born, अस्मात् from this, दशरथात् from Dasaratha, भ्रातरौ brothers, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, जातौ were born.
explanation: Nabhaga's son was Aja. Aja was the father of Dasaratha and Dasaratha, the father of  Rama and Lakshmana.

shloka_text: एवं ब्रुवाणं जनक: प्रत्युवाच कृताञ्जलि:। श्रोतुमर्हसि भद्रं ते कुलं न: परिकीर्तितम्।।1.71.1।।
translation: एवम् in this manner, ब्रुवाणम् speaking (Vasishta), जनक: Janaka, कृताञ्जलि: with folded palms, प्रत्युवाच replied, ते भद्रं safety to you, परिकीर्तितम् related, न: our, कुलम् genealogy,  श्रोतुम् to listen, अर्हसि behoves of you.
explanation: Vasishta having thus described (the genealogy of Dasaratha) Janaka with folded hands rejoined, "Be blessed. Let me relate the genealogy  of my race. Listen".
comments: King Janaka narrates the history of his dynasty--consents to give Sita and Urmila in marriage to Rama and Lakshmana.

shloka_text: प्रदाने हि मुनिश्रेष्ठ कुलं निरवशेषत:। वक्तव्यं कुलजातेन तन्निबोध महामुने।।1.71.2।।
translation: मुनिश्रेष्ठ O Best of ascetics, महामुने O Great sage, कुलजातेन by one born in a noble family, प्रदाने at the time of bestowing their daughter in marriage, निरवशेषत: completely, कुलम् geneology of dynasty, वक्तव्यं हि indeed to be told, तत् that, निबोध listen to the same.
explanation: "O Great sage O Best of ascetics while one offers his daughter (in marriage), one born in a noble family should describe his genealogy in full. Listen.

shloka_text: राजाऽभूत् त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुत स्स्वेन कर्मणा। निमि: परमधर्मात्मा सर्वसत्त्ववतां वर:।।1.71.3।।
translation: स्वेन by his own, कर्मणा acts, त्रिषु three, लोकेषु worlds, विश्रुत: known, परमधर्मात्मा supremely virtuous, सर्वसत्त्ववताम् those endowed with strength, वर: best, राजा निमि: अभूत् was king named Nimi.
explanation: There was a great man of religion king Nimi, strongest of men and wellknown in the three worlds by his own acts.

shloka_text: तस्य पुत्रोमिथिर्नाम मिथिला येन निर्मिता। प्रथमो जनको नाम जनकादप्युदावसु:।।1.71.4।।
translation: मिथिर्नाम named Mithi, तस्य his, पुत्र: son, येन निर्मिता by whom constructed, मिथिला Mithila  प्रथम: first, जनक: Janaka, नाम named, जनकाद् from Janaka, उदावसु: Udavasu was born.
explanation: Nimi begot a son named Mithi who constructed Mithila. He was the first Janaka whose son was Udavasu.

shloka_text: उदावसोस्तु धर्मात्मा जातो वै नन्दिवर्धन:। नन्दिवर्धनपुत्रस्तु सुकेतुर्नाम नामत:।।1.71.5।।
translation: उदावसो: तु for that Udavasu, धर्मात्मा righteous, नन्दिवर्धन: Nandivardha, जात: was born, नन्दिवर्धनपुत्र: तु the son of Nandivardhana, नामत: by name, सुकेतुर्नाम named Suketu.
explanation: Virtuous Nandivardhana was the son of Udavasu whose son was Suketu.

shloka_text: सुकेतोरपि धर्मात्मा देवरातो महाबल:। देवरातस्य राजर्षेर्बृहद्रथ इति स्मृत:।।1.71.6।।
translation: सुकेतो: अपि for that Suketu, धर्मात्मा righteous, महाबल: highly powerful, देवरात: Devarata, राजर्षे: rishi among kings, देवरातस्य for that Devarata, बृहद्रथ Brihadradha, इति स्मृत: known as.
explanation: Suketu's son was the righteous and powerful Devarata, father of Brihadradha.

shloka_text: बृहद्रथस्य शूरोऽभून्महावीर: प्रतापवान्। महावीरस्य धृतिमान् सुधृतिस्सत्यविक्रम:।।1.71.7।।
translation: बृहद्रथस्य for Brihadradha, शूर: heroic, प्रतापवान् valourous, महावीर: Mahavera, महावीरस्य Mahaveera's, धृतिमान् courageous, सत्यविक्रम: having truthful prowess, सुधृति: Sudhruti was born.
explanation: Brihadradha's son was the heroic and powerful Mahavira, father of Sudhruti, who was armed with courage and the power of truth.

shloka_text: सुधृतेरपि धर्मात्मा दृष्टकेतुस्सुधार्मिक:। दृष्टकेतोस्तु राजर्षेर्हर्यश्व इति विश्रुत:।।1.71.8।।
translation: सुधृते: for Sudhruti, धर्मात्मा righteous, सुधार्मिक: committed to dharma, दृष्टकेतु: Drishtaketu, राजर्षे: of that royal rishi, दृष्टकेतो: for Drishtaketu, हर्यश्व: Haryasva, इति  विश्रुत: thus well known (son was born.)
explanation: To Sudhruti was born the righteous Drishtaketu, committed to dharma. Rajarshi Drishtaketu was father to the wellknown Haryasva.

shloka_text: हर्यश्वस्य मरु: पुत्रो मरो: पुत्र: प्रतिन्धक:। प्रतिंधकस्य धर्मात्मा राजा कीर्तिरथस्सुत:।।1.71.9।।
translation: हर्यश्वस्य Haryasva's, मरु: Maru, पुत्र: son, मरो: for Meru, प्रतिन्धक: Pratindhaka, पुत्र: son, धर्मात्मा righteous, राजा king, कीर्तिरथ: Kirtiratha, प्रतिन्धकस्य Pratindhaka's, सुत: son.
explanation: Haryasva's son was Maru, father of Pratindhaka. Pratindhaka's son was the righteous king Kirtiratha.

shloka_text: पुत्र: कीर्तिरथस्यापि देवमीढ इति स्मृत:। देवमीढस्य विबुधो विबुधस्य महीध्रक:।।1.71.10।।
translation: कीर्तिरथस्यापि Kirtiratha's, पुत्र: son, देवमीढ इति as Devamidha, स्मृत: has been known, देवमीढस्य Devamidha's son, विबुध: was Vibudha, विबुधस्य Vibhuda's son, महीध्रक: was Mahidhraka.
explanation: The son of Kirtiratha was known as Devamidha. His son was Vibudha, father of Mahidhraka.

shloka_text: महीध्रकसुतो राजा कीर्तिरातो महाबल:। कीर्तिरातस्य राजर्षेर्महारोमा व्यजायत।।1.71.11।।
translation: महाबल: mighty, राजा कीर्तिरात: king Kirtirata, महीध्रकसुत: son of Mahidhraka, राजर्षेः of that  royal rishi, कीर्तिरातस्य Kirtirata's, महारोमा Maharoma, व्यजायत born.
explanation: Mighty king Kirtirata was the son of Mahidhraka. He was a Rajarshi, father of Maharoma.

shloka_text: महारोम्णस्तु धर्मात्मा स्वर्णरोमा व्यजायत। स्वर्णरोम्णस्तु राजर्षेर्ह्रस्वरोमा व्यजायत।।1.71.12।।
translation: महारोम्ण: तु for Maharoma, स्वर्णरोमा Swarnaroma, व्यजायत was born, राजर्षेः of the royal rishi, स्वर्णरोम्ण: तु for Swarnaroma, ह्रस्वरोमा Hrasvaroma, व्यजायत was born.
explanation: To Maharoma's was born the virtuous Swarnaroma. Swarnaroma's son was Hrasvaroma.

shloka_text: तस्य पुत्रद्वयं जज्ञे धर्मज्ञस्य महात्मन:। ज्येष्ठोऽहमनुजो भ्राता मम वीर: कुशध्वज:।।1.71.13।।
translation: धर्मज्ञस्य knower of morality and ethics, तस्य of  that,  महात्मन: magnanimous, पुत्रद्वयम् two sons, जज्ञे were born, अहम् I am, ज्येष्ट: eldest, वीर: valiant,  कुशध्वज: Kusadhwaja, मम my, अनुज: younger, भ्राता brother.
explanation: Hrasvaroma, was a religious king. He was a great soul. Of his two sons. I am the eldest and valiant Kusadhwaja is my younger brother.

shloka_text: मां तु ज्येष्ठं पिता राज्ये सोऽभिषिच्य नराधिप:। कुशध्वजं समावेश्य भारं मयि वनं गत:।।1.71.14।।
translation: पिता father, स: नराधिप: king Hrasvaroma, ज्येष्ठं eldest, माम् me, राज्ये in the kingdom,  अभिषिच्य having crowned me, कुशध्वजं Kusadhwaja, भारम् responsibility of supporting,  मयि in me, समावेश्य placeing, वनम् forest, गत: went.
explanation: My father king Hrasvaroma crowned me king, entrusted Kusadhwaja to my care and retired to the forest.

shloka_text: वृद्धे पितरि स्वर्याते धर्मेण धुरमावहम्। भ्रातरं देवसङ्काशं स्नेहात्पश्यन् कुशध्वजम्।।1.71.15।।
translation: वृद्धे when the aged, पितरि father, स्वर्याते सति had attained heaven, भ्रातरम् brother, देवसङ्काशम् resembling devatas, कुशध्वजम् Kusadhwaja, स्नेहात् affectionately, पश्यन् looking after, धर्मेण with righteousness, धुरम weight of ruling the kingdom, आवहम् bore.
explanation: After my aged father attained heaven, I looked after my brother Kusadhwaja, who resembles the celestials, affectionately and ruled the kingdom with righteousness.

shloka_text: कस्य चित्त्वथकालस्य साङ्काश्यादगमत्पुरात्। सुधन्वा वीर्यवान्राजा मिथिलामवरोधक:।।1.71.16।।
translation: अथ thereafter, कस्यचित् कालस्य after sometime, वीर्यवान् powerful, सुधन्वा राजा king  Sundhava, मिथिलाम् Mithila, अवरोधक: with a view to beseige, साङ्काश्यात् from Sankasya, पुरात् city, अगमत् set out.
explanation: A little later a powerful king named Sudhanva from the city of Sankasya beseiged Mithila.

shloka_text: स च मे प्रेषयामास शैवं धनुरनुत्तमम्। सीता कन्या च पद्माक्षी मह्यं वै दीयतामिति।।1.71.17।।
translation: अनुत्तमम् excellent, शैवं धनु: bow of Siva, पद्माक्षी lotuseyed, कन्या maiden, सीता च Sita also, मह्यम् to me, दीयताम् be given, इति thus, प्रेषयामास sent a message.
explanation: He (Sudhanva) sent me a message: 'give me the great bow of Siva and the lotuseyed maiden Sita'.

shloka_text: तस्याप्रदानाद्ब्रह्मर्षे युद्धमासीन्मया सह। स हतोऽभिमुखो राजा सुधन्वा तु मया रणे।।1.71.18।।
translation: ब्रह्मर्षे O Brahmarshi, अप्रदानात् by not offering, तस्य for him, मया सह with me, युद्धम् असीत् great conflict broke, रणे in the battle, अभिमुख: he in an encounter, स: that, सुधन्वा राजा king Sudhanva, मया by me, हत: killed.
explanation: O Brahmarshi when I refused, a great conflict broke out between him and me. In the encounter king Sudhanva was killed by me.

shloka_text: निहत्य तं मुनिश्रेष्ठ सुधन्वानं नराधिपम्। साङ्काश्ये भ्रातरं वीरमभ्यषिञ्चं कुशध्वजम्।।1.71.19।।
translation: मुनिश्रेष्ठ O Best of ascetics, नराधिपम् king, तम् that, सुधन्वानम् Sudhanva, निहत्य having killed, भ्रातरम् brother, वीरम् heroic one, कुशध्वजम् Kusadhwaja, साङ्काश्ये in Sankasya, अभ्यषिञ्चम् I have crowned.
explanation: O Best of ascetics having killed king Sudhanva, I have crowned my heroic brother Kusadhwaja in Sankasya.

shloka_text: कनीयानेष मे भ्राता अहं ज्येष्ठो महामुने। ददामि परमप्रीतो वध्वौ ते मुनिपुङ्गव।।1.71.20।। सीतां रामाय भद्रं ते ऊर्मिला लक्ष्मणाय च।
translation: महामुने O Great ascetic, एष: this one, मे my, कनीयान् youger, भ्राता brother, अहम् I, ज्येष्ठ: elder, मुनिपुङ्गव preeminent among ascetics, परमप्रीत: immensely pleased, ते those, वध्वौ two maidens, ददामि I am giving, सीतां रामाय Sita to Rama, ऊर्मिला लक्ष्मणाय Urmila to  Lakshmana, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you.
explanation: O Great ascetic (Vasishta), this one is my youger brother and I am the elder one. O preeminent among ascetics with immense pleasure I am giving these maidens, Sita to Rama and Urmila to Lakshmana. Be blessed

shloka_text: वीर्यशुल्कां मम सुतां सीतां सुरसुतोपमाम्	।।1.71.21।। द्वितीयामूर्मिलां चैव त्रिर्ददामि न संशय:।
translation: वीर्यशुल्काम् as reward for prowess, सुरसुतोपमाम् equal to the daughter of devatas, मम सुताम् my daughter, सीताम् Sita, द्वितीयाम् second daughter, ऊर्मिलां चैव Urmila also, त्रि: three times, ददामि bestowing, संशय: न no doubt.
explanation: I offer my daughter Sita, who looks like a celestial maiden as reward for (Rama's) prowess and my second daughter Urmila (to Lakshmana). I proclaim it three times so that there is no doubt about it.

shloka_text: ददामि परमप्रीतो वध्वौ ते रघुनन्दन।।1.71.22।। रामलक्ष्मणयो राजन् गोदानं कारयस्व ह। पितृकार्यं च भद्रं ते ततो वैवाहिकं कुरु।।1.71.23।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O King Dasaratha, परमप्रीत: immensely pleased, ते to you, वध्वौ brides, ददामि I am giving, राजन् O King, रामलक्ष्मणयो: to Rama and Lakshmana, गोदानम् distribution of cows, कारयस्व ह let it be performed, पितृकार्यं च ritual duty towards pitris, भद्रं ते prosperity to you, तत: thereafter, वैवाहिकम् कुरु let the marriage be performed.
explanation: O Delight of the Raghus (King Dasaratha), I offer these brides with immense pleasure to Rama and Lakshmana. You may perform the rites for your forefathers by gift of cows. Prosperity to you. Thereafter you may perform the marriage.

shloka_text: ददामि परमप्रीतो वध्वौ ते रघुनन्दन।।1.71.22।। रामलक्ष्मणयो राजन् गोदानं कारयस्व ह। पितृकार्यं च भद्रं ते ततो वैवाहिकं कुरु।।1.71.23।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O King Dasaratha, परमप्रीत: immensely pleased, ते to you, वध्वौ brides, ददामि I am giving, राजन् O King, रामलक्ष्मणयो: to Rama and Lakshmana, गोदानम् distribution of cows, कारयस्व ह let it be performed, पितृकार्यं च ritual duty towards pitris, भद्रं ते prosperity to you, तत: thereafter, वैवाहिकम् कुरु let the marriage be performed.
explanation: O Delight of the Raghus (King Dasaratha), I offer these brides with immense pleasure to Rama and Lakshmana. You may perform the rites for your forefathers by gift of cows. Prosperity to you. Thereafter you may perform the marriage.

shloka_text: मखा ह्यद्य महाबाहो तृतीये दिवसे प्रभो। फल्गुन्यामुत्तरे राजंस्तस्मिन्वैवाहिकं कुरु।।1.71.24।। रामलक्ष्मणयो राजन् दानं कार्यं सुखोदयम् ।।
translation: महाबाहो O Strong armed one, प्रभो (विभो) O Lord, अद्य today, मखा हि star Makha is on the ascendent, राजन् O King, तृतीये दिवसे third day from today, फल्गुन्याम् known as Phalguni, तस्मिन् in that, उत्तरे in the star Uttara, वैवाहिकम् marriage, कुरु perform, राजन् O King, रामलक्ष्मणयो: for Rama and Lakshmana, सुखोदयम् for enjoying felicity, दानम् distribution of kine, etc, कार्यम् fit to be done.
explanation: Today the star Makha is on the ascendant. O King perform the marriage on the, third day from today under UttaraPhalguni star. Gifts may be given for the happiness of Rama and Lakshmana". इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे एकसप्ततितमस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the seventyfirst sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: तमुक्तवन्तं वैदेहं विश्वामित्रो महामुनि:। उवाच वचनं वीरं वसिष्ठसहितो नृपम्।।1.72.1।।
translation: महामुनि: mighty ascetic, विश्वामित्र: Visvamitra, वसिष्ठसहित: accompanied by Vasista, उक्तवन्तम् thus spoken, वीरम् valiant, वैदेहम् king of Videha, नृपम् addressing king Janaka, वचनम् words, उवाच said.
explanation: When Janaka the valiant king of Videha thus spoke (on the genealogy of his family) the mighty ascetic Viswamitra accompanied by Vasishta said to Janaka:
comments: Preparations for the marriage of the four sons of king Dasaratha.

shloka_text: अचिन्त्यान्यप्रमेयानि कुलानि नरपुङ्गव। इक्ष्वाकूणां विदेहानां नैषां तुल्योऽस्ति कश्चन।।1.72.2।।
translation: नरपुङ्गव O Preeminent among men, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् of kings of Ikshvaku, विदेहानां च also of Videha, कुलानि races, अचिन्त्यानि beyond comprehension, अप्रमेयानि immeasurable, एषां for  these kings of Ikshvaku and Videha, तुल्य: equal, कश्चन anyone, नास्ति is not there.
explanation: "O Preeminent among men the glory of the two races of Ikshvakus as also of Videhas is in comprehensible and immeasurable. There is none equal to these kings of the Ikshvakus and Videhas.

shloka_text: सदृशो धर्मसम्बन्ध: सदृशो रूपसम्पदा। रामलक्ष्मणयो राजन् सीता चोर्मिलया सह।।1.72.3।।
translation: राजन् O King, ऊर्मिलया सह along with Urmila, सीता Sita, रामलक्ष्मणयो: for Rama and Lakshmana (is being offered), सदृश: perfectly matched, धर्मसम्बन्ध: the marriage is in accordance with religious merit, रूपसम्पदाच in virtue and beauty, सदृश: is fit.
explanation: O King it is a perfect match between Sita and Rama and Urmila and Lakshmana. In respect of piety and beauty  the match is perfect.

shloka_text: वक्तव्यं च नरश्रेष्ठ श्रूयतां वचनं मम। भ्राता यवीयान् धर्मज्ञ एष राजा कुशध्वज:।।1.72.4।।
translation: नरश्रेष्ठ O Best of men, मम my, वक्तव्यं च is fit to be divulged, वचनम् words, श्रूयताम् may be heard, यवीयान् भ्राता this younger brother, एष: राजा this king, कुशध्वज: Kusadhwaja, धर्मज्ञ: knower of righteousness.
explanation: O Best of men my words deserve to be heard. This younger brother king Kusadhwaja is knower of righteousness.

shloka_text: अस्य धर्मात्मनो राजन् रूपेणाप्रतिमं भुवि	। सुताद्वयं नरश्रेष्ठ पत्न्यर्थं वरयामहे।।1.72.5।।
translation: राजन् O King, नरश्रेष्ठ O Eminent among men, रूपेण in beauty, भुवि on this earth, अप्रतिमम् unrivalled, अस्य धर्मात्मन: this virtuous one's, सुताद्वयम् two daughters, पत्न्यर्थम् as consorts, वरयामहे we are seeking.
explanation: O King, O Eminent among men we seek the hands of this virtuous king's two daughters, unrivalled in beauty, on earth, as consorts.

shloka_text: भरतस्य कुमारस्य शत्रुघ्नस्य च धीमत:। वरयामस्सुते राजन् तयोरर्थे महात्मनो:।।1.72.6।।
translation: राजन् O King, कुमारस्य of the youthful, भरतस्य Bharata, धीमत: sagacious, शत्रुघ्नस्य च for Satrughna also, महात्मनो: for the magnanimous ones, तयोरर्थे in the interests of both of them, सुते two daughters, वरयाम: we choose.
explanation: O king we choose your brother's daughters for the great souls: the young Bharata and the sagacious Satrughna.

shloka_text: पुत्रा दशरथस्येमे रूपयौवनशालिन:। लोकपालोपमास्सर्वे देवतुल्यपराक्रमा:।।1.72.7।।
translation: इमे these, दशरथस्य पुत्रा: sons of Dasaratha, सर्वे all, रूपयौवनशालिन: shining with youth and beauty, लोकपालोपमा: resembling the kings who are the protectors of the worlds,   देवतुल्यपराक्रमा: equal to devatas in valour.
explanation: Bestowed with youth and beauty, these sons of Dasaratha resemble kings in defending the worlds and gods in valour.

shloka_text: उभयोरपि राजेन्द्र सम्बन्धेनानुबध्यताम्। इक्ष्वाको: कुलमव्यग्रं भवत:पुण्यकर्मण:।।1.72.8।।
translation: राजेन्द्र O King, इक्ष्वाको: Ikshvaku's, पुण्यकर्मणः of pious deeds, भवत: your, उभयोरपि both of you, कुलम् races, सम्बन्धेन by this alliance, अन्यग्रम् with clear vision, अनुबध्यताम् let it be tied.
explanation: O King of kings (Janaka) the bond between your race with its pious deeds and the Ikshvakus  may be strenghthened by this alliance".

shloka_text: विश्वामित्रवच श्शृत्वा वसिष्ठस्य मते तदा। जनक: प्रांजलिर्वाक्यमुवाच मुनिपुङ्गवौ।।1.72.9।।
translation: तदा then, वसिष्ठस्य Vasistha's, मते by  wish, विश्वामित्रवच: Viswamitra's words, शृत्वा having listened, जनक: Janaka, प्रांजलि: with folded palms, मुनिपुङ्गवौ addressing eminent asetics, वाक्यम् words, उवाच spoke.
explanation: Having heard the words of Viswamitra which echoed the wish of Vasishta, Janaka replied to the eminent ascetics with folded palms.

shloka_text: कुलं धन्यमिदं मन्ये येषां नो मुनिपुङ्गवौ	। सदृशं कुलसम्बन्धं यदाज्ञापयथ: स्वयम्।।1.72.10।।
translation: येषाम् न: for those of us, सदृशं befitting, कुलसम्बन्धम् alliance of the two races, मुनिपुङ्गवौ two eminent ascetics, स्वयम् on your own, यत् for which reason, आज्ञापयथ: are commanding, इदम् this, कुलम् race, धन्यम् blessed, मन्ये I consider.
explanation: "Since both of you, eminent ascetics, recomended this befitting alliance of the two races on your own, I regard my race as blessed.

shloka_text: एवं भवतु भद्रं व: कुशध्वजसुते इमे। पत्न्यौ भजेतां सहितौ शत्रुघ्नभरतावुभौ।।1.72.11।।
translation: एवं भवतु let it be so, व: भद्रं: prosperity to you, इमे these, कुशध्वजसुते daughters of Kusadhwaja, सहितौ together moving, शत्रुघ्नभरतौ for Satrughna and Bharata, उभौ for both of them, पत्न्यौ as wives, भजेताम् let them serve.
explanation: "Let it be so, Be blessed Let these two daughters of Kusadhwaja (Srutakirti and Mandavi) be the wives of Satrughna and Bharata respectively and serve them.

shloka_text: एकाह्ना राजपुत्रीणां चतसृणां महामुने। पाणीन् गृह्णन्तु चत्वारो राजपुत्रा महाबला:।।1.72.12।।
translation: महामुने O Great ascetic, महाबला: valiant, चत्वार: four, राजपुत्रा: princes, एकाह्ना on the same day, चतसृ़णाम् of the four, राजपुत्रीणाम् princesses, पाणीन् hands, गृह्णन्तु let them take.
explanation: O Great ascetic let the valiant four princes take the hands of four princesses on the same day.

shloka_text: उत्तरे दिवसे ब्रह्मन् फल्गुनीभ्यां मनीषिण:। वैवाहिकं प्रशंसन्ति भगो यत्र प्रजापति:।।1.72.13।।
translation: ब्रह्मन् O Foremost among brahmins, फल्गुनीभ्याम् उत्तरे दिवसे on the later day of the ascent of the two Phalgunis (Phalgunis are two sisters. The previous day of the ascent of Phalguni stars, Poorva Phalguni wil be ascendent and the folowing day Uttara Phalguni wil be ascendant ), यत्र in which day, प्रजापति: bestower of children, भग: Bhaga, वैवाहिकम् to perform marriage, मनीषिण: wise people, प्रशंसन्ति are praising.
explanation: "The wise, O Brahmin think the marriage is favourable when Bhaga is Prajapati on the succeeding day of the ascent of the two stars. (that is, when poorva is followed by uttara phalguni).

shloka_text: एवमुक्त्वा वचस्सौम्यं प्रत्युत्थाय कृताञ्जलि:। उभौ मुनिवरौ राजा जनको वाक्यमब्रवीत्।।1.72.14।।
translation: जनक: राजा king Janaka, एवम् thus, सौम्यम् pleasing, वच: words, उक्त्वा having spoken, प्रत्युत्थाय having stood up, कृताञ्जलि: with folded hands, उभौ both, मुनिवरौ great ascetics, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: King Janaka, having spoken these pleasing words, stood up and with folded hands  addressing both the great ascetics:

shloka_text: परो धर्म: कृतो मह्यं शिष्योऽस्मिभवतो सदा। इमान्यासनमुख्यानि आसातां मुनिपुङ्गवौ।।1.72.15।।
translation: मह्यम् for me, पर: supreme, धर्म: religious merit, कृत: has been done, सदा always, भवतो: for both of you, शिष्य: अस्मि I am a desciple, मुनिपुङ्गवौ eninent ascestics, इमानि these,  आसनमुख्यानि best of thrones, आसाताम् occupy.
explanation: "You have earned me a great religious merit. I shall be always your disciple O Eminent ascestics, occupy these important seats".

shloka_text: यथा दशरथस्येयं तथाऽयोध्या पुरी मम। प्रभुत्वे नास्ति सन्देहो यथार्हं कर्तुमर्हथ।।1.72.16।।
translation: इयम् this Mithila, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, यथा as, अयोध्या पुरी Ayodhya city, मम to me, तथा so it is, प्रभुत्वे in the matter of governance, सन्देह: doubt, नास्ति not there, यथार्हम्  appropriately, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हथ behoves of you.
explanation: "Dasaratha has right on the city of Ayodhya as much as I have on this. This right is unquestionable. So do whatever you think right".

shloka_text: तथा ब्रुवति वैदेहे जनके रघुनन्दन:। राजा दशरथो हृष्ट: प्रत्युवाच महीपतिम्।।1.72.17।।
translation: वैदेहे when the king of Videha, जनके Janaka, तथा in that manner, ब्रुवति while speaking, रघुनन्दन: descendent of Raghu, राजा दशरथ: king Dasaratha, हृष्ट: pleased, महीपतिम् addressing king Janaka, प्रत्युवाच replied.
explanation: To the words of Janaka, king of Videha, king Dasaratha, the descendant of Raghu cheerfully replied:

shloka_text: युवामसङ्ख्येयगुणौ भ्रातरौ मिथिलेश्वरौ। ऋषयो राजसङ्घाश्च भवद्भ्यामभिपूजिता:।।1.72.18।।
translation: मिथिलेश्वरौ lords of Mithila, भ्रातरौ brothers, युवाम् both of you, असङ्ख्येयगुणौ have countless virtues, भवद्भ्याम् by you, ऋषय: rishis, राजसङ्घाश्च hosts of kings, अभिपूजिता: have been worshipped.
explanation: "You both brothers are lords of Mithila. You possess countless virtues. You pay regards to  many rishis and hosts of kings".

shloka_text: स्वस्ति प्राप्नुहि भद्रं ते गमिष्यामि स्वमालयम्। श्राद्धकर्माणि सर्वाणि विधास्यामीति चाब्रवीत्।।1.72.19।।
translation: स्वस्ति safety, प्राप्नुहि you may obtain, ते भद्रम् prosperity to you, स्वम् relating to mine, आलयम् residence, गमिष्यामि I shall go, सर्वाणि all, श्राद्धकर्माणि rites concerning the ceremony in accordance with the rituals, विधास्यामि च I shall perform, इति thus, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: "Be safe. Be blessed. Let me retire to the camp. I have to perform the rites offerings to the forefathers".

shloka_text: तमापृष्ट्वा नरपतिं राजा दशरथस्तदा। मुनीन्द्रौ तौ पुरस्कृत्य जगामाशु महायशा:।।1.72.20।।
translation: तदा then, महायशा: renowned, राजा दशरथ: king Dasaratha, तम् that, नरपतिम् king men, आपृष्ट्वा having taken leave of, तौ those two, मुनीन्द्रौ ascetics, पुरस्कृत्य placing them in the forefront, आशु immediately, जगाम went away.
explanation: Then renowned king Dasaratha, took leave of the two great ascetics. Then the rowned king Dasaratha took have of the king (Janaka) immediately following the two great ascetics.

shloka_text: स गत्वा निलयं राजा श्राद्धं कृत्वा विधानत:। प्रभाते काल्यमुत्थाय चक्रे गोदानमुत्तमम्।।1.72.21।।
translation: स: that, राजा king, निलयम् residence, गत्वा having gone, विधानत: according to scriptures, श्राद्धम् Shraddha ceremony, कृत्वा having performed, प्रभाते at dawn, उत्थाय having risen, काल्यम् appropriate to the time, उत्तमम् excellent, गोदानम्  gifting of cows (a ceremony duly initiating the marriage, vow of Snathaka ), चक्रे made.
explanation: The king (Dasaratha) reached the abode, performed the sharaddha ceremony in accordance with the scriptures. Next day at dawn at appropriate time he gifted away cows (a ceremony performed by initiating the bridegrooms into the marriage.)

shloka_text: गवां शतसहस्राणि ब्राह्मणेभ्यो नराधिप:। एकैकशो ददौ राजा पुत्रानुद्दिश्य धर्मत:।।1.72.22।।
translation: नराधिप: lord of men, राजा king, पुत्रान् sons, एकैकश: for each one, उद्धिश्य referring to their  names, ब्राह्मणेभ्य: for brahmins, गवाम् cows, शतसहस्राणि in hundred thousands, धर्मत: in accordance with law, ददौ bestowed.
explanation: For the welfare of each of his sons the king (Dasaratha) religiously gave away a hundred thousand cows to brahmins.

shloka_text: सुवर्णश्रुङ्गा स्सम्पन्ना स्सवत्सा: कांस्यदोहना:। गवां शतसहस्राणि चत्वारि पुरुषर्षभ:।।1.72.23।। वित्तमन्यच्च सुबहुद्विजेभ्यो रघुनन्दन:। ददौ गोदानमुद्दिश्य पुत्राणां पुत्रवत्सल:।।1.72.24।।
translation: पुरुषर्षभ: great among men, पुत्रवत्सल: affectionate towards his children, रघुनन्दन: Dasaratha, पुत्राणाम् sons', गोदानम् gifting away of cows, उद्धिश्य with reference to that, सुवर्णश्रुङ्गा: with their horns plaited with gold, सम्पन्ना: endowed with abundance(of milk), सवत्सा: accompanied by calves, कांस्यदोहना: bronze vessels for milking, गवाम् of cows, चत्वारि four, शतसहस्राणि a hundred thousand, अन्यत् other, सुबहु innumerable, वित्तम् च valuables, द्विजेभ्य: for brahmins, ददौ bestowed.
explanation: Great among men and affectionate towards his children, (king Dasaratha), the delight of the Raghus donated in the name of his sons' donates to the brahmins four hundred thousand cows. They were capable of abundance of milk. Their horns were plaited with gold. They were accompanied by calves. With them were given away bellmetal vessels for keeping milk and innumerable valuables.

shloka_text: सुवर्णश्रुङ्गा स्सम्पन्ना स्सवत्सा: कांस्यदोहना:। गवां शतसहस्राणि चत्वारि पुरुषर्षभ:।।1.72.23।। वित्तमन्यच्च सुबहुद्विजेभ्यो रघुनन्दन:। ददौ गोदानमुद्दिश्य पुत्राणां पुत्रवत्सल:।।1.72.24।।
translation: पुरुषर्षभ: great among men, पुत्रवत्सल: affectionate towards his children, रघुनन्दन: Dasaratha, पुत्राणाम् sons', गोदानम् gifting away of cows, उद्धिश्य with reference to that, सुवर्णश्रुङ्गा: with their horns plaited with gold, सम्पन्ना: endowed with abundance(of milk), सवत्सा: accompanied by calves, कांस्यदोहना: bronze vessels for milking, गवाम् of cows, चत्वारि four, शतसहस्राणि a hundred thousand, अन्यत् other, सुबहु innumerable, वित्तम् च valuables, द्विजेभ्य: for brahmins, ददौ bestowed.
explanation: Great among men and affectionate towards his children, (king Dasaratha), the delight of the Raghus donated in the name of his sons' donates to the brahmins four hundred thousand cows. They were capable of abundance of milk. Their horns were plaited with gold. They were accompanied by calves. With them were given away bellmetal vessels for keeping milk and innumerable valuables.

shloka_text: स सुतै: कृतगोदानैर्वृतस्तु नृपतिस्तदा। लोकपालैरिवाभाति वृत: स्सौम्य: प्रजापति:।।1.72.25।।
translation: कृतगोदानै: having distributed the cows, सुतै: with his sons, वृत: surrounded, स: that, नृपति: king, तदा then, लोकपालै: by guardians of worlds, वृत: surrounded, सौम्य: pleased, प्रजापतिरिव like brahma, आभाति shining.
explanation: With his sons for whose sake cows have been given away the cheerful king looked like  shining Prajapati surrrounded by the guardians of the world. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये बालकाण्डे द्विसप्ततितमस्सर्ग:।। Thus ends the seventhsecond sarga of Balakanda of the holy Ramayana the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.

shloka_text: यस्मिंस्तु दिवसे राजा चक्रे गोदानमुत्तमम्	। तस्मिं स्तु दिवसे शूरो युधाजित्समुपेयिवान्।।1.73.1।।
translation: राजा king, यस्मिन् on which, दिवसे day, उत्तमम् best, गोदानम् gift of cows, चक्रे made, तस्मिन् तु on that दिवसे day, शूर: heroic, युथाजित् Yudhajit, समुपेयिवान् arrived.
explanation: The day the king (Dasaratha) made a gift of the best (available) cows the heroic Yudhajit arrived.
comments: Marriage of Rama, Lakshmana, Bharata and Satrughna.

shloka_text: पुत्र: केकयराजस्य साक्षाद्भरतमातुल:। दृष्ट्वा पृष्ट्वा च कुशलं राजानमिदमब्रवीत्।।1.73.2।।
translation: केकयराजस्य king Kekaya's, पुत्र: son, साक्षात् directly, भरतमातुल: maternal uncle of Bharata, राजानम् king Dasaratha, दृष्ट्वा having seen, कुशलम् welfare, पृष्ट्वा च having enquired, राजानम् addressing the king, इदं this word, अब्रवीत् spoke.
explanation: Yudhajit, son of king Kekaya, Bharata's own maternal uncle met the king (Dasaratha) and enquiring about his wellbeing said:

shloka_text: केकयाधिपती राजा स्नेहात् कुशलमब्रवीत्	। येषां कुशलकामोऽसि तेषां सम्प्रत्यनामयम्	।।1.73.3।।
translation: केकयाधिपति: lord of Kekaya, राजा king, स्नेहात् out of affection, कुशलम् welfare, अब्रवीत् spoken, येषाम् whose, कुशलकाम: असि are desiring the welfare, तेषाम् their, सम्प्रति now,  अनामयम् healthy.
explanation: "My father, king of Kekaya affectionately enquires about your welfare. And they whose welfare you seek  are hale and healthy.

shloka_text: स्वस्रीयं मम राजेन्द्र द्रष्टुकामो महीपति:। तदर्थमुपयातोऽहमयोध्यां रघुनन्दन।।1.73.4।।
translation: रघुनन्दन O Joy of Raghus, राजेन्द्र O Indra among kings, महीपति: king of Kekaya, मम my, स्वस्रीयम् son of my sister, द्रष्टुकाम: wishing to see, तदर्थम् on that account, अहम् I, अयोध्याम् towards Ayodhya, उपयात: have gone.
explanation: The king of Kekaya, O Indra among kings, O Joy of the Raghus, desires to see my  sisters's son and on that account I went to Ayodhya.

shloka_text: श्रुत्वा त्वहमयोध्यायां विवाहार्थं तवात्मजान् । मिथिलामुपयातांस्तु त्वया सह महीपते।।1.73.5।। त्वरयाभ्युपयातोऽहं द्रष्टुकाम स्स्वसुस्सुतम्।
translation: महीपते O King, तव your, आत्मजान् sons, विवाहार्थम् for their marriage, त्वया सह along with you, मिथिलाम् to Mithila, उपयातान् having arrived, अयोध्यायाम् Ayodhya, श्रुत्वा listened, अहम् I, स्वसु: sister's, सुतम् son, द्रष्टुकाम: desiring to see, त्वरया speedily, अभ्युपयात: came.
explanation: O King having heard in Ayodhya that you have arrived in Mithila along with your sons for their marriage I came here speedily with a desire to see my sister's son .

shloka_text: अथ राजा दशरथ: प्रियातिथिमुपस्थितम्।।1.73.6।। दृष्ट्वा परमसत्कारै: पूजार्हं समपूजयत्।
translation: अथ afterwards, राजा king, दशरथ: Dasaratha, उपस्थितम् attended, प्रियातिथिम् dear guest, दृष्ट्वा having seen, पूजार्हम् deserving the honours, परमसत्कारै: with supreme honours, समपूजयत् extended.
explanation: King Dasaratha, then accorded a warm welcome to the honoured guest.

shloka_text: ततस्तामुषितो रात्रिं सह पुत्रैर्महात्मभि:।।1.73.7।। प्रभाते पुनरुत्थाय कृत्वा कर्माणि कर्मवित्	। ऋषींस्तदा पुरस्कृत्य यज्ञवाटमुपागमत्।।1.73.8।।
translation: तत: thereafter, महात्मभि: with the illustrious, पुत्रै: सह with sons, ताम् that, रात्रिम् night, उषित: having dwelt, कर्मवित् knower of duties, प्रभाते at dawn, पुन: again, उत्थाय having arisen, कर्माणि daily devotions, कृत्वा having made, तदा then, ऋषीन् rishis, पुरस्कृत्य preceded by, यज्ञवाटम् sacrificial place, उपागमत् reached.
explanation: With the night spent with his virtuous sons, he who knew his duties got up at dawn and performed his daily devotionas and reached the sacrificial place following the  rishis.

shloka_text: ततस्तामुषितो रात्रिं सह पुत्रैर्महात्मभि:।।1.73.7।। प्रभाते पुनरुत्थाय कृत्वा कर्माणि कर्मवित्	। ऋषींस्तदा पुरस्कृत्य यज्ञवाटमुपागमत्।।1.73.8।।
translation: तत: thereafter, महात्मभि: with the illustrious, पुत्रै: सह with sons, ताम् that, रात्रिम् night, उषित: having dwelt, कर्मवित् knower of duties, प्रभाते at dawn, पुन: again, उत्थाय having arisen, कर्माणि daily devotions, कृत्वा having made, तदा then, ऋषीन् rishis, पुरस्कृत्य preceded by, यज्ञवाटम् sacrificial place, उपागमत् reached.
explanation: With the night spent with his virtuous sons, he who knew his duties got up at dawn and performed his daily devotionas and reached the sacrificial place following the  rishis.

shloka_text: युक्ते मुहूर्ते विजये सर्वाभरणभूषितै:। भ्रातृभिस्सहितो राम: कृतकौतुकमंगल:।।1.73.9।। वसिष्ठं पुरत: कृत्वा महर्षीनपरानपि। पितु स्समीपमाश्रित्य तस्थौ भ्रातृभिरावृत:।।1.73.10।।
translation: युक्ते at auspicious, विजये Vijaya, मुहुर्ते time, सर्वाभरणभूषितै: adorned with ornaments ,भ्रातृभि: with brothers, सहित: accompanied by, राम: Rama, कृतकौतुकमङ्गल: with all the auspicious rites preparatory to marriage having been performed, वसिष्ठम् Vasistha, अपरान् other, महर्षीनपि maharshi also, पुरत: कृत्वा keeping ahead, पितु: father's, समीपम् presence, आश्रित्य having reached, भ्रातृभि: with brother, आवृत: surrounded by, तस्थौ remained.
explanation: With the necessary auspicious rites preparatory to marriage performed at an auspicious moment, Vijaya, and keeping Vasishta and other maharshis in the forefront,  Rama accompanied by his brothers adorned with ornaments of every kind came into his  father's presence.

shloka_text: युक्ते मुहूर्ते विजये सर्वाभरणभूषितै:। भ्रातृभिस्सहितो राम: कृतकौतुकमंगल:।।1.73.9।। वसिष्ठं पुरत: कृत्वा महर्षीनपरानपि। पितु स्समीपमाश्रित्य तस्थौ भ्रातृभिरावृत:।।1.73.10।।
translation: युक्ते at auspicious, विजये Vijaya, मुहुर्ते time, सर्वाभरणभूषितै: adorned with ornaments ,भ्रातृभि: with brothers, सहित: accompanied by, राम: Rama, कृतकौतुकमङ्गल: with all the auspicious rites preparatory to marriage having been performed, वसिष्ठम् Vasistha, अपरान् other, महर्षीनपि maharshi also, पुरत: कृत्वा keeping ahead, पितु: father's, समीपम् presence, आश्रित्य having reached, भ्रातृभि: with brother, आवृत: surrounded by, तस्थौ remained.
explanation: With the necessary auspicious rites preparatory to marriage performed at an auspicious moment, Vijaya, and keeping Vasishta and other maharshis in the forefront,  Rama accompanied by his brothers adorned with ornaments of every kind came into his  father's presence.

shloka_text: वसिष्ठो भगवानेत्य वैदेहमिदमब्रवीत्। राजा दशरथो राजन् कृतकौतुकमङ्गलै:।।1.73.11।। पुत्रैर्नरवर श्रेष्ठ दातारमभिकाङ्क्षते।
translation: भगवान् adorable, वसिष्ठ: Vasishta, वैदेहम् king Janaka, एत्य approaching him, इदम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke, राजन् O King, नरवर श्रेष्ठ excellent among men, राजा दशरथ: king Dasaratha, कृतकौतुकमङ्गलै: having performed all the auspicious rites preparatory to their marriage, पुत्रैः with sons, दातारम् bestower of bride, अभिकाङ्क्षते is awaiting.
explanation: Adorable Vasishta approached king Janaka and said, "O King, of Videha king Dasaratha, the best of men with his sons having performed the auspicious rites preparatory to marriage is awaiting the bestower of the brides".

shloka_text: दातृप्रतिग्रहीतृभ्यां सर्वार्था: प्रभवन्ति हि।।1.73.12।। स्वधर्मं प्रतिपद्यस्व कृत्वा वैवाह्यमुत्तमम्।
translation: सर्वार्था: all the ends, दातृप्रतिग्रहीतृभ्याम् through the giver and receiver, प्रभवन्ति हि takes place, उत्तमम् वैवाह्यम् excellent (auspicious) marriage, कृत्वा having performed, स्वधर्मम्   own duty, प्रतिपद्यस्व fulfill.
explanation: The giver and the receiver, indeed, attain all ends. Fulfil  your own duty by performing the auspicious marriage".

shloka_text: इत्युक्त: परमोदारो वसिष्ठेन महात्मना।।1.73.13।। प्रत्युवाच महातेजा वाक्यं परमधर्मवित्।
translation: महात्मना magnanimous, वसिष्ठेन by Vasishta, इति thus, उक्त: having been spoken, परमोदार: exceedingly generous, महातेजा highly lustrous, परमधर्मवित् eminent in ethics and morality, वाक्यम् words, प्रत्युवाच replied.
explanation: Thus addressed by the great self Vasishta, Janaka, the exceedingly generous, highly lustrous, eminent in ethics replied.

shloka_text: कस्स्थित: प्रतिहारो मे कस्याज्ञा सम्प्रतीक्ष्यते।।1.73.14।। स्वगृहे को विचारोऽस्ति यथा राज्यमिदं तव।
translation: मे my, प्रतिहार: guarding the door, क: who, स्थित: is waiting, कस्य whose, आज्ञा command,  सम्प्रतीक्ष्यते awaiting, स्वगृहे own house, क: what, विचार: अस्ति hesitation is there, इदम् this, राज्यम् kingdom,  तव यथा is like yours.
explanation: "Did any guard prevent you? Whose command are you waiting for? Why do you hesitate to enter into your own house? This kingdom is like your kingdom".

shloka_text: कृतकौतुकसर्वस्वा वेदिमूलमुपागता:।।1.73.15।। मम कन्या मुनिश्रेष्ठ दीप्ता वह्नेरिवार्चिष:।
translation: मुनिश्रेष्ठ O Best of ascetics, मम my, कन्या daughters, कृतकौतुकसर्वस्वा: having performed  completely all the rites relating to marriage, दीप्ता: shining, वह्ने: fire's, अर्चिष इव like the lustre of flames, वेदिमूलम् foot of the altar, उपागता: arrived.
explanation: O Best of ascetics my daughters have performed all the rites relating to marriage. They (now) stand at the foot of the altar shining like the bright flames of fire.

shloka_text: सज्जोऽहं त्वत्प्रतीक्षोऽस्मि वेद्यामस्यां प्रतिष्ठित:।।1.73.16।। अविघ्नं कुरुतां राजा किमर्थमवलम्बते।
translation: सज्ज: kept ready, अहम् I, अस्याम् on this, वेद्याम् altar, प्रतिष्ठित: staying, त्वत्प्रतीक्ष: अस्मि awaiting you, राजा king, अविघ्नम् without hindrance, कुरुताम् let it be done, किमर्थम् why for, अवलम्बते delay.
explanation: Ready at the altar, I have been awaiting you, O King Without hindrance proceed Why delay?".

shloka_text: तद्वाक्यं जनकेनोक्तं श्रुत्वा दशरथस्तदा। प्रवेशयामास सुतान् सर्वानृषिगणानपि।।1.73.17।।
translation: तदा then, दशरथ: Dasaratha, जनकेन by Janaka, उक्तम् having been spoken, तत् those, वाक्यम् words, श्रुत्वा having listened, सुतान् sons, सर्वान् all, ऋषिगणानपि hosts of ascetics also, प्रवेशयामास made them enter.
explanation: At the words of Janaka, Dasaratha brought his sons along with the hosts of ascetics and entered the marriage pavilion.

shloka_text: ततो राजा विदेहानां वसिष्ठमिदमब्रवीत्।।1.73.18।। कारयस्व ऋषे सर्वमृषिभि: सह धार्मिक। रामस्य लोकरामस्य क्रियां वैवाहिकीं विभो।।1.73.19।।
translation: तत: thereafter, विदेहानाम् king of Videhas, राजा king, वसिष्ठम् Vasishta, इदम् these (words),  अब्रवीत् spoke, धार्मिक O Adherent of righteousness, विभो O Competent one, ऋषे O Maharshi Vasishta, ऋषिभि: सह together with rishis, लोकरामस्य delighting the worlds, रामस्य Rama's, वैवाहिकीम् relating to the marriage, क्रियाम् ceremonies, कारयस्व make them perform.
explanation: Thereafter the king of the Videhas to Vasishta, "O Adherent of righteousness, O Lord O Maharshi perform with the rishis the marriage ceremony of Rama who causes delight to the three worlds".

shloka_text: ततो राजा विदेहानां वसिष्ठमिदमब्रवीत्।।1.73.18।। कारयस्व ऋषे सर्वमृषिभि: सह धार्मिक। रामस्य लोकरामस्य क्रियां वैवाहिकीं विभो।।1.73.19।।
translation: तत: thereafter, विदेहानाम् king of Videhas, राजा king, वसिष्ठम् Vasishta, इदम् these (words),  अब्रवीत् spoke, धार्मिक O Adherent of righteousness, विभो O Competent one, ऋषे O Maharshi Vasishta, ऋषिभि: सह together with rishis, लोकरामस्य delighting the worlds, रामस्य Rama's, वैवाहिकीम् relating to the marriage, क्रियाम् ceremonies, कारयस्व make them perform.
explanation: Thereafter the king of the Videhas to Vasishta, "O Adherent of righteousness, O Lord O Maharshi perform with the rishis the marriage ceremony of Rama who causes delight to the three worlds".

shloka_text: तथेत्युक्त्वा तु जनकं वसिष्ठो भगवानृषि:। विश्वामित्रं पुरस्कृत्य शतानन्दं च धार्मिकम्।।1.73.20।। प्रपामध्ये तु विधिवत्वेदिं कृत्वा महातपा:	। अलञ्चकार तां वेदिं गन्धपुष्पै स्समन्तत:	।।1.73.21।। सुवर्णपालिकाभिश्च छिद्रकुम्भैश्च साङ्कुरै:। अङ्कुराढ्यैश्शरावैश्च धूपपात्रै स्सधूपकै:।।1.73.22।। शङ्खपात्रै स्स्रुवै स्स्रुग्भि: पात्रैरर्घ्याभिपूरितै:। लाजपूर्णैश्च पात्रीभिरक्षतैरभिसंस्कृतै:।।1.73.23।।
translation: भगवान् venerable, महतपा: renowned ascetic, वसिष्ठ: ऋषि: rishi Vasishta, जनकम् addressing king Janaka, तथा इति "Be it so", उक्त्वा having said, विश्वामित्रम् to Visvamitra, धार्मिकम् virtuous, शतानन्दं च Satananda, पुरस्कृत्य in the forefront, प्रपामध्ये in the center of the marriage pavillion, विधिवत् in accordance with scriptures, वेदिम् altar, कृत्वा having constructed, गन्धपुष्पै: with fragrant flowers, सुवर्णपालिकाभिश्च with golden hollow plates, साङ्कुरै: with sprouts, छिद्रकुम्भैश्च water pots containing holes, अङ्कुराढ्यै: filled with sprouts, शरावैश्च earthenware vessels, सधूपकै: by burning frgrant insenses, धूपपात्रै: holders of frgrant insenses, शङ्खपात्रै: conch shaped vessels, सृवै: sacrificial ladles, सृग्भि: bowls, अर्घ्याभिपूरितै: filled with with water for Arghya and other purposes, पात्रै: with vessels, लाजपूर्णै: roasted paddy, पात्रीभि: with vessels, अभिसंस्कृतै: sanctified, अक्षतै: rice grains, ताम् that, वेदिम् altar, समन्तत on all sides, अलञ्चकार adorned.
explanation: Venerable and renowned ascetic Vasishta said "Be it so".And with Viswamitra and virtuous Satananda in the forefront, an altar was duly improvised in the centre of the sacrificial pavilion. He adorned the altar on all sides  with fragrant flowers, golden ladles, waterpots with holes filled with sprouts, earthen vessels with sprouts, holders of burning fragrant incense conchshaped vessels, sacrificial ladles, bowls filled with with water for arghya and other purposes, vessels with roasted paddy and grains of rice.
